Book.Name: Genesis
Text: In the beginning God created the heauen and the earth.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the earth was without forme and voide, and darkenesse was vpon the deepe, and the Spirit of God moued vpon ye waters.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then God saide, Let there be light: And there was light.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And God sawe the light that it was good, and God separated the light from the darkenes.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And God called the light, Day, and the darkenes, he called Night. So the euening and the morning were the first day.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Againe God saide, Let there be a firmament in the middes of the waters: and let it separate the waters from the waters.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then God made the firmament, and separated the waters, which were vnder the firmament, from the waters which were aboue the firmament; it was so.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And God called the firmament Heauen. So the Euening and the morning were the seconde day.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: God saide againe, Let the waters vnder the heauen be gathered into one place, and let the dry land appeare; it was so.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And God called the dry land, Earth, and he called the gathering together of the waters, Seas: and God sawe that it was good.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then God said, Let the earth bud foorth the bud of the herbe, that seedeth seede, the fruitfull tree, which beareth fruite according to his kinde, which hath his seede in it selfe vpon the earth; it was so.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the earth brought foorth the bud of the herbe, that seedeth seede according to his kind, also the tree that beareth fruite, which hath his seede in it selfe according to his kinde: and God sawe that it was good.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So the euening and the morning were the third day.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And God said, Let there be lightes in the firmament of the heauen, to separate the day from the night, and let them be for signes, and for seasons, and for dayes and yeeres.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And let them be for lightes in the firmament of the heauen to giue light vpon the earth; it was so.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: God then made two great lightes: the greater light to rule the day, and the lesse light to rule the night: he made also the starres.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And God set them in the firmament of the heauen, to shine vpon the earth,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And to rule in the day, and in the night, and to separate the light from the darkenes: and God sawe that it was good.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So the euening and the morning were the fourth day.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Afterward God said, Let the waters bring foorth in abundance euery creeping thing that hath life: and let the foule flie vpon the earth in the open firmament of the heauen.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then God created the great whales, and euery thing liuing and mouing, which the waters brought foorth in abundance according to their kinde, and euery fethered foule according to his kinde: and God sawe that it was good.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then God blessed them, saying, Bring foorth fruite and multiplie, and fill the waters in the seas, and let the foule multiplie in the earth.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So the euening and the morning were the fift day.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Moreouer God said, Let the earth bring foorth the liuing thing according to his kinde, cattell, and that which creepeth, and the beast of the earth, according to his kinde; it was so.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And God made the beast of the earth according to his kinde, and the cattell according to his kinde, & euery creeping thing of the earth according to his kind: & God saw that it was good.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Furthermore God said, Let vs make man in our image according to our likenes, and let them rule ouer the fish of the sea, and ouer the foule of the heauen, and ouer the beastes, and ouer all the earth, and ouer euery thing that creepeth and moueth on the earth.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Thus God created the man in his image: in the image of God created he him: he created them male and female.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And God blessed them, and God said to them, Bring forth fruite and multiplie, and fill the earth, and subdue it, and rule ouer the fish of the sea, and ouer the foule of the heauen, & ouer euery beast that moueth vpon the earth.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And God said, Beholde, I haue giuen vnto you euery herbe bearing seede, which is vpon al the earth, and euery tree, wherein is the fruite of a tree bearing seede: that shall be to you for meate.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Likewise to euery beast of the earth, and to euery foule of the heauen, and to euery thing that moueth vpon the earth, which hath life in it selfe, euery greene herbe shall be for meate; it was so.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And God sawe all that he had made, and loe, it was very good. So the euening and the morning were the sixt day.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Thus the heauens and the earth were finished, and all the host of them.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: For in the seuenth day GOD ended his worke which he had made, and the seuenth day he rested from al his worke, which he had made.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So God blessed the seuenth day, & sanctified it, because that in it he had rested from all his worke, which God had created and made.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: These are the generations of the heauens and of the earth, when they were created, in the day that the Lorde God made the earth and the heauens,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And euery plant of the fielde, before it was in the earth, and euery herbe of the field, before it grewe: for the Lorde God had not caused it to raine vpon the earth, neither was there a man to till the ground,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But a myst went vp from the earth, and watered all the earth.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: The Lord God also made the man of the dust of the grounde, and breathed in his face breath of life, and the man was a liuing soule.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the Lord God planted a garden Eastward in Eden, and there he put the man whom he had made.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: (For out of the grounde made the Lorde God to growe euery tree pleasant to the sight, and good for meate: the tree of life also in the middes of the garden, and the tree of knowledge of good and of euill.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And out of Eden went a riuer to water the garden, and from thence it was deuided, and became into foure heads.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: The name of one is Pishon: the same compasseth the whole land of Hauilah, where is golde.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the golde of that land is good: there is Bdelium, and the Onix stone.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the name of the seconde riuer is Gihon: the same compasseth the whole lande of Cush.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: The name also of the third riuer is Hiddekel: this goeth toward the Eastside of Asshur: and the fourth riuer is Perath)

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then the Lord God tooke the man, and put him into the garden of Eden, that he might dresse it and keepe it.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the Lorde God commaunded the man, saying, Thou shalt eate freely of euery tree of the garden,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But of the tree of knowledge of good and euill, thou shalt not eate of it: for in the day that thou eatest thereof, thou shalt die the death.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Also the Lorde God saide, It is not good that the man should be himself alone: I wil make him an helpe meete for him.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So the Lorde God formed of the earth euery beast of the fielde, and euery foule of the heauen, and brought them vnto the man to see howe he would call them: for howsoeuer the man named the liuing creature, so was the name thereof.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: The man therefore gaue names vnto all cattell, and to the foule of the heauen, and to euery beast of the fielde: but for Adam founde he not an helpe meete for him.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Therefore the Lord God caused an heauie sleepe to fall vpon the man, and he slept: and he tooke one of his ribbes, & closed vp the flesh in steade thereof.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the ribbe which the Lorde God had taken from the man, made he a woman, and brought her to the man.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then the man said, This now is bone of my bones, and flesh of my flesh. She shalbe called woman, because she was taken out of man.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Therefore shall man leaue his father and his mother, and shall cleaue to his wife, and they shall be one flesh.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And they were both naked, the man and his wife, and were not ashamed.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Nowe the serpent was more subtill then any beast of the fielde, which the Lord God had made: and he said to the woman, Yea, hath God in deede said, Ye shall not eate of euery tree of the garden?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the woman said vnto the serpent, We eate of the fruite of the trees of the garden,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But of the fruite of the tree which is in the middes of the garden, God hath said, Ye shall not eate of it, neither shall ye touche it, lest ye die.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then the serpent said to the woman, Ye shall not die at all,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But God doeth knowe, that when ye shall eate thereof, your eyes shall be opened, and ye shall be as gods, knowing good and euill.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So the woman (seeing that the tree was good for meate, and that it was pleasant to the eyes, and a tree to be desired to get knowledge) tooke of the fruite thereof, and did eate, & gaue also to her husband with her, and he did eate.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then the eyes of them both were opened, and they knewe that they were naked, and they sewed figge tree leaues together, and made them selues breeches.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Afterward they heard the voyce of the Lord God walking in the garden in the coole of the day, and the man & his wife hid themselues from the presence of the Lorde God among the trees of the garden.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But the Lord God called to the man, and said vnto him, Where art thou?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Who saide, I heard thy voyce in the garden, and was afraide: because I was naked, therefore I hid my selfe.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And he saide, Who tolde thee, that thou wast naked? Hast thou eaten of the tree, whereof I commanded thee that thou shouldest not eate?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then the man saide, The woman which thou gauest to be with me, she gaue me of the tree, and I did eate.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the Lorde God saide to the woman, Why hast thou done this? And the woman said, The serpent beguiled me, and I did eate.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then the Lord God said to the serpent, Because thou hast done this, thou art cursed aboue all cattell, and aboue euery beast of the fielde: vpon thy belly shalt thou goe, and dust shalt thou eate all the dayes of thy life.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: I wil also put enimitie betweene thee and the woman, and betweene thy seede & her seede. He shall breake thine head, and thou shalt bruise his heele.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Vnto the woman he said, I will greatly increase thy sorowes, and thy conceptions. In sorowe shalt thou bring foorth children, and thy desire shalbe subiect to thine husbande, and he shall rule ouer thee.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Also to Adam he said, Because thou hast obeyed the voyce of thy wife, and hast eaten of the tree, (whereof I commanded thee, saying, Thou shalt not eate of it) cursed is the earth for thy sake: in sorowe shalt thou eate of it all the dayes of thy life.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Thornes also, and thistles shall it bring foorth to thee, and thou shalt eate the herbe of the fielde.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: In the sweate of thy face shalt thou eate bread, till thou returne to the earth: for out of it wast thou taken, because thou art dust, and to dust shalt thou returne.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: (And the man called his wiues name Heuah, because she was the mother of all liuing)

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Vnto Adam also and to his wife did the Lord God make coates of skinnes, and clothed them.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the Lord God said, Beholde, the man is become as one of vs, to knowe good and euill; nowe lest he put foorth his hand, and take also of ye tree of life & eate & liue for euer,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Therefore the Lord God sent him foorth from the garden of Eden, to till ye earth, whence he was taken.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Thus he cast out man, and at the East side of the garden of Eden he set the Cherubims, and the blade of a sworde shaken, to keepe the way of the tree of life.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Afterwarde the man knewe Heuah his wife, which conceiued and bare Kain, and said, I haue obteined a man by the Lord.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And againe she brought foorth his brother Habel, & Habel was a keeper of sheepe, and Kain was a tiller of the ground.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And in processe of time it came to passe, that Kain brought an oblation vnto the Lorde of the fruite of the ground.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Habel also him selfe brought of the first fruites of his sheepe, and of the fat of them, and the Lorde had respect vnto Habel, and to his offering,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But vnto Kain and to his offering he had no regarde: wherefore Kain was exceeding wroth, and his countenance fell downe.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then ye Lord said vnto Kain, Why art thou wroth? and why is thy countenance cast downe?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: If thou do well, shalt thou not be accepted? and if thou doest not well, sinne lieth at the doore: also vnto thee his desire shalbe subiect, and thou shalt rule ouer him.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Kain spake to Habel his brother; when they were in the fielde, Kain rose vp against Habel his brother, and slewe him.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then the Lorde said vnto Kain, Where is Habel thy brother? Who answered, I cannot tell. Am I my brothers keeper?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Againe he said, What hast thou done? the voyce of thy brothers blood cryeth vnto me from the earth.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Now therefore thou art cursed from the earth, which hath opened her mouth to receiue thy brothers blood from thine hand.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: When thou shalt till the grounde, it shall not henceforth yeelde vnto thee her strength: a vagabond and a runnagate shalt thou be in the earth.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Kain said to the Lorde, My punishment is greater, then I can beare.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Behold, thou hast cast me out this day fro the earth, and from thy face shall I be hid, and shalbe a vagabond, and a runnagate in the earth, and whosoeuer findeth me, shall slay me.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then the Lord said vnto him, Doubtlesse whosoeuer slayeth Kain, he shalbe punished seue folde; the Lord set a marke vpon Kain, lest any man finding him should kill him.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Kain went out from the presence of the Lord, and dwelt in the land of Nod towarde the Eastside of Eden.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Kain also knewe his wife, which conceiued and bare Henoch: and he built a citie, and called the name of the citie by ye name of his sonne, Henoch.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And to Henoch was borne Irad, and Irad begate Mehuiael, and Mehuiael begate Methushael, and Methushael begate Lamech.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Lamech tooke him two wiues: the name of the one was Adah, and the name of the other Zillah.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Adah bare Iabal, who was the father of such as dwell in the tents, and of such as haue cattell.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And his brothers name was Iubal, who was the father of all that play on the harpe and organes.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Zillah also bare Tubal-kain, who wrought cunningly euery craft of brasse and of yron: and the sister of Tubal-kain was Naamah.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Lamech saide vnto his wiues Adah and Zillah, Heare my voyce, ye wiues of Lamech: hearken vnto my speach: for I would slay a man in my wound, and a yong man in mine hurt.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: If Kain shalbe auenged seuen folde, truely Lamech, seuentie times seuen folde.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Adam knewe his wife againe, and she bare a sonne, and she called his name Sheth: for God, saide she, hath appointed me another seede for Habel, because Kain slewe him.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And to ye same Sheth also there was borne a sonne, and he called his name Enosh. Then beganne men to call vpon the name of the Lord.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: This is the booke of the generations of Adam. In the day that God created Adam, in the likenes of God made he him,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Male and female created he them, and blessed them, and called their name Adam in the day that they were created.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Nowe Adam liued an hundred and thirtie yeeres, and begate a childe in his owne likenes after his image, and called his name Sheth.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the dayes of Adam, after he had begotten Sheth, were eight hundreth yeeres, and he begate sonnes and daughters.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So all the dayes that Adam liued, were nine hundreth and thirtie yeeres: and he died.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Sheth liued an hundreth and fiue yeeres, and begate Enosh.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Sheth liued, after he begate Enosh, eight hundreth and seuen yeeres, and begate sonnes and daughters.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So all the dayes of Sheth were nine hundreth and twelue yeeres: and he died.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Also Enosh liued ninetie yeeres, and begate Kenan.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Enosh liued, after he begate Kenan, eight hundreth and fifteene yeeres, and begate sonnes and daughters.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So all the dayes of Enosh were nine hundreth and fiue yeeres: and he died

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Likewise Kenan liued seuentie yeeres, and begate Mahalaleel.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Kenan liued, after he begate Mahalaleel, eight hundreth and fourtie yeeres, and begate sonnes and daughters.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So all the dayes of Kenan were nine hundreth and tenne yeeres: and he died.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Mahalaleel also liued sixtie & fiue yeres, and begate Iered.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Also Mahalaleel liued, after he begate Iered, eight hundreth and thirtie yeeres, and begate sonnes and daughters.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So all the dayes of Mahalaleel were eight hundreth ninetie and fiue yeeres: and he died.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Iered liued an hundreth sixtie and two yeeres, and begate Henoch.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Iered liued, after he begate Henoch, eight hundreth yeeres, and begate sonnes and daughters.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So all the dayes of Iered were nine hundreth sixtie and two yeeres: and he died.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Also Henoch liued sixtie & fiue yeeres, and begate Methushelah.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Henoch walked with God, after he begate Methushelah, three hundreth yeeres, and begate sonnes and daughters.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So all the dayes of Henoch were three hundreth sixtie and fiue yeeres.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Henoch walked with God, and he was no more seene: for God tooke him away.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Methushelah also liued an hundreth eightie and seuen yeeres, and begate Lamech.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Methushelah liued, after he begate Lamech, seuen hundreth eightie and two yeeres, and begate sonnes and daughters.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So al the dayes of Methushelah were nine hundreth sixtie and nine yeeres: and he died.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Lamech liued an hundreth eightie and two yeeres, and begate a sonne,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And called his name Noah, saying, This same shall comfort vs concerning our worke and sorowe of our hands, as touching the earth, which the Lord hath cursed.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Lamech liued, after he begate Noah, fiue hundreth ninetie and fiue yeeres, and begate sonnes and daughters.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So all the dayes of Lamech were seuen hundreth seuentie and seuen yeeres: and he died.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Noah was fiue hundreth yeere olde; Noah begate Shem, Ham and Iapheth.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So when men beganne to be multiplied vpon the earth, and there were daughters borne vnto them,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then the sonnes of God sawe the daughters of men that they were faire, & they tooke them wiues of all that they liked.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Therefore the Lord saide, My Spirit shall not alway striue with man, because he is but flesh, and his dayes shalbe an hundreth & twentie yeeres.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: There were gyants in the earth in those dayes: yea, and after that the sonnes of God came vnto the daughters of men, and they had borne them children, these were mightie men, which in olde time were men of renoume.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: When the Lorde sawe that the wickednesse of man was great in the earth, and all the imaginations of the thoughtes of his heart were onely euill continually,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then it repented ye Lord, that he had made man in the earth, and he was sorie in his heart.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Therefore ye Lord said, I will destroy from the earth the man, whom I haue created, fro man to beast, to the creeping thing, and to the foule of the heauen: for I repent that I haue made them.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But Noah found grace in the eyes of the Lord.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: These are the generations of Noah. Noah was a iust and vpright man in his time: and Noah walked with God.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Noah begate three sonnes, Shem, Ham and Iapheth.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: The earth also was corrupt before God: for the earth was filled with crueltie.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then God looked vpon the earth, and beholde, it was corrupt: for all flesh had corrupt his way vpon the earth.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And God said vnto Noah, An ende of all flesh is come before me: for the earth is filled with crueltie through them: and beholde, I wil destroy them with the earth.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Make thee an Arke of pine trees: thou shalt make cabines in the Arke, and shalt pitch it within and without with pitch.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And thus shalt thou make it: The length of the Arke shalbe three hundreth cubites, the breadth of it fiftie cubites, and the height of it thirtie cubites.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: A windowe shalt thou make in the Arke, and in a cubite shalt thou finish it aboue, and the doore of the Arke shalt thou set in the side thereof: thou shalt make it with the lowe, seconde and third roume.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And I, beholde, I will bring a flood of waters vpon the earth to destroy all flesh, wherein is the breath of life vnder the heauen: all that is in the earth shall perish.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But with thee will I establish my couenant, and thou shalt goe into the Arke, thou, and thy sonnes, and thy wife, and thy sonnes wiues with thee.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And of euery liuing thing, of all flesh two of euery sort shalt thou cause to come into the Arke, to keepe them aliue with thee: they shalbe male and female.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Of the foules, after their kinde, and of the cattell after their kind, of euery creeping thing of the earth after his kinde, two of euery sort shall come vnto thee, that thou mayest keepe them aliue.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And take thou with thee of all meate that is eaten: and thou shalt gather it to thee, that it may be meate for thee and for them.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Noah therefore did according vnto all, that God commanded him: euen so did he.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the Lord said vnto Noah, Enter thou and all thine house into the Arke: for thee haue I seene righteous before me in this age.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Of euery cleane beast thou shalt take to thee by seuens, the male & his female: but of vncleane beastes by couples, the male & his female.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Of the foules also of the heauen by seuens, male and female, to keepe seede aliue vpon the whole earth.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: For seuen dayes hence I will cause it raine vpon the earth fourtie dayes and fourtie nightes, and all the substance that I haue made, will I destroy from off the earth.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Noah therefore did according vnto all that the Lord commanded him.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Noah was sixe hundreth yeeres olde, when the flood of waters was vpon the earth.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So Noah entred and his sonnes, and his wife, & his sonnes wiues with him into the Arke, because of the waters of the flood.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Of the cleane beastes, and of the vncleane beastes, and of the foules, and of all that creepeth vpon the earth,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: There came two and two vnto Noah into the Arke, male and female, as God had commanded Noah.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And so after seuen dayes the waters of the flood were vpon the earth.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: In the sixe hundreth yeere of Noahs life in the second moneth, the seuetenth day of the moneth, in the same day were all the fountaines of the great deepe broken vp, and the windowes of heauen were opened,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the raine was vpon the earth fourtie dayes and fourtie nightes.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: In the selfe same day entred Noah with Shem, and Ham and Iapheth, the sonnes of Noah, and Noahs wife, and the three wiues of his sonnes with them into the Arke.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: They and euery beast after his kinde, and all cattell after their kinde, and euery thing that creepeth and moueth vpon the earth after his kinde, and euery foule after his kinde, euen euery bird of euery fether.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: For they came to Noah into ye Arke, two and two, of all flesh wherein is ye breath of life.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And they entring in, came male and female of all flesh, as God had commanded him: and the Lord shut him in.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then ye flood was fourtie dayes vpon the earth, and the waters were increased, and bare vp the Arke, which was lift vp aboue the earth.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: The waters also waxed strong, and were increased exceedingly vpon the earth, and the Arke went vpon the waters.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: The waters preuailed so exceedingly vpon the earth, that all the high mountaines, that are vnder the whole heauen, were couered.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Fifteene cubites vpwarde did the waters preuaile, when the mountaines were couered.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then all flesh perished that moued vpon the earth, both foule and cattell and beast, and euery thing that creepeth and moueth vpon the earth, and euery man.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Euery thing in whose nostrels the spirit of life did breathe, whatsoeuer they were in the drie land, they died.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So he destroyed euery thing that was vpon the earth, from man to beast, to ye creeping thing, and to the foule of the heauen: they were euen destroyed from the earth; Noah onely remained; & they that were with him in ye Arke.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the waters preuailed vpon the earth an hundreth and fiftie dayes.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Nowe God remembred Noah and euery beast, and all the cattell that was with him in the Arke: therefore God made a winde to passe vpon the earth, and the waters ceased.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: The fountaines also of the deepe and the windowes of heauen were stopped and the raine from heauen was restrained,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the waters returned from aboue the earth, going and returning: and after the ende of the hundreth and fiftieth day the waters abated.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And in the seuenth moneth, in the seuenteenth day of the moneth, the Arke rested vpon the mountaines of Ararat.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the waters were going and decreasing vntill the tenth moneth: in the tenth moneth, and in the first day of the moneth were the toppes of the mountaines seene.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So after fourtie dayes, Noah opened the windowe of the Arke, which he had made,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And sent forth a rauen, which went out going forth and returning, vntill the waters were dried vp vpon the earth.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Againe he sent a doue from him, that he might see if the waters were diminished from off the earth.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But the doue found no rest for the sole of her foote: therefore she returned vnto him into the Arke (for the waters were vpon the whole earth) and he put forth his hand, and receiued her, and tooke her to him into the Arke.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And he abode yet other seuen dayes, and againe he sent forth the doue out of the Arke.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the doue came to him in ye euening, and loe, in her mouth was an oliue leafe that she had pluckt: whereby Noah knewe that the waters were abated from off the earth.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Notwithstanding he wayted yet other seuen dayes, and sent forth the doue, which returned not againe vnto him any more.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And in the sixe hundreth and one yeere, in the first day of the first moneth the waters were dryed vp from off the earth: and Noah remoued the couering of the Arke and looked, and beholde, the vpper part of the ground was drie.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And in the second moneth, in the seuen & twentieth day of the moneth was the earth drie.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then God spake to Noah, saying,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Goe forth of the Arke, thou & thy wife, and thy sonnes and thy sonnes wiues with thee.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Bring forth with thee euery beast that is with thee, of all flesh, both foule and cattell, and euery thing that creepeth and moueth vpon the earth, that they may breede abundantly in ye earth, and bring forth fruite & increase vpon ye earth.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So Noah came forth, and his sonnes, and his wife, and his sonnes wiues with him.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Euery beast, euery creeping thing, and euery foule, all that moueth vpon the earth after their kindes went out of the Arke.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Noah built an altar to the Lord & tooke of euery cleane beast, & of euery cleane foule, and offered burnt offerings vpon the altar.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the Lord smelled a sauour of rest, and the Lord said in his heart, I will hencefoorth curse the ground no more for mans cause: for the imagination of mans heart is euill, euen from his youth: neither will I smite any more all things liuing, as I haue done.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Hereafter seede time & haruest, & colde and heate, and sommer and winter, and day and night shal not cease, so long as ye earth remaineth.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And God blessed Noah and his sonnes, and said to them, Bring foorth fruite, and multiplie, and replenish the earth.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Also the feare of you, and the dread of you shalbe vpon euery beast of the earth, and vpon euery foule of the heauen, vpon all that moueth on the earth, and vpon all the fishes of the sea: into your hand are they deliuered.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Euery thing that moueth and liueth, shall be meate for you: as the greene herbe, haue I giuen you all things.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But flesh with the life thereof, I meane, with the blood thereof, shall ye not eate.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: For surely I will require your blood, wherein your liues are: at the hand of euery beast will I require it: and at the hand of man, euen at the hand of a mans brother will I require the life of man.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Who so sheadeth mans blood, by man shall his blood be shed: for in the image of God hath he made man.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But bring ye forth fruite & multiplie: grow plentifully in the earth, and increase therein.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: God spake also to Noah & to his sonnes with him, saying,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Behold, I, euen I establish my couenant with you, and with your seede after you,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And with euery liuing creature that is with you, with the foule, with the cattell, and with euery beast of the earth with you, from all that goe out of the Arke, vnto euery beast of the earth.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And my couenant will I establish with you, that from henceforth all flesh shall not be rooted out by ye waters of the flood, neither shall there be a flood to destroy the earth any more.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then God saide, This is the token of the couenant which I make betweene me and you, and betweene euery liuing thing, that is with you vnto perpetuall generations.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: I haue set my bowe in the cloude, and it shalbe for a signe of the couenant betweene me and the earth.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And when I shall couer the earth with a cloud, and the bowe shall be seene in the cloude,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then will I remember my couenant, which is betweene me and you, and betweene euery liuing thing in all flesh, and there shalbe no more waters of a flood to destroy all flesh.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Therefore the bowe shalbe in the cloude, that I may see it, and remember the euerlasting couenant betweene God, and euery liuing thing in all flesh that is vpon the earth.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: God said yet to Noah, This is the signe of the couenant, which I haue established betweene me and all flesh that is vpon the earth.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Nowe the sonnes of Noah going foorth of the Arke, were Shem and Ham and Iapheth; Ham is the father of Canaan.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: These are the three sonnes of Noah, and of them was the whole earth ouerspred.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Noah also began to be an husband man and planted a vineyard.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And he drunke of ye wine and was drunken, & was vncouered in the middes of his tent.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And when Ham the father of Canaan sawe the nakednesse of his father, he tolde his two brethren without.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then tooke Shem & Iapheth a garment, and put it vpon both their shoulders, and went backwarde, and couered the nakednesse of their father with their faces backwarde: so they sawe not their fathers nakednesse.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Noah awoke from his wine, and knew what his yonger sonne had done vnto him,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And said, Cursed be Canaan: a seruant of seruants shall he be vnto his brethren.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: He said moreouer, blessed be the Lord God of Shem, and let Canaan be his seruant.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: God perswade Iapheth, that he may dwell in the tentes of Shem, and let Canaan be his seruant.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Noah liued after the flood three hundreth and fiftie yeeres.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So all the dayes of Noah were nine hundreth and fiftie yeeres: and he died.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Now these are the generations of the sonnes of Noah, Shem, Ham and Iapheth: vnto whom sonnes were borne after the flood.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: The sonnes of Iapheth were Gomer and Magog, and Madai, and Iauan, and Tubal, and Meshech, and Tiras.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the sonnes of Gomer, Ashkenaz, and Riphath, and Togarmah.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Also the sonnes of Iauan, Elishah and Tarshish, Kittim, and Dodanim.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Of these were the yles of the Gentiles deuided in their landes, euery man after his tongue, and after their families in their nations.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Moreouer, ye sonnes of Ham were Cush, and Mizraim, and Put, and Canaan.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the sonnes of Cush, Seba and Hauilah, and Sabtah, and Raamah, and Sabtecha: also the sonnes of Raamah were Sheba and Dedan.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Cush begate Nimrod, who began to be mightie in the earth.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: He was a mightie hunter before the Lord. wherefore it is saide, As Nimrod the mightie hunter before the Lord.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the beginning of his kingdome was Babel, and Erech, and Accad, and Calneh, in the land of Shinar.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Out of that land came Asshur, and builded Niniueh, and the citie Rehoboth, and Calah:

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Resen also betweene Niniueh and Calah: this is a great citie.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Mizraim begate Ludim, and Anamim, and Lehabim, and Naphtuhim.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Pathrusim also, & Casluhim (out of whom came the Philistims) and Caphtorims.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Also Canaan begat Zidon his first borne, and Heth,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Iebusi, and Emori, and Girgashi,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Hiui, and Arki, and Sini,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Aruadi, and Zemari, and Hamathi: and afterwarde were the families of the Canaanites spred abroade.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then the border of the Canaanites was from Zidon, as thou commest to Gerar vntil Azzah, and as thou goest vnto Sodom, & Gomorah, and Admah, and Zeboijm, euen vnto Lasha.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: These are the sonnes of Ham according to their families, according to their tongues in their countries and in their nations.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Vnto Shem also the father of all the sonnes of Eber, and elder brother of Iapheth were children borne.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: The sonnes of Shem were Elam and Asshur, and Arpachshad, and Lud, and Aram.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the sonnes of Aram, Vz and Hul, and Gether and Mash.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Also Arpachshad begate Shelah, and Shelah begate Eber.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Vnto Eber also were borne two sonnes: the name of the one was Peleg: for in his dayes was the earth diuided: and his brothers name was Ioktan.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Ioktan begate Almodad and Sheleph, and Hazarmaueth, and Ierah,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Hadoram, and Vzal, and Dicklah,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Obal, and Abimael, and Sheba,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Ophir, and Hauilah, and Iobab: all these were the sonnes of Ioktan.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And their dwelling was from Mesha, as thou goest vnto Sephar a mount of the East.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: These are the sonnes of Shem according to their families, according to their tongues, in their countreis and nations.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: These are the families of the sonnes of Noah, after their generations among their people: and out of these were the nations diuided in the earth after the flood.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then the whole earth was of one language and one speache.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And as they went from the East, they found a plaine in the land of Shinar, and there they abode.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And they said one to another, Come, let vs make bricke, and burne it in the fire. So they had bricke for stone, and slyme had they in steade of morter.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Also they said, Goe to, let vs builde vs a citie and a towre, whose top may reache vnto the heauen, that we may get vs a name, lest we be scattered vpon the whole earth.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But the Lord came downe, to see the citie and towre, which the sonnes of men builded.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the Lord said, Beholde, the people is one, and they all haue one language, and this they begin to doe, neither can they now be stopped from whatsoeuer they haue imagined to do.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Come on, let vs goe downe, and there confound their language, that euery one perceiue not anothers speache.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So ye Lord scattered them from thence vpon all the earth, & they left off to build the citie.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Therefore the name of it was called Babel, because the Lorde did there confounde the language of all the earth: from thence then did the Lord scatter them vpon all the earth.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: These are the generations of Shem: Shem was an hundreth yeere olde, & begate Arpachshad two yeere after the flood.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Shem liued, after he begate Arpachshad, fiue hundreth yeeres, and begate sonnes and daughters.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Also Arpachshad liued fiue and thirtie yeeres, and begate Shelah.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Arpachshad liued, after he begate Shelah, foure hundreth and three yeeres, and begate sonnes and daughters.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Shelah liued thirtie yeeres, and begat Eber.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So Shelah liued, after he begat Eber, foure hundreth and three yeeres, and begat sonnes and daughters.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Likewise Eber liued foure & thirtie yeres, and begate Peleg.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So Eber liued, after he begate Peleg, foure hundreth and thirtie yeeres, and begate sonnes and daughters

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Peleg liued thirtie yeeres, and begate Reu.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Peleg liued, after he begate Reu, two hundreth and nine yeeres, and begate sonnes and daughters.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Also Reu liued two and thirtie yeeres, and begate Serug.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So Reu liued, after he begate Serug, two hundreth & seuen yeeres, and begate sonnes and daughters.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Moreouer Serug liued thirtie yeeres, and begate Nahor.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Serug liued, after he begate Nahor, two hundreth yeeres, and begate sonnes and daughters.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Nahor liued nine and twentie yeeres, and begate Terah.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So Nahor liued, after he begate Terah, an hundreth and nineteene yeeres, and begat sonnes and daughters.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So Terah liued seuentie yeeres, and begate Abram, Nahor, and Haran.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Nowe these are the generations of Terah: Terah begate Abram, Nahor, and Haran: and Haran begate Lot.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Haran died before Terah his father in the land of his natiuitie, in Vr of the Caldees.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So Abram and Nahor tooke them wiues. The name of Abrams wife was Sarai, & the name of Nahors wife Milcah, the daughter of Haran, the father of Milcah, and the father of Iscah.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But Sarai was barren, and had no childe.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Terah tooke Abram his sonne, and Lot the sonne of Haran, his sonnes sonne, and Sarai his daughter in lawe, his sonne Abrams wife: and they departed together from Vr of the Caldees, to goe into the land of Canaan, and they came to Haran, and dwelt there.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So the dayes of Terah were two hundreth and fiue yeeres, and Terah died in Haran.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: For the Lorde had said vnto Abram, Get thee out of thy countrey, and from thy kindred, and from thy fathers house vnto the land that I will shewe thee.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And I will make of thee a great nation, and will blesse thee, and make thy name great, and thou shalt be a blessing.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: I will also blesse them that blesse thee, and curse them that curse thee, and in thee shall all families of the earth be blessed.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So Abram departed, euen as ye Lorde spake vnto him, and Lot went with him. (And Abram was seuentie and fiue yeere olde, when he departed out of Haran)

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Abram tooke Sarai his wife, & Lot his brothers sonne, and all their substance that they possessed, and the soules that they had gotten in Haran, & they departed, to goe to the land of Canaan: & to the land of Canaan they came.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So Abram passed through the land vnto the place of Shechem, and vnto the plaine of Moreh (and the Canaanite was then in ye land)

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the Lord appeared vnto Abram, and said, Vnto thy seede will I giue this land; there builded he an altar vnto the Lord, which appeared vnto him.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Afterward remouing thence vnto a moutaine Eastward from Beth-el, he pitched his tent hauing Beth-el on the Westside, & Haai on the East: and there he built an altar vnto the Lord, and called on the Name of the Lord.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Againe Abram went forth going & iourneying toward the South.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then there came a famine in the land: therefore Abram went downe into Egypt to soiourne there: for there was a great famine in the lande.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And when he drewe neere to enter into Egypt, he said to Sarai his wife, Beholde nowe, I know that thou art a faire woman to looke vpo:

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Therefore it will come to passe, that when the Egyptians see thee, they will say, She is his wife: so will they kill me, but they will keepe thee aliue.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Say, I pray thee, that thou art my sister, that I may fare well for thy sake, & that my life may be preserued by thee.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Nowe when Abram was come into Egypt, the Egyptians behelde the woman: for she was very faire.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the Princes of Pharaoh sawe her, and commended her vnto Pharaoh: so the woman was taken into Pharaohs house:

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Who intreated Abram well for her sake, and he had sheepe, and beeues, and hee asses, and men seruants and maide seruants, and shee asses, and camelles.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But the Lorde plagued Pharaoh and his house with great plagues, because of Sarai Abrams wife.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Pharaoh called Abram, and saide, Why hast thou done this vnto me? Wherefore diddest thou not tell me, that she was thy wife?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Why saidest thou, She is my sister, that I should take her to be my wife? Nowe therefore beholde thy wife, take her and goe thy way.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Pharaoh gaue men commaundement concerning him: and they conueyed him forth, and his wife, and all that he had.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Abram went vp from Egypt, he, and his wife, and all that he had, and Lot with him toward the South.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Abram was very rich in cattell, in siluer and in golde.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And he went on his iourney from ye South toward Beth-el, to the place where his tent had bene at ye beginning, betweene Beth-el & Haai,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Vnto the place of the altar, which he had made there at the first: and there Abram called on the Name of the Lord.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Lot also, who went with Abram, had sheepe, and cattell and tentes,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So that the land coulde not beare them, that they might dwell together: for their substance was great, so that they coulde not dwell together.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Also there was debate betweene ye heardmen of Abrams cattell, & the heardmen of Lots cattell. (and the Canaanites and the Perizzites dwelled at that time in the land.)

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then saide Abram vnto Lot, Let there be no strife, I pray thee, betweene thee and me, neither betweene mine heardmen & thine heardmen: for we be brethren.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Is not the whole land before thee? depart I pray thee from me: if thou wilt take the left hand, then I will goe to the right: or if thou goe to the right hand, then I will take the left.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So when Lot lifted vp his eyes, he saw that all the plaine of Iorden was watered euery where: (for before the Lorde destroyed Sodom and Gomorah, it was as the garden of the Lorde, like the land of Egypt, as thou goest vnto Zoar)

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Lot chose vnto him all the plaine of Iorden, and tooke his iourney from the East: and they departed the one from the other.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Abram dwelled in the lande of Canaan, and Lot abode in the cities of the plaine, and pitched his tent euen to Sodom.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Now the men of Sodom were wicked and exceeding sinners against the Lord.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then the Lord saide vnto Abram, (after that Lot was departed from him) Lift vp thine eyes nowe, and looke from the place where thou art, Northward, and Southward, and Eastwarde, and Westward:

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: For all the land, which thou seest, will I giue vnto thee and to thy seede for euer,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And I will make thy seede, as the dust of the earth: so that if a man can number the dust of the earth, then shall thy seede be numbred.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Arise, walke through the land, in ye length thereof, and breadth thereof: for I will giue it vnto thee.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Abram remoued his tent, and came and dwelled in the plaine of Mamre, which is in Hebron, and builded there an altar vnto ye Lorde.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And in the dayes of Amraphel King of Shinar, Arioch King of Ellasar, Chedor-laomer King of Elam, and Tidal king of the nations:

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: These men made warre with Bera King of Sodom, and with Birsha King of Gomorah, Shinab King of Admah, and Shemeber King of Zeboiim, and the King of Bela, which is Zoar.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: All these ioyned together in the vale of Siddim, which is the salt Sea.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Twelue yeere were they subiect to Chedor-laomer, but in the thirteenth yeere they rebelled.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And in the fourteenth yeere came Chedor-laomer, and the Kings that were with him, and smote the Rephaims in Ashteroth Karnaim, and the Zuzims in Ham, and the Emims in Shaueh Kiriathaim,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the Horites in their mount Seir, vnto the plaine of Paran, which is by the wildernesse.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And they returned and came to En-mishpat, which is Kadesh, and smote all the countrey of the Amalekites, and also the Amorites that dwelled in Hazezon-tamar.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then went out the King of Sodom, and the King of Gomorah, and the King of Admah, and the King of Zeboiim, and the King of Bela, which is Zoar: and they ioyned battell with them in the vale of Siddim:

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: To wit, with Chedor-laomer king of Elam, and Tidal king of nations, and Amraphel king of Shinar, and Arioch king of Ellasar: foure Kings against fiue.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Now the vale of Siddim was full of slime pits, & the Kings of Sodom & Gomorah fled and fell there: and ye residue fled to the mountaine.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then they tooke all the substance of Sodom and Gomorah, and al their vitailes and went their way.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: They tooke Lot also Abrams brothers sonne and his substance (for he dwelt at Sodom) and departed.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then came one that had escaped, and told Abram the Ebrew, which dwelt in the plaine of Mamre ye Amorite, brother of Eshcol, & brother of Aner, which were confederat with Abram.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: When Abram heard that his brother was taken, he brought forth of them that were borne and brought vp in his house, three hundreth and eighteene, and pursued them vnto Dan.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then he, and his seruants deuided them selues against them by night, & smote them and pursued them vnto Hobah, which is on the left side of Damascus,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And he recouered all the substance, and also brought againe his brother Lot, & his goods, and the women also and the people.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: After that he returned from the slaughter of Chedor-laomer, and of the Kings that were with him, came the King of Sodom foorth to meete him in the valley of Shaueh, which is the Kings dale.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Melchi-zedek King of Shalem brought foorth bread and wine: and he was a Priest of the most high God.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Therefore he blessed him, saying, Blessed art thou, Abram, of God most high possessour of heauen and earth,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And blessed be the most high God, which hath deliuered thine enemies into thine hand. And Abram gaue him tythe of all.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then the King of Sodom saide to Abram, Giue me the persons, and take the goodes to thy selfe.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Abram said to the King of Sodom, I haue lift vp mine hand vnto the Lorde the most hie God possessor of heauen and earth,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: That I will not take of all that is thine, so much as a threde or shoolatchet, lest thou shouldest say, I haue made Abram riche,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Saue onely that, which the yong men haue eaten, and the partes of the men which went with me, Aner, Eshcol, and Mamre: let them take their partes.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: After these things, the worde of the Lorde came vnto Abram in a vision, saying, Feare not, Abram, I am thy buckler, and thine exceeding great reward.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Abram said, O Lord God, what wilt thou giue me, seeing I goe childlesse, and the steward of mine house is this Eliezer of Damascus?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Againe Abram saide, Beholde, to me thou hast giuen no seede: wherefore loe, a seruant of mine house shalbe mine heire.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then beholde, the worde of the Lorde came vnto him, saying, This man shall not be thine heire, but one that shall come out of thine owne bowels, he shalbe thine heire.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Moreouer he brought him forth and said, Looke vp nowe vnto heauen, and tell ye starres, if thou be able to number them: and he said vnto him, So shall thy seede be.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Abram beleeued the Lorde, and he counted that to him for righteousnesse.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Againe he saide vnto him, I am the Lord, that brought thee out of Vr of the Caldees, to giue thee this land to inherite it.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And he said, O Lord God, whereby shall I knowe that I shall inherite it?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then he said vnto him, Take me an heifer of three yeeres olde, and a shee goate of three yeeres olde, and a ramme of three yeeres olde, a turtle doue also and a pigeon.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So he tooke all these vnto him, and deuided them into the middes, & laid euery piece one against an other: but the birdes deuided he not.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then foules fell on the carkases, and Abram droue them away.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And when the sunne went downe, there fell an heauie sleepe vpon Abram: and loe, a very fearefull darkenes fell vpon him.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then he saide to Abram, Knowe for a suretie, that thy seede shalbe a stranger in a land, that is not theirs, foure hundreth yeeres, and shall serue them: & they shall intreate them euill.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Notwithstanding the nation, whom they shall serue, will I iudge: and afterward shall they come out with great substance.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But thou shalt goe vnto thy fathers in peace, and shalt be buried in a good age.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And in the fourth generation they shall come hither againe: for the wickednes of the Amorites is not yet full.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Also when the sunne went downe, there was a darkenes: & behold, a smoking fornace, and a firebrand, which went betweene those pieces.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: In that same day the Lord made a couenant with Abram, saying, Vnto thy seede haue I giuen this lande, from the riuer of Egypt vnto the great riuer, the riuer Euphrates.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: The Kenites, and the Kenizites, and the Kadmonites,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the Hittites, and the Perizzites, and the Rephaims,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: The Amorites also, and the Canaanites, and the Girgashites, and the Iebusites.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Nowe Sarai Abrams wife bare him no children, and she had a maide an Egyptian, Hagar by name.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Sarai said vnto Abram, Beholde now, the Lorde hath restrained me from childe bearing. I pray thee goe in vnto my maide: it may be that I shall receiue a childe by her; Abram obeyed the voyce of Sarai.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Sarai Abrams wife tooke Hagar her maide the Egyptian, after Abram had dwelled ten yeere in the land of Canaan, and gaue her to her husband Abram for his wife.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And he went in vnto Hagar, & she conceiued; when she sawe that she had conceiued, her dame was despised in her eyes.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Sarai saide to Abram, Thou doest me wrong. I haue giuen my maide into thy bosome, and she seeth that she hath conceiued, and I am despised in her eyes: the Lorde iudge betweene me and thee.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Abram saide to Sarai, Beholde, thy maide is in thine hand: doe with her as it pleaseth thee. Then Sarai dealt roughly with her: wherefore she fled from her.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But the Angel of the Lord founde her beside a fountaine of water in the wildernesse by the fountaine in the way to Shur,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And he saide, Hagar Sarais maide, whence commest thou? and whither wilt thou goe? And she said, I flie from my dame Sarai.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then the Angel of the Lorde saide to her, Returne to thy dame, and humble thy selfe vnder her hands.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Againe the Angel of the Lorde saide vnto her, I will so greatly increase thy seede, that it shal not be numbred for multitude.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Also the Angel of the Lord said vnto her, See, thou art with childe, and shalt beare a sonne, and shalt call his name Ishmael: for the Lorde hath heard thy tribulation.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And he shalbe a wilde man: his hande shall be against euery man, and euery mans hand against him. and he shall dwell in the presence of all his brethren.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then she called the name of the Lorde, that spake vnto her, Thou God lookest on me: for she said, Haue I not also here looked after him that seeth me?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Wherefore the well was called, Beerlahai-roi. lo, it is betweene Kadesh and Bered.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Hagar bare Abram a sonne, and Abram called his sonnes name, which Hagar bare, Ishmael.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Abram was foure score and sixe yeere olde, when Hagar bare him Ishmael.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: When Abram was ninetie yeere olde and nine, the Lord appeared to Abram, and said vnto him, I am God all sufficient. walke before me, and be thou vpright,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And I will make my couenant betweene me and thee, & I will multiplie thee exceedingly.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Abram fell on his face, and God talked with him, saying,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Beholde, I make my couenant with thee, and thou shalt be a father of many nations,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Neither shall thy name any more be called Abram, but thy name shalbe Abraham: for a father of many nations haue I made thee.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Also I will make thee exceeding fruitfull, and will make nations of thee: yea, Kings shall proceede of thee.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Moreouer I wil establish my couenant betweene me and thee, and thy seede after thee in their generations, for an euerlasting couenant, to be God vnto thee and to thy seede after thee.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And I will giue thee and thy seede after thee the land, wherein thou art a stranger, euen all the land of Canaan, for an euerlasting possession, and I will be their God.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Againe God said vnto Abraham, Thou also shalt keepe my couenant, thou, and thy seede after thee in their generations.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: This is my couenant which ye shall keepe betweene me & you, & thy seede after thee, Let euery man childe among you be circumcised:

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: That is, ye shall circumcise the foreskin of your flesh, and it shalbe a signe of the couenant betweene me and you.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And euery man childe of eight dayes olde among you, shalbe circumcised in your generations, aswell he that is borne in thine house, as he that is bought with money of any stranger, which is not of thy seede.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: He that is borne in thine house, & he that is bought with thy money, must needes be circumcised: so my couenant shall be in your flesh for an euerlasting couenant.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But the vncircumcised man childe, in whose flesh the foreskin is not circumcised, euen that person shall be cut off from his people, because he hath broken my couenant.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Afterward God said vnto Abraham, Sarai thy wife shalt thou not call Sarai, but Sarah shalbe her name.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And I will blesse her, & will also giue thee a sonne of her, yea, I will blesse her, and she shall be the mother of nations: Kings also of people shall come of her.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Abraham fell vpon his face, and laughed, and said in his heart, Shall a childe be borne vnto him, that is an hundreth yeere olde? and shall Sarah that is ninetie yeere olde beare?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Abraham saide vnto God, Oh, that Ishmael might liue in thy sight.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then God saide, Sarah thy wife shall beare thee a sonne in deede, and thou shalt call his name Izhak: and I will establish my couenant with him for an euerlasting couenant, and with his seede after him.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And as concerning Ishmael, I haue heard thee: loe, I haue blessed him, and will make him fruitfull, and will multiplie him exceedingly: twelue princes shall he beget, and I will make a great nation of him.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But my couenant will I establish with Izhak, which Sarah shall beare vnto thee, the next yeere at this season.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And he left off talking with him, and God went vp from Abraham.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Abraham tooke Ishmael his sonne and all that were borne in his house, and all that was bought with his money, that is, euery man childe among the men of Abrahams house, and he circumcised the foreskinne of their flesh in that selfe same day, as God had comaunded him.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Abraham also himselfe was ninetie yeere olde and nine, when the foreskinne of his flesh was circumcised.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Ishmael his sonne was thirteene yeere olde, when the foreskinne of his flesh was circumcised.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: The selfe same day was Abraham circumcised, and Ishmael his sonne:

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And all the men of his house, both borne in his house, and bought with money of the stranger, were circumcised with him.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Againe the Lord appeared vnto him in the plaine of Mamre, as he sate in his tent doore about the heate of the day.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And he lift vp his eyes, and looked: and lo, three men stoode by him, and when he sawe them, he ranne to meete them from the tent doore, and bowed himselfe to the grounde.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And he said, Lord, if I haue now founde fauour in thy sight, goe not, I pray thee, from thy seruant.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Let a litle water, I pray you, be brought, and wash your feete, and rest your selues vnder the tree.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And I will bring a morsell of bread, that you may comfort your hearts, afterward ye shall go your wayes: for therefore are ye come to your seruant; they said, Do euen as thou hast said.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Abraham made haste into the tent vnto Sarah, and saide, Make ready at once three measures of fine meale: kneade it, and make cakes vpon the hearth.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Abraham ranne to the beastes, and tooke a tender and good calfe, and gaue it to the seruant, who hasted to make it ready.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And he tooke butter and milke, and the calfe, which he had prepared, and set before them, and stoode himselfe by them vnder the tree, and they did eate.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then they saide to him, Where is Sarah thy wife? And he answered, Beholde, she is in the tent.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And he saide, I will certainely come againe vnto thee according to ye time of life: and loe, Sarah thy wife shall haue a sonne; Sarah heard in the tent doore, which was behinde him.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: (Nowe Abraham and Sarah were old and striken in age, and it ceased to be with Sarah after the maner of women)

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Therefore Sarah laughed within her selfe, saying, After I am waxed olde, and my lord also, shall I haue lust?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And ye Lord saide vnto Abraham, Wherefore did Sarah thus laugh, saying, Shall I certainely beare a childe, which am olde?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: (Shall any thing be hard to the Lord? at the time appointed will I returne vnto thee, euen according to the time of life, and Sarah shall haue a sonne.)

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But Sarah denied, saying, I laughed not: for she was afraide; he said, It is not so: for thou laughedst.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Afterwarde the men did rise vp from thence and looked toward Sodom: and Abraham went with them to bring them on the way.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the Lord said, Shall I hide from Abraham that thing which I doe,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Seeing that Abraham shalbe in deede a great and a mightie nation, and all the nations of the earth shalbe blessed in him?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: For I knowe him that he will commande his sonnes and his houshold after him, that they keepe the way of the Lord, to doe righteousnesse and iudgement, that the Lord may bring vpon Abraham that he hath spoken vnto him.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then the Lorde saide, Because the crie of Sodom and Gomorah is great, and because their sinne is exceeding grieuous,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: I will goe downe nowe, and see whether they haue done altogether according to that crie which is come vnto me: and if not, that I may knowe.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the men turned thence and went toward Sodom: but Abraham stoode yet before the Lord.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Abraham drewe neere, & said, Wilt thou also destroy the righteous with the wicked?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: If there be fiftie righteous within the citie, wilt thou destroy and not spare the place for the fiftie righteous that are therein?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Be it farre fro thee from doing this thing, to slay the righteous with the wicked: and that the righteous should be euen as the wicked, be it farre from thee. shall not the Iudge of all the worlde doe right?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the Lord answered, If I shall finde in Sodom fiftie righteous within the citie, then will I spare all the place for their sakes.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Abraham answered and said, Behold nowe, I haue begun to speake vnto my Lord, and I am but dust and ashes.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: If there shall lacke fiue of fiftie righteous, wilt thou destroy all the citie for fiue? And he saide, If I finde there fiue and fourtie, I will not destroy it.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And he yet spake to him againe, and saide, What if there shalbe found fourtie there? Then he answered, I will not doe it for fourties sake.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Againe he said, Let not my Lord nowe be angry, that I speake, What if thirtie be founde there? Then he saide, I will not doe it, if I finde thirtie there.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Moreouer he said, Behold, now I haue begonne to speake vnto my Lord, What if twentie be founde there? And he answered, I will not destroy it for twenties sake.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then he saide, Let not my Lord be nowe angrie, and I will speake but this once, What if tenne be found there? And he answered, I will not destroy it for tennes sake.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the Lord went his way when he had left communing with Abraham, and Abraham returned vnto his place.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And in the euening there came two Angels to Sodom: and Lot sate at the gate of Sodom, and Lot sawe them, and rose vp to meete them, and he bowed himselfe with his face to the ground.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And he saide, See my Lords, I pray you turne in nowe into your seruants house, and tarie all night, and wash your feete, & ye shall rise vp early and goe your wayes. Who saide, Nay, but we will abide in the streete all night.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then he preassed vpon them earnestly, and they turned in to him, and came to his house, and he made them a feast, and did bake vnleauened bread, and they did eate.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But before they went to bed, the men of the citie, euen the men of Sodom compassed the house rounde about from the yong euen to the olde, all the people from all quarters.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Who crying vnto Lot said to him, Where are the men, which came to thee this night? Bring them out vnto vs that we may knowe them.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Lot went out at the doore vnto them, and shut the doore after him,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And said, I pray you, my brethren, do not so wickedly.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Beholde nowe, I haue two daughters, which haue not knowen man: them will I bring out now vnto you, and doe to them as seemeth you good: onely vnto these men doe nothing: for therefore are they come vnder the shadowe of my roofe.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then they said, Away hence, and they said, He is come alone as a stranger, and shall he iudge and rule? We will nowe deale worse with thee then with them. So they preassed sore vpon Lot himselfe, and came to breake the doore.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But the men put forth their hand and pulled Lot into the house to them & shut to ye doore.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then they smote the men that were at the doore of the house with blindnes both small and great, so that they were wearie in seeking the doore.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then the men said vnto Lot, Whom hast thou yet here? Either sonne in lawe, or thy sonnes, or thy daughters, or whatsoeuer thou hast in the citie, bring it out of this place.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: For we will destroy this place, because the crye of them is great before the Lorde, and the Lord hath sent vs to destroy it.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Lot went out and spake vnto his sonnes in lawe, which maried his daughters, and said, Arise, get you out of this place: for the Lord will destroy the citie: but he seemed to his sonnes in lawe as though he had mocked.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And when the morning arose, the Angels hasted Lot, saying, Arise, take thy wife and thy two daughters which are here, lest thou be destroyed in the punishment of the citie.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And as he prolonged the time, the men caught both him and his wife, and his two daughters by the hands (the Lord being mercifull vnto him) and they brought him foorth, and set him without the citie.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And when they had brought them out, the Angel said, Escape for thy life: looke not behinde thee, neither tarie thou in all the plaine: escape into ye mountaine, least thou be destroyed.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Lot saide vnto them, Not so, I pray thee, my Lord.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Behold now, thy seruant hath found grace in thy sight, and thou hast magnified thy mercie, which thou hast shewed vnto me in sauing my life: and I cannot escape in the mountaine, least some euill take me, and I die.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: See nowe this citie hereby to flee vnto, which is a litle one: Oh let me escape thither: is it not a litle one, and my soule shall liue?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then he said vnto him, Beholde, I haue receiued thy request also concerning this thing, that I will not ouerthrow this citie, for the which thou hast spoken.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Haste thee, saue thee there: for I can doe nothing till thou be come thither. Therefore the name of the citie was called Zoar.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: The sunne did rise vpon the earth, when Lot entred into Zoar.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then the Lord rained vpon Sodom and vpon Gomorah brimstone, & fire from the Lord out of heauen,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And ouerthrewe those cities and all the plaine, and all the inhabitants of the cities; and that that grewe vpon the earth.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Now his wife behind him looked backe, and she became a pillar of salt.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Abraham rising vp earely in ye morning went to the place, where he had stand before the Lord,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And looking towarde Sodom and Gomorah and toward all the land of the plaine, behold, he sawe the smoke of the lande mounting vp as the smoke of a fornace.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But yet when God destroyed the cities of the plaine, God thought vpon Abraham, and sent Lot out from the middes of the destruction, when he ouerthrewe the cities, wherein Lot dwelled.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Lot went vp from Zoar, & dwelt in the mountaine with his two daughters: for he feared to tarie in Zoar, but dwelt in a caue, he, and his two daughters.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the elder saide vnto the yonger, Our father is old, and there is not a man in the earth, to come in vnto vs after the maner of all ye earth.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Come, wee will make our father drinke wine, and lie with him, that we may preserue seede of our father.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So they made their father drinke wine that night, and the elder went and lay with her father: but he perceiued not, neither whe she lay downe, neither when she rose vp.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And on the morowe the elder saide to the yonger, Behold, yester night lay I with my father: let vs make him drinke wine this night also, and goe thou and lie with him, that we may preserue seede of our father.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So they made their father drinke wine that night also, and the yonger arose, & lay with him, but he perceiued not, when she lay downe, neither when she rose vp.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Thus were both the daughters of Lot with childe by their father.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the elder bare a sonne, and she called his name Moab: the same is the father of the Moabites vnto this day.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the yonger bare a sonne also, and she called his name Ben-ammi: the same is the father of the Ammonites vnto this day.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Afterward Abraham departed thence toward the South countrey and dwelled betweene Cadesh and Shur, and soiourned in Gerar.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Abraham said of Sarah his wife, She is my sister. Then Abimelech King of Gerar sent and tooke Sarah.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But God came to Abimelech in a dreame by night, and said to him, Beholde, thou art but dead, because of the woman, which thou hast taken: for she is a mans wife.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: (Notwithstanding Abimelech had not yet come neere her) And he said, Lord, wilt thou slay euen the righteous nation?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Said not he vnto me, She is my sister? yea, and she her selfe said, He is my brother: with an vpright minde, and innocent handes haue I done this.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And God saide vnto him by a dreame, I knowe that thou diddest this euen with an vpright minde, and I kept thee also that thou shouldest not sinne against me: therefore suffered I thee not to touche her.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Now then deliuer the man his wife againe: for he is a Prophet, and he shall pray for thee that thou mayest liue: but if thou deliuer her not againe, be sure that thou shalt die the death, thou, and all that thou hast.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Abimelech rising vp early in ye morning, called all his seruants, and tolde all these things vnto them, and the men were sore afraid.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Afterward Abimelech called Abraham, and said vnto him, What hast thou done vnto vs? and what haue I offeded thee, that thou hast brought on me and on my kingdome this great sinne? thou hast done things vnto me that ought not to be done.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So Abimelech said vnto Abraham, What sawest thou that thou hast done this thing?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Abraha answered, Because I thought thus, Surely the feare of God is not in this place, and they will slay me for my wiues sake.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Yet in very deede she is my sister: for she is the daughter of my father, but not the daughter of my mother, and she is my wife.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Nowe when God caused me to wander out of my fathers house, I said then to her, This is thy kindnes that thou shalt shewe vnto me in all places where we come, Say thou of me, He is my brother.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then tooke Abimelech sheepe & beeues, & men seruants, & women seruants, & gaue them vnto Abraham, and restored him Sarah his wife.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Abimelech saide, Beholde, my land is before thee: dwell where it pleaseth thee.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Likewise to Sarah he said, Beholde, I haue giuen thy brother a thousand pieces of siluer: behold, he is the vaile of thine eyes to all that are with thee, and to all others: and she was thus reproued.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Abraham prayed vnto God, and God healed Abimelech, and his wife, and his women seruants: and they bare children.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: For the Lorde had shut vp euery wombe of the house of Abimelech, because of Sarah Abrahams wife.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Nowe the Lord visited Sarah, as he had saide, and did vnto her according as he had promised.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: For Sarah conceiued, and bare Abraham a sonne in his olde age, at the same season that God tolde him.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Abraham called his sonnes name that was borne vnto him, which Sarah bare him, Izhak.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Abraha circumcised Izhak his sonne, when he was eight dayes olde, as God had commanded him.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So Abraham was an hundreth yeere olde, when his sonne Izhak was borne vnto him.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Sarah said, God hath made me to reioyce: all that heare will reioyce with me.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Againe she said, Who would haue saide to Abraham, that Sarah shoulde haue giuen children sucke? for I haue borne him a sonne in his olde age.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then the childe grewe and was weaned: and Abraham made a great feast the same day that Izhak was weaned.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Sarah sawe the sonne of Hagar the Egyptian (which she had borne vnto Abraham) mocking.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Wherefore she saide vnto Abraham, Cast out this bond woman and her sonne: for ye sonne of this bonde woman shall not be heire with my sonne Izhak.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And this thing was very grieuous in Abrahams sight, because of his sonne.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But God said vnto Abraham, Let it not be grieuous in thy sight for the childe, and for thy bonde woman: in all that Sarah shall say vnto thee, heare her voyce: for in Izhak shall thy seede be called.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: As for the sonne of the bond woman, I will make him a nation also, because he is thy seede.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So Abraham arose vp early in ye morning, and tooke bread, and a bottell of water, and gaue it vnto Hagar, putting it on her shoulder, and the childe also, and sent her away: who departing wandred in the wildernesse of Beer-sheba.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And when the water of the bottell was spent, she cast the childe vnder a certaine tree.

Book.Name: Genesis
