Text: Then she went and sate her ouer against him a farre off about a bowe shoote: for she said, I will not see the death of the child; she sate downe ouer against him, and lift vp her voyce and wept.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then God heard the voyce of ye childe, and the Angel of God called to Hagar from heauen, and said vnto her, What aileth thee, Hagar? feare not, for God hath heard the voyce of the childe where he is.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Arise, take vp the childe, and holde him in thine hand: for I will make of him a great people.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And God opened her eyes, and she sawe a well of water. so she went and filled the bottell with water, and gaue the boy drinke.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So God was with the childe, and he grewe and dwelt in the wildernesse, and was an archer.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And he dwelt in the wildernesse of Paran, and his mother tooke him a wife out of the land of Egypt.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And at that same time Abimelech and Phichol his chief captaine spake vnto Abraham, saying, God is with thee in all that thou doest.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Nowe therefore sweare vnto me here by God, that thou wilt not hurt me, nor my children, nor my childrens children: thou shalt deale with me, and with the countrey, where thou hast bene a stranger, according vnto the kindnesse that I haue shewed thee.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Abraham said, I will sweare.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Abraham rebuked Abimelech for a well of water, which Abimelechs seruants had violently taken away.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Abimelech saide, I knowe not who hath done this thing: also thou toldest me not, neither heard I of it but this day.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Abraham tooke sheepe and beeues, and gaue them vnto Abimelech: and they two made a couenant.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Abraham set seuen lambes of the flocke by themselues.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Abimelech said vnto Abraham, What meane these seuen lambes, which thou hast set by themselues?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And he answered, Because thou shalt receiue of mine hand these seuen lambes, that it may be a witnes vnto me, that I haue digged this well.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Wherefore the place is called Beer-sheba, because there they both sware.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Thus made they a couenant at Beer-sheba: afterward Abimelech and Phichol his chiefe captaine rose vp, and turned againe vnto the land of the Philistims.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Abraham planted a groue in Beer-sheba, and called there on the Name of ye Lord, the euerlasting God.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Abraham was a stranger in the Philistims land a long season.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And after these things God did proue Abraham, and said vnto him, Abraham. Who answered, Here am I.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And he said, Take nowe thine onely sonne Izhak whom thou louest, and get thee vnto the land of Moriah, and offer him there for a burnt offering vpon one of the mountaines, which I will shewe thee.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Abraham rose vp early in the morning, and sadled his asse, and tooke two of his seruants with him, and Izhak his sonne, and cloue wood for the burnt offering, and rose vp & went to the place, which God had tolde him.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then the third day Abraham lift vp his eyes, and sawe the place afarre off,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And said vnto his seruants, Abide you here with the asse: for I and the childe will go yonder and worship, and come againe vnto you.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Abraham tooke the wood of the burnt offering, and layed it vpon Izhak his sonne, and he tooke the fire in his hand, and the knife: and they went both together.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then spake Izhak vnto Abraham his father, and said, My father; he answered, Here am I, my sonne; he said, Behold the fire & the wood, but where is the lambe for ye burnt offring?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Abraham answered, My sonne, God will prouide him a lambe for a burnt offering: so they went both together.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And when they came to the place which God had shewed him, Abraham builded an altar there, & couched ye wood, and bound Izhak his sonne and laid him on the altar vpon the wood.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Abraham stretching forth his hand, tooke the knife to kill his sonne.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But the Angel of the Lord called vnto him from heauen, saying, Abraham, Abraham; he answered, Here am I.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then he said, Lay not thine hand vpon the childe, neither doe any thing vnto him: for now I know that thou fearest God, seeing for my sake thou hast not spared thine onely sonne.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Abraham lifting vp his eyes, looked: and behold, there was a ramme behind him caught by the hornes in a bush. then Abraham went and tooke the ramme, and offered him vp for a burnt offering in the steade of his sonne.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Abraham called the name of that place, Iehouah-ijreh. as it is said this day, In the mount will the Lord be seene.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the Angel of the Lorde cryed vnto Abraham from heauen the second time,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And saide, By my selfe haue I sworne (saith ye Lord) because thou hast done this thing, and hast not spared thine onely sonne,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Therefore will I surely blesse thee, and will greatly multiplie thy seede, as the starres of the heauen, and as the sand which is vpon the sea shore, and thy seede shall possesse the gate of his enemies.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And in thy seede shall all the nations of the earth be blessed, because thou hast obeyed my voyce.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then turned Abraham againe vnto his seruants, and they rose vp & went together to Beer-sheba: and Abraham dwelt at Beer-sheba.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And after these things one tolde Abraham, saying, Beholde Milcah, she hath also borne children vnto thy brother Nahor:

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: To wit, Vz his eldest sonne, and Buz his brother, and Kemuel the father of Aram,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Chesed and Hazo, and Pildash, and Iidlaph, and Bethuel.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Bethuel begate Rebekah: these eight did Milcah beare to Nahor Abrahams brother.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And his concubine called Reumah, she bare also Tebah, and Gahan, and Thahash and Maachah.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: When Sarah was an hundreth twentie and seuen yeere olde ( so long liued she).

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Sarah dyed in Kiriath-arba: the same is Hebron in the land of Canaan; Abraham came to mourne for Sarah and to weepe for her.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Abraham rose vp from the sight of his corps, & talked with the Hittites, saying,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: I am a stranger, & a forreiner among you, giue me a possession of buriall with you, that I may burie my dead out of my sight.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then the Hittites answered Abraham, saying vnto him,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Heare vs, my lorde: thou art a prince of God among vs: in the chiefest of our sepulchres bury thy dead: none of vs shall forbid thee his sepulchre, but thou mayest bury thy dead therein.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Abraham stoode vp, and bowed him selfe before the people of the land of the Hittites.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And he communed with them, saying, If it be your minde, that I shall bury my dead out of my sight, heare me, and intreate for me to Ephron the sonne of Zohar,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: That he would giue me ye caue of Machpelah, which he hath in the ende of his field: that he would giue it me for as much money as it is worth, for a possession to bury in among you.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: (For Ephron dwelt among the Hittites) Then Ephron the Hittite answered Abraham in the audience of all the Hittites that went in at the gates of his citie, saying,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: No, my Lorde, heare me: the fielde giue I thee, and the caue, that therein is, I giue it thee: euen in the presence of the sonnes of my people giue I it thee, to bury thy dead.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Abraham bowed himselfe before the people of the land,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And spake vnto Ephron in the audience of the people of the countrey, saying, Seeing thou wilt giue it, I pray thee, heare me, I will giue the price of the fielde: receiue it of me, and I will bury my dead there.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Ephron then answered Abraham, saying vnto him,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: My lord, hearken vnto me: ye land is worth foure hundreth shekels of siluer: what is that betweene me and thee? bury therefore thy dead.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So Abraham hearkened vnto Ephron, and Abraham weyed to Ephron the siluer, which he had named, in the audience of the Hittites, euen foure hundreth siluer shekels of currant money among marchants.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So the fielde of Ephron which was in Machpelah, and ouer against Mamre, euen the field and the caue that was therein, and all the trees that were in the fielde, which were in all the borders round about, was made sure

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Vnto Abraham for a possession, in ye sight of the Hittites, euen of all that went in at the gates of his citie.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And after this, Abraham buried Sarah his wife in the caue of the fielde of Machpelah ouer against Mamre: the same is Hebron in the land of Canaan.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Thus the fielde and the caue, that is therein, was made sure vnto Abraham for a possession of buriall by the Hittites.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Nowe Abraham was olde, and striken in yeeres, and the Lord had blessed Abraham in all things.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Therefore Abraham saide vnto his eldest seruant of his house, which had the rule ouer all that he had, Put nowe thine hand vnder my thigh,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And I will make thee sweare by ye Lorde God of the heauen, and God of the earth, that thou shalt not take a wife vnto my sonne of the daughters of the Canaanites among who I dwel.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But thou shalt go vnto my countrey, and to my kinred, & take a wife vnto my sone Izhak.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the seruant saide to him, What if the woman will not come with me to this land? Shall I bring thy sonne againe vnto the lande from whence thou camest?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: To whom Abraham answered, Beware that thou bring not my sonne thither againe.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: The Lord God of heauen, who tooke me from my fathers house, and from the land where I was borne, and that spake vnto me, and that sware vnto me, saying, Vnto thy seede wil I giue this land, he shall send his Angel before thee, and thou shalt take a wife vnto my sonne fro thence.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Neuertheles if the woman wil not followe thee, then shalt thou bee discharged of this mine othe: onely bring not my sonne thither againe.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then the seruant put his hand vnder the thigh of Abraham his master, and sware to him for this matter.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So the seruant tooke ten camels of the camels of his master, and departed: (for he had all his masters goods in his hand:) and so he arose, and went to Aram Naharaim, vnto the citie of Nahor.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And he made his camels to lye downe without the citie by a well of water, at euentide about the time that the women come out to draw water.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And he said, O Lord God of my master Abraham, I beseech thee, send me good speede this day, & shew mercy vnto my master Abraha.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Lo, I stand by the well of water, whiles the mens daughters of this citie come out to drawe water.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Graunt therefore that ye maide, to whom I say, Bowe downe thy pitcher, I pray thee, that I may drinke: if she say, Drinke, and I will giue thy camels drinke also: may be she that thou hast ordeined for thy seruant Izhak: and thereby shall I know that thou hast shewed mercy on my master.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And nowe yer he had left speaking, beholde, Rebekah came out, the daughter of Bethuel, sonne of Milcah the wife of Nahor Abrahams brother, and her pitcher vpon her shoulder.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: (And the maide was very faire to looke vpon, a virgine and vnknowen of man) and she went downe to the well, and filled her pitcher, and came vp.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then the seruant ranne to meete her, and said, Let me drinke, I pray thee, a litle water of thy pitcher.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And she said, Drinke sir: and she hasted, and let downe her pitcher vpon her hand and gaue him drinke.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And when she had giuen him drinke, she said, I will drawe water for thy camels also vntill they haue drunken inough.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And she powred out her pitcher into the trough speedily; and ranne againe vnto the well to drawe water, and she drewe for all his camels.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So the man wondred at her, and helde his peace, to knowe whether the Lord had made his iourney prosperous or not.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And when the camels had left drinking, the man tooke a golden abillement of halfe a shekell weight, and two bracelets for her hands, of ten shekels weight of golde:

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And he said, Whose daughter art thou? Tell me, I pray thee, Is there roume in thy fathers house for vs to lodge in?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then she said to him, I am the daughter of Bethuel the sonne of Milcah whom she bare vnto Nahor.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Moreouer she said vnto him, We haue litter also & prouender ynough, & roume to lodge in.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the man bowed himselfe and worshipped the Lord,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And said, Blessed be the Lorde God of my master Abraham, which hath not withdrawen his mercie and his trueth from my master: for when I was in the way, the Lord brought me to my masters brethrens house.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the maide ranne and tolde them of her mothers house according to these wordes.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Now Rebekah had a brother called Laban, and Laban ranne vnto the man to the well.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: For when he had seene the earings and the bracelets in his sisters hands, and when he heard the wordes of Rebekah his sister, saying, Thus said the man vnto me, then he went to the man, and loe, he stoode by the camels at the well.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And he saide, Come in thou blessed of the Lord: wherefore standest thou without, seeing I haue prepared the house, & roume for ye camels?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then the man came into the house, and he vnsadled the camels, and brought litter and prouender for the camels, and water to wash his feete, and the mens feete that were with him.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Afterward the meate was set before him: but he saide, I will not eate, vntill I haue saide my message: And he said, Speake on.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then he said, I am Abrahams seruant,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the Lord hath blessed my master wonderfully, that he is become great: for he hath giuen him sheepe, and beeues, and siluer, and golde, and men seruants, and maide seruants, and camels, and asses.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Sarah my masters wife hath borne a sonne to my master, when she was olde, and vnto him hath he giuen all that he hath.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Now my master made me sweare, saying, Thou shalt not take a wife to my sonne of the daughters of the Canaanites, in whose land I dwell:

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But thou shalt go vnto my fathers house and to my kinred, and take a wife vnto my sonne.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then I saide vnto my master, What if the woman will not followe me?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Who answered me, The Lord, before who I walke, will send his Angel with thee, and prosper thy iourney, and thou shalt take a wife for my sonne of my kinred and my fathers house.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then shalt thou be discharged of mine othe, when thou commest to my kinred: and if they giue thee not one, thou shalt be free from mine othe.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So I came this day to the well, and said, O Lorde, the God of my master Abraham, if thou nowe prosper my iourney which I goe,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Behold, I stand by the wel of water: when a virgine commeth forth to drawe water, and I say to her, Giue me, I pray thee, a litle water of thy pitcher to drinke,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And she say to me, Drinke thou, and I will also drawe for thy camels, let her be ye wife, which the Lord hath prepared for my masters sonne.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And before I had made an end of speaking in mine heart, beholde, Rebekah came foorth, and her pitcher on her shoulder, and she went downe vnto the well, and drewe water. Then I said vnto her, Giue me drinke, I pray thee.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And she made haste, and tooke downe her pitcher from her shoulder, and said, Drinke, and I will giue thy camels drinke also. So I dranke, and she gaue the camels drinke also.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then I asked her, and said, Whose daughter art thou? And she answered, The daughter of Bethuel Nahors sonne, whom Milcah bare vnto him. Then I put the abillement vpon her face, and the bracelets vpon her hands:

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And I bowed downe and worshipped the Lord, and blessed the Lord God of my master Abraham, which had brought me the right way to take my masters brothers daughter vnto his sone.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Now therefore, if ye will deale mercifully and truely with my master, tell me: and if not, tell me that I may turne me to the right hand or to the left.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then answered Laban and Bethuel, and said, This thing is proceeded of the Lorde: we cannot therefore say vnto thee, neither euill nor good.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Beholde, Rebehak is before thee, take her and goe, that she may be thy masters sonnes wife, euen as the Lord hath said.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And when Abrahams seruant heard their wordes, he bowed himselfe toward the earth vnto the Lord.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then the seruant tooke foorth iewels of siluer, and iewels of golde, and raiment, and gaue to Rebekah: also vnto her brother and to her mother he gaue gifts.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Afterward they did eate & drinke, both he, and the men that were with him, and taried all night; when they rose vp in the morning, he said, Let me depart vnto my master.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then her brother and her mother answered, Let the maide abide with vs, at the least ten dayes: then shall she goe.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But he said vnto them, Hinder you me not, seeing the Lord hath prospered my iourney: send me away, that I may goe to my master.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then they said, We will call the maide, and aske her consent.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And they called Rebekah, and saide vnto her, Wilt thou go with this man? And she answered, I will go.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So they let Rebekah their sister goe, & her nourse, with Abrahams seruant and his men.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And they blessed Rebekah, and sayde vnto her, Thou art our sister, growe into thousande thousands, and thy seede possesse the gate of his enemies.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Rebekah arose, & her maydes, and rode vpon the camels, and followed the man; the seruant tooke Rebekah, and departed.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Nowe Izhak came from the way of Beer-lahai-roi, (for he dwelt in the South countrey)

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Izhak went out. to pray in the fielde toward the euening: who lift vp his eyes and looked, and behold, the camels came.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Also Rebekah lift vp her eyes, & when she saw Izhak, she lighted downe from the camel.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: (For shee had sayde to the seruant, Who is yonder man, that commeth in the fielde to meete vs? and the seruant had said, It is my master) So she tooke a vaile, and couered her.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the seruant tolde Izhak all things, that he had done.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Afterward Izhak brought her into the tent of Sarah his mother, and he tooke Rebekah, and she was his wife, and he loued her: So Izhak was comforted after his mothers death.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Nowe Abraham had taken him another wife called Keturah,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Which bare him Zimran, and Iokshan, and Medan, and Midian, and Ishbak, and Shuah.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Iokshan begate Sheba, and Dedan: And the sonnes of Dedan were Asshurim, and Letushim, and Leummim.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Also the sonnes of Midian were Ephah, and Epher, and Hanoch, and Abida, & Eldaah all these were the sonnes of Keturah.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Abraham gaue all his goods to Izhak,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But vnto the sonnes of the concubines, which Abraham had, Abraham gaue giftes, and sent them away from Izhak his sonne (while he yet liued) Eastward to the East countrey.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And this is the age of Abrahams life, which he liued, an hundreth seuentie & fiue yeere.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Abraham yeelded the spirit, and died in a good age, an olde man, and of great yeeres, & was gathered to his people.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And his sonnes, Izhak and Ishmael buryed him in the caue of Machpelah, in the fielde of Ephron sonne of Zohar the Hittite, before Mamre.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Which fielde Abraham bought of the Hittites, where Abraham was buryed with Sarah his wife.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And after the death of Abraham God blessed Izhak his sonne, and Izhak dwelt by Beer-lahai-roi.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Nowe these are the generations of Ishmael Abrahams sonne, whome Hagar the Egyptian Sarahs handmayde bare vnto Abraham.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And these are the names of the sonnes of Ishmael, name by name, according to their kinreds; the eldest sonne of Ishmael was Nebaioth, then Kedar, and Adbeel, and Mibsam,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Mishma, and Dumah, and Massa,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Hadar, and Tema, Ietur, Naphish, and Kedemah.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: These are the sonnes of Ishmael, and these are their names, by their townes and by their castles: to wit, twelue princes of their nations.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: (And these are the yeeres of the life of Ishmael, an hundreth thirtie and seuen yeere, and he yeelded the spirit, and dyed, and was gathered vnto his people)

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And they dwelt from Hauilah vnto Shur, that is towardes Egypt, as thou goest to Asshur. Ishmael dwelt in the presence of all his brethren.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Likewise these are the generations of Izhak Abrahams sonne Abraham begate Izhak,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Izhak was fourtie yeere olde, when he tooke Rebekah to wife, the daughter of Bethuel the Aramite of Padan Aram, and sister to Laban the Aramite.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Izhak prayed vuto the Lorde for his wife, because she was barren: and the Lord was intreated of him, and Rebekah his wife conceiued,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But the children stroue together within her: therefore shee sayde, Seeing it is so, why am I thus? wherefore she went to aske the Lord.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the Lord sayd to her, Two nations are in thy wombe, and two maner of people shalbe diuided out of thy bowels, and the one people shall be mightier then the other, and the elder shall serue the yonger.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Therefore when her time of deliuerance was fulfilled, behold, twinnes were in her wombe.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So he that came out first was red, and he was all ouer as a rough garment, and they called his name Esau.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And afterward came his brother out, and his hande helde Esau by the heele: therefore his name was called Iaakob. Nowe Izhak was threescore yeere olde when Rebekah bare them.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the boyes grew, and Esau was a cunning hunter, and liued in the fields: but Iaakob was a plaine man, and dwelt in tentes.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Izhak loued Esau, for venison was his meate, but Rebekah loued Iaakob.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Nowe Iaakob sod pottage, and Esau came from the fielde and was wearie.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Esau sayd to Iaakob, Let me eate, I pray thee, of that pottage so red, for I am wearie. Therefore was his name called Edom.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Iaakob sayd, Sell me euen nowe thy birthright.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Esau sayd, Lo, I am almost dead, what is then this birthright to me?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Iaakob then said, Sweare to me euen now; he sware to him, and solde his birthright vnto Iaakob.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Iaakob gaue Esau bread and pottage of lentiles: and he did eate and drinke, and rose vp, and went his way: So Esau contemned his birthright.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And there was a famine in the lande besides the first famine that was in the dayes of Abraham. Wherefore Izhak went to Abimelech King of the Philistims vnto Gerar.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: For the Lord appeared vnto him, and sayde, Goe not downe into Egypt, but abide in the land which I shall shewe vnto thee.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Dwell in this lande, and I will be with thee, and will blesse thee: for to thee, and to thy seede I will giue all these countreys: and I will performe the othe which I sware vnto Abraham thy father.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Also I wil cause thy seede to multiply as the starres of heauen, and will giue vnto thy seede all these countreys: and in thy seede shall all the nanations of the earth be blessed,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Because that Abraham obeyed my voyce and kept mine ordinance, my commandements, my statutes, and my Lawes.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So Izhak dwelt in Gerar.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the men of the place asked him of his wife, and he sayd, She is my sister: for he feared to say, She is my wife, least, sayde he, the men of the place shoulde kill me, because of Rebekah: for she was beautifull to the eye.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So after hee had bene there long time, Abimelech King of the Philistims looked out at a windowe, and loe, he sawe Izhak sporting with Rebekah his wife.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Abimelech called Izhak, and sayde, Loe, shee is of a suertie thy wife, and why saydest thou, She is my sister? To whom Izhak answered, Because I thought this, It may be that I shall dye for her.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Abimelech said, Why hast thou done this vnto vs? one of the people had almost lien by thy wife, so shouldest thou haue brought sinne vpon vs.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Abimelech charged all his people, saying, He that toucheth this man, or his wife, shal die the death.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Afterwarde Izhak sowed in that lande, and founde in the same yeere an hundreth folde by estimation: and so the Lord blessed him.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the man waxed mightie, and stil increased, till he was exceeding great,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: For he had flockes of sheepe, and heards of cattell, and a mightie housholde: therefore the Philistims had enuy at him.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: In so much that the Philistims stopped and filled vp with earth all the welles, which his fathers seruantes digged in his father Abrahams time.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Abimelech sayde vnto Izhak, Get thee from vs, for thou art mightier then wee a great deale.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Therefore Izhak departed thence and pitched his tent in the valley of Gerar, and dwelt there.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Izhak returning, digged the welles of water, which they had digged in the dayes of Abraham his father: for the Philistims had stopped them after the death of Abraham, and hee gaue them the same names, which his father gaue them.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Izhaks seruantes then digged in the valley, and found there a well of liuing water.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But the herdmen of Gerar did striue with Izhaks herdmen, saying, The water is ours: therefore called he the name of the wel Esek, because they were at strife with him.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Afterwarde they digged another well, and stroue for that also, and he called the name of it Sitnah.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then he remoued thence, and digged an other well, for the which they stroue not: therefore called hee the name of it Rehoboth, and sayde, Because the Lorde hath nowe made vs roome, we shall increase vpon the earth.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So he went vp thence to Beer-sheba.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the Lord appeared vnto him the same night, and sayde, I am the God of Abraham thy father: feare not, for I am with thee, and wil blesse thee, and will multiplie thy seede for my seruant Abrahams sake.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then he builte an altar there, and called vpon the Name of the Lorde, and there spred his tent: where also Izhaks seruauntes digged a well.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then came Abimelech to him from Gerar, and Ahuzzath one of his friendes, and Phichol the captaine of his armie.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: To whom Izhak sayd, Wherefore come ye to me, seeing ye hate mee and haue put mee away from you?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Who answered, Wee sawe certainely that the Lorde was with thee, and wee thought thus, Let there be nowe an othe betweene vs, euen betweene vs and thee, and let vs make a couenant with thee.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: If thou shalt do vs no hurt, as we haue not touched thee, and as we haue done vnto thee nothing but good, and sent thee away in peace: thou nowe, the blessed of the Lord, doe this.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then hee made them a feast, and they dyd eate and drinke.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And they rose vp betimes in the morning, and sware one to another: then Izhak let them go, and they departed from him in peace.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And that same day Izhaks seruantes came and tolde him of a well, which they had digged, and said vnto him, We haue found water.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So hee called it Shibah: therefore the name of the citie is called Beer-sheba vnto this day.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Nowe when Esau was fourtie yeere olde, he tooke to wife Iudith, the daughter of Beeri an Hittite, and Bashemath the daughter of Elon an Hittite also.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And they were a griefe of minde to Izhak and to Rebekah.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And when Izhak was olde, and his eyes were dimme (so that he coulde not see) he called Esau his eldest sonne, and sayde vnto him, My sonne; he answered him, I am here.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then he sayd, Beholde, I am nowe olde, and knowe not the day of my death:

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Wherefore nowe, I pray thee take thine instrumentes, thy quiuer and thy bowe, and get thee to the fielde, that thou mayest take mee some venison.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then make mee sauourie meate, such as I loue, and bring it me that I may eat, and that my soule may blesse thee, before I die.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: (Nowe Rebekah heard, when Izhak spake to Esau his sonne) and Esau went into the fielde to hunt for venison, and to bring it.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Rebekah spake vnto Iaakob her sonne, saying, Beholde, I haue heard thy father talking with Esau thy brother, saying,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Bring mee venision, and make mee sauourie meate, that I may eate and blesse thee before the Lord, afore my death.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Nowe therefore, my sonne, heare my voyce in that which I command thee.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Get thee nowe to the flocke, and bring me thence two good kids of the goates, that I may make pleasant meate of them for thy father, such as he loueth.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then shalt thou bring it to thy father, and he shal eate, to the intent that he may blesse thee before his death.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But Iaakob sayde to Rebekah his mother, Beholde, Esau my brother is rough, and I am smoothe.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: My father may possibly feele me, and I shal seem to him to be a mocker: so shall I bring a curse vpon me, and not a blessing.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But his mother sayd vnto him, vpon me be thy curse, my sonne: onely heare my voyce, and go and bring me them.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So he went and set them, and brought them to his mother: and his mother made pleasant meat, such as his father loued.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Rebekah tooke faire clothes of her elder sonne Esau, which were in her house, and clothed Iaakob her yonger sonne:

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And she couered his hands and the smoothe of his necke with the skinnes of the kiddes of the goates.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Afterward she put the pleasant meate and bread, which she had prepared, in the hand of her sonne Iaakob.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And when he came to his father, he sayd, My father. Who answered, I am here: who art thou, my sonne?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Iaakob sayde to his father, I am Esau thy first borne, I haue done as thou badest me, arise, I pray thee: sit vp and eate of my venison, that thy soule may blesse me.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Izhak said vnto his sonne, Howe hast thou founde it so quickly my sonne? Who sayde, Because the Lorde thy God brought it to mine hande.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Againe sayde Izhak vnto Iaakob, Come neere nowe, that I may feele thee, my sonne, whether thou be that my sonne Esau or not.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Iaakob came neere to Izhak his father, and he felt him and sayd, The voyce is Iaakobs voyce, but the hands are the hands of Esau.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: (For he knewe him not, because his hands were rough as his brother Esaus hands: wherefore he blessed him)

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Againe he sayd, Art thou that my sonne Esau? Who answered, Yea.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then said he, Bring it me hither, and I will eate of my sonnes venison, that my soule may blesse thee; he brought it to him, and he ate: also he brought him wine, and he dranke.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Afterward his father Izhak sayd vnto him, Come neere nowe, and kisse me, my sonne.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And hee came neere and kissed him. Then he smelled the sauour of his garmentes, and blessed him, and sayde, Behold, the smell of my sonne is as the smell of a fielde, which the Lorde hath blessed.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: God giue thee therefore of the dewe of heauen, and the fatnesse of the earth, and plentie of wheate and wine.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Let people bee thy seruantes, and nations bowe vnto thee: be Lorde ouer thy brethren, and let thy mothers children honour thee. Cursed be he that curseth thee, and blessed be he that blesseth thee.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And when Izhak had made an ende of blessing Iaakob, and Iaakob was scarce gone out from the presence of Izhak his father, then came Esau his brother from his hunting,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And hee also prepared sauourie meate and brought it to his father, and sayd vnto his father, Let my father arise, and eat of his sonnes venison, that thy soule may blesse me.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But his father Izhak sayde vnto him, Who art thou? And he answered, I am thy sonne, euen thy first borne Esau.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Izhak was stricken with a marueilous great feare, and sayde, Who and where is hee that hunted venison, and brought it mee, and I haue eate of all before thou camest? And I haue blessed him, therefore he shalbe blessed.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: When Esau heard the wordes of his father, he cryed out with a great crye and bitter, out of measure, and sayde vnto his father, Blesse me, euen me also, my father.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Who answered, Thy brother came with subtiltie, and hath taken away thy blessing.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then he sayde, Was hee not iustly called Iaakob? for hee hath deceiued mee these two times: he tooke my birthright, and loe, nowe hath he taken my blessing. Also he sayd, Hast thou not reserued a blessing for me?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Izhak answered, and sayd vnto Esau, Beholde, I haue made him thy lorde, and all his brethre haue I made his seruants: also with wheate and wine haue I furnished him, & vnto thee now what shall I doe, my sonne?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Esau sayde vnto his father, Hast thou but one blessing my father? blesse mee, euen me also, my father: and Esau lifted vp his voyce, and wept.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Izhak his father answered, and sayde vnto him, Behold, the fatnesse of the earth shal be thy dwelling place, and thou shalt haue of the dewe of heauen from aboue.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And by thy sword shalt thou liue, and shalt be thy brothers seruant. But it shall come to passe, when thou shalt get the masterie, that thou shalt breake his yoke from thy necke.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Therefore Esau hated Iaakob, because of the blessing, wherewith his father blessed him; Esau thought in his minde, The dayes of mourning for my father will come shortly, then I will slay may brother Iaakob.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And it was told to Rebekah of the wordes of Esau her elder sonne, and shee sent and called Iaakob her yonger sonne, and sayd vnto him, Beholde, thy brother Esau is comforted against thee, meaning to kill thee:

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Now therefore my sonne, heare my voyce, arise, & flee thou to Haran to my brother Laban,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And tarie with him a while vntill thy brothers fiercenesse be swaged,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And till thy brothers wrath turne away from thee, and hee forget the thinges, which thou hast done to him: then will I sende and take thee from thence: why shoulde I bee depriued of you both in one day?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Also Rebekah said to Izhak, I am weary of my life, for the daughters of Heth. If Iaakob take a wife of the daughters of Heth like these of the daughters of the lande, what auaileth it me to liue?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Izhak called Iaakob and blessed him, and charged him, and sayde vnto him, Take not a wife of the daughters of Canaan.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Arise, get thee to Padan Aram to the house of Bethuel thy mothers father, and thence take thee a wife of the daughters of Laban thy mothers brother.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And God all sufficient blesse thee, and make thee to encrease, and multiplie thee, that thou mayest be a multitude of people,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And giue thee the blessing of Abraham, euen to thee & to thy seede with thee, that thou mayest inherite the lande (wherein thou art a stranger,) which God gaue vnto Abraham.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Thus Izhak sent forth Iaakob, & he went to Padan Aram vnto Laban sonne of Bethuel the Aramite, brother to Rebekah, Iaakobs and Esaus mother.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: When Esau sawe that Izhak had blessed Iaakob, and sent him to Padan Aram, to set him a wife thence, and giuen him a charge when he blessed him, saying, Thou shalt not take a wife of the daughters of Canaan,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And that Iaakob had obeyed his father & his mother, and was gone to Padan Aram:

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Also Esau seeing that the daughters of Canaan displeased Izhak his father,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then went Esau to Ishmael, & tooke vnto the wiues, which he had, Mahalath the daughter of Ishmael Abrahams sonne, the sister of Nabaioth, to be his wife.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Now Iaakob departed from Beer-sheba, and went to Haran,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And he came vnto a certaine place, and taried there al night, because the sunne was downe, and tooke of the stones of the place, and layde vnder his head and slept in the same place.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then he dreamed, & behold, there stoode a ladder vpon the earth, and the top of it reached vp to heauen: and loe, the Angels of God went vp and downe by it.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And behold, the Lord stoode aboue it, & sayd, I am the Lord God of Abraham thy father, and the God of Izhak: the land, vpon the which thou sleepest, wil I giue thee and thy seede.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And thy seede shall be as the dust of the earth, & thou shalt spread abroad to the West, and to the East, & to the North, & to the South, and in thee and in thy seede shall all the families of the earth be blessed.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And lo, I am with thee, and wil keepe thee whithersoeuer thou goest, and will bring thee againe into this lande: for I will not forsake thee vntill I haue performed that, that I haue promised thee.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Iaakob awoke out of his sleepe, & sayde, Surely the Lorde is in this place, and I was not aware.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And he was afraid, & said, How fearefull is this place! this is none other but the house of God, and this is the gate of heauen.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Iaakob rose vp early in the morning, and tooke the stone that hee had layde vnder his head, and set it vp as a pillar, and powred oyle vpon the top of it.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And he called ye name of that place Bethel: notwithstanding the name of the citie was at the first called Luz.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Iaakob vowed a vowe, saying, If God will be with me, and will keepe me in this iourney which I go, & wil giue me bread to eate, and clothes to put on:

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So that I come againe vnto my fathers house in safetie, then shal the Lord be my God.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And this stone, which I haue set vp as a pillar, shall be Gods house: and of all that thou shalt giue me, wil I giue the tenth vnto thee.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Iaakob lift vp his feete and came into the East countrey.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And as he looked about, behold there was a well in the field, and lo, three flocks of sheepe lay thereby (for at that well were the flockes watered) & there was a great stone vpon the welles mouth.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And thither were all the flockes gathered, & they rolled the stone from the welles mouth, and watered the sheepe, and put the stone againe vpon the welles mouth in his place.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Iaakob sayde vnto them, My brethren, whence be ye? And they answered, We are of Haran.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then he sayd vnto them, Know ye Laban the sonne of Nahor? Who said, We know him.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Againe he sayd vnto them, Is he in good health? And they answered, He is in good health, and beholde, his daughter Rahel commeth with the sheepe.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then he sayd, Lo, it is yet hie day, neither is it time that the cattell shoulde be gathered together: water ye the sheepe and go feede them.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But they sayde, We may not vntill all the flocks be brought together, and till men rolle the stone from the welles mouth, that we may water the sheepe.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: While he talked with them, Rahel also came with her fathers sheepe, for she kept them.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And assoone as Iaakob saw Rahel ye daughter of Laban his mothers brother, and the sheepe of Laban his mothers brother, then came Iaakob neere, & rolled the stone fro the welles mouth, & watered ye flocke of Laban his mothers brother.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Iaakob kissed Rahel, and lift vp his voyce and wept.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: (For Iaakob tolde Rahel, that he was her fathers brother, & that he was Rebekahs sonne) then she ranne and tolde her father.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And when Laban heard tell of Iaakob his sisters sonne, he ranne to meete him, and embraced him and kissed him, and brought him to his house: and he tolde Laban all these things.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: To whome Laban sayd, Well, thou art my bone and my flesh; he abode with him the space of a moneth.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: For Laban sayde vnto Iaakob, Though thou be my brother, shouldest thou therfore serue me for nought? tell me, what shalbe thy wages?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Now Laban had two daughters, the elder called Leah, and the yonger called Rahel.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Leah was tender eyed, but Rahel was beautifull and faire.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Iaakob loued Rahel, and sayde, I will serue thee seuen yeeres for Rahel thy yonger daughter.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Laban answered, It is better that I giue her thee, then that I should giue her to another man: abide with me.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Iaakob serued seuen yeres for Rahel, and they seemed vnto him but a few dayes, because he loued her.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Iaakob sayde to Laban, Giue me my wife, that I may goe in to her: for my terme is ended.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Wherefore Laban gathered together all the men of the place, and made a feast.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But whe the euening was come, he tooke Leah his daughter and brought her to him, and he went in vnto her.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Laban gaue his mayde Zilpah to his daughter Leah, to be her seruant.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But when the morning was come, behold, it was Leah. Then sayde he to Laban, Wherefore hast thou done thus to mee? did not I serue thee for Rahel? wherfore then hast thou beguiled me?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Laban answered, It is not the maner of this place, to giue the yonger before the elder.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Fulfill seuen yeeres for her, and we wil also giue thee this for the seruice, which thou shalt serue me yet seuen yeeres more.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Iaakob did so, and fulfilled her seuen yeeres, so he gaue him Rahel his daughter to be his wife.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Laban also gaue to Rahel his daughter Bilhah his mayde to be her seruant.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So entred he in to Rahel also, and loued also Rahel more then Leah, and serued him yet seuen yeeres mo.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: When the Lord saw that Leah was despised, he made her fruitful: but Rahel was barren.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Leah conceiued & bare a sonne, and she called his name Reuben: for she said, Because the Lord hath looked vpon my tribulation, now therefore mine husband will loue me.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And she conceiued againe & bare a sonne, and sayde, Because the Lord heard that I was hated, he hath therefore giuen me this sonne also, & she called his name Simeon.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And she conceiued againe & bare a sonne, and said, Now at this time wil my husband keepe mee company, because I haue borne him three sonnes: therefore was his name called Leui.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Moreouer shee conceiued againe and bare a sonne, saying, Nowe will I prayse the Lorde: therefore shee called his name Iudah, and left bearing.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And when Rahel saw that she bare Iaakob no children, Rahel enuied her sister, and said vnto Iaakob, Giue me children, or els I dye.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Iaakobs anger was kindled against Rahel, and he sayde, Am I in Gods steade, which hath withholden from thee the fruite of the wombe?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And she said, Behold my maide Bilhah, goe in to her, and she shal beare vpon my knees, and I shal haue children also by her.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then shee gaue him Bilhah her mayde to wife, and Iaakob went in to her.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So Bilhah conceiued and bare Iaakob a sonne.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then said Rahel, God hath giuen sentence on my side, and hath also heard my voyce, and hath giuen mee a sonne: therefore called shee his name, Dan.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Bilhah Rahels maide coceiued againe, and bare Iaakob the second sonne.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Rahel said, with excellent wrestlings haue I wrestled with my sister, & haue gotten the vpper hande: and shee called his name, Naphtali.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And when Leah saw that she had left bearing, shee tooke Zilpah her mayde, and gaue her Iaakob to wife.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Zilpah Leahs mayde bare Iaakob a sonne.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then sayd Leah, A companie commeth: and she called his name, Gad.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Againe Zilpah Leahs mayde bare Iaakob another sonne.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then sayde Leah, Ah, blessed am I, for the daughters will blesse me; she called his name, Asher.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Nowe Reuben went in the dayes of the wheateharuest, and founde mandrakes in the fielde and brought them vnto his mother Leah. Then sayde Rahel to Leah, Giue me, I pray thee, of thy sonnes mandrakes.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But shee answered her, Is it a small matter for thee to take mine husband, except thou take my sonnes mandrakes also? Then sayde Rahel, Therefore he shall sleepe with thee this night for thy sonnes mandrakes.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Iaakob came from the fielde in the euening, and Leah went out to meete him, and sayde, Come in to mee, for I haue bought and payed for thee with my sonnes mandrakes: and he slept with her that night.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And God heard Leah and shee conceiued, and bare vnto Iaakob the fift sonne.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then said Leah, God hath giuen me my reward, because I gaue my mayde to my husband, and she called his name Issachar.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: After, Leah conceiued againe, & bare Iaakob the sixt sonne.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Leah said, God hath endued me with a good dowrie: nowe will mine husbande dwell with me, because I haue borne him sixe sonnes: & she called his name Zebulun.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: After that, shee bare a daughter, and shee called her name Dinah.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And God remembred Rahel, and God heard her, and opened her wombe.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So she conceiued & bare a sonne, and said, God hath taken away my rebuke.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And shee called his name Ioseph, saying, The Lord wil giue me yet another sonne.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And assoone as Rahel had borne Ioseph, Iaakob said to Laban, Sende me away that I may go vnto my place and to my countrey.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Giue me my wiues and my children, for whom I haue serued thee, and let me go: for thou knowest what seruice I haue done thee.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: To whom Laban answered, If I haue nowe found fauour in thy sight tarie: I haue perceiued that the Lord hath blessed me for thy sake.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Also he said, Appoynt vnto me thy wages, and I will giue it thee.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But he sayd vnto him, Thou knowest, what seruice I haue done thee, and in what taking thy cattell hath bene vnder me.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: For the litle, that thou haddest before I came, is increased into a multitude: and the Lorde hath blessed thee by my coming: but nowe when shall I trauell for mine owne house also?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then he saide, What shal I giue thee? And Iaakob answered, Thou shalt giue mee nothing at all: if thou wilt doe this thing for mee, I will returne, feede, and keepe thy sheepe.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: I wil passe through all thy flockes this day, and separate from them all the sheepe with litle spots & great spots, and al blacke lambes among the sheepe, and the great spotted, and litle spotted among the goates: and it shalbe my wages.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So shal my righteousnesse answere for me hereafter, when it shall come for my rewarde before thy face, and euery one that hath not litle or great spots among the goates, and blacke among the sheepe, the same shalbe theft with me.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Laban sayde, Goe to, woulde God it might be according to thy saying.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Therefore he tooke out the same day the hee goates that were partie coloured and with great spots, and all the shee goates with litle and great spots, and all that had white in them, and all the blacke among the sheepe, and put them in the keeping of his sonnes.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And hee set three dayes iourney betweene himselfe and Iaakob; Iaakob kept the rest of Labans sheepe.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Iaakob tooke rods of greene popular, and of hasell, and of the chesnut tree, and pilled white strakes in them, and made the white appeare in the rods.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then he put the rods, which he had pilled, in the gutters and watering troughes, when the sheepe came to drink, before the sheepe. (for they were in heate, when they came to drinke)

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the sheepe were in heate before the rods, and afterward brought forth yong of partie colour, and with small and great spots.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Iaakob parted these lambes, and turned the faces of the flocke towardes these lambes partie coloured and all maner of blacke, among the sheepe of Laban: so hee put his owne flockes by themselues, and put them not with Labans flocke.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And in euery ramming time of the stronger sheepe, Iaakob layde the rods before the eyes of the sheepe in the gutters, that they might conceiue before the rods.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But when the sheepe were feeble, hee put them not in: and so the feebler were Labans, and the stronger Iaakobs.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So the man encreased exceedingly, and had many flockes, and maide seruantes, and men seruants, and camels and asses.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Now he heard the words of Labans sonnes, saying, Iaakob hath taken away all that was our fathers, and of our fathers goods hath he gotten all this honour.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Also Iaakob beheld the countenance of Laban, that it was not towards him as in times past:

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the Lorde had said vnto Iaakob, Turne againe into the lande of thy fathers, and to thy kinred, and I wilbe with thee.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Therefore Iaakob sent and called Rahel and Leah to the fielde vnto his flocke.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then sayde hee vnto them, I see your fathers countenance, that it is not towardes me as it was wont, and the God of my father hath bene with me.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And yee knowe that I haue serued your father with all my might.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But your father hath deceiued me, & changed my wages tenne times: but God suffred him not to hurt me.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: If he thus sayd, The spotted shall be thy wages, then all the sheepe bare spotted: and if he sayd thus, the party coloured shalbe thy rewarde, then bare all the sheepe particoloured.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Thus hath God taken away your fathers substance, and giuen it me.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: For in ramming time I lifted vp mine eyes and saw in a dreame, & beholde, ye hee goates leaped vpon the shee goates, that were partie coloured with litle and great spots spotted.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the Angel of God sayde to mee in a dreame, Iaakob; I answered, Lo, I am here.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And he sayde, Lift vp nowe thine eyes, and see all the hee goates leaping vpon ye shee goates that are partie coloured, spotted with litle and great spots: for I haue seene all that Laban doeth vnto thee.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: I am the God of Beth-el, where thou anoyntedst the pillar, where thou vowedst a vowe vnto me. Nowe arise, get thee out of this countrey and returne vnto ye land where thou wast borne.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then answered Rahel and Leah, and sayde vnto him, Haue wee any more porcion and inheritance in our fathers house?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Doeth not he count vs as strangers? For he hath solde vs, and hath eaten vp and consumed our money.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Therefore all the riches, which God hath taken from our father, is ours and our childrens: nowe then whatsoeuer God hath saide vnto thee, doe it.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Iaakob rose vp, and set his sonnes and his wiues vpon camels.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And he caried away all his flockes, & al his substance which he had gotten, to wit, his riches, which he had gotten in Padan Aram, to goe to Izhak his father vnto the land of Canaan.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Whe Laban was gone to shere his sheepe, Then Rahel stole her fathers idoles.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Thus Iaakob stole away ye heart of Laban the Aramite: for he told him not that he fled.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So fled he with all that he had, and he rose vp, and passed the riuer, and set his face towarde mount Gilead.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the third day after was it told Laban, that Iaakob fled.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then he tooke his brethren with him, & followed after him seuen dayes iourney, and ouertooke him at mount Gilead.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And God came to Laban the Aramite in a dreame by night, and sayde vnto him, Take heede that thou speake not to Iaakob ought saue good.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Laban ouertooke Iaakob, & Iaakob had pitched his tent in the mount: and Laban also with his brethren pitched vpon mount Gilead.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Laban sayde to Iaakob, What hast thou done? thou hast euen stolen away mine heart and caried away my daughters as though they had bene taken captiues with the sworde.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Wherfore diddest thou flie so secretly and steale away from me, and diddest not tel me, that I might haue sent thee foorth with mirth & with songs, with timbrel and with harpe?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But thou hast not suffered me to kisse my sonnes and my daughters: nowe thou hast done foolishly in doing so.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: I am able to do you euill: but the God of your father spake vnto me yesternight, saying, Take heed that thou speake not to Iaakob ought saue good.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Nowe though thou wentest thy way, because thou greatly longedst after thy fathers house, yet wherefore hast thou stollen my gods?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Iaakob answered, and said to Laban, Because I was afraid, & thought that thou wouldest haue taken thy daughters from me.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But with whome thou findest thy gods, let him not liue. Search thou before our brethre what I haue of thine, & take it to thee, (but Iaakob wist not that Rahel had stolen them)

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then came Laban into Iaakobs tent, and into Leahs tent, and into the two maides tentes, but founde them not. So hee went out of Leahs tent, and entred into Rahels tent.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: (Nowe Rahel had taken the idoles, & put them in the camels litter and sate downe vpon them) and Laban searched al the tent, but found them not.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then said she to her father, My Lord, be not angrie that I cannot rise vp before thee: for the custome of women is vpo me: so he searched, but found not the idoles.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: The Iaakob was wroth, and chode with Laban: Iaakob also answered and sayd to Laban, What haue I trespassed? what haue I offended, that thou hast pursued after me?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Seeing thou hast searched all my stuffe, what hast thou foud of all thine houshold stuffe? put it here before my brethren & thy brethren, that they may iudge betweene vs both.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: This twenty yere I haue bin with thee: thine ewes & thy goates haue not cast their yong, and the rammes of thy flocke haue I not eaten.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Whatsoeuer was torne of beasts, I brought it not vnto thee, but made it good my selfe: of mine hand diddest thou require it, were it stollen by day or stollen by night.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: I was in the day consumed with heate, and with frost in the night, and my sleepe departed from mine eyes.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Thus haue I bene twentie yeere in thine house, and serued thee fourteene yeeres for thy two daughters, and sixe yeeres for thy sheepe, and thou hast changed my wages tenne times.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Except the God of my father, the God of Abraham, and the feare of Izhak had bene with me, surely thou haddest sent me away nowe emptie: but God behelde my tribulation, & the labour of mine hads, & rebuked thee yester night.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Laban answered, and saide vnto Iaakob, These daughters are my daughters, & these sonnes are my sonnes, and these sheepe are my sheepe, and all that thou seest, is mine, and what can I doe this day vnto these my daughters, or to their sonnes which they haue borne?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Nowe therefore come and let vs make a couenant, I and thou, which may be a witnes betweene me and thee.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then tooke Iaakob a stone, and set it vp as a pillar:

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Iaakob sayde vnto his brethren, Gather stones: who brought stones, and made an heape, and they did eate there vpon the heape.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Laban called it Iegar-sahadutha, and Iaakob called it Galeed.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: For Laban sayd, This heape is witnesse betweene me and thee this day: therefore he called the name of it Galeed.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Also he called it Mizpah, because he said, The Lorde looke betweene me and thee, when we shalbe departed one from another,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: If thou shalt vexe my daughters, or shalt take wiues beside my daughters: there is no man with vs, beholde, God is witnesse betweene me and thee.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Moreouer Laban sayd to Iaakob, Beholde this heape, and behold the pillar, which I haue set betweene me and thee,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: This heape shall be witnesse, and the pillar shall be witnesse, that I will not come ouer this heape to thee, and that thou shalt not passe ouer this heape and this pillar vnto me for euill.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: The God of Abraham, and the God of Nabor, and the God of their father be iudge betweene vs: But Iaakob sware by the feare of his father Izhak.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Iaakob did offer a sacrifice vpon the mount, and called his brethren to eate bread; they did eate bread, and taried all night in the mount.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And earely in the morning Laban rose vp and kissed his sonnes and his daughters, & blessed them, & Laban departing, went vnto his place againe.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Nowe Iaakob went forth on his iourney and the Angels of God met him.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And when Iaakob saw them, he said, This is Gods hoste, and called the name of the same place Mahanaim.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Iaakob sent messengers before him to Esau his brother, vnto the land of Seir into the countrey of Edom:

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: To whom he gaue commandement, saying, Thus shall ye speake to my lorde Esau: thy seruant Iaakob sayeth thus, I haue bene a stranger with Laban, and taried vnto this time.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: I haue beeues also and Asses, sheepe, & men seruantes, and women seruantes, and haue sent to shew my lord, that I may find grace in thy sight.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So ye messengers came againe to Iaakob, saying, We came vnto thy brother Esau, and hee also commeth against thee and foure hundreth men with him.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Iaakob was greatly afraid, and was sore troubled, and deuided the people that was with him, and the sheepe, and the beeues, and the camels into two companies.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: For he said, If Esau come to ye one copanie and smite it, the other companie shall escape.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Moreouer Iaakob said, O God of my father Abraham, & God of my father Izhak: Lord, which saydest vnto me, Returne vnto thy coutrey and to thy kinred, and I will do thee good,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: I am not worthy of the least of all the mercies, and al the trueth, which thou hast shewed vnto thy seruant: for with my staffe came I ouer this Iorden, & now haue I gotte two bads.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: I pray thee, Deliuer me from the hande of my brother, from the hande of Esau: for I feare him, least he will come and smite me, and the mother vpon the children.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: For thou saydest; I will surely doe thee good, and make thy seede as the sande of the sea, which can not be nombred for multitude.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And he taryed there the same night, and tooke of that which came to had, a present for Esau his brother:

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Two hundreth shee goates & twenty hee goates, two hundreth ewes & twentie rammes:

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Thirtie mylche camels with their coltes, fourtie kine, and ten bullockes, twentie she asses and ten foles.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So he deliuered them into the hande of his seruants, euery droue by themselues, and saide vnto his seruants, Passe before me, & put a space betweene droue and droue.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And he commanded the formost, saying, If Esau my brother meete thee, and aske thee, saying, Whose seruant art thou? And whither goest thou? And whose are these before thee?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then thou shalt say, They be thy seruant Iaakobs: it is a present sent vnto my lord Esau: and beholde, he him selfe also is behinde vs.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So likewise commaunded he the seconde and the thirde, and all that followed the droues, saying, After this maner, ye shall speake vnto Esau, when ye finde him.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And ye shall say moreouer, Beholde, thy seruant Iaakob commeth after vs (for he thought, I will appease his wrath with the present that goeth before me, and afterwarde I will see his face: it may be that he will accept me.)

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So went the present before him: but he taried that night with the companie.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And he rose vp the same night, and tooke his two wiues, and his two maides, and his eleuen children, and went ouer the forde Iabbok.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And he tooke them, and sent them ouer the riuer, and sent ouer that he had.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Now when Iaakob was left him selfe alone, there wrestled a man with him vnto the breaking of the day.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And he sawe that he could not preuaile against him: therefore he touched the holowe of his thigh, and the holowe of Iaakobs thigh was loosed, as he wrestled with him.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And he saide, Let me goe, for the morning appeareth. Who answered, I will not let thee go except thou blesse me.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then said he vnto him, What is thy name? And he said, Iaakob.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then said he, Thy name shalbe called Iaakob no more, but Israel: because thou hast had power with God, thou shalt also preuaile with men.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Iaakob demaded, saying, Tell me, I pray thee, thy name; he said, Wherefore now doest thou aske my name? & he blessed him there

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Iaakob called the name of the place, Peniel: for, saide he, I haue seene God face to face, and my life is preserued.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the sunne rose vp to him as he passed Peniel, and he halted vpon his thigh.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Therefore the children of Israel eate not of the sinewe that shranke in the hollowe of the thigh, vnto this day: because he touched the sinew that shranke in the holow of Iaakobs thigh.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And as Iaakob lift vp his eyes, and looked, behold, Esau came, and with him foure hundreth men: and he deuided the children to Leah, and to Rahel, and to the two maides.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And he put the maides, and their children formost, and Leah, and her children after, and Rahel, and Ioseph hindermost.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So he went before them and bowed him selfe to the ground seuen times, vntill he came neere to his brother.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Esau ranne to meete him, and embraced him, and fell on his necke, and kissed him, & they wept.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And he lift vp his eyes, and sawe the women, and the children, and saide, Who are these with thee? And he answered, They are ye childre whome God of his grace hath giuen thy seruant.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then came the maides neere, they, and their children, and bowed themselues.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Leah also with her children came nere and made obeysance: and after Ioseph & Rahel drew neere, and did reuerence.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then he said, What meanest thou by all this droue, which I met? Who answered, I haue sent it, that I may finde fauour in the sight of my lorde:

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Esau said, I haue ynough, my brother: keepe that thou hast to thy selfe.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But Iaakob answered, Nay, I pray thee: if I haue found grace nowe in thy sight, then receiue my present at mine hande: for I haue seene thy face, as though I had seene the face of God, because thou hast accepted me.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: I pray thee take my blessing, that is brought thee: for God hath had mercie on me, and therefore I haue all things: so he compelled him, and he tooke it.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And he saide, Let vs take our iourney and go, and I will goe before thee.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then he answered him, My lord knoweth, that the children are tender, & the ewes & kine with yong vnder mine hande: and if they should ouerdriue them one day, all the flocke would die.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Let now my lord go before his seruant, & I will driue softly, according to ye pase of ye cattel, which is before me, and as the children be able to endure, vntill I come to my lord vnto Seir.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Esau said, I will leaue then some of my folke with thee; he answered, what needeth this? let me finde grace in the sight of my lorde.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So Esau returned, and went his way that same day vnto Seir.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Iaakob went forwarde towarde Succoth, and built him an house, & made boothes for his cattell: therefore he called the name of the place Succoth.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Afterward, Iaakob came safe to Sheche a citie, which is in the lande of Canaan, when he came from Padan Aram, and pitched before the citie.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And there he bought a parcell of ground, where hee pitched his tent, at the hande of the sonnes of Hamor Shechems father, for an hundreth pieces of money.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And he set vp there an altar, and called it, The mightie God of Israel.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Dinah the daughter of Leah, which she bare vnto Iaakob, went out to see the daughters of that countrey.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Whome when Shechem the sonne of Hamor the Hiuite lorde of that countrey sawe, hee tooke her, and lay with her, and defiled her.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So his heart claue vnto Dinah the daughter of Iaakob: and he loued the maide, & spake kindely vnto the maide.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then said Shechem to his father Hamor, saying, Get me this maide to wife.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: (Nowe Iaakob heard that he had defiled Dinah his daughter, and his sonnes were with his cattell in the fielde: therefore Iaakob helde his peace, vntill they were come.)

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Hamor the father of Shechem went out vnto Iaakob to commune with him.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And whe the sonnes of Iaakob were come out of the fielde and heard it, it grieued the men, & they were very angry, because he had wrought villenie in Israel, in that he had lyen with Iaakobs daughter: which thing ought not to be done.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Hamor communed with them, saying, the soule of my sonne Shechem longeth for your daughter: giue her him to wife, I pray you.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So make affinitie with vs: giue your daughters vnto vs, and take our daughters vnto you,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And ye shall dwell with vs, and the lande shalbe before you: dwell, and doe your businesse in it, and haue your possessions therein.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Shechem also said vnto her father & vnto her brethren, Let me finde fauour in your eyes, and I will giue whatsoeuer ye shall appoint me.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Aske of me abundantly both dowrie and giftes, and I will giue as ye appoint me, so that ye giue me the maide to wife.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then the sonnes of Iaakob answered Shechem and Hamor his father, talking deceitfully, because he had defiled Dinah their sister,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And they said vnto them, We can not do this thing, to giue our sister to an vncircumcised man: for that were a reproofe vnto vs.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But in this will we consent vnto you, if ye will be as we are, that euery man childe among you be circumcised:

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then will we giue our daughters to you, and we will take your daughters to vs, and will dwell with you, and be one people.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But if ye will not hearken vnto vs to be circumcised, then will we take our daughter and depart.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Nowe their wordes pleased Hamor, and Shechem Hamors sonne.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the yong man deferd not to doe the thing because he loued Iaakobs daughter: he was also the most set by of all his fathers house.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Hamor and Shechem his Sonne went vnto the gate of their citie, and communed with the men of their citie, saying,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: These men are peaceable with vs: and that they may dwell in the land, and doe their affaires therin (for behold, the land hath roume ynough for them) let vs take their daughters to wiues, and giue them our daughters.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Onely herein will the men consent vnto vs for to dwell with vs, and to be one people, if all the men children among vs be circumcised as they are circumcised.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Shall not their flockes and their substance and all their cattell be ours? onely let vs consent herein vnto them, and they will dwell with vs.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And vnto Hamor, and Shechem his sonne hearkened all that went out of the gate of his citie: and all the men children were circumcised, euen all that went out of the gate of his citie.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And on the thirde day (when they were sore) two of the sonnes of Iaakob, Simeon and Leui, Dinahs brethren tooke either of them his sworde and went into the citie boldly, and slue euery male.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: They slewe also Hamor and Shechem his sonne with the edge of the sword, & tooke Dinah out of Shechems house, and went their way.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Againe the other sonnes of Iaakob came vpon the dead, and spoyled the citie, because they had defiled their sister.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: They tooke their sheepe & their beeues, and their asses, and whatsoeuer was in the citie, and in the fieldes.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Also they caryed away captiue & spoyled all their goods, and all their children and their wiues, and all that was in the houses.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Iaakob said to Simeon and Leui, Ye haue troubled me, and made me stinke among the inhabitats of the land, aswell the Canaanites, as the Perizzites, and and I being few in nomber, they shall gather theselues together against me, & slay me, and so shall I, and my house be destroied.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And they answered, Shoulde hee abuse our sister as a whore?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then God sayde to Iaakob, Arise, goe vp to Beth-el and dwell there, and make there an altar vnto God, that appeared vnto thee, when thou fleddest from Esau thy brother.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then saide Iaakob vnto his houshold and to all that were with him, Put away the strange gods that are among you, and clense your selues, and change your garments:

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: For we will rise and goe vp to Beth-el, and I will make an altar there vnto God, which heard me in the day of my tribulation, and was with me in the way which I went.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And they gaue vnto Iaakob all the strange gods, which were in their hands, and all their earings which were in their eares, and Iaakob hidde them vnder an oke, which was by Shechem.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then they went on their iourney, and the feare of God was vpon the cities that were roud about them: so that they did not followe after the sonnes of Iaakob.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So came Iaakob to Luz, which is in the land of Canaan: (the same is Beth-el) hee and all the people that was with him.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And he built there an altar, and had called the place, The God of Beth-el, because that God appeared vnto him there, when he fled from his brother.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Deborah Rebekahs nourse dyed, and was buried beneath Beth-el vnder an oke: and he called the name of it Allon Bachuth.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Againe God appeared vnto Iaakob, after he came out of Padan Aram, and blessed him.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Moreouer God said vnto him, Thy name is Iaakob: thy name shalbe no more called Iaakob, but Israel shalbe thy name: and hee called his name Israel.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Againe God said vnto him, I am God all sufficient. growe, and multiplie. a nation and a multitude of nations shall spring of thee, and Kings shall come out of thy loynes.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Also I will giue the lande, which I gaue to Abraham and Izhak, vnto thee: and vnto thy seede after thee will I giue that land.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So God ascended from him in the place where he had talked with him.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Iaakob set vp a pillar in the place where he talked with him, a pillar of stone, and powred drinke offring thereon: also hee powred oyle thereon.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Iaakob called the name of the place, where God spake with him, Beth-el.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then they departed from Beth-el, and when there was about halfe a daies iourney of ground to come to Ephrath, Rahel trauailed, and in trauailing she was in perill.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And whe she was in paines of her labour, the midwife saide vnto her, Feare not: for thou shalt haue this sonne also.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then as she was about to yeelde vp the Ghost (for she died) she called his name Ben-oni, but his father called him Beniamin.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Thus died Rahel, and was buried in the way to Ephrath, which is Beth-lehem.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Iaakob set a pillar vpon her graue: This is the pillar of Rahels graue vnto this day.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Israel went forwarde, and pitched his tent beyond Migdal-eder.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Now, when Israel dwelt in that land, Reuben went, and lay with Bilhah his fathers concubine, and it came to Israels eare; Iaakob had twelue sonnes.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: The sonnes of Leah: Reuben Iaakobs eldest sonne, and Simeon, and Leui, and Iudah, and Issachar, and Zebulun.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: The sonnes of Rahel: Ioseph & Beniamin.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the sonnes of Bilhah Rahels maide: Dan and Naphtali.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the sonnes of Zilpah Leahs maide: Gad and Asher. These are the sonnes of Iaakob, which were borne him in Padan Aram.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Iaakob came vnto Izhak his father to Mamre a citie of Arbah: this is Hebron, where Abraham and Izhak were strangers.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the daies of Izhak were an hundreth and fourescore yeeres.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Izhak gaue vp the ghost and died, and was gathered vnto his people, being olde & full of daies: & his sonnes Esau & Iaakob buried him.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Nowe these are the generations of Esau, which is Edom.

Book.Name: Genesis
