Text: Esau tooke his wiues of the daughters of Canaan: Adah the daughter of Elon an Hittite, & Aholibamah the daughter of Anah, the daughter of Zibeon an Hiuite,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And tooke Basemath Ishmaels daughter, sister of Nebaioth.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Adah bare vnto Esau, Eliphaz: and Basemath bare Reuel.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Also Aholibamah bare Ieush, and Iaalam, and Korah: these are the sonnes of Esau which were borne to him in the land of Canaan.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So Esau tooke his wiues and his sonnes, and his daughters, & all the soules of his house, & his flocks, & all his cattell, & all his substance, which he had gotten in the land of Canaan, and went into an other countrey from his brother Iaakob.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: For their riches were so great, that they could not dwell together, and the lande, wherein they were strangers, coulde not receiue them because of their flockes.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Therefore dwelt Esau in mount Seir: this Esau is Edom.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So these are the generations of Esau father of Edom in mount Seir.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: These are the names of Esaus sonnes: Eliphaz, the sonne of Adah, the wife of Esau, & Reuel the sonne of Bashemath, the wife of Esau.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the sonnes of Eliphaz were Teman, Omar, Zepho, and Gatam, and Kenaz.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Timna was concubine to Eliphaz Esaus sonne, and bare vnto Eliphaz, Amalek: these be the sonnes of Adah Esaus wife.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And these are the sonnes of Reuel: Nahath, and Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah: these were the sonnes of Bashemath Esaus wife.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And these were the sonnes of Aholibamah the daughter of Anah, daughter of Zibeon Esaus wife: for she bare vnto Esau, Ieush, and Iaalam, and Korah.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: These were Dukes of the sonnes of Esau: the sonnes of Eliphaz, the first borne of Esau: Duke Teman, Duke Omar, Duke Zepho, Duke Kenaz,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Duke Korah, Duke Gatam, Duke Amalek: these are the Dukes that came of Eliphaz in the land of Edom: these were the sonnes of Adah.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And these are the sonnes of Reuel Esaus sonne: Duke Nahath, Duke Zerah, Duke Shammah, Duke Mizzah: these are the Dukes that came of Reuel in the land of Edom: these are the sonnes of Bashemath Esaus wife.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Likewise these were the sonnes of Aholibamah Esaus wife: Duke Ieush, Duke Iaalam, Duke Korah: these Dukes came of Aholibamah, the daughter of Anah Esaus wife.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: These are the children of Esau, and these are the Dukes of them: This Esau is Edom.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: These are the sonnes of Seir the Horite, which inhabited the lande before, Lotan, and Shobal, and Zibeon, and Anah.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Dishon, and Ezer, and Dishan: these are the Dukes of the Horites, the sonnes of Seir in the land of Edom.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the sonnes of Lotan were, Hori and Hemam, and Lotans sister was Timna.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the sonnes of Shobal were these: Aluan, and Manahath, and Ebal, Shepho, and Onam.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And these are the sonnes of Zibeon: Both Aiah, and Anah: this was Anah that founde mules in the wildernesse, as he fedde his father Zibeons asses.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the children of Anah were these: Dishon and Aholibamah, the daughter of Anah.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Also these are the sonnes of Dishan: Hemdan, and Eshban, and Ithran, and Cheran.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: The sonnes of Ezer are these: Bilhan, and Zaauan, and Akan.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: The sonnes of Dishan are these: Vz, and Aran.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: These are the Dukes of the Horites: Duke Lotan, Duke Shobal, Duke Zibeon, Duke Anah,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Duke Dishon, Duke Ezer, Duke Dishan: these bee the Dukes of the Horites, after their Dukedomes in the land of Seir.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And these are the Kings that reigned in the lande of Edom, before there reigned any King ouer the children of Israel.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Bela the sonne of Beor reigned in Edom, & the name of his citie was Dinhabah.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And when Bela dyed, Iobab the sonne of Zerah of Bozra reigned in his steade.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: When Iobab also was dead, Husham of the land of Temani reigned in his steade.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And after the death of Husham, Hadad the sonne of Bedad, which slewe Midian in the field of Moab, reigned in his steade, and the name of his citie was Auith.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: When Hadad was dead, then Samlah of Masrekah reigned in his steade.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: When Samlah was dead, Shaul of Rehoboth by the riuer, reigned in his steade.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: When Shaul dyed, Baal-hanan the sonne of Achbor reigned in his steade.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And after the death of Baal-hanan the sonne of Achbor, Hadad reigned in his stead, and the name of his citie was Pau: and his wiues name Mehetabel the daughter of Matred, the daughter of Mezahab.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then these are the names of the Dukes of Esau according to their families, their places and by their names: Duke Timna, Duke Aluah, Duke Ietheth,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Duke Aholibamah, Duke Elah, Duke Pinon,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Duke Kenaz, Duke Teman, Duke Mibzar,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Duke Magdiel, Duke Iram: these bee the Dukes of Edom, according to their habitations, in the lande of their inheritance. This Esau is the father of Edom.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Iaakob nowe dwelt in the lande, wherein his father was a stranger, in the lande of Canaan.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: These are the generations of Iaakob, when Ioseph was seuenteene yeere olde: he kept sheepe with his brethren, and the childe was with the sonnes of Bilhah, and with the sonnes of Zilpah, his fathers wiues; Ioseph brought vnto their father their euill saying.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Nowe Israel loued Ioseph more then all his sonnes, because he begate him in his old age, and he made him a coat of many colours.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So when his brethren sawe that their father loued him more then all his brethren, then they hated him, and could not speake peaceably vnto him.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Ioseph dreamed a dreame, and told his brethren, who hated him so much the more.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: For he saide vnto them, Heare, I pray you, this dreame which I haue dreamed.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Beholde nowe, wee were binding sheues in the middes of the field: and loe, my shefe arose and also stoode vpright, and behold, your sheues compassed rounde about, and did reuerence to my shefe.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then his brethren saide to him, What, shalt thou reigne ouer vs, and rule vs? or shalt thou haue altogether dominion ouer vs? And they hated him so much the more, for his dreames, and for his wordes.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Againe hee dreamed an other dreame, & tolde it his brethren, and saide, Behold, I haue had one dreame more, and beholde, the Sunne and the Moone & eleuen starres did reuerence to me.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then he tolde it vnto his father and to his brethren, and his father rebuked him, and saide vnto him, What is this dreame, which thou hast dreamed? Shal I, and thy mother, & thy brethren come in deede & fall on the ground before thee?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And his brethren enuied him, but his father noted the saying.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then his brethren went to keepe their fathers sheepe in Shechem.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Israel said vnto Ioseph, Doe not thy brethren keepe in Shechem? Come and I will send thee to them.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And he answered him, I am here. Then he saide vnto him, Goe now, see whether it bee well with thy brethren, and how the flocks prosper, and bring me word againe. So hee sent him from the vale of Hebron, and he came to Shechem.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then a man found him: for lo, hee was wandring in the fielde, and the man asked him, saying, What seekest thou?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And he answered, I seeke my brethren: tell me, I pray thee, where they keepe sheepe.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the man said, they are departed hece: for I heard them say, Let vs goe vnto Dothan. Then went Ioseph after his brethren, and found them in Dothan.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And when they sawe him a farre off, euen before he came at them, they conspired against him for to slay him.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: For they sayd one to another, Behold, this dreamer commeth.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Come now therefore, and let vs slay him, and cast him into some pitte, and wee will say, A wicked beast hath deuoured him: then wee shall see, what will come of his dreames.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But when Reuben heard that, he deliuered him out of their handes, and saide, Let vs not kill him.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Also Reuben saide vnto them, Shed not blood, but cast him into this pitte that is in the wildernesse, and lay no hande vpon him. Thus he said, that he might deliuer him out of their hand, and restore him to his father againe.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Now when Ioseph was come vnto his brethren, they stript Ioseph out of his coate, his particoloured coate that was vpon him.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And they tooke him, and cast him into a pit, and the pit was emptie, without water in it.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then they sate them downe to eate bread: and they lift vp their eyes and looked, and behold, there came a companie of Ishmeelites from Gilead, and their camels laden with spicerie, and balme, and myrrhe, and were going to cary it downe into Egypt.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Iudah said vnto his brethren, What auaileth it, if we slay our brother, though wee keepe his blood secret?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Come and let vs sell him to the Ishmeelites, and let not our handes be vpon him: for he is our brother and our flesh: and his brethren obeyed.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then the Midianites marchant men passed by, and they drewe foorth, and lift Ioseph out of the pit, and solde Ioseph vnto the Ishmeelites for twentie pieces of siluer: who brought Ioseph into Egypt.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Afterwarde Reuben returned to the pit, and beholde, Ioseph was not in the pit: then he rent his clothes,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And returned to his brethren, and said, The childe is not yonder, and I, whither shall I goe?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And they tooke Iosephs coate, and killed a kidde of the goates, and dipped the coate in the blood.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So they sent that particoloured coat, and they brought it vnto their father, and saide, This haue we founde: see nowe, whether it be thy sonnes coate, or no.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then he knewe it and said, It is my sonnes coate: a wicked beast hath deuoured him: Ioseph is surely torne in pieces.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Iaakob rent his clothes, & put sackecloth about his loynes, and sorowed for his sonne a long season.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then all his sonnes and all his daughters rose vp to comfort him, but he woulde not be comforted, but said, Surely I will go downe into the graue vnto my sonne mourning: so his father wept for him.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the Midianites solde him into Egypt vnto Potiphar an Eunuche of Pharaohs, and his chiefe stewarde.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And at that time Iudah went downe from his brethren, and turned in to a man called Hirah an Adullamite.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Iudah sawe there the daughter of a man called Suah a Canaanite: and he tooke her to wife, and went in vnto her.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So she conceiued and bare a sonne, and he called his name Er.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And she conceiued againe, & bare a sonne, and she called his name Onan.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Moreouer she bare yet a sonne, whome she called Shelah: and Iudah was at Chezib when she bare him.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Iudah tooke a wife to Er his first borne sonne whose name was Tamar.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Now Er the first borne of Iudah was wicked in the sight of the Lord: therefore the Lord slewe him.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Iudah said to Onan, Goe in vnto thy brothers wife, and do the office of a kinsman vnto her, and raise vp seede vnto thy brother.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Onan knewe that the seede should not be his: therefore when he went in vnto his brothers wife, he spilled it on the grounde, least he should giue seede vnto his brother.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And it was wicked in the eyes of the Lord, which he did: wherefore he slewe him also.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then said Iudah to Tamar his daughter in lawe, Remaine a widowe in thy fathers house, till Shelah my sonne growe vp (for he thought thus, Least he die as well as his brethren.) So Tamar went and dwelt in her fathers house.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And in processe of time also the daughter of Shuah Iudahs wife dyed. Then Iudah, when he had left mourning, went vp to his sheepe sherers to Timnah, he, and his neighbour Hirah the Adullamite.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And it was tolde Tamar, saying, beholde, thy father in lawe goeth vp to Timnah, to shere his sheepe.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then she put her widowes garments off from her, and couered her with a vaile, and wrapped her selfe, and sate downe in Pethah-enaim, which is by the way to Timnah, because she sawe that Shelah was growen, and she was not giuen vnto him to wife.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: When Iudah sawe her, he iudged her an whore: for she had couered her face.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And he turned to the way towardes her, and saide, Come, I pray thee, let me lie with thee. (for he knewe not that she was his daughter in lawe) And she answered, What wilt thou giue me for to lie with me?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then said he, I will sende thee a kid of the goates from the flocke; she said, Well, if thou wilt giue me a pledge, till thou sende it.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then he saide, What is the pledge that I shall giue thee? And she answered, Thy signet, and thy cloke, and thy staffe that is in thine hande. So he gaue it her, and lay by her, and she was with childe by him.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then she rose, and went and put her vaile from her and put on her widowes raiment.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Afterwarde Iudah sent a kid of the goates by the hande of his neighbour the Adullamite, for to receiue his pledge from the womans hand: but he found her not.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then asked he the men of that place, saying, Where is ye whore, that sate in Enaim by the way side? And they answered, There was no whore here.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: He came therefore to Iudah againe, and said, I can not finde her, and also the men of the place said, There was no whore there.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Iudah said, Let her take it to her, lest we be shamed: beholde, I sent this kid, and thou hast not found her.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Now after three moneths, one tolde Iudah, saying, Tamar thy daughter in law hath played the whore, and lo, with playing the whore, she is great with childe. Then Iudah saide, Bring ye her foorth and let her be burnt.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: When she was brought foorth, she sent to her father in law, saying, By the man, vnto whom these things pertaine, am I with childe: and saide also, Looke, I pray thee, whose these are, the seale, and the cloke, and the staffe.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Iudah knewe them, and said, She is more righteous then I: for she hath done it because I gaue her not to Shelah my sonne. So he lay with her no more.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Now, when the time was come that she should be deliuered, beholde, there were twinnes in her wombe.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And when she was in trauell, the one put out his hand: and the midwife tooke and bound a red threde about his hand, saying, This is come out first.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But when he plucked his hand backe againe, loe, his brother came out, and the midwife said, How hast thou broken the breach vpon thee? and his name was called Pharez.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And afterward came out his brother that had the red threde about his hande, and his name was called Zarah.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Now Ioseph was brought downe into Egypt: and Potiphar an Eunuche of Pharaohs (and his chiefe stewarde an Egyptian) bought him at the hande of the Ishmeelites, which had brought him thither.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the Lorde was with Ioseph, and he was a man that prospered and was in the house of his master the Egyptian.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And his master sawe that the Lorde was with him, and that the Lorde made all that hee did to prosper in his hande.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So Ioseph founde fauour in his sight, and serued him: and he made him ruler of his house, and put all that he had in his hand.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And from that time that he had made him ruler ouer his house and ouer all that he had, the Lorde blessed the Egyptians house for Iosephs sake: and the blessing of the Lorde was vpon all that he had in the house, and in the fielde.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Therefore he left all that he had in Iosephs hand, and tooke accompt of nothing, that was with him, saue onely of the bread, which he did eate; Ioseph was a faire person, and well fauoured.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Nowe therefore after these thinges, his masters wife cast her eyes vpon Ioseph, and saide, Lye with me.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But he refused and said to his masters wife, Beholde, my master knoweth not what he hath in the house with me, but hath committed all that he hath to mine hande.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: There is no ma greater in this house then I: neither hath he kept any thing from me, but only thee, because thou art his wife: how then can I do this great wickednes & so sinne against God?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And albeit she spake to Ioseph day by day, yet he hearkened not vnto her, to lye with her, or to be in her company.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then on a certaine day Ioseph entred into the house, to doe his businesse: and there was no man of the houshold in the house:

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Therefore she caught him by his garmet, saying, Sleepe with me: but he left his garment in her hand and fled, and got him out.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Nowe when she sawe that he had left his garment in her hand, and was fled out,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: She called vnto the men of her house, and tolde them, saying, Beholde, he hath brought in an Ebrewe vnto vs to mocke vs: who came in to me for to haue slept with me: but I cryed with a loude voyce.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And when he heard that I lift vp my voice and cryed, he left his garment with me, and fled away, and got him out.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So she layde vp his garment by her, vntill her lord came home.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then she tolde him according to these words, saying, The Ebrew seruat, which thou hast brought vnto vs, came in to me, to mocke me.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But assoone as I lift vp my voyce & cried, he left his garment with me, and fled out.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then when his master heard the wordes of his wife, which she tolde him, saying, After this maner did thy seruant to me, his anger was kindled.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Iosephs master tooke him and put him in prison, in the place, where the kings prisoners lay bounde: and there he was in prison.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But the Lorde was with Ioseph, and shewed him mercie, and got him fauour in the sight of the master of the prison.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the keeper of the prison committed to Iosephs hande all the prisoners that were in the prison, and whatsoeuer they did there, that did he.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the keeper of the prison looked vnto nothing that was vnder his hande, seeing that the Lord was with him: for whatsoeuer he did, the Lorde made it to prosper.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And after these things, the butler of the King of Egypt and his baker offended their lorde the King of Egypt.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Pharaoh was angrie against his two officers, against the chiefe butler, and against the chiefe baker.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Therefore he put them in ward in his chiefe stewardes house, in the prison and place where Ioseph was bound.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the chiefe steward gaue Ioseph charge ouer them, and he serued them: and they continued a season in warde.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And they both dreamed a dreame, eyther of them his dreame in one night, eche one according to the interpretation of his dreame, both the butler and the baker of the King of Egypt, which were bounde in the prison.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And when Ioseph came in vnto them in the morning, and looked vpon them, beholde, they were sad.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And he asked Pharaohs officers, that were with him in his masters warde, saying, Wherefore looke ye so sadly to day?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Who answered him, We haue dreamed, eche one a dreame, and there is none to interprete the same. Then Ioseph saide vnto them, Are not interpretations of God? Tell them me nowe.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So the chiefe butler tolde his dreame to Ioseph, and said vnto him, In my dreame, behold, a vine was before me,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And in the vine were three branches, and as it budded, her flowre came foorth: and the clusters of grapes waxed ripe.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And I had Pharaohs cup in mine hande, and I tooke the grapes, & wrung the into Pharaohs cup, and I gaue the cup into Pharaohs hand.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Ioseph sayde vnto him, This is the interpretation of it: The three braunches are three dayes.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Within three dayes shall Pharaoh lift vp thine head, & restore thee vnto thine office, and thou shalt giue Pharaohs cup into his hand after the olde maner, when thou wast his butler.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But haue me in remeberance with thee, when thou art in good case, & shew mercie, I pray thee, vnto me, and make mention of me to Pharaoh, that thou mayest bring me out of this house.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: For I was stollen away by theft out of the land of the Ebrewes, and here also haue I done nothing, wherefore they should put mee in the dungeon.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And when the chiefe baker sawe that the interpretation was good, hee saide vnto Ioseph, Also mee thought in my dreame that I had three white baskets on mine head.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And in the vppermost basket there was of all maner baken meates for Pharaoh: and the birdes did eate them out of the basket vpon mine head.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Ioseph answered, and saide, This is the interpretation thereof: The three baskets are three dayes:

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Within three dayes shall Pharaoh take thine head from thee, & shal hang thee on a tree, and the birdes shall eate thy flesh from off thee.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And so the third day, which was Pharaohs birthday, hee made a feast vnto all his seruants: and hee lifted vp the head of the chiefe butler, and the head of the chiefe baker among his seruants.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And he restored the chiefe butler vnto his butlershippe, who gaue the cup into Pharaohs hande,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But he hanged the chiefe baker, as Ioseph had interpreted vnto them.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Yet the chiefe butler did not remember Ioseph, but forgate him.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And two yeeres after, Pharaoh also dreamed, and beholde, he stoode by a riuer,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And loe, there came out of the riuer seuen goodly kine and fatfleshed, and they fedde in a medowe:

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And loe, seuen other kine came vp after the out of the riuer, euill fauoured & leane fleshed, and stoode by the other kine vpon the brinke of the riuer.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the euilfauoured and leane fleshed kine did eate vp the seuen welfauoured and fatte kine: so Pharaoh awoke.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Againe he slept, and dreamed the second time: and beholde, seuen eares of corne grewe vpon one stalke, ranke and goodly.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And loe, seuen thinne eares, and blasted with the east winde, sprang vp after them:

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the thinne eares deuoured the seuen ranke and full eares. then Pharaoh awaked, and loe, it was a dreame.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Nowe when the morning came, his spirit was troubled: therefore he sent and called all the soothsayers of Egypt, and all the wise men thereof, and Pharaoh tolde them his dreames: but none coulde interprete them to Pharaoh.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then spake the chiefe butler vnto Pharaoh, saying, I call to minde my faultes this day.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Pharaoh being angrie with his seruantes, put me in ward in the chiefe stewards house, both me and the chiefe baker.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then we dreamed a dreame in one night, both I, and he: we dreamed eche man according to the interpretation of his dreame.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And there was with vs a yong man, an Ebrew, seruant vnto the chiefe steward, whome when we told, he declared our dreames to vs, to euery one he declared according to his dreame.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And as he declared vnto vs, so it came to passe: for he restored me to mine office, & hanged him.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then sent Pharaoh, and called Ioseph, and they brought him hastily out of prison, and he shaued him, and chaunged his rayment, and came to Pharaoh.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Pharaoh sayde to Ioseph, I haue dreamed a dreame, and no man can interprete it, and I haue hearde say of thee, that when thou hearest a dreame, thou canst interprete it.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Ioseph answered Pharaoh, saying, Without me God shal answere for the wealth of Pharaoh.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Pharaoh sayde vnto Ioseph, In my dreame, beholde, I stoode by the banke of the riuer:

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And lo, there came vp out of the riuer seuen fat fleshed, and welfauoured kine, and they fedde in the medowe.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Also loe, seuen other kine came vp after them, poore and very euilfauoured, and leanefleshed: I neuer sawe the like in all the lande of Egypt, for euilfauoured.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the leane and euilfauoured kine did eate vp the first seuen fat kine.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And when they had eaten them vp, it could not be knowen that they had eaten them, but they were still as euilfauoured, as they were at the beginning: so did I awake.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Moreouer I sawe in my dreame, and beholde, seuen eares sprang out of one stalke, full and faire.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And lo, seuen eares, withered, thinne, and blasted with the East winde, sprang vp after them.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the thinne eares deuoured the seuen good eares. Nowe I haue tolde the soothsayers, and none can declare it vnto me.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Ioseph answered Pharaoh, Both Pharaohs dreames are one. God hath shewed Pharaoh, what he is about to doe.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: The seuen good kine are seuen yeres, and the seuen good eares are seuen yeeres: this is one dreame.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Likewise the seuen thinne and euilfauoured kine, that came out after them, are seuen yeeres: and the seuen emptie eares blasted with the East winde, are seuen yeeres of famine.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: This is the thing which I haue saide vnto Pharaoh, that God hath shewed vnto Pharaoh, what he is about to doe.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Beholde, there come seuen yeeres of great plentie in all the land of Egypt.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Againe, there shall arise after them seuen yeeres of famine, so that all the plentie shall be forgotten in the land of Egypt, and the famine shall consume the land:

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Neither shall the plentie bee knowen in the land, by reason of this famine that shall come after: for it shalbe exceeding great.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And therefore the dreame was doubled vnto Pharaoh the second time, because the thing is established by God, & God hasteth to performe it.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Nowe therefore let Pharaoh prouide for a man of vnderstanding and wisedome, and set him ouer the land of Egypt.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Let Pharaoh make and appoynt officers ouer the lande, and take vp the fift part of the land of Egypt in the seuen plenteous yeeres.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Also let them gather all the foode of these good yeeres that come, and lay vp corne vnder the hand of Pharaoh for foode, in the cities, and let them keepe it.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So the foode shall be for the prouision of the lande, against the seuen yeeres of famine, which shalbe in the lande of Egypt, that the land perish not by famine.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the saying pleased Pharaoh and all his seruants.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then saide Pharaoh vnto his seruants, Can we finde such a man as this, in whom is the Spirit of God?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: The Pharaoh said to Ioseph, For as much as God hath shewed thee all this, there is no man of vnderstanding, or of wisedome like vnto thee.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Thou shalt be ouer mine house, & at thy word shall all my people be armed, onely in the kings throne will I be aboue thee.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Moreouer Pharaoh said to Ioseph, Behold, I haue set thee ouer all the land of Egypt.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Pharaoh tooke off his ring from his hand, and put it vpon Iosephs hand, and arayed him in garments of fine linnen, and put a golden cheyne about his necke.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So he set him vpon the best charet that hee had, saue one: & they cryed before him, Abrech, & placed him ouer all the land of Egypt.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Againe Pharaoh saide vnto Ioseph, I am Pharaoh, and without thee shall no man lift vp his hand or his foote in all the land of Egypt.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Pharaoh called Iosephs name Zaphnath-paaneah: and he gaue him to wife Asenath the daughter of Poti-pherah prince of On. then went Ioseph abrode in the land of Egypt.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Ioseph was thirtie yeere old when he stood before Pharaoh king of Egypt: and Ioseph departing from the presence of Pharaoh, went throughout all the land of Egypt.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And in the seuen plenteous yeres the earth brought foorth store.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And hee gathered vp all the foode of the seuen plenteous yeeres, which were in the lande of Egypt, and layde vp foode in the cities: the foode of the fielde, that was round about euery citie, layde he vp in the same.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So Ioseph gathered wheate, like vnto the sand of the sea in multitude out of measure, vntill he left numbring: for it was without number.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Now vnto Ioseph were borne two sonnes (before the yeeres of famine came) which Asenath the daughter of Poti-pherah prince of On bare vnto him.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Ioseph called the name of the first borne Manasseh: for God, said he, hath made me forget all my labour & al my fathers houshold.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Also hee called the name of the second, Ephraim: For God, sayde he hath made me fruitfull in the land of mine affliction.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So the seuen yeeres of the plentie that was in the land of Egypt were ended.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then began the seuen yeeres of famine to come, according as Ioseph had saide: and the famine was in all landes, but in all the land of Egypt was bread.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: At the length all the lande of Egypt was affamished, and the people cryed to Pharaoh for bread; Pharaoh said vnto all the Egyptians, Goe to Ioseph: what he sayth to you, doe ye.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: When the famine was vpon all the land, Ioseph opened all places, wherein the store was, and solde vnto the Egyptians: for the famine waxed sore in the land of Egypt.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And all countries came to Egypt to bye corne of Ioseph, because the famine was sore in all landes.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Iaakob saw that there was foode in Egypt, and Iaakob said vnto his sonnes, Why gaze ye one vpon an other?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And he said, Behold, I haue heard that there is foode in Egypt, Get you downe thither, & bie vs foode thence, that we may liue and not die.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So went Iosephs ten brethren downe to bye corne of the Egyptians.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But Beniamin Iosephs brother woulde not Iaakob send with his brethren: for he saide, Least death should befall him.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the sonnes of Israel came to bye foode among them that came: for there was famine in the land of Canaan.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Now Ioseph was gouerner of the land, who solde to all the people of the lande: then Iosephs brethren came, & bowed their face to the groud before him.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And when Ioseph sawe his brethren, hee knewe them, and made himselfe straunge toward them, and spake to them roughly, and saide vnto them, Whence come yee? Who answered, Out of the land of Canaan, to bye vitaile.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: (Now Ioseph knewe his brethren, but they knew not him.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Ioseph remembred the dreames, which he dreamed of them) and he sayde vnto them, Ye are spies, and are come to see the weaknesse of the land.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But they sayde vnto him, Nay, my lorde, but to bye vitayle thy seruants are come.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Wee are all one mans sonnes: wee meane truely, and thy seruants are no spies.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But he saide vnto them, Nay, but yee are come to see the weakenes of the land.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And they said, We thy seruants are twelue brethren, the sonnes of one man in the lande of Canaan: and beholde, the yongest is this day with our father, and one is not.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Againe Ioseph sayde vnto them, This is it that I spake vnto you, saying, Ye are spies.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Hereby ye shall be proued: by the life of Pharaoh, ye shal not goe hence, except your yongest brother come hither.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Send one of you which may fet your brother, & ye shall be kept in prison, that your words may be proued, whether there bee trueth in you: or els by the life of Pharaoh ye are but spies.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So he put them in warde three dayes.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Ioseph said vnto them the third day, This do, and liue: for I feare God.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: If ye be true men, let one of your brethren be bounde in your prison house, and goe ye, carie foode for the famine of your houses:

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But bring your yonger brother vnto me, that your wordes may be tried, and that ye dye not: and they did so.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And they said one to another, We haue verily sinned against our brother, in that we sawe the anguish of his soule, when he besought vs, and we would not heare him: therefore is this trouble come vpon vs.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Reuben answered them, saying, Warned I not you, saying, Sinne not against the childe, and ye would not heare? and lo, his blood is now required.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: (And they were not aware that Ioseph vnderstoode them: for he spake vnto them by an interpreter.)

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then he turned from them, and wept, & turned to them againe, & communed with them, and tooke Simeon from among them, & bounde him before their eyes.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So Ioseph commanded that they should fill their sackes with wheate, and put euery mans money againe in his sacke, and giue them vitaile for the iourney: and thus did he vnto them.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And they layed their vitaile vpon their asses, and departed thence.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And as one of them opened his sacke for to giue his asse prouender in the ynne, he espyed his money: for lo, it was in his sackes mouth.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then he sayde vnto his brethren, My money is restored: for loe, it is euen in my sacke; their heart fayled them, and they were astonished, and sayde one to another, What is this, that God hath done vnto vs?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And they came vnto Iaakob their father vnto the lande of Canaan, and tolde him all that had befallen them, saying,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: The man, who is Lorde of the lande, spake roughly to vs, and put vs in prison as spyes of the countrey.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And we sayd vnto him, We are true men, and are no spies.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: We be twelue brethren, sonnes of our father: one is not, and the yongest is this day with our father in the land of Canaan.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then the Lord of the countrey sayde vnto vs, Hereby shal I knowe if ye be true men: Leaue one of your brethren with me, and take foode for the famine of your houses and depart,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And bring your yongest brother vnto me, that I may knowe that ye are no spies, but true men: so will I deliuer you your brother, and yee shall occupie in the land.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And as they emptied their sacks, behold, euery mans bundel of money was in his sacke: and when they and their father sawe the bundels of their money, they were afrayde.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Iaakob their father said to them, Ye haue robbed me of my children: Ioseph is not, & Simeon is not, and ye will take Beniamin: all these things are against me.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Reuben answered his father, saying, Slay my two sonnes, if I bring him not to thee againe: deliuer him to mine hand, and I will bring him to thee againe.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But he sayd, My sonne shall not go downe with you: for his brother is dead, and he is left alone: if death come vnto him by the way which ye goe, then ye shall bring my gray head with sorow vnto the graue.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Now great famine was in the land.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And when they had eaten vp the vitaile, which they had brought from Egypt, their father sayd vnto them, Turne againe, and bye vs a little foode.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Iudah answered him, saying, The man charged vs by an othe, saying, Neuer see my face, except your brother be with you.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: If thou wilt sende our brother with vs, we will goe downe, and bye thee foode:

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But if thou wilt not send him, we wil not go downe: for the man said vnto vs, Looke me not in the face, except your brother be with you.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Israel sayd, Wherefore delt ye so euill with me, as to tell the man, whether ye had yet a brother or no?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And they answered, The man asked straitly of our selues and of our kinred, saying, Is your father yet aliue? haue ye any brother? And wee tolde him according to these wordes: could we knowe certainely that he would say, Bring your brother downe?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then sayde Iudah to Israel his father, Send the boy with mee, that we may rise and goe, and that we may liue and not dye, both we, and thou, and our children.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: I wil be suertie for him: of mine hand shalt thou require him. If I bring him not to thee, and set him before thee, then let me beare the blame for euer.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: For except we had made this tarying, doutlesse by this we had returned the second time.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then their father Israel sayd vnto them, If it must needes be so now, do thus: take of the best fruites of the lande in your vessels, and bring the man a present, a little rosen, & a little hony, spices and myrrhe, nuttes, and almondes:

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And take double money in your hande, and the money, that was brought againe in your sackes mouthes: cary it againe in your hand, lest it were some ouersight.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Take also your brother and arise, and go againe to the man.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And God almightie giue you mercie in the sight of the man, that hee may deliuer you your other brother, and Beniamin: but I shall be robbed of my childe, as I haue bene.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Thus the men tooke this present, & tooke twise so much money in their hande with Beniamin, and rose vp, and went downe to Egypt and stoode before Ioseph.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And whe Ioseph saw Beniamin with them, he sayde to his stewarde, Bring these men home and kill meate, and make ready: for the men shal eate with me at noone.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the man did as Ioseph bad, & brought the men vnto Iosephs house.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Nowe when the men were brought into Iosephs house, they were afrayd, & sayd, Because of the money, that came in our sackes mouthes at the first time, are we brought, that hee may picke a quarrell against vs, and lay some thing to our charge, and bring vs in bondage and our asses.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Therefore came they to Iosephs stewarde, & communed with him at the doore of ye house.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And said, Oh syr, we came in deede down hither at the first time to bye foode,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And as wee came to an ynne and opened our sackes, behold, euery mans money was in his sackes mouth, euen our money in full weight, but we haue brought it againe in our handes.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Also other money haue we brought in our handes to bye foode, but we cannot tell, who put our money in our sackes.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And he said, Peace be vnto you, feare not: your God and the God of your father hath giuen you that treasure in your sackes, I had your money: and he brought forth Simeon to them.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So the man led them into Iosephs house, & gaue them water to wash their feete, and gaue their asses prouender.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And they made ready their present against Ioseph came at noone, (for they heard say, that they should eate bread there)

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: When Ioseph came home, they brought the present into the house to him, which was in their handes, and bowed downe to the grounde before him.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And he asked them of their prosperitie, and sayd, Is your father the olde man, of whome ye tolde me, in good health? is he yet aliue?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Who answered, Thy seruant our father is in good health, he is yet aliue: and they bowed downe, and made obeysance.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And he lifting vp his eyes, beheld his brother Beniamin his mothers sonne, and sayde, Is this your yonger brother, of whome ye tolde me? And he said, God be merciful vnto thee, my sone.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Ioseph made haste (for his affection was inflamed towarde his brother, and sought where to weepe) and entred into his chamber, and wept there.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Afterward he washed his face, & came out, and refrained himselfe, and sayd, Set on meate.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And they prepared for him by himselfe, and for them by themselues, and for the Egyptians, which did eate with him, by themselues, because the Egyptians might not eate bread with the Ebrewes: for that was an abomination vnto the Egyptians.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So they sate before him: the eldest according vnto his age, and the yongest according vnto his youth; the men marueiled among themselues.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And they tooke meases from before him, and sent to them: but Beniamins mease was fiue times so much as any of theirs: and they drunke, and had of the best drinke with him.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Afterward he commanded his steward, saying, Fill the mens sackes with foode, as much as they can carry, and put euery mans money in his sackes mouth.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And put my cup, I meane the siluer cup, in the sackes mouth of the yongest, and his corne money; he did according to the commandement that Ioseph gaue him.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And in the morning the men were sent away, they, and their asses.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And when they went out of the citie not farre off, Ioseph sayd to his stewarde, Vp, followe after the men: and when thou doest ouertake them, say vnto them, Wherefore haue ye rewarded euill for good?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Is that not the cuppe, wherein my Lorde drinketh? and in the which he doeth deuine and prophecie? ye haue done euill in so doing.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And when he ouertooke them, he sayde those wordes vnto them.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And they answered him, Wherefore sayeth my lorde such wordes? God forbid that thy seruants should do such a thing.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Behold, the money which we found in our sackes mouthes, wee brought againe to thee out of the land of Canaan: how then should we steale out of thy lordes house siluer or golde?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: With whomesoeuer of thy seruants it bee found, let him dye, and we also will be my lordes bondmen.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And he said, Now then let it be according vnto your wordes: he with whome it is found, shal be my seruant, and ye shalbe blamelesse.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then at once euery man tooke downe his sacke to the grounde, and euery one opened his sacke.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And he searched, and began at the eldest and left at the yongest: and the cuppe was found in Beniamins sacke.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then they rent their clothes, and laded euery man his asse, & went againe into the citie.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So Iudah and his brethren came to Iosephs house (for he was yet there) and they fel before him on the ground.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Ioseph sayd vnto them, What acte is this, which ye haue done? know ye not that such a man as I, can deuine and prophecie?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then sayd Iudah, What shall we say vnto my lord? what shall we speake? and howe can we iustifie our selues? God hath found out the wickednesse of thy seruants: beholde, we are seruants to my Lorde, both wee, and he, with whome the cuppe is founde.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But he answered, God forbid, that I should doe so, but the man, with whome the cuppe is founde, he shalbe my seruant, and go ye in peace vnto your father.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Iudah drewe neere vnto him, and sayde, O my Lord, let thy seruant nowe speake a worde in my lordes eares, and let not thy wrath be kindled against thy seruant: for thou art euen as Pharaoh.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: My Lord asked his seruants, saying, Haue ye a father, or a brother?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And we answered my Lorde, We haue a father that is olde, and a young childe, which he begate in his age: and his brother is dead, and he alone is left of his mother, and his father loueth him.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Now thou saidest vnto thy seruants, Bring him vnto me, that I may set mine eye vpo him.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And we answered my lord, The childe can not depart from his father: for if he leaue his father, his father would die.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then saydest thou vnto thy seruants, Except your yonger brother come downe with you, looke in my face no more.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So when we came vnto thy seruant our father, and shewed him what my lord had sayd,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And our father sayde vnto vs, Goe againe, bye vs a litle foode,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then we answered, We can not go downe: but if our yongest brother go with vs, then will we go downe: for we may not see the mans face, except our yongest brother be with vs.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then thy seruant my father sayde vnto vs, Ye knowe that my wife bare me two sonnes,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the one went out from me, and I said, Of a suretie he is torne in pieces, and I sawe him not since.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Nowe yee take this also away from me: if death take him, then yee shall bring my graye head in sorowe to the graue.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Nowe therefore, when I come to thy seruant my father, & the childe be not with vs (seeing that his life dependeth on the childes life)

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then when hee shall see that the childe is not come, he will die: so shall thy seruants bring the graye head of thy seruant our father with sorowe to the graue.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Doubtlesse thy seruant became suertie for the childe to my father, and said, If I bring him not vnto thee againe, then I will beare the blame vnto my father for euer.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Nowe therefore, I pray thee, let me thy seruant bide for the childe, as a seruant to my Lord, and let the childe go vp with his brethren.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: For howe can I go vp to my father, if the childe be not with me, vnlesse I woulde see the euil that shall come on my father?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Ioseph coulde not refraine him selfe before all that stoode by him, but hee cryed, Haue forth euery man from me; there taryed not one with him, while Ioseph vttered himselfe vnto his brethren.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And hee wept & cried, so that the Egyptians heard: the house of Pharaoh heard also.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Ioseph sayde to his brethren, I am Ioseph: doeth my father yet liue? But his brethren coulde not answere him, for they were astonished at his presence.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Againe, Ioseph sayde to his brethren, Come neere, I pray you, to mee; they came neere; he sayde, I am Ioseph your brother, whom ye sold into Egypt.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Nowe therefore be not sad, neither grieued with your selues, that ye sold me hither: for God did send me before you for your preseruation.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: For nowe two yeeres of famine haue bene through ye land, and fiue yeeres are behind, wherein neither shalbe earing nor haruest.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Wherefore God sent me before you to preserue your posteritie in this land, & to saue you aliue by a great deliuerance.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Now the you sent not me hither, but God, who hath made mee a father vnto Pharaoh, and lorde of all his house, and ruler throughout all the land of Egypt.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Haste you & go vp to my father, & tel him, Thus saieth thy sonne Ioseph, God hath made me lord of all Egypt: come downe to me, tary not.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And thou shalt dwel in ye land of Goshen, and shalt be neere me, thou and thy children, and thy childrens children, and thy sheepe, and thy beastes, and all that thou hast.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Also I will nourish thee there (for yet remaine fiue yeeres of famine) lest thou perish through pouertie, thou and thy houshold, and all that thou hast.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And behold, your eyes doe see, and the eyes of my brother Beniamin, that my mouth speaketh to you.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Therefore tel my father of al mine honour in Egypt, and of all that ye haue seene, and make haste, and bring my father hither.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then hee fell on his brother Beniamins necke, & wept, and Beniamin wept on his necke.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Moreouer, he kissed all his brethren, and wept vpon them: and afterwarde his brethren talked with him.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the tidinges came vnto Pharaohs house, so that they said, Iosephs brethre are come: and it pleased Pharaoh well, and his seruants.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Pharaoh said vnto Ioseph, Say to thy brethren, This doe ye, lade your beastes & depart, go to the land of Canaan,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And take your father, and your houshoulds, and come to me, and I wil giue you the best of the land of Egypt, and ye shall eate of the fat of the land.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And I commaunde thee, Thus doe ye, take you charets out of the lande of Egypt for your children, and for your wiues, and bring your father and come.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Also regarde not your stuffe: for the best of all the land of Egypt is yours.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the children of Israel did so: & Ioseph gaue them charets according to the commandement of Pharaoh: hee gaue them vitaile also for the iourney.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: He gaue them all, none except, change of raiment: but vnto Beniamin he gaue three hundreth pieces of siluer, and fiue sutes of raiment.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And vnto his father likewise hee sent ten hee asses laden with the best things of Egypt, and ten shee asses laden with wheate, and bread and meate for his father by the way.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So sent he his brethren away, and they departed: and he sayde vnto them, Fall not out by the way.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then they went vp from Egypt, and came vnto the land of Canaan vnto Iaakob their father,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And tolde him, saying, Ioseph is yet aliue, and he also is gouernour ouer all the lande of Egypt, and Iaakobs heart failed: for he beleeued them not.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And they told him al the words of Ioseph, which he had said vnto the: but when he saw the charets, which Ioseph had sent to cary him, then the spirit of Iaakob their father reuiued.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Israel sayde, I haue inough: Ioseph my sonne is yet aliue: I wil go and see him yer I die.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Israel tooke his iourney with all that he had, and came to Beer-sheba, and offered sacrifice vnto the God of his father Izhak.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And God spake vnto Israel in a vision by night, saying, Iaakob, Iaakob. Who answered, I am here.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then hee sayde, I am God, the God of thy father, feare not to goe downe into Egypt: for I will there make of thee a great nation.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: I wil go downe with thee into Egypt, and I will also bring thee vp againe, and Ioseph shal put his hand vpon thine eyes.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Iaakob rose vp from Beer-sheba: and the sonnes of Israel caried Iaakob their father, & their children, & their wiues in the charets, which Pharaoh had sent to cary him.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And they tooke their cattell & their goods, which they had gotten in the lande of Canaan, and came into Egypt, both Iaakob and all his seede with him,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: His sonnes and his sonnes sonnes with him, his daughters and his sonnes daughters, and al his seede brought he with him into Egypt.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And these are the names of the children of Israel, which came into Egypt, euen Iaakob and his sonnes: Reuben, Iaakobs first borne.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the sonnes of Reuben: Hanoch, and Phallu, and Hezron, and Carmi.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the sonnes of Simeon: Iemuel, & Iamin, and Ohad, and Iachin, and Zohar; & Shaul the sonne of a Canaanitish woman.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Also the sonnes of Leui: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Also the sonnes of Iudah: Er, & Onan, and Shelah, and Pharez, and Zerah: (but Er and Onan died in ye land of Canaan) And the sonnes of Pharez were Hezron and Hamul.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Also the sonnes of Issachar: Tola, and Phuuah, and Iob, and Shimron.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Also the sonnes of Zebulun: Sered, and Elon, and Iahleel.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: These bee the sonnes of Leah, which shee bare vnto Iaakob in Padan Aram, with his daughter Dinah. All the soules of his sonnes & his daughters were thirtie and three.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Also the sonnes of Gad: Ziphion, & Haggi, Shuni, and Ezbon, Eri, and Arodi, and Areli.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Also the sonnes of Asher: Iimnah, and Ishuah, and Isui, and Beriah, and Serah their sister; the sonnes of Beriah: Heber, and Malchiel.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: These are the children of Zilpah, whome Laban gaue to Leah his daughter: and these shee bare vnto Iaakob, euen sixtene soules.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: The sonnes of Rahel Iaakobs wife were Ioseph and Beniamin.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And vnto Ioseph in the lande of Egypt were borne Manasseh, and Ephraim, which Asenath the daughter of Poti-pherah prince of On bare vnto him.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Also the sonnes of Beniamin: Belah, & Becher, and Ashbel, Gera, and Naaman, Ehi, and Rosh, Muppim, and Huppim, and Ard.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: These are the sonnes of Rahel, which were borne vnto Iaakob, fourteene soules in all.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Also the sonnes of Dan: Hushim.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Also the sonnes of Naphtali: Iahzeel, & Guni, and Iezer, and Shillem.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: These are the sonnes of Bilhah, which Laban gaue vnto Rahel his daughter, and shee bare these to Iaakob, in all, seuen soules.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Al the soules, that came with Iaakob into Egypt, which came out of his loynes (beside Iaakobs sonnes wiues) were in the whole, three score and sixe soules.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Also the sonnes of Ioseph, which were borne him in Egypt, were two soules: so that al the soules of the house of Iaakob, which came into Egypt, are seuentie.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: The he sent Iudah before him vnto Ioseph, to direct his way vnto Goshen, and they came into the land of Goshen.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Ioseph made ready his charet and went vp to Goshen to meete Israel his father, and presented himselfe vnto him and fel on his necke, and wept vpon his necke a good while.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Israel sayde vnto Ioseph, Now let me die, since I haue seene thy face, and that thou art yet aliue.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Ioseph said to his brethren, & to his fathers house, I wil go vp and shew Pharaoh, and tell him, My brethren & my fathers house, which were in the land of Canaan, are come vnto me,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the men are shepheardes, & because they are shepheardes, they haue brought their sheepe and their cattell, and all that they haue.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And if Pharaoh call you, and aske you, What is your trade?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then ye shal say, Thy seruants are men occupied about cattell, from our childehoode euen vnto this time, both we and our fathers: that yee may dwell in the lande of Goshen: for euery sheepe keeper is an abomination vnto the Egyptians.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then came Ioseph and tolde Pharaoh, and sayde, My father, and my brethren, and their sheepe, and their cattell, and all that they haue, are come out of the land of Canaan, and behold, they are in the land of Goshen.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Ioseph tooke part of his brethren, euen fiue men, and presented them vnto Pharaoh.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Pharaoh said vnto his brethren, What is your trade? And they answered Pharaoh, Thy seruants are shepheards, both we and our fathers.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: They sayde moreouer vnto Pharaoh, For to soiourne in ye lande are we come: for thy seruants haue no pasture for their sheepe, so sore is ye famine in the lande of Canaan. Nowe therefore, we pray thee, let thy seruants dwel in the land of Goshen.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then spake Pharaoh to Ioseph, saying, Thy father and thy brethren are come vnto thee.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: The lande of Egypt is before thee: in the best place of the land make thy father & thy brethren dwel: let the dwel in the land of Goshen: & if thou knowest that there be men of actiuitie among them, make them rulers ouer my cattell.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Ioseph also brought Iaakob his father, and set him before Pharaoh; Iaakob saluted Pharaoh.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Pharaoh sayde vnto Iaakob, Howe olde art thou?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Iaakob sayd vnto Pharaoh, The whole time of my pilgrimage is an hundreth & thirty yeeres: fewe and euill haue the dayes of my life bene, and I haue not attayned vnto the yeeres of the life of my fathers, in the dayes of their pilgrimages.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Iaakob tooke leaue of Pharaoh, & departed from the presence of Pharaoh.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Ioseph placed his father, and his brethren, and gaue them possession in the lande of Egypt, in the best of the land, euen in the lande of Rameses, as Pharaoh had commanded.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Ioseph nourished his father, and his brethren, and all his fathers houshold with bread, euen to the yong children.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Now there was no bread in all the land: for the famine was exceeding sore: so that the land of Egypt, and the land of Canaan were famished by reason of the famine.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Ioseph gathered all the money, that was found in the land of Egypt, & in the land of Canaan, for the corne which they bought, & Ioseph layd vp the money in Pharaohs house.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So when money fayled in the lande of Egypt, and in the lande of Canaan, then all the Egyptians came vnto Ioseph, and sayde, Giue vs bread: for why should we dye before thee? for our money is spent.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then saide Ioseph, Bring your cattell, and I will giue you for your cattell, if your money be spent.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So they brought their cattell vnto Ioseph, and Ioseph gaue them bread for the horses, & for the flockes of sheepe, and for the heards of cattel, and for the asses: so he fed them with bread for all their cattell that yeere.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But when the yeere was ended, they came vnto him the next yeere, and sayd vnto him, We will not hide from my lord, that since our money is spent, and my lord hath the heards of the cattel, there is nothing left in the sight of my lorde, but our bodies and our ground.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Why shall we perish in thy sight, both we, and our land? bye vs and our land for bread, and we and our land will be bonde to Pharaoh: therefore giue vs seede, that we may liue and not dye, and that the land go not to waste.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So Ioseph bought all the lande of Egypt for Pharaoh: for the Egyptians solde euery man his ground because the famine was sore vpon the: so the land became Pharaohs.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And he remoued the people vnto the cities, from one side of Egypt euen to the other.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Onely the lande of the Priestes bought he not: for the Priestes had an ordinarie of Pharaoh, and they did eate their ordinarie, which Pharaoh gaue them: wherefore they solde not their grounde.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Ioseph sayd vnto the people, Behold, I haue bought you this daye, and your lande for Pharaoh: lo, here is seede for you: sowe therefore the grounde.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And of the encrease ye shall giue the fifth part vnto Pharaoh, and foure partes shalbe yours for the seede of the fielde, and for your meate, and for them of your housholdes, and for your children to eate.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then they answered, Thou hast saued our liues: let vs finde grace in the sight of my Lorde, and we will be Pharaohs seruants.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Ioseph made it a lawe ouer the land of Egypt vnto this day, that Pharaoh should haue the fift part, except the land of the priests only, which was not Pharaohs.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Israel dwelt in the lande of Egypt, in the countrey of Goshen: and they had their possessions therein, and grewe and multiplied exceedingly.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Moreouer, Iaakob liued in the lande of Egypt seuenteene yeeres, so that the whole age of Iaakob was an hundreth fourtie and seuen yeere.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Now when the time drewe neere that Israel must dye, he called his sonne Ioseph, and sayde vnto him, If I haue nowe founde grace in thy sight, put thine hand nowe vnder my thigh, and deale mercifully & truely with me: burie me not, I pray thee, in Egypt.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But when I shall sleepe with my fathers, thou shalt carry me out of Egypt, and bury mee in their buryall; he answered, I will doe as thou hast sayde.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: The he said, Sweare vnto me; he sware vnto him; Israel worshipped towardes the beds head.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Againe after this, one sayd to Ioseph, Loe, thy father is sicke: then hee tooke with him his two sonnes, Manasseh and Ephraim.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Also one told Iaakob, and said, Behold, thy sonne Ioseph is come to thee, and Israel tooke his strength vnto him and sate vpon the bed.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Iaakob sayde vnto Ioseph, God almightie appeared vnto me at Luz in the land of Canaan, and blessed me.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And he sayde vnto me, Behold, I wil make thee fruitefull, and will multiplie thee, and will make a great number of people of thee, and will giue this lande vnto thy seede after thee for an euerlasting possession.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And now thy two sonnes, Manasseh & Ephraim, which are borne vnto thee in the lande of Egypt, before I came to thee into Egypt, shall be mine, as Reuben and Simeon are mine.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But the linage, which thou hast begotten after them, shalbe thine: they shall be called after the names of their brethren in their inheritance.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Nowe when I came from Padan, Rahel died vpon mine hande in the lande of Canaan, by the way when there was but halfe a dayes iourney of grounde to come to Ephrath: and I buryed her there in the way to Ephrath: the same is Beth-lehem.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Israel beheld Iosephs sonnes & sayd, Whose are these?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Ioseph sayd vnto his father, They are my sonnes, which God hath giuen mee here. Then he sayd, I pray thee, bring them to me, that I may blesse them:

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: (For the eyes of Israel were dimme for age, so that hee coulde not well see) Then he caused them to come to him, & he kissed them and embraced them.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Israel sayde vnto Ioseph, I had not thought to haue seene thy face: yet lo, God hath shewed me also thy seede.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Ioseph tooke them away from his knees, & did reuerence downe to the ground.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then tooke Ioseph them both, Ephraim in his right hand towarde Israels left hand, and Manasseh in his left hand toward Israels right hand, so he brought them vnto him.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But Israel stretched out his right hand, and layde it on Ephraims head, which was the yonger, and his left hande vpon Manassehs head (directing his handes of purpose) for Manasseh was the elder.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Also he blessed Ioseph and sayde, The God, before whom my fathers Abraham and Izhak did walke, the God, which hath fed me al my life long vnto this day, blesse thee.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: The Angel, which hath deliuered me from all euill, blesse the children, and let my name be named vpon them, and the name of my fathers Abraham and Izhak, that they may growe as fish into a multitude in the middes of the earth.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But when Ioseph sawe that his father layde his right hande vpon the head of Ephraim, it displeased him: and he stayed his fathers hand to remooue it from Ephraims head to Manassehs head.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Ioseph sayde vnto his father, Not so, my father, for this is the eldest: put thy right hand vpon his head.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But his father refused, & sayd, I know well, my sonne, I know well: he shalbe also a people, and he shalbe great likewise: but his yonger brother shalbe greater then he, and his seede shall be full of nations.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So he blessed them that day, and sayde, In thee Israel shall blesse, and say, God make thee as Ephraim and as Manasseh; he set Ephraim before Manasseh.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Israel said vnto Ioseph, Behold, I die, and God shall be with you, and bring you againe vnto the land of your fathers.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Moreouer, I haue giuen vnto thee one portion aboue thy brethren, which I gate out of the hand of the Amorite by my sworde and by my bowe.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Iaakob called his sonnes, and sayde, Gather your selues together, that I may tell you what shal come to you in the last dayes.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Gather your selues together, and heare, ye sonnes of Iaakob, and hearken vnto Israel your father.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Reuben mine eldest sonne, thou art my might, and the beginning of my strength, the excellencie of dignitie, and the excellencie of power:

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Thou wast light as water: thou shalt not be excellent, because thou wentest vp to thy fathers bed: then diddest thou defile my bed, thy dignitie is gone.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Simeon and Leui, brethren in euill, the instruments of crueltie are in their habitations.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Into their secret let not my soule come: my glory, be not thou ioyned with their assembly: for in their wrath they slew a man, and in their selfe will they digged downe a wall.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Cursed be their wrath, for it was fierce, and their rage, for it was cruell: I will deuide them in Iaakob, and scatter them in Israel.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Thou Iudah, thy brethre shal praise thee: thine hande shalbe in the necke of thine enemies: thy fathers sonnes shal bowe downe vnto thee.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Iudah, as a Lions whelpe shalt thou come vp from the spoyle, my sonne. He shall lye downe and couche as a Lion, and as a Lionesse: Who shall stirre him vp?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: The scepter shall not depart from Iudah, nor a Lawegiuer from betweene his feete, vntill Shiloh come, and the people shall be gathered vnto him.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: He shall binde his Asse foale vnto ye vine, and his Asses colte vnto the best vine. hee shall wash his garment in wine, and his cloke in the blood of grapes.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: His eyes shalbe red with wine, and his teeth white with milke.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Zebulun shall dwell by the sea side, and he shalbe an hauen for shippes: and his border shalbe vnto Zidon.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Issachar shalbe a strong asse, couching downe betweene two burdens:

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And he shall see that rest is good, and that the land is pleasant, and he shall bow his shoulder to beare, and shalbe subiect vnto tribute.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Dan shal iudge his people as one of the tribes of Israel.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Dan shall be a serpent by the way, an adder by the path, byting the horse heeles, so that his rider shall fall backward.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: O Lord, I haue waited for thy saluation.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Gad, an hoste of men shal ouercome him, but he shal ouercome at the last.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Concerning Asher, his bread shalbe fat, and he shal giue pleasures for a king.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Naphtali shalbe a hinde let goe, giuing goodly wordes.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Ioseph shalbe a fruitefull bough, euen a fruitful bough by the well side: the smal boughs shall runne vpon the wall.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And the archers grieued him, and shotte against him and hated him.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: But his bowe abode strong, and the hands of his armes were strengthened, by the handes of the mighty God of Iaakob, of whom was the feeder appointed, by the stone of Israel,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Euen by the God of thy father, who shall helpe thee, and by the almightie, who shall blesse thee with heauenly blessinges from aboue, with blessings of the deepe, that lyeth beneath, with blessings of the brestes, and of the wombe.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: The blessings of thy father shalbe stronger then the blessings of mine elders: vnto the ende of the hilles of the worlde they shall be on the head of Ioseph, and on the top of the head of him that was separate from his brethren.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Beniamin shall rauine as a wolfe: in the morning he shall deuoure the pray, and at night he shal deuide the spoyle.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: All these are the twelue tribes of Israel, and thus their father spake vnto them, and blessed them: euery one of them blessed hee with a seuerall blessing.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And he charged them & sayd vnto them, I am ready to be gathered vnto my people: burie mee with my fathers in the caue, that is in the fielde of Ephron the Hittite,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: In the caue that is in the field of Machpelah besides Mamre in the land of Canaan: which caue Abraham bought with the fielde of Ephron the Hittite for a possession to burie in.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: There they buried Abraham and Sarah his wife: there they buryed Izhak and Rebekah his wife: and there I buried Leah.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: The purchase of the fielde and the caue that is therein, was bought of the children of Heth.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Thus Iaakob made an end of giuing charge to his sonnes, and plucked vp his feete into the bed and gaue vp the ghost, and was gathered to his people.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Ioseph fell vpon his fathers face and wept vpon him, and kissed him.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Ioseph commaunded his seruantes the physicions, to enbaume his father, and the physicions enbaumed Israel.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So fourtie dayes were accomplished (for so long did the dayes of them that were enbaumed last) and the Egyptians bewayled him seuentie dayes.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And when the dayes of his mourning were past, Ioseph spake to the house of Pharaoh, saying, If I haue nowe found fauour in your eyes, speake, I pray you, in the eares of Pharaoh, and say,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: My father made me sweare, saying, Loe, I die, bury me in my graue, which I haue made me in the land of Canaan: now therefore let me go, I pray thee, & bury my father, & I wil come againe.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Pharaoh said, Goe vp and bury thy father, as he made thee to sweare.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So Ioseph went vp to bury his father, and with him went all the seruants of Pharaoh, both the elders of his house, and all the elders of the land of Egypt.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Likewise all the house of Ioseph, and his brethren, and his fathers house: onely their children, and their sheepe, and their cattell left they in the land of Goshen.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And there went vp with him both charets and horsemen: and they were an exceeding great company.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And they came to Goren Atad, which is beyond Iorden, and there they made a great and exceeding sore lamentation: and he mourned for his father seuen dayes.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And when the Canaanites the inhabitants of the lande sawe the mourning in Goren Atad, they sayde, This is a great mourning vnto the Egyptians: wherefore the name thereof was called Abel Mizraim, which is beyond Iorden.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So his sonnes did vnto him, according as he had commanded them:

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: For his sonnes caried him into the lande of Canaan, & buried him in the caue of the fielde of Machpelah, which caue Abraham bought with the fielde, to be a place to bury in, of Ephron the Hittite besides Mamre.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Then Ioseph returned into Egypt, he and his brethren, and al that went vp with him to bury his father, after that he had buried his father.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And when Iosephs brethren saw that their father was dead, they sayde, It may be that Ioseph will hate vs, and will pay vs againe all the euill, which we did vnto him.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Therefore they sent vnto Ioseph, saying, Thy father commanded before his death, saying,

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Thus shal ye say vnto Ioseph, Forgiue now, I pray thee, the trespasse of thy brethren, and their sinne: for they rewarded thee euil; nowe, we pray thee, forgiue the trespasse of the seruants of thy fathers God; Ioseph wept, when they spake vnto him.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Also his brethren came vnto him, and fell downe before his face, and sayde, Beholde, we be thy seruants.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: To whome Ioseph sayde, Feare not: for am not I vnder God?

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: When ye thought euill against mee, God disposed it to good, that he might bring to passe, as it is this day, and saue much people aliue.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: Feare not nowe therefore, I will nourish you, and your children: and hee comforted them, and spake kindly vnto them.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So Ioseph dwelt in Egypt, he, and his fathers house: and Ioseph liued an hundreth and tenne yeere.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Ioseph saw Ephraims children, euen vnto the third generation: also the sonnes of Machir the sonne of Manasseh were brought vp on Iosephs knees.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Ioseph sayd vnto his brethren, I am ready to dye, and God will surely visite you, and bring you out of this land, vnto ye land which hee sware vnto Abraha, vnto Izhak, and vnto Iaakob.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: And Ioseph tooke an oth of the children of Israel, saying, God will surely visite you, and ye shall cary my bones hence.

Book.Name: Genesis
Text: So Ioseph died, when he was an hundreth and ten yere olde: and they enbaumed him & put him in a chest in Egypt.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Nowe these are the names of the children of Israel, which came into Egypt (euery man and his housholde came thither with Iaakob)

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Reuben, Simeon, Leui, and Iudah,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Issachar, Zebulun, and Beniamin,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Dan, and Naphtali, Gad, and Asher.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: So al the soules, that came out of the loines of Iaakob, were seuentie soules: Ioseph was in Egypt already.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Nowe Ioseph died and all his brethren, and that whole generation.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the children of Israel brought foorth fruite and encreased in aboundance, and were multiplied, and were exceeding mightie, so that the land was full of them.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then there rose vp a newe King in Egypt, who knewe not Ioseph.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And he sayde vnto his people, Beholde, the people of the children of Israel are greater and mightier then we.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Come, let vs worke wisely with them, least they multiplie, and it come to passe, that if there be warre, they ioyne them selues also vnto our enemies, and fight against vs, and get them out of the land.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Therefore did they set taskemasters ouer them, to keepe the vnder with burdens: and they built the cities Pithom and Raamses for the treasures of Pharaoh.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: But the more they vexed them, the more they multiplied and grewe: therefore they were more grieued against the children of Israel.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Wherefore the Egyptians by crueltie caused the children of Israel to serue.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Thus they made them weary of their liues by sore labour in clay & in bricke, & in al worke in the fielde, with all maner of bondage, which they layde vpon them most cruelly.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Moreouer the King of Egypt commanded ye midwiues of the Ebrewe women, (of which the ones name was Shiphrah, and the name of the other Puah)

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And sayde, When ye doe the office of a midwife to the women of the Ebrewes, and see them on their stooles, if it be a sonne, then yee shall kill him: but if it be a daughter, then let her liue.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Notwithstanding ye midwiues feared God, and did not as the King of Egypt commaunded them, but preserued aliue the men children.
