Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then the King of Egypt called for the midwiues, and sayde vnto them, Why haue yee done thus, and haue preserued aliue the men children?

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the midwiues answered Pharaoh, Because the Ebrewe women are not as the women of Egypt: for they are liuely, and are deliuered yer the midwife come at them.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: God therefore prospered the midwiues, and the people multiplied and were very mightie.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And because ye midwiues feared God, therefore he made them houses.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then Pharaoh charged all his people, saying, Euery man childe that is borne, cast yee into the riuer, but reserue euery maide childe aliue.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then there went a man of the house of Leui, and tooke to wife a daughter of Leui,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the woman coceiued and bare a sonne: and when she saw that he was faire, she hid him three moneths.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: But when she could no longer hide him, she tooke for him an arke made of reede, and daubed it with slime and with pitch, and laide the childe therein, and put it among the bulrushes by the riuers brinke.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Now his sister stood a farre off, to wit what would come of him.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then ye daughter of Pharaoh came downe to wash her in the riuer, and her maidens walked by the riuers side: and when shee sawe the arke among the bulrushes, she sent her maide to fet it.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then she opened it, and sawe it was a childe: and beholde, the babe wept: so she had compassion on it, and sayde, This is one of the Ebrewes children.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then said his sister vnto Pharaohs daughter, Shall I go and cal vnto thee a nurce of the Ebrew women to nurce thee the childe?

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And Pharaohs daughter sayde to her, Goe. So the maide went and called the childes mother,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: To whome Pharaohs daughter sayde, Take this childe away, and nurce it for me, and I wil reward thee. Then the woman tooke the childe and nurced him.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Nowe the childe grewe, and she brought him vnto Pharaohs daughter, and he was as her sonne, and she called his name Moses, because, said she, I drewe him out of the water.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And in those dayes, when Moses was growen, he went forth vnto his brethren, & looked on their burdens: also he sawe an Egyptian smiting an Ebrewe one of his brethren.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And he looked rounde about, and when he sawe no man, hee slewe the Egyptian, and hid him in the sande.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Againe he came forth the second day, and behold, two Ebrewes stroue: and he said vnto him that did the wrong, Wherefore smitest thou thy fellowe?

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And hee answered, Who made thee a man of authoritie, and a iudge ouer vs? Thinkest thou to kill mee, as thou killedst the Egyptian? Then Moses feared and sayde, Certainly this thing is knowen.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Now Pharaoh heard this matter, & sought to slay Moses: therefore Moses fled from Pharaoh, and dwelt in the lande of Midian, and hee sate downe by a well.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the Priest of Midian had seue daughters, which came and drewe water, and filled the troghes, for to water their fathers sheepe.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then the shepherds came and droue them away: but Moses rose vp and defended them, and watered their sheepe.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And whe they came to Reuel their father, he said, Howe are ye come so soone to day?

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And they saide, A man of Egypt deliuered vs from the hand of the shepherdes, and also drew vs water ynough, and watered the sheepe.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then he saide vnto his daughters, And where is he? why haue ye so left the man? call him that he may eate bread.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And Moses agreed to dwell with the man: who gaue vnto Moses Zipporah his daughter:

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And she bare a sonne, whose name he called Gershom: for he said, I haue bene a stranger in a strange lande.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then in processe of time, the King of Egypt dyed, and the children of Israel sighed for the bondage and cryed: and their crie for the bondage came vp vnto God.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then God heard their mone, and God remembred his couenant with Abraham, Izhak, and Iaakob.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: So God looked vpon the children of Israel, and God had respect vnto them.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: When Moses kept the sheepe of Iethro his father in lawe, Priest of Midian, & droue the flocke to the backe side of the desert, and came to the Mountaine of God, Horeb,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then the Angel of the Lord appeared vnto him in a flame of fire, out of the middes of a bush: and he looked, and behold, the bush burned with fire, and the bush was not consumed.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Therefore Moses saide, I will turne aside nowe, and see this great sight, why the bush burneth not.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And when the Lord sawe that he turned aside to see, God called vnto him out of the middes of the bush, and said, Moses, Moses; he answered, I am here.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then he saide, Come not hither, put thy shooes off thy feete: for the place whereon thou standest is holy ground.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Moreouer he saide, I am the God of thy father, the God of Abraham, the God of Izhak, and the God of Iaakob. Then Moses hid his face: for he was afraid to looke vpon God.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then the Lorde said, I haue surely seene the trouble of my people, which are in Egypt, and haue heard their crie, because of their taskemasters: for I knowe their sorowes.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Therefore I am come downe to deliuer them out of the hande of the Egyptians, and to bring them out of that lande into a good lande and a large, into a lande that floweth with milke and honie, euen into the place of the Canaanites, and the Hittites, and the Amorites, and the Perizzites, and the Hiuites, and the Iebusites.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And now lo, the crie of the children of Israel is come vnto me, & I haue also seene ye oppression, wherewith the Egyptians oppresse them.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Come now therefore, and I will send thee vnto Pharaoh, that thou maiest bring my people the children of Israel out of Egypt.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: But Moses said vnto God, Who am I, that I should go vnto Pharaoh, and that I should bring the children of Israel out of Egypt?

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And he answered, Certainely I will be with thee: and this shall be a token vnto thee, that I haue sent thee, After that thou hast brought the people out of Egypt, ye shall serue God vpon this Mountaine.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then Moses said vnto God, Behold, when I shall come vnto the children of Israel, and shall say vnto them, The God of your fathers hath sent me vnto you: if they say vnto me, What is his Name? What shall I say vnto them?

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And God answered Moses, I Am That I Am. Also he said, Thus shalt thou say vnto the children of Israel, I Am hath sent me vnto you.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And God spake further vnto Moses, Thus shalt thou say vnto the children of Israel, The Lorde God of your fathers, the God of Abraham, the God of Izhak, and the God of Iaakob hath sent me vnto you: this is my Name for euer, and this is my memoriall vnto all ages.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Go & gather the Elders of Israel together, & thou shalt say vnto the, The Lord God of your fathers, the God of Abraham, Izhak, & Iaakob appeared vnto me, & said, I haue surely remembred you, & that which is done to you in Egypt.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Therefore I did say, I wil bring you out of the affliction of Egypt vnto the land of the Canaanites, and the Hittites, and the Amorites, and the Perizzites, and the Hiuites, and the Iebusites, vnto a lande that floweth with milke and honie.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then shall they obey thy voyce, and thou and the Elders of Israel shall go vnto the King of Egypt, and say vnto him, The Lorde God of the Ebrewes hath met with vs: we pray thee nowe therefore, let vs goe three dayes iourney in the wildernesse, that we may sacrifice vnto the Lord our God.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: But I know, that the King of Egypt wil not let you goe, but by strong hande.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Therefore will I stretch out mine hande and smite Egypt with all my wonders, which I will doe in the middes thereof: and after that shall he let you goe.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And I will make this people to be fauoured of the Egyptians: so that when ye go, ye shal not goe emptie.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: For euery woman shall aske of her neighbour, and of her that soiourneth in her house, iewels of siluer and iewels of gold and raiment, and ye shall put them on your sonnes, and on your daughters, and shall spoyle the Egyptians.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then Moses answered, and said, But lo, they will not beleeue me, nor hearken vnto my voyce: for they will say, The Lorde hath not appeared vnto thee.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the Lord said vnto him, What is that in thine hande? And he answered, A rod.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then said he, Cast it on the ground. So he cast it on the grounde, and it was turned into a serpent: and Moses fled from it.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Againe the Lorde saide vnto Moses, Put foorth thine hand, and take it by the tayle. Then he put foorth his hande and caught it, and it was turned into a rod in his hand.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Do this that they may beleeue, that the Lorde God of their fathers, the God of Abraha, the God of Izhak, and the God of Iaakob hath appeared vnto thee.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the Lorde saide furthermore vnto him, Thrust nowe thine hand into thy bosome; he thrust his hand into his bosome, & when he tooke it out againe, behold, his hand was leprous as snowe.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Moreouer he said, Put thine hand into thy bosome againe. So he put his hande into his bosome againe, & pluckt it out of his bosome, and behold, it was turned againe as his other flesh.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: So shall it be, if they wil not beleeue thee, neither obey the voyce of ye first signe, yet shall they beleeue for the voyce of the seconde signe.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: But if they will not yet beleeue these two signes, neither obey vnto thy voyce, then shalt thou take of the water of the riuer, and powre it vpon the drie lande: so the water which thou shalt take out of the riuer, shalbe turned to blood vpon the drie land.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: But Moses said vnto the Lorde, Oh my Lorde, I am not eloquent, neither at any time haue bene, nor yet since thou hast spoken vnto thy seruant: but I am slowe of speach & slowe of tongue.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then the Lorde said vnto him, Who hath giuen the mouth to man? or who hath made the domme, or the deafe, or him that seeth, or the blinde? haue not I the Lorde?

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Therefore goe nowe, and I will be with thy mouth, and will teach thee what thou shalt say.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: But he saide, Oh my Lorde, sende, I pray thee, by the hande of him, whome thou shouldest sende.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then the Lorde was verie angrie with Moses, and said, Doe not I know Aaron thy brother the Leuite, that he himselfe shall speake? for loe, he commeth also foorth to meete thee, and when he seeth thee, he will be glad in his heart.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Therefore thou shalt speake vnto him, and put the wordes in his mouth, and I will be with thy mouth, and with his mouth, and will teach you what ye ought to doe.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And he shall be thy spokesman vnto the people: and he shall be, euen he shall be as thy mouth, and thou shalt be to him as God.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Moreouer thou shalt take this rod in thine hand, wherewith thou shalt do miracles.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Therefore Moses went and returned to Iethro his father in lawe, & said vnto him, I pray thee, let me goe, and returne to my brethren, which are in Egypt, and see whether they be yet aliue. Then Iethro said to Moses, Go in peace.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: (For the Lord had said vnto Moses in Midian, Goe, returne to Egypt: for they are all dead which went about to kill thee)

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then Moses tooke his wife, & his sonnes, and put them on an asse, and returned towarde the lande of Egypt, and Moses tooke the rod of God in his hand.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the Lorde saide vnto Moses, When thou art entred and come into Egypt againe, see that thou doe all the wonders before Pharaoh, which I haue put in thine hand: but I will harden his heart, and he shall not let the people goe.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then thou shalt say to Pharaoh, Thus saith the Lorde, Israel is my sonne, euen my first borne.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Wherefore I say to thee, Let my sonne go, that he may serue me: if thou refuse to let him goe, beholde, I will slay thy sonne, euen thy first borne.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And as he was by the waye in the ynne, the Lord met him, and would haue killed him.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then Zipporah tooke a sharpe knife, and cut away the foreskinne of her sonne, and cast it at his feete, and said, Thou art indeede a bloody husband vnto me.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: So he departed from him. Then she saide, O bloodie husbande (because of the circumcision)

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then the Lorde saide vnto Aaron, Goe meete Moses in the wildernesse; he went and mette him in the Mount of God, and kissed him.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then Moses tolde Aaron all the wordes of the Lord, who had sent him, and all the signes wherewith he had charged him.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: So went Moses and Aaron, and gathered all the Elders of the children of Israel.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And Aaron told all the wordes, which the Lorde had spoken vnto Moses, and he did the miracles in the sight of the people,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the people beleeued, and when they heard that the Lorde had visited the children of Israel, and had looked vpon their tribulation, they bowed downe, and worshipped.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then afterwarde Moses and Aaron went and said to Pharaoh, Thus saith the Lorde God of Israel, Let my people go, that they may celebrate a feast vnto me in the wildernesse.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And Pharaoh saide, Who is the Lorde, that I should heare his voyce, & let Israel go? I knowe not the Lord, neither will I let Israel goe.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And they saide, We worship the God of the Ebrewes: we pray thee, let vs goe three daies iourney in the desert, and sacrifice vnto the Lord our God, least he bring vpon vs the pestilence or sword.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then saide the King of Egypt vnto them, Moses & Aaron, why cause ye the people to cease from their workes? get you to your burdens.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Pharaoh saide furthermore, Behold, much people is nowe in the lande, and ye make them leaue their burdens.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Therefore Pharaoh gaue commandement the same day vnto the taskemasters of the people, and to their officers, saying,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Ye shall giue the people no more strawe, to make bricke ( as in time past) but let them goe and gather them strawe them selues:

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Notwithstanding lay vpon them the nober of bricke, which they made in time past, diminish nothing thereof: for they be idle, therefore they crie, saying, Let vs go to offer sacrifice vnto our God.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Lay more worke vpon the men, & cause them to do it, & let the not regard vaine words.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then went the taskemasters of the people and their officers out, and tolde the people, saying, Thus saith Pharaoh, I will giue you no more strawe.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Goe your selues, get you strawe where yee can finde it, yet shall nothing of your labour bee diminished.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then were the people scattered abroade throughout all the land of Egypt, for to gather stubble in steade of strawe.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the taskmasters hasted them, saying, Finish your dayes worke euery dayes taske, as ye did when ye had strawe.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the officers of the children of Israel, which Pharaohs taskemasters had set ouer them, were beaten, and demanded, Wherefore haue ye not fulfilled your taske in making bricke yesterday and to daye, as in times past?

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then the officers of the children of Israel came, & cryed vnto Pharaoh, saying, Wherfore dealest thou thus with thy seruants?

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: There is no strawe giuen to thy seruantes, and they say vnto vs, Make bricke: and loe, thy seruants are beaten, and thy people is blamed.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: But he said, Ye are to much idle: therfore ye say, Let vs goe to offer sacrifice to the Lord.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Goe therefore nowe and worke: for there shall no strawe be giuen you, yet shall yee deliuer the whole tale of bricke.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then the officers of the children of Israel sawe them selues in an euill case, because it was saide, Ye shall diminish nothing of your bricke, nor of euery dayes taske.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And they met Moses and Aaron, which stood in their way as they came out fro Pharaoh,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: To whom they said, The Lord looke vpon you and iudge: for yee haue made our sauour to stinke before Pharaoh and before his seruants, in that ye haue put a sword in their hand to slay vs.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Wherefore Moses returned to the Lorde, and saide, Lorde, why hast thou afflicted this people? wherefore hast thou thus sent me?

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: For since I came to Pharaoh to speake in thy Name, he hath vexed this people, and yet thou hast not deliuered thy people.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then the Lord sayd vnto Moses, Nowe shalt thou see, what I will doe vnto Pharaoh: for by a strong hand shall he let them goe, and euen be constrained to driue them out of his land.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Moreouer God spake vnto Moses, and sayd vnto him, I am the Lord,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And I appeared vnto Abraha, to Izhak, & to Iaakob by the Name of Almightie God: but by my Name Iehouah was I not knowen vnto the.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Furthermore as I made my couenant with them to giue them ye land of Canaan, the land of their pilgrimage, wherein they were strangers:

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: So I haue also hearde the groning of the children of Israel, whom the Egyptians keepe in bondage, and haue remembred my couenant.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Wherefore say thou vnto the children of Israel, I am the Lord, and I will bring you out fro the burdens of the Egyptians, & will deliuer you out of their bondage, and will redeeme you in a stretched out arme, and in great iudgements.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also I will take you for my people, & will be your God: then ye shall knowe that I the Lord your God bring you out from the burdens of the Egyptians.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And I will bring you into the land which I sware that I woulde giue to Abraham, to Izhak, and to Iaakob, and I will giue it vnto you for a possession: I am the Lord.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: So Moses told the children of Israel thus: but they hearkened not vnto Moses, for anguish of spirit and for cruel bondage.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then the Lord spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Go speak to Pharaoh King of Egypt, that he let the children of Israel goe out of his land.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: But Moses spake before the Lorde, saying, Beholde, the children of Israel hearken not vnto me, howe then shall Pharaoh heare mee, which am of vncircumcised lippes?

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then the Lord spake vnto Moses & vnto Aaron, & charged them to goe to the children of Israel & to Pharaoh King of Egypt, to bring the children of Israel out of the lande of Egypt.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: These bee the heades of their fathers houses: the sonnes of Reuben the first borne of Israel are Hanoch and Pallu, Hezron and Carmi: these are ye families of Reuben.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also the sonnes of Simeon: Iemuel and Iamin, and Ohad, and Iachin, and Zoar, and Shaul the sonne of a Canaanitish woman: these are the families of Simeon.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: These also are the names of the sonnes of Leui in their generations: Gershon & Kohath and Merari (and the yeres of the life of Leui were an hundreth thirtie and seuen yere)

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: The sonnes of Gershon were Libni and Shimi by their families.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the sonnes of Kohath, Amram and Izhar, and Hebron, & Vzziel. (and Kohath liued an hundreth thirtie and three yeere)

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also the sonnes of Merari were Mahali & Mushi: these are ye families of Leui by their kinreds.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And Amram tooke Iochebed his fathers sister to his wife, and shee bare him Aaron and Moses (and Amram liued an hundreth thirtie and seuen yeere)

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also the sonnes of Izhar: Korah, and Nepheg, and Zichri.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the sonnes of Vzziel: Mishael, and Elzaphan, and Sithri.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And Aaron tooke Elisheba daughter of Amminadab, sister of Nahashon to his wife, which bare him Nadab, and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also the sonnes of Korah: Assir, and Elkanah, and Abiasaph: these are the families of the Korhites.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And Eleazar Aarons sonne tooke him one of the daughters of Putiel to his wife, which bare him Phinehas: these are the principall fathers of the Leuites throughout their families.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: These are Aaron and Moses to whom the Lord said, Bring the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt, according to their armies.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: These are that Moses and Aaron, which spake to Pharaoh King of Egypt, that they might bring the children of Israel out of Egypt.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And at that time when the Lorde spake vnto Moses in the land of Egypt,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: When the Lorde, I say, spake vnto Moses, saying, I am the Lord, speake thou vnto Pharaoh the King of Egypt all that I say vnto thee,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then Moses said before the Lord, Behold, I am of vncircumcised lippes, & how shall Pharaoh heare me?

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then the Lord saide to Moses, Behold, I haue made thee Pharaohs God, and Aaron thy brother shall be thy Prophet.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Thou shalt speake all that I commaunded thee: and Aaron thy brother shall speake vnto Pharaoh, that he suffer the children of Israel to go out of his land.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: But I will harden Pharaohs heart, and multiplie my miracles and my wonders in the lande of Egypt.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And Pharaoh shall not hearken vnto you, that I may lay mine hand vpon Egypt, and bring out myne armies, euen my people, the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt, by great iudgements.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then the Egyptians shall knowe that I am the Lord, when I stretch foorth mine hand vpon Egypt, and bring out the children of Israel from among them.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: So Moses and Aaron did as the Lord commanded them, euen so did they.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: (Nowe Moses was foure score yeere olde, and Aaron foure score and three, when they spake vnto Pharaoh)

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the Lorde had spoken vnto Moses and Aaron, saying,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: If Pharaoh speake vnto you, saying, Shewe a miracle for you, then thou shalt say vnto Aaron, Take thy rod, and cast it before Pharaoh, and it shalbe turned into a serpent.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then went Moses and Aaron vnto Pharaoh, and did euen as the Lord had commaunded: and Aaron cast forth his rod before Pharaoh and before his seruants, & it was turned into a serpent.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then Pharaoh called also for the wise men and sorcerers: and those charmers also of Egypt did in like maner with their enchantmens,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: For they cast downe euery man his rod, & they were turned into serpents: but Aarons rodde deuoured their rods.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: So Pharaohs heart was hardened, and hee hearkened not to them, as the Lorde had saide.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: The Lorde then saide vnto Moses, Pharaohs heart is obstinate, hee refuseth to let the people goe.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Goe vnto Pharaoh in the morning, (loe, he will come forth vnto the water) and thou shalt stand and meete him by the riuers brinke, and the rod, which was turned into a serpent, shalt thou take in thine hand.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And thou shalt say vnto him, The Lorde God of the Ebrewes hath sent me vnto thee, saying, Let my people goe, that they may serue mee in the wildernesse: and beholde, hitherto thou wouldest not heare.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Thus saith the Lorde, In this shalt thou know that I am the Lord: behold, I wil smite with the rodde that is in mine hand vpon the water that is in the riuer, and it shalbe turned to blood.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the fish that is in the riuer shall dye, and the riuer shall stinke, and it shall grieue the Egyptians to drinke of the water of the riuer.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: The Lord then spake to Moses, Say vnto Aaron, Take thy rod, and stretch out thine hand ouer the waters of Egypt, ouer their streames, ouer their riuers, & ouer their pondes,, and ouer all pooles of their waters, and they shalbe blood, and there shalbe blood throughout all the land of Egypt, both in vessels of wood, and of stone.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: So Moses and Aaron did euen as the Lord commaunded: and hee lift vp the rodde, and smote the water that was in the riuer in the sight of Pharaoh, and in the sight of his seruants: and all the water that was in the riuer, was turned into blood.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the fish that was in the ryuer dyed, & the riuer stanke: so that the Egyptians could not drinke of the water of the riuer: and there was blood throughout all the lande of Egypt.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the enchanters of Egypt did likewise with their sorceries: and the heart of Phraoh was hardened: so that he did not hearken vnto them, as the Lord had sayde.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then Pharaoh returned, and went againe into his house, neither did this yet enter into his heart.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: All the Egyptians then digged rounde about the riuer for waters to drinke: for they could not drinke of the water of the riuer.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And this continued fully seuen dayes after the Lord had smitten the riuer.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Afterward the Lorde sayde vnto Moses, Goe vnto Pharaoh, and tell him, Thus saith the Lorde, Let my people goe, that they may serue me:

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And if thou wilt not let them goe, beholde, I will smite all thy countrey with frogges:

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the riuer shal scral ful of frogges, which shall goe vp and come into thine house, and into thy chamber, where thou sleepest, and vpon thy bed, and into the house of thy seruants, and vpon thy people, and into thine ouens, and into thy kneading troughes.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Yea, the frogges shall climbe vp vpon thee, and on thy people, and vpon all thy seruants.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also the Lord said vnto Moses, Say thou vnto Aaron, Stretch out thine hande with thy rod vpon the streames, vpon the riuers, and vpon the ponds, and cause frogs to come vp vpon the land of Egypt.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then Aaron stretched out his hand vpon the waters of Egypt, and the frogges came vp, and couered the land of Egypt.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the sorcerers did likewise with their sorceries, and brought frogges vp vpon the land of Egypt.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then Pharaoh called for Moses and Aaron, and said, Pray ye vnto the Lord, that hee may take away the frogges from mee, and from my people, and I will let the people goe, that they may doe sacrifice vnto the Lord.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And Moses said vnto Pharaoh, Concerning me, euen command when I shall pray for thee, and for thy seruants, and for thy people, to destroy the frogges from thee and from thine houses, that they may remaine in the riuer only.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then he said, To morowe; he answered, Be it as thou hast said, that thou maiest know, that there is none like vnto the Lord our God.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: So the frogges shall depart from thee, and from thine houses, and from thy seruantes, and from thy people: onely they shall remaine in the riuer.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then Moses and Aaron went out from Pharaoh: and Moses cryed vnto the Lorde concerning the frogges, which hee had sent vnto Pharaoh.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the Lorde did according to the saying of Moses: so the frogges died in the houses, in the townes, and in the fieldes.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And they gathered the together by heaps, and the land stanke of them.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: But when Pharaoh sawe that hee had rest giuen him, he hardened his heart, and hearkened not vnto them, as the Lord had said.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Againe the Lord sayd vnto Moses, Say vnto Aaron, Stretche out the rod, and smite the dust of the earth, that it may bee turned to lyce throughout all the land of Egypt.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And they did so: for Aaron stretched out his hand with his rod, and smote the dust of the earth: and lyce came vpon man and vpon beast: all the dust of the earth was lyce throughout all the land of Egypt.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Nowe the enchanters assaied likewise with their enchantments to bring forth lyce, but they could not. So the lyce were vpon man & vpon beast.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then saide the enchanters vnto Pharaoh, This is the finger of God. But Pharaohs heart remained obstinate, and hee hearkened not vnto them, as the Lorde had said.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Moreouer the Lorde sayd to Moses, Rise vp earely in the morning, and stand before Pharaoh (lo, hee will come forth vnto the water) and say vnto him, Thus saith the Lord, Let my people go, that they may serue me.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Els, if thou wilt not let my people goe, behold, I will send swarmes of flies both vpon thee, and vpon thy seruants, and vpon thy people, and into thine houses: and the houses of the Egyptians shalbe full of swarmes of flies, and the ground also whereon they are.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: But ye land of Goshe, where my people are, wil I cause to be wonderfull in that day, so that no swarmes of flies shalbe there, that thou maiest know that I am the Lorde in the middes of the earth.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And I will make a deliuerance of my people from thy people: to morowe shall this miracle be.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the Lorde did so: for there came great swarmes of flies into the house of Pharaoh, and into his seruants houses, so that through all the lande of Egypt, the earth was corrupt by the swarmes of flies.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then Pharaoh called for Moses and Aaron, and saide, Goe, doe sacrifice vnto your God in this lande.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: But Moses answered, It is not meete to do so: for then we shoulde offer vnto the Lorde our God that, which is an abomination vnto the Egyptians. Loe, can we sacrifice the abomination of the Egyptians before their eyes, and they not stone vs?

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Let vs go three dayes iourney in the desert, and sacrifice vnto the Lord our God, as he hath commanded vs.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And Pharaoh said, I will let you go, that ye may sacrifice vnto the Lord your God in the wildernesse: but goe not farre away, pray for me.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And Moses said, Behold, I will go out from thee, and pray vnto the Lord, that the swarmes of flies may depart from Pharaoh, from his seruants, and from his people to morowe: but let Pharaoh from hencefoorth deceiue no more, in not suffering the people to sacrifice vnto the Lorde.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: So Moses went out from Pharaoh & prayed vnto the Lorde.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the Lord did according to the saying of Moses, and the swarmes of flies departed from Pharaoh, from his seruants, and from his people, and there remained not one.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Yet Pharaoh hardened his heart at this time also, and did not let the people goe.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then the Lorde said vnto Moses, Go to Pharaoh, and tell him, Thus saith the Lorde God of the Ebrewes, Let my people go, that they may serue me.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: But if thou refuse to let them goe, and wilt yet holde them still,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Beholde, the hande of the Lorde is vpon thy flocke which is in the fielde: for vpon the horses, vpon the asses, vpon the camels, vpon the cattell, and vpon the sheepe shalbe a mightie great moraine.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the Lorde shall doe wonderfully betweene the beastes of Israel, and the beastes of Egypt: so that there shall nothing dye of all, that pertaineth to the children of Israel.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the Lord appointed a time, saying, To morowe the Lorde shall finish this thing in this lande.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: So the Lord did this thing on the morow, and all the cattel of Egypt dyed: but of the cattell of the children of Israel dyed not one.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then Pharaoh sent, and beholde, there was not one of the cattell of the Israelites dead: and the heart of Pharaoh was obstinate, and hee did not let the people goe.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the Lord said to Moses and to Aaron, Take your handfull of ashes of the fornace, and Moses shall sprinkle them towarde the heauen in the sight of Pharaoh,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And they shall be turned to dust in all the land of Egypt: and it shalbe as a scab breaking out into blisters vpon man, and vpon beast, thorow out all the land of Egypt.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then they tooke ashes of the fornace, and stoode before Pharaoh: and Moses sprinkled them towarde the heauen, and there came a scab breaking out into blisters vpon man, and vpon beast.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the sorcerers could not stande before Moses, because of the scab: for the scab was vpon the enchanters, and vpon all the Egyptians.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the Lord hardened the heart of Pharaoh, and he hearkened not vnto them, as the Lorde had said vnto Moses.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also the Lorde said vnto Moses, Rise vp early in the morning, and stand before Pharaoh, and tell him, Thus saith the Lorde God of the Ebrewes, Let my people goe, that they may serue me.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: For I will at this time send all my plagues vpon thine heart, and vpon thy seruants, and vpon thy people, that thou mayest knowe that there is none like me in all the earth.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: For nowe I will stretch out mine hande, that I may smite thee and thy people with the pestilence: and thou shalt perish from the earth.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And in deede, for this cause haue I appointed thee, to shewe my power in thee, and to declare my Name throughout all the world.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Yet thou exaltest thy selfe against my people, and lettest them not goe.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Beholde, to morowe this time I will cause to raine a mightie great haile, such as was not in Egypt since the foundation thereof was laid vnto this time.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Send therefore nowe, and gather the cattell, and all that thou hast in the fielde: for vpon all the men, and the beastes, which are found in the field, and not brought home, the haile shal fall vpon them, and they shall die.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Such then as feared the word of the Lorde among the seruants of Pharaoh, made his seruants and his cattell flee into the houses:

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: But such as regarded not the worde of the Lorde, left his seruants, and his cattell in the fielde.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the Lorde saide to Moses, Stretche foorth thine hande towarde heauen, that there may be haile in all the land of Egypt, vpon man, and vpon beast, and vpon all the herbes of the fielde in the lande of Egypt.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then Moses stretched out his rod towarde heauen, & the Lord sent thunder and haile, and lightening vpon the ground: and the Lorde caused haile to raine vpon the land of Egypt.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: So there was haile, and fire mingled with the haile, so grieuous, as there was none throughout all the lande of Egypt, since it was a nation.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the haile smote throughout al ye land of Egypt all that was in the fielde, both man and beast: also ye haile smote all the herbes of ye field, and brake to pieces all the trees of the fielde.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Onely in the lande of Goshen (where the children of Israel were) was no haile.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then Pharaoh sent and called for Moses and Aaron, and said vnto them, I haue now sinned: the Lorde is righteous, but I and my people are wicked.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Pray ye vnto the Lorde (for it is ynough) that there be no more mightie thunders and haile, and I will let you goe, and yee shall tarie no longer.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then Moses saide vnto him, Assoone as I am out of the citie, I will spreade mine hands vnto the Lorde, and the thunder shall cease, neither shall there be any more haile, that thou mayest knowe that the earth is the Lordes.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: As for thee and thy seruants, I knowe afore I pray ye will feare before the face of the Lorde God.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: (And the flaxe, & the barley were smitten: for the barley was eared, & the flaxe was bolled.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: But the wheat and the rye were not smitten, for they were hid in the grounde)

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then Moses went out of the citie from Pharaoh, and spred his hands to the Lorde, and the thunder and the haile ceased, neither rained it vpon the earth.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And when Pharaoh sawe that the raine and the haile and the thunder were ceased, hee sinned againe, and hardened his heart, both he, and his seruants.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: So the heart of Pharaoh was hardened: neither would he let the children of Israel goe, as the Lord had said by Moses.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Againe the Lorde saide vnto Moses, Goe to Pharaoh: for I haue hardened his heart, and the heart of his seruants, that I might worke these my miracles in the middes of his realme,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And that thou maist declare in the eares of thy sonne, & of thy sonnes sonne, what things I haue done in Egypt, and my miracles, which I haue done among them: that ye may knowe that I am the Lorde.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then came Moses and Aaron vnto Pharaoh, and they said vnto him, Thus saith the Lord God of the Ebrewes, Howe long wilt thou refuse to humble thy selfe before me? Let my people goe, that they may serue me.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: But if thou refuse to let my people go, beholde, to morowe will I bring grashoppers into thy coastes.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And they shall couer the face of the earth, that a man can not see the earth: and they shall eate the residue which remaineth vnto you, and hath escaped from the haile: and they shall eate all your trees that bud in the fielde.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And they shall fil thine houses, and all thy seruants houses, and the houses of all the Egyptians, as neither thy fathers, nor thy fathers fathers haue seene, since the time they were vpon the earth vnto this day. So he returned, and went out from Pharaoh.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then Pharaohs seruants saide vnto him, How long shall he be an offence vnto vs? let the men go, that they may serue the Lord their God: wilt thou first knowe that Egypt is destroyed?

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: So Moses and Aaron were brought againe vnto Pharaoh, and he saide vnto them, Goe, serue the Lorde your God, but who are they that shall goe?

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And Moses answered, We will go with our yong and with our olde, with our sonnes and with our daughters, with our sheepe and with our cattell will we goe: for we must celebrate a feast vnto the Lorde.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And he said vnto them, Let the Lorde so be with you, as I will let you goe and your children: beholde, for euill is before your face.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: It shall not be so: nowe goe ye that are men, and serue the Lorde: for that was your desire. Then they were thrust out from Pharaohs presence.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: After, the Lord said vnto Moses, Stretch out thine hande vpon the lande of Egypt for the grashoppers, that they may come vpon the lande of Egypt, and eate all the herbes of the land, euen all that the haile hath left.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then Moses stretched foorth his rod vpon the lande of Egypt: and the Lorde brought an East winde vpon the land all that day, and al that night: and in the morning the East wind brought the grashoppers.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: So the grashoppers went vp vpon all the land of Egypt, and remained in all quarters of Egypt: so grieuous Grashoppers, like to these were neuer before, neither after them shalbe such.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: For they couered all the face of the earth, so that the lande was darke: and they did eate all the herbes of the lande, and all the fruites of the trees, which the haile had left, so that there was no greene thing left vpon the trees, nor among the herbes of the fielde throughout all the lande of Egypt.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Therefore Pharaoh called for Moses and Aaron in haste, and sayde, I haue sinned against the Lorde your God, and against you.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And nowe forgiue mee my sinne onely this once, and pray vnto the Lord your God, that hee may take away from me this death onely.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Moses then went out from Pharaoh, and prayed vnto the Lord.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the Lorde turned a mightie strong West winde, and tooke away the grashoppers, & violently cast them into the red Sea, so that there remained not one grashopper in all the coast of Egypt.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: But the Lord hardened Pharaohs heart, & hee did not let the children of Israel goe.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Againe ye Lord said vnto Moses, Stretch out thine hand toward heauen, that there may be vpon the lande of Egypt darkenesse, euen darkenesse that may be felt.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then Moses stretched forth his hande towarde heauen, and there was a blacke darkenesse in all the land of Egypt three daies.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: No man saw an other, neither rose vp from ye place where he was for three dayes: but all the children of Israel had light where they dwelt.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: The Pharaoh called for Moses & said, Go, serue the Lord: onely your sheepe and your cattel shall abide, and your children shall go with you.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And Moses sayd, Thou must giue vs also sacrifices, and burnt offrings that wee may doe sacrifice vnto the Lord our God.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Therefore our cattell also shall go with vs: there shall not an hoofe bee left, for thereof must we take to serue the Lord our God: neither doe wee knowe howe we shall serue the Lorde, vntill we come thither.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: (But the Lorde hardened Pharaohs heart, and he would not let them goe)

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And Pharaoh sayde vnto him, Get thee from mee: looke thou see my face no more: for whensoeuer thou commest in my sight, thou shalt dye.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then Moses said, Thou hast said wel: from henceforth will I see thy face no more.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: (Now the Lord had saide vnto Moses, yet will I bring one plague more vpo Pharaoh, and vpon Egypt: after that, he will let you go hence: when he letteth you goe, he shall at once chase you hence.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Speake thou nowe to the people, that euery man require of his neighbour, & euery woman of her neighbour iewels of siluer & iewels of gold.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the Lorde gaue the people fauour in the sight of the Egyptians: also Moses was very great in the land of Egypt, in the sight of Pharaohs seruantes, and in the sight of the people.)

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also Moses sayde, Thus sayth the Lord, About midnight will I goe out into the middes of Egypt.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And all the first borne in the lande of Egypt shall die, from the first borne of Pharaoh that sitteth on his throne, vnto the first borne of the maide seruant, that is at the mille, and all the first borne of beastes.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then there shalbe a great crie throughout all the land of Egypt, such as was neuer none like, nor shalbe.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: But against none of ye children of Israel shal a dogge moue his tongue, neyther against man nor beast, that ye may knowe that the Lord putteth a differece betweene the Egyptians & Israel.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And all these thy seruants shall come downe vnto me, and fal before me, saying, Get thee out, and all the people that are at thy feete, and after this will I depart. So he went out from Pharaoh very angry.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the Lord saide vnto Moses, Pharaoh shall not heare you, that my wonders may bee multiplied in the land of Egypt.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: So Moses and Aaron did all these wonders before Pharaoh: but the Lorde hardened Pharaohs heart, and he suffred not the children of Israel to goe out of his lande.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then the Lord spake to Moses and to Aaron in the land of Egypt, saying,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: This moneth shalbe vnto you the beginning of moneths: it shalbe to you the first moneth of the yere.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Speake ye vnto all the congregation of Israel, saying, In the tenth of this moneth let euery man take vnto him a lambe, according to the house of the fathers, a lambe for an house.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And if the housholde be too litle for the lambe, he shall take his neighbour, which is next vnto his house, according to the nomber of the persons: euery one of you, according to his eating shall make your count for the lambes,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Your lambe shalbe without blemish, a male of a yeere olde: ye shall take it of the lambes, or of the kiddes.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And yee shall keepe it vntill the fourteenth day of this moneth: then al the multitude of the Congregation of Israel shall kill it at euen.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: After, they shall take of the blood, & strike it on the two postes, and on the vpper doore post of the houses where they shall eate it.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And they shal eate the flesh the same night, roste with fire, and vnleauened bread: with sowre herbes they shall eate it.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Eate not thereof rawe, boyled nor sodden in water, but rost with fire, both his head, his feete, and his purtenance.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And ye shal reserue nothing of it vnto the morning: but that, which remaineth of it vnto the morowe, shall ye burne with fire.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And thus shall yee eate it, Your loynes girded, your shoes on your feete, and your staues in your handes, and yee shall eate it in haste: for it is the Lords Passeouer.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: For I will passe through the lande of Egypt the same night, and will smite all the first borne in the land of Egypt, both man and beast, and I will execute iudgement vpon all the gods of Egypt. I am the Lord.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the blood shalbe a toke for you vpon the houses where ye are: so when I see the blood, I will passe ouer you, and the plague shall not be vpon you to destruction, when I smite the lande of Egypt.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And this day shalbe vnto you a remembrance: and ye shall keepe it an holie feast vnto the Lord, throughout your generations: yee shall keepe it holie by an ordinance for euer.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Seuen daies shall ye eat vnleauened bread, and in any case ye shall put away leauen the first day out of your houses: for whosoeuer eateth leauened bread from the first daie vntill the seuenth day, that person shalbe cut off from Israel.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And in the first day shalbe an holie assemblie: also in the seuenth day shalbe an holy assemblie vnto you: no worke shalbe done in them, saue about that which euery man must eate: that onely may ye do.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Ye shall keepe also the feast of vnleauened bread: for that same daye I will bring your armies out of the lande of Egypt: therefore ye shal obserue this day, throughout your posteritie, by an ordinance for euer.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: In the first moneth and the fourteenth day of the moneth at euen, yee shall eate vnleauened bread vnto the one and twentieth day of the moneth at euen.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Seuen daies shall no leauen be founde in your houses: for whosoeuer eateth leauened bread, that person shalbe cut off from the Congregation of Israel: whether he bee a stranger, or borne in the land.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Ye shall eate no leauened bread: but in all your habitations shall ye eate vnleauened bread.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then Moses called all the Elders of Israel, and saide vnto them, Choose out and take you for euerie of your housholdes a lambe, & kill the Passeouer.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And take a bunch of hyssop, and dip it in the blood that is in the basen, and strike the lintell, and the doore cheekes with the blood that is in the basen, and let none of you goe out at the doore of his house, vntill the morning.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: For the Lord will passe by to smite the Egyptians: and when he seeth the blood vpon the lintel and on the two doore cheekes, the Lorde wil passe ouer the doore, & wil not suffer the destroyer to come into your houses to plague you.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Therefore shall ye obserue this thing as an ordinance both for thee and thy sonnes for euer.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And when ye shall come into the land, which the Lord will giue you as hee hath promised, then ye shall keepe this seruice.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And when your children aske you, What seruice is this ye keepe?

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then ye shall saye, It is the sacrifice of the Lordes Passeouer, which passed ouer the houses of the children of Israel in Egypt, when he smote the Egyptians, and preserued our houses. Then the people bowed them selues, & worshipped.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: So the children of Israel went, and did as the Lorde had commanded Moses and Aaron: so did they.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Nowe at midnight, the Lorde smote all the first borne in the lande of Egypt, from the first borne of Pharaoh that sate on his throne, vnto the first borne of the captiue that was in prison, and all the first borne of beastes.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And Pharaoh rose vp in the night, he, and all his seruants and all the Egyptians: and there was a great crye in Egypt: for there was no house where there was not one dead.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And hee called to Moses and to Aaron by night, and saide, Rise vp, get you out from among my people, both yee, and the children of Israel, and goe serue the Lorde as ye haue sayde.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Take also your sheepe and your cattell as yee haue sayde, & depart, and blesse me also.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the Egyptians did force the people, because they would send them out of the land in haste: for they said, We die all.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Therfore the people tooke their dough before it was leauened, euen their dough bound in clothes vpon their shoulders.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the children of Israel did according to the saying of Moses, & they asked of ye Egyptians iewels of siluer & iewels of gold, & raiment.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the Lorde gaue the people fauour in the sight of the Egyptians: and they graunted their request: so they spoyled the Egyptians.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then the children of Israel tooke their iourney from Rameses to Succoth about sixe hundreth thousand men of foote, beside children.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And a great multitude of sundrie sortes of people went out with them, and sheepe, and beeues, and cattel in great abundance.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And they baked the dough which they brought out of Egypt, & made vnleauened cakes: for it was not leauened, because they were thrust out of Egypt, neither coulde they tarie, nor yet prepare themselues vitailes.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: So the dwelling of the children of Israel, while they dwelled in Egypt, was foure hundreth and thirtie yeres.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And when the foure hundreth & thirtie yeeres were expired, euen the selfe same day departed all the hostes of the Lord out of the land of Egypt.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: It is a night to be kept holie to the Lord, because he brought them out of the lande of Egypt: this is that night of the Lord, which all the children of Israel must keepe throughout their generations.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also the Lorde said vnto Moses & Aaron, This is the Lawe of the Passeouer: no stranger shall eate thereof.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: But euerie seruant that is bought for money, when thou hast circumcised him, then shall he eat thereof.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: A stranger or an hyred seruant shall not eat thereof.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: In one house shall it bee eaten: thou shalt carie none of ye flesh out of the house, neither shall ye breake a bone thereof.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: All the Congregation of Israel shall obserue it.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: But if a stranger dwell with thee, and will obserue the Passeouer of the Lorde, let him circumcise all the males, that belong vnto him, and then let him come and obserue it, & he shall be as one that is borne in the land: for none vncircumcised person shall eate thereof.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: One lawe shalbe to him that is borne in the land, and to the stranger that dwelleth among you.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then all the children of Israel did as the Lorde commaunded Moses and Aaron: so did they.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the selfe same day did the Lord bring the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt by their armies.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the Lorde spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Sanctifie vnto me all the first borne: that is, euery one that first openeth the wombe among the children of Israel, as well of man as of beast: for it is mine.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then Moses sayd vnto the people, Remember this day in the which ye came out of Egypt, out of the house of bondage: for by a mightie hande the Lorde brought you out from thence: therefore no leauened bread shall bee eaten.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: This day come yee out in the moneth of Abib.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Now when the Lord hath brought thee into the land of the Canaanites, and Hittites, and Amorites, and Hiuites, and Iebusites (which he sware vnto thy fathers, that he woulde giue thee, a land flowing with milke and honie) then thou shalt keepe this seruice in this moneth.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Seuen dayes shalt thou eate vnleauened bread, and the seuenth day shall be the feast of the Lord.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Vnleauened bread shall bee eaten seuen dayes, and there shal no leauened bread be seene with thee, nor yet leauen be seene with thee in all thy quarters.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And thou shalt shew thy sonne in that day, saying, This is done, because of that which the Lord did vnto me, when I came out of Egypt.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And it shalbe a signe vnto thee vpo thine hande, and for a remembrance betweene thine eyes, that the Lawe of the Lorde may be in thy mouth: for by a strong hand the Lorde brought thee out of Egypt.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Keepe therefore this ordinance in his season appoynted from yeere to yeere.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And when the Lord shall bring thee into the lande of the Canaanites, as hee sware vnto thee and to thy fathers, and shall giue it thee,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then thou shalt set apart vnto the Lorde all that first openeth the wombe: also euery thing that first doeth open the wombe, and commeth forth of thy beast: the males shalbe the Lordes.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: But euery first foale of an asse, thou shalt redeeme with a lambe: and if thou redeeme him not, then thou shalt breake his necke: likewise all the first borne of man among thy sonnes shalt thou bye out.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And when thy sonne shall aske thee to morowe, saying, What is this? thou shalt then say vnto him, With a mightie hande the Lorde brought vs out of Egypt, out of the house of bondage.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: For when Pharaoh was harde hearted against our departing, the Lord then slewe all the first borne in the lande of Egypt: from the first borne of man euen to the first borne of beast: therefore I sacrifice vnto the Lorde all the males that first open the wombe, but all the first borne of my sonnes I redeeme.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And it shalbe as a token vpon thine hand, and as frontlets betweene thine eyes, that the Lorde brought vs out of Egypt by a mightie hande.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Nowe when Pharaoh had let the people go, God caried them not by the way of the Philistims countrey, though it were neerer: (for God sayd, Lest the people repent whe they see warre, and turne againe to Egypt)

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: But God made the people to go about by the way of the wildernesse of the red sea: and the children of Israel went vp armed out of the land of Egypt.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: (And Moses tooke the bones of Ioseph with him: for he had made the children of Israel sweare, saying, God will surely visite you, and ye shal take my bones away hence with you)

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: So they tooke their iourney from Succoth, and camped in Etham in the edge of the wildernesse.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the Lord went before them by day in a pillar of a cloude to leade them the way, & by night in a pillar of fire to giue them light, that they might go both by day and by night.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: He tooke not away the pillar of ye cloude by day, nor the pillar of fire by night from before the people.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then the Lord spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Speake to the children of Israel, that they returne and campe before Pi-hahiroth, betweene Migdol & the Sea, ouer against Baal-zephon: about it shal ye campe by the Sea.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: For Pharaoh will say of the children of Israel, They are tangled in the land: the wildernesse hath shut them in.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And I will harden Pharaohs heart that hee shall followe after you: so I will get mee honour vpon Pharaoh, and vpon all his hoste: the Egyptians also shall knowe that I am the Lorde: and they did so.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then it was told the King of Egypt, that the people fled: and the heart of Pharaoh and of his seruants was turned against the people, and they sayde, Why haue we this done, and haue let Israel go out of our seruice?

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And he made ready his charets, and tooke his people with him,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And tooke sixe hundreth chosen charets, and all the charets of Egypt, and captaines ouer euery one of them.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: (For the Lorde had hardened the heart of Pharaoh king of Egypt, and he followed after the children of Israel: but the children of Israel went out with an hie hand)

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the Egyptians pursued after them, and all the horses and charets of Pharaoh, and his horsemen and his hoste ouertooke them camping by the Sea, beside Pi-hahiroth, before Baal-zephon.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And when Pharaoh drew nie, the children of Israel lift vp their eyes, and beholde, the Egyptians marched after them, and they were sore afrayde: wherefore the children of Israel cried vnto the Lorde.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And they sayde vnto Moses, Hast thou brought vs to die in the wildernes, because there were no graues in Egypt? wherefore hast thou serued vs thus, to carie vs out of Egypt?

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Did not wee tell thee this thing in Egypt, saying, Let vs be in rest, that we may serue the Egyptians? for it had bene better for vs to serue the Egyptians, then that wee shoulde dye in the wildernesse.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then Moses sayde to the people, Feare ye not, stand still, and beholde the saluation of the Lord which he will shew to you this day. For the Egyptians, whome ye haue seene this day, ye shall neuer see them againe.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: The Lorde shall fight for you: therefore hold you your peace.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the Lord sayd vnto Moses, Wherefore cryest thou vnto me? speake vnto the children of Israel that they go forward:

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And lift thou vp thy rod, and stretche out thine hand vpon the Sea and deuide it, and let the children of Israel goe on drie ground thorow the middes of the Sea.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And I, beholde, I will harden the heart of the Egyptians, that they may followe them, and I wil get me honour vpon Pharaoh, & vpon all his host, vpon his charets, and vpon his horsemen.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then the Egyptians shall know that I am the Lorde, when I haue gotten me honour vpon Pharaoh, vpon his charets, & vpon his horsemen.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: (And the Angel of God, which went before the hoste of Israel, remoued & went behinde them: also the pillar of the cloude went from before them, and stoode behinde them,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And came betweene the campe of the Egyptians and the campe of Israel: it was both a cloude and darkenes, yet gaue it light by night, so that all the night long the one came not at the other)

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And Moses stretched forth his hande vpon the Sea, & the Lord caused the sea to runne backe by a strong East winde all the night, & made the Sea dry land: for the waters were deuided.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then the children of Israel went through the middes of the Sea vpon the drie ground, and the waters were a wall vnto them on their right hand, and on their left hand.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the Egyptians pursued and went after them to the middes of the Sea, euen all Pharaohs horses, his charets, and his horsemen.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Nowe in the morning watche, when the Lord looked vnto the hoste of the Egyptians, out of the firie and cloudie pillar, he strooke the host of the Egyptians with feare.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: For he tooke off their charet wheeles, and they draue them with much a doe: so that the Egyptians euery one sayd, I wil flee from the face of Israel: for the Lord fighteth for them against the Egyptians.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then the Lord sayde to Moses, Stretche thine hand vpon the Sea, that the waters may returne vpon the Egyptians, vpon their charets and vpon their horsemen.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then Moses stretched forth his hand vpon the Sea, and the Sea returned to his force early in the morning, and the Egyptians fled against it: but the Lord ouerthrew the Egyptians in the mids of the Sea.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: So the water returned & couered the charets and the horsemen, euen all the hoste of Pharaoh that came into the sea after them: there remained not one of them.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: But the children of Israel walked vpon dry land thorowe the middes of the Sea, and the waters were a wall vnto them on their right hande, and on their left.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Thus the Lorde saued Israel the same day out of the hand of the Egyptians, and Israel sawe the Egyptians dead vpon the Sea banke.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And Israel saw the mightie power, which the Lord shewed vpon the Egyptians: so the people feared the Lord, and beleeued the Lorde, and his seruant Moses.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then sang Moses and the children of Israel this song vnto the Lord, and sayd in this maner, I will sing vnto the Lorde: for he hath triumphed gloriously: the horse and him that rode vpon him hath he ouerthrowen in the Sea.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: The Lord is my strength and praise, and he is become my saluation. He is my God, and I will prepare him a tabernacle. he is my fathers God, and I will exalt him.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: The Lord is a man of warre, his Name is Iehouah.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Pharaohs charets and his host hath he cast into the Sea: his chosen captaines also were drowned in the red Sea.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: The depths haue couered them, they sanke to the bottome as a stone.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Thy right hande, O Lorde, is glorious in power: thy right hand, O Lorde, hath brused the enemie.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And in thy great glorie thou hast ouerthrowen them that rose against thee: thou sentest forth thy wrath, which consumed them as the stubble.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And by the blast of thy nostrels the waters were gathered, the floods stoode still as an heape, the depthes congealed together in the heart of the Sea.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: The enemie sayd, I wil pursue, I wil ouertake them, I will deuide the spoyle, my lust shall bee satisfied vpon them, I will drawe my sworde, mine hand shall destroy them.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Thou blewest with thy winde, the Sea couered them, they sanke as leade in the mightie waters.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Who is like vnto thee, O Lord, among the Gods! Who is like thee so glorious in holinesse, fearefull in prayses, doing wonders!

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Thou stretchedst out thy right hande, the earth swallowed them.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Thou wilt by thy mercie cary this people, which thou deliueredst: thou wilt bring them in thy strength vnto thine holy habitation.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: The people shal heare and be afraide: sorow shal come vpon the inhabitants of Palestina.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then the dukes of Edom shalbe amased, & trembling shall come vpon the great men of Moab: all the inhabitantes of Canaan shall waxe faint hearted.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Feare and dread shall fall vpon them: because of the greatnesse of thine arme, they shalbe stil as a stone, till thy people passe, O Lord: til this people passe, which thou hast purchased.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Thou shalt bring them in, and plant them in the mountaine of thine inheritance, which is the place that thou hast prepared, O Lord, for to dwell in, euen the sanctuarie, O Lord, which thine hands shall establish.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: The Lord shall reigne for euer and euer.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: For Pharaohs horses went with his charets and horsemen into the Sea, and the Lorde brought the waters of the Sea vpon them: but the children of Israel went on drie land in the middes of the Sea.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And Miriam the prophetesse, sister of Aaron tooke a timbrell in her hande, and all the women came out after her with timbrels and daunces.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And Miriam answered the men, Sing yee vnto the Lord: for he hath triumphed gloriously: the horse and his rider hath hee ouerthrowen in the Sea.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then Moses brought Israel from the redde Sea, and they went out into the wildernesse of Shur: and they went three dayes in the wildernesse, and found no waters.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And whe they came to Marah, they could not drinke of the waters of Marah, for they were bitter: therefore the name of the place was called Marah.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then the people murmured against Moses, saying, What shall we drinke?

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And he cried vnto the Lord, and the Lord shewed him a tree, which when he had cast into the waters, the waters were sweete: there he made them an ordinance and a law, and there he proued them,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And sayd, if thou wilt diligently hearken, O Israel, vnto the voyce of the Lord thy God, and wilt do that, which is right in his sight, and wilt giue eare vnto his commaundementes, and keepe all his ordinances, then will I put none of these diseases vpon thee, which I brought vpon the Egyptians: for I am the Lord that healeth thee.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And they came to Elim, where were twelue fountaines of water, and seuentie palme trees, and they camped thereby the waters.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Afterwarde all the Congregation of the children of Israel departed from Elim, and came to the wildernes of Sin, (which is betweene Elim and Sinai) the fiftenth day of the second moneth after their departing out of ye land of Egypt.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the whole Congregation of the children of Israel murmured against Moses & against Aaron in the wildernesse.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: For the children of Israel sayde to them, Oh that we had dyed by the hand of the Lord in the land of Egypt, when wee sate by the flesh pots, when wee ate bread our bellies full: for yee haue brought vs out into this wildernesse, to kill this whole company with famine.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then sayd the Lord vnto Moses, Behold, I wil cause bread to rayne from heauen to you, & the people shal goe out, and gather that that is sufficient for euery day, that I may proue them, whether they wil walke in my Law or no.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: But the sixt daye they shall prepare that, which they shal bring home, and it shalbe twise as much as they gather dayly.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then Moses and Aaron sayde vnto all the children of Israel, At euen ye shal know, that the Lord brought you out of the land of Egypt:

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And in the morning ye shall see the glorie of the Lorde: for he hath heard your grudgings against the Lorde: and what are we that ye haue murmured against vs?

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Againe Moses sayd, At euen shal the Lord giue you flesh to eate, and in the morning your fil of bread: for the Lorde hath heard your murmurings, which ye murmure against him: for what are we? Your murmurings are not against vs, but against the Lord.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And Moses sayd to Aaron, Say vnto all the Congregation of the children of Israel, Draw neere before the Lorde: for he hath heard your murmurings.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Now as Aaron spake vnto the whole Congregation of the children of Israel, they looked toward the wildernesse, and beholde, the glory of the Lord appeared in a cloude.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: (For the Lorde had spoken vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: I haue heard the murmurings of the children of Israel: tell them therefore, & say, At euen ye shal eate flesh, and in the morning ye shall be filled with bread, and ye shall knowe that I am the Lord your God)

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And so at euen the quailes came and couered the campe: and in the morning the dewe lay round about the hoste.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And when the dewe that was fallen was ascended, beholde, a small round thing was vpon the face of the wildernes, small as the hoare frost on the earth.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And when the children of Israel sawe it, they sayde one to another, It is MAN, for they wist not what it was; Moses sayd vnto them, This is the breade which the Lorde hath giuen you to eate.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: This is the thing which the Lorde hath commanded: gather of it euery man according to his eating an Omer for a man according to the number of your persons: euery man shall take for them which are in his tent.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the children of Israel did so, and gathered, some more, some lesse.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And when they did measure it with an Omer, hee that had gathered much, had nothing ouer, & he that had gathered litle, had no lacke: so euery man gathered according to his eating.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Moses then said vnto them, Let no man reserue thereof till morning.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Notwithstanding they obeyed not Moses: but some of them reserued of it till morning, and it was full of wormes, and stanke: therefore Moses was angrie with them.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And they gathered it euery morning, euery man according to his eating: for when the heate of the sunne came, it was melted.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the sixt day they gathered twise so much bread, two Omers for one man: then all the rulers of the Congregation came and told Moses.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And he answered them, This is that, which the Lord hath sayde, To morowe is the rest of the holy Sabbath vnto the Lorde: bake that to day which ye wil bake, and seethe that which ye wil seethe, and all that remaineth, lay it vp to be kept till the morning for you.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And they laied it vp till the morning, as Moses bade, and it stanke not, neyther was there any worme therein.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then Moses sayde, Eate that to day: for to day is the Sabbath vnto the Lord: to day ye shall not finde it in the fielde.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Sixe dayes shall yee gather it, but in the seuenth day is the Sabbath: in it there shalbe none.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Notwithstanding, there went out some of the people in ye seuenth day for to gather, and they found none.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the Lorde sayde vnto Moses, Howe long refuse yee to keepe my commaundementes, and my lawes?

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Beholde, howe the Lorde hath giuen you the Sabbath: therefore he giueth you the sixt day bread for two dayes: tary therefore euery man in his place: let no man goe out of his place the seuenth day.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: So the people rested the seuenth day.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the house of Israel called the name of it, MAN; it was like to coriander seede, but white: and the taste of it was like vnto wafers made with hony.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And Moses said, This is that which the Lord hath commanded, Fill an Omer of it, to keepe it for your posteritie: that they may see the bread wherewith I haue fed you in wildernesse, when I brought you out of the land of Egypt.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Moses also said to Aaron, Take a pot and put an Omer full of MAN therein, and set it before the Lord to be kept for your posteritie.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: As the Lord commanded Moses, so Aaron laied it vp before the Testimonie to be kept.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the children of Israel did eate MAN fourtie yeres, vntill they came vnto a land inhabited: they did eate MAN vntill they came to the borders of the land of Canaan.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: The Omer is the tenth part of the Ephah.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And all the Congregation of the children of Israel departed from the wildernesse of Sin, by their iourneyes at the commaundement of the Lord, and camped in Rephidim, where was no water for the people to drinke.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Wherefore the people contended with Moses, and sayde, Giue vs water that we may drinke; Moses sayde vnto them, Why contende yee with me? wherefore do ye tempt the Lord?

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: So the people thirsted there for water, & the people murmured against Moses, & said, Wherefore hast thou thus brought vs out of Egypt to kil vs and our children and our cattel with thirst?

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And Moses cried to the Lorde, saying, What shal I do to this people? for they be almost ready to stone me.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And ye Lord answered to Moses, Goe before the people, and take with thee of the Elders of Israel: and thy rod, wherewith thou smotest the riuer, take in thine hand, and go:

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Behold, I will stand there before thee vpon the rocke in Horeb, and thou shalt smite on the rocke, and water shall come out of it, that the people may drinke; Moses did so in the sight of the Elders of Israel.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And he called the name of the place, Massah and Meribah, because of the contention of the children of Israel, and because they had tempted the Lorde, saying, Is the Lorde among vs, or no?

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then came Amalek and fought with Israel in Rephidim.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And Moses sayde to Ioshua, Chuse vs out men, and go fight with Amalek: to morowe I will stande on the toppe of the hill with the rod of God in mine hand.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: So Ioshua did as Moses bad him, & fought with Amalek: and Moses, Aaron, and Hur, went vp to the top of the hill.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And when Moses helde vp his hande, Israel preuailed: but when he let his hande downe, Amalek preuailed.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Nowe Moses handes were heauy: therefore they tooke a stone and put it vnder him, and hee sate vpon it: and Aaron and Hur stayed vp his hands, the one on the one side, and the other on the other side: so his hands were steady vntill the going downe of the sunne.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And Ioshua discomfited Amalek and his people with the edge of the sword.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the Lorde sayde to Moses, Write this for a remembrance in the booke, and rehearse it to Ioshua: for I will vtterly put out the remembraunce of Amalek from vnder heauen.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: (And Moses builte an altar and called the name of it, Iehouah-nissi)

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also he said, The Lord hath sworne, that he will haue warre with Amalek from generation to generation.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: When Iethro the Priest of Midian Moses father in lawe heard all that God had done for Moses, and for Israel his people, and howe the Lord had brought Israel out of Egypt,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then Iethro the father in lawe of Moses, tooke Zipporah Moses wife, (after he had sent her away)

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And her two sonnes, (whereof the one was called Gershom: for he sayd, I haue bene an aliant in a strange land:

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the name of the other was Eliezer: for the God of my father, said he, was mine helpe, & deliuered me from the sword of Pharaoh)

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And Iethro Moses father in law came with his two sonnes, and his wife vnto Moses into the wildernes, where he camped by ye mout of God.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And he said to Moses, I thy father in law Iethro am come to thee, and thy wife & her two sonnes with her.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And Moses went out to meete his father in law, and did obeisance and kissed him, and eche asked other of his welfare: and they came into the tent.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then Moses told his father in law all that the Lorde had done vnto Pharaoh, and to the Egyptians for Israels sake, and all the trauaile that had come vnto them by the way, and howe the Lord deliuered them.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And Iethro reioyced at all the goodnesse, which the Lord had shewed to Israel, and because he had deliuered them out of the hande of the Egyptians.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Therfore Iethro sayd, Blessed be the Lord who hath deliuered you out of the hande of the Egyptians, and out of the hand of Pharaoh: who hath also deliuered the people from vnder the hand of the Egyptians.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Now I know that the Lord is greater then all the gods: for as they haue dealt proudly with them, so are they recompensed.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then Iethro Moses father in lawe tooke burnt offerings and sacrifices to offer vnto God; Aaron & all the Elders of Israel came to eat bread with Moses father in law before God.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Now on the morow, when Moses sate to iudge the people, the people stoode about Moses from morning vnto euen.

Book.Name: Exodus
