Text: And when Moses father in law saw all that he did to the people, he sayde, What is this that thou doest to the people? why sittest thou thy selfe alone, and all the people stande about thee from morning vnto euen?

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And Moses sayd vnto his father in law, Because the people come vnto me to seeke God.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: When they haue a matter, they come vnto me, and I iudge betweene one and another, and declare the ordinances of God, and his lawes.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: But Moses father in law said vnto him, The thing which thou doest, is not well.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Thou both weariest thy selfe greatly, & this people that is with thee: for the thing is too heauie for thee: thou art not able to doe it thy selfe alone.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Heare nowe my voyce, (I will giue thee counsell, and God shalbe with thee) be thou for the people to Godwarde, and report thou the causes vnto God,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And admonish them of the ordinances, & of the lawes, & shew them the way, wherein they must walke, and the worke that they must do.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Moreouer, prouide thou among al the people men of courage, fearing God, men dealing truely, hating couetousnesse: and appoynt such ouer them to be rulers ouer thousandes, rulers ouer hundreths, rulers ouer fifties, and rulers ouer tennes.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And let them iudge the people at all seasons: but euery great matter let them bring vnto thee, and let them iudge all small causes: so shall it be easier for thee, when they shal beare the burden with thee.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: If thou do this thing, (& God so command thee) both thou shalt be able to endure, and all this people shal also go quietly to their place.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: So Moses obeyed the voyce of his father in law, and did all that he had sayd:

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And Moses chose men of courage out of all Israel, and made them heads ouer the people, rulers ouer thousandes, rulers ouer hundreths, rulers ouer fifties, and rulers ouer tennes.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And they iudged the people at all seasons, but they brought the hard causes vnto Moses: for they iudged all small matters themselues.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Afterward Moses let his father in law depart, and he went into his countrey.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: In the third moneth, after the children of Israel were gone out of the lande of Egypt, the same day came they into the wildernes of Sinai.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: For they departed from Rephidim, & came to the desart of Sinai, and camped in the wildernesse: euen there Israel camped before the mount.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: But Moses went vp vnto God, for ye Lord had called out of the mount vnto him, saying, Thus shalt thou say to the house of Iaakob, and tell the children of Israel,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Ye haue seene what I did vnto the Egyptians, and how I caryed you vpon eagles wings, and haue brought you vnto me.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Now therefore if ye wil heare my voyce in deede, and keepe my couenant, then ye shalbe my chiefe treasure aboue all people, though all the earth be mine.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Yee shall be vnto mee also a kingdome of Priestes, and an holy nation. These are the words which thou shalt speake vnto the children of Israel.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Moses then came & called for the Elders of the people, and proposed vnto them all these things, which the Lord commanded him.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the people answered all together, and sayd, All that the Lord hath commaunded, we will doe; Moses reported the wordes of the people vnto the Lord.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the Lord sayd vnto Moses, Lo, I come vnto thee in a thicke cloude, that the people may heare, whiles I talke with thee, and that they may also beleeue thee for euer. (for Moses had tolde the wordes of the people vnto the Lord)

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Moreouer, the Lord sayd vnto Moses, Goe to the people, and sanctifie them to day and to morow, and let them wash their clothes.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And let them be ready on the third day: for the thirde day the Lorde will come downe in the sight of all the people vpon mount Sinai:

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And thou shalt set markes vnto the people rounde about, saying, Take heede to your selues that ye goe not vp the mount, nor touche the border of it: whosoeuer toucheth the mount, shall surely die.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: No hand shall touche it, but he shalbe stoned to death, or striken through with darts: whether it be beast or man, he shal not liue: when the horne bloweth long, they shal come vp into the mountaine.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then Moses went downe from ye mount vnto the people, and sanctified the people, and they washed their clothes.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And he said vnto the people, Be ready on the third day, and come not at your wiues.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the thirde day, when it was morning, there was thunders and lightnings, and a thicke cloude vpon the mount, and the sounde of the trumpet exceeding loude, so that all the people, that was in the campe, was afrayde.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then Moses brought the people out of the tents to meete with God, and they stoode in the nether part of the mount.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And mount Sinai was all on smoke, because the Lorde came downe vpon it in fire, and the smoke therof ascended, as the smoke of a fornace, and all the mount trembled exceedingly.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And when the sound of the trumpet blew long, and waxed louder and louder, Moses spake, and God answered him by voyce.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: (For the Lorde came downe vpon mount Sinai on the toppe of the mount) and when the Lord called Moses vp into the top of the mount, Moses went vp.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then the Lord said vnto Moses, Go down, charge the people, that they breake not their boundes, to go vp to the Lord to gaze, least many of them perish.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And let the Priestes also which come to the Lorde be sanctified, least the Lorde destroy them.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And Moses sayde vnto the Lord, The people can not come vp into the mount Sinai: for thou hast charged vs, saying, Set markes on the mountaine, and sanctifie it.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the Lord sayd vnto him, Go, get thee downe, and come vp, thou, and Aaron with thee: but let not the Priestes and the people breake their boundes to come vp vnto the Lord, least he destroy them.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: So Moses went downe vnto the people, & tolde them.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then God spake all these wordes, saying,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: I am the Lorde thy God, which haue brought thee out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Thou shalt haue none other Gods before me.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Thou shalt make thee no grauen image, neither any similitude of things that are in heauen aboue, neither that are in the earth beneath, nor that are in the waters vnder the earth.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Thou shalt not bowe downe to them, neither serue them: for I am the Lord thy God, a ielous God, visiting the iniquitie of the fathers vpon the children, vpon the third generation and vpon the fourth of them that hate me:

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And shewing mercie vnto thousandes to them that loue me, & keepe my commandemets.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Thou shalt not take the Name of the Lorde thy God in vaine: for the Lorde will not hold him guiltles that taketh his Name in vayne.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Remember the Sabbath day, to keepe it holy.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Sixe dayes shalt thou labour, and doe all thy worke,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: But the seuenth day is the Sabbath of the Lord thy God: in it thou shalt not do any worke, thou, nor thy sonne, nor thy daughter, thy man seruant, nor thy mayde, nor thy beast, nor thy stranger that is within thy gates.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: For in sixe dayes the Lord made the heauen and the earth, the sea, and all that in them is, and rested the seuenth day: therefore the Lorde blessed the Sabbath day, and hallowed it.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Honour thy father and thy mother, that thy dayes may be prolonged vpon the land, which the Lord thy God giueth thee.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Thou shalt not kill.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Thou shalt not commit adulterie.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Thou shalt not steale.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Thou shalt not beare false witnes against thy neighbour.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Thou shalt not couet thy neighbours house, neither shalt thou couet thy neighbours wife, nor his man seruant, nor his mayde, nor his oxe, nor his asse, neyther any thing that is thy neighbours.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And all the people sawe the thunders, and the lightnings, & the sound of the trumpet, and the mountaine smoking & when the people saw it they fled and stoode afare off,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And sayde vnto Moses, Talke thou with vs, and we will heare: but let not God talke with vs, lest we die.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then Moses sayde vnto the people, Feare not: for God is come to proue you, & that his feare may be before you, that ye sinne not.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: So the people stoode afarre off, but Moses drew neere vnto the darkenes where God was.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the Lorde sayde vnto Moses, Thus thou shalt say vnto the children of Israel, Ye haue seene that I haue talked with you from heauen.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Ye shall not make therefore with me gods of siluer, nor gods of golde: you shall make you none.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: An altar of earth thou shalt make vnto me, and thereon shalt offer thy burnt offerings, and thy peace offerings, thy sheepe, and thine oxen: in all places, where I shall put the remembrance of my Name, I will come vnto thee, and blesse thee.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: But if thou wilt make mee an altar of stone, thou shalt not buylde it of hewen stones: for if thou lift vp thy toole vpon them, thou hast polluted them.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Neither shalt thou goe vp by steppes vnto mine altar, that thy filthines be not discouered thereon.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Now these are the lawes, which thou shalt set before them:

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: If thou bye an Ebrewe seruant, he shall serue sixe yeres, and in the seuenth he shal go out free, for nothing.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: If he came himselfe alone, he shall goe out himselfe alone: if hee were married, then his wife shall go out with him.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: If his master haue giuen him a wife, and she hath borne him sonnes or daughters, he wife and her children shalbe her masters, but he shall goe out himselfe alone.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: But if the seruant saye thus, I loue my master, my wife and my children, I will not goe out free,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then his master shall bring him vnto the Iudges, & set him to the dore, or to the poste, and his master shall bore his eare through with a nawle, and he shall serue him for euer.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Likewise if a man sell his daughter to be a seruant, she shal not goe out as the men seruantes doe.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: If shee please not her master, who hath betrothed her to him selfe, then shall hee cause to buy her: hee shall haue no power to sell her to a strange people, seeing he despised her.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: But if he hath betrothed her vnto his sonne, he shal deale with her according to the custome of the daughters.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: If he take him another wife, he shall not diminish her foode, her rayment, and recompence of her virginitie.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And if he do not these three vnto her, the shall she go out free, paying no money.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: He that smiteth a man, and he die, shal dye the death.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And if a man hath not layed wayte, but God hath offered him into his hande, then I wil appoynt thee a place whither he shall flee.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: But if a man come presumptuously vpon his neighbour to slay him with guile, thou shalt take him from mine altar, that he may die.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also hee that smiteth his father or his mother, shall die the death.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And he that stealeth a man, and selleth him, if it be founde with him, shal die the death.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And hee that curseth his father or his mother, shall die the death.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: When men also striue together, and one smite another with a stone, or with the fist, and he die not, but lieth in bed,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: If hee rise againe and walke without vpon his staffe, then shall he that smote him go quite, saue onely hee shall beare his charges for his resting, and shall pay for his healing.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And if a man smite his seruant, or his maide with a rod, and he die vnder his hande, he shalbe surely punished.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: But if he continue a day, or two dayes, hee shall not be punished: for he is his money.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also if men striue and hurt a woman with childe, so that her childe depart from her, and death followe not, hee shall bee surely punished according as the womans husbande shall appoynt him, or he shall pay as the Iudges determine.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: But if death followe, then thou shalt paye life for life,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hande for hand, foote for foote,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Burning for burning, wound for wounde, stripe for stripe.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And if a man smite his seruant in the eie, or his maide in the eye, and hath perished it, hee shall let him goe free for his eye.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also if he smite out his seruants tooth, or his maides tooth, he shall let him goe out free for his tooth.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: If an oxe gore a man or a woman, that he die, the oxe shalbe stoned to death, and his flesh shall not be eaten, but the owner of the oxe shall goe quite.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: If the oxe were wont to push in times past, and it hath bene tolde his master, and hee hath not kept him, and after he killeth a man or a woman, the oxe shall be stoned, and his owner shall die also.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: If there be set to him a summe of mony, then he shal pay the raunsome of his life, whatsoeuer shalbe laied vpon him.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Whether he hath gored a sonne or gored a daughter, he shalbe iudged after the same maner.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: If the oxe gore a seruant or a mayde, hee shal giue vnto their master thirtie shekels of siluer, and the oxe shalbe stoned.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And when a man shall open a well, or when he shall dig a pit and couer it not, and an oxe or an asse fall therein,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: The owner of the pit shall make it good, and giue money to the owners thereof, but the dead beast shalbe his.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And if a mans oxe hurt his neighbours oxe that he die, then they shal sel the liue oxe, & deuide the money thereof, and the dead oxe also they shall deuide.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Or if it bee knowen that the oxe hath vsed to push in times past, & his master hath not kept him, he shal pay oxe for oxe, but the dead shall be his owne.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: If a man steale an oxe or a sheepe, and kill it or sell it, he shal restore fiue oxen for the oxe, & foure sheepe for the sheepe.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: If a thiefe bee founde breaking vp, and be smitten that he dye, no blood shall be shed for him.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: But if it be in the day light, blood shall be shed for him: for he should make full restitution: if he had not wherewith, then shoulde he bee solde for his theft.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: If the theft bee founde with him, aliue, (whether it be oxe, asse, or sheepe) he shal restore the double.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: If a man doe hurt fielde, or vineyarde, and put in his beast to feed in an other mans fielde, he shall recompence of the best of his owne fielde, and of the best of his owne vineyard.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: If fire breake out, and catche in ye thornes, and the stackes of corne, or the standing corne, or the fielde be consumed, he that kindled the fire shall make full restitution.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: If a man deliuer his neighbour money or stuffe to keepe, and it be stollen out of his house, if the thiefe be found, he shall pay the double.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: If the thiefe be not founde, then the master of the house shalbe brought vnto the Iudges to sweare, whether he hath put his hande vnto his neighbours good, or no.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: In all maner of trespasse, whether it bee for oxen, for asse, for sheepe, for raiment, or for any maner of lost thing, which an other chalengeth to be his, the cause of both parties shal come before the iudges, and whom the Iudges condemne, he shall pay the double vnto his neighbour.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: If a man deliuer vnto his neighbour to keepe asse, or oxe, or sheepe, or any beast, and it die, or be hurt, or taken away by enemies, and no man see it,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: An oth of the Lord shalbe betweene the twaine, that hee hath not put his hande vnto his neighbours good, and the owner of it shall take the othe, and he shall not make it good:

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: But if it be stollen fro him, he shal make restitution vnto the owner thereof.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: If it be torne in pieces, he shall bring recorde, and shall not make that good, which is deuoured.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And if a man borow ought of his neighbour, and it be hurt, or els die, the owner thereof not being by, he shal surely make it good.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: If the owner thereof bee by, hee shall not make it good: for if it be an hired thing, it came for his hire.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And if a man entise a maide that is not betrothed, and lie with her, hee shall endowe her, and take her to his wife.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: If her father refuse to giue her to him, hee shal pay money, according to ye dowry of virgins.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Thou shalt not suffer a witch to liue.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Whosoeuer lieth with a beast, shall dye the death.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Hee that offereth vnto any gods, saue vnto the Lord onely, shalbe slaine.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Moreouer, thou shalt not do iniurie to a stranger, neither oppresse him: for ye were strangers in the land of Egypt.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Ye shall not trouble any widowe, nor fatherlesse childe.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: If thou vexe or trouble such, and so he call and cry vnto me, I will surely heare his cry.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then shal my wrath be kindled, and I will kill you with the sword, and your wiues shall be widowes, and your children fatherlesse.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: If thou lende money to my people, that is, to the poore with thee, thou shalt not bee as an vsurer vnto him: yee shall not oppresse him with vsurie.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: If thou take thy neighbours rayment to pledge, thou shalt restore it vnto him before the sunne go downe:

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: For that is his couering only, and this is his garment for his skin: wherin shal he sleepe? therefore when he crieth vnto mee, I will heare him: for I am mercifull.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Thou shalt not raile vpon the Iudges, neither speake euil of the ruler of thy people.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Thine abundance and thy licour shalt thou not keepe backe. The first borne of thy sonnes shalt thou giue me.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Likewise shalt thou do with thine oxen & with thy sheepe: seuen dayes it shall bee with his damme, and the eight day thou shalt giue it me.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Ye shalbe an holy people vnto me, neither shall ye eate any flesh that is torne of beastes in the fielde: ye shall cast it to the dogge.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Thou shalt not receiue a false tale, neyther shalt thou put thine hande with the wicked, to be a false witnes.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Thou shalt not followe a multitude to do euil, neither agree in a controuersie to decline after many and ouerthrowe the trueth.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Thou shalt not esteeme a poore man in his cause.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: If thou meete thine enemies oxe, or his asse going astray, thou shalt bring him to him againe.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: If thou see thine enemies asse lying vnder his burden, wilt thou cease to helpe him? Thou shalt helpe him vp againe with it.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Thou shalt not ouerthrowe the right of thy poore in his sute.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Thou shalt keepe thee farre fro a false matter, and shalt not slaye the innocent and the righteous: for I will not iustifie a wicked man.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Thou shalt take no gift: for the gift blindeth the wise, and peruerteth the wordes of the righteous.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Thou shalt not oppresse a stranger: for ye knowe the heart of a stranger, seeing yee were strangers in the land of Egypt.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Moreouer, sixe yeres thou shalt sowe thy land, and gather the fruites thereof,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: But the seuenth yeere thou shalt let it rest and lie still, that the poore of thy people may eat, and what they leaue, the beastes of the fielde shal eate. In like maner thou shalt doe with thy vineyard, and with thine oliue trees.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Sixe dayes thou shalt do thy worke, and in the seuenth day thou shalt rest, that thine oxe, and thine asse may rest, and the sonne of thy maide and the stranger may be refreshed.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And ye shall take heede to all things that I haue sayde vnto you: and ye shall make no mention of the name of other gods, neither shal it be heard out of thy mouth.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Three times thou shalt keepe a feast vnto me in the yeere.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Thou shalt keepe the feast of vnleauened bread: thou shalt eate vnleauened bread seue dayes, as I commaunded thee, in the season of the moneth of Abib: for in it thou camest out of Egypt: and none shall appeare before me emptie:

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: The feast also of the haruest of the first fruites of thy labours, which thou hast sowen in the fielde: and the feast of gathering fruites in the ende of the yere, when thou hast gathered in thy labours out of the fielde.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: These three times in the yeere shall all thy men children appeare before the Lord Iehouah.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Thou shalt not offer the blood of my sacrifice with leauened bread: neyther shall the fatte of my sacrifice remayne vntill the morning.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: The first of the first fruites of thy lande thou shalt bring into the house of the Lorde thy God: yet shalt thou not seeth a kid in his mothers milke.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Behold, I send an Angel before thee, to keepe thee in the way, and to bring thee to the place which I haue prepared.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Beware of him, and heare his voyce, and prouoke him not: for he will not spare your misdeedes, because my name is in him.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: But if thou hearken vnto his voyce, & do all that I speake, the I wil be an enemie vnto thine enemies, and will afflict them that afflict thee.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: For mine Angel shall go before thee, & bring thee vnto the Amorites, and the Hittites, and the Perizzites, and the Canaanites, the Hiuites, and the Iebusites, and I will destroy them.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Thou shalt not bow downe to their gods, neither serue them, nor doe after the workes of them: but vtterly ouerthrowe them, and breake in pieces their images.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: For ye shall serue the Lord your God, and he shall blesse thy bread and thy water, & I will take all sickenes away from the middes of thee.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: There shall none cast their fruite nor be baren in thy lande: the number of thy dayes will I fulfill.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: I will send my feare before thee, & will destroy all the people among whome thou shalt go: and I will make all thine enemies turne their backes vnto thee:

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And I will sende hornets before thee, which shal driue out the Hiuites, the Canaanites, and the Hittites from thy face.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: I will not cast them out from thy face in one yeere, least the land grow to a wildernes: & the beasts of the field multiplie against thee.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: By litle and litle I will driue them out from thy face, vntill thou increase, and inherite the lande.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And I will make thy coastes from the red sea vnto the sea of the Philistims, and from the desert vnto the Riuer: for I will deliuer the inhabitants of the lande into your hande, and thou shalt driue them out from thy face.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Thou shalt make no couenant with them, nor with their gods:

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Neither shall they dwell in thy lande, least they make thee sinne against me: for if thou serue their gods, surely it shall be thy destruction.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Nowe he had said vnto Moses, Come vp to the Lorde, thou, and Aaron, Nadab, and Abihu, and seuentie of the Elders of Israel, and yee shall worship a farre off.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And Moses himselfe alone shal come nere to the Lord, but they shall not come neere, neither shall the people goe vp with him.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Afterwarde Moses came and told the people all the wordes of the Lorde, and all the lawes: and all the people answered with one voyce, and said, All the things which the Lorde hath said, will we doe.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And Moses wrote all the wordes of the Lord, and rose vp early, and set vp an altar vnder the mountaine, and twelue pillars according to the twelue tribes of Israel.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And he sent young men of the children of Israel, which offered burnt offrings of bieues, and sacrificed peace offrings vnto the Lorde.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then Moses tooke halfe of the blood, and put it in basens, and halfe of the blood he sprinckled on the altar.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: After he tooke the booke of the couenant, and read it in the audience of the people: who said, All that the Lord hath said, we will do, and be obedient.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then Moses tooke the blood, & sprinkled it on the people, and said, Behold, the blood of the couenant, which the Lord hath made with you concerning all these things.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then went vp Moses & Aaron, Nadab, & Abihu, and seuentie of the Elders of Israel.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And they saw the God of Israel, and vnder his feete was as it were a worke of a Saphir stone, and as the very heauen when it is cleare.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And vpon the nobles of the children of Israel he laide not his hande: also they sawe God, and did eate and drinke.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the Lord said vnto Moses, Come vp to me into the mountaine, and be there, and I will giue thee tables of stone, and the law and the commandement, which I haue written, for to teach them.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then Moses rose vp, and his minister Ioshua, and Moses went vp into the mountaine of God,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And said vnto the Elders, Tary vs here, vntill we come againe vnto you: and beholde, Aaron, and Hur are with you: whosoeuer hath any matters, let him come to them.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then Moses went vp to the mount, and the cloude couered the mountaine,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the glorie of the Lorde abode vpon mount Sinai, and the cloude couered it sixe dayes: and the seuenth day he called vnto Moses out of the middes of the cloude.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the sight of the glorie of the Lorde was like consuming fire on the top of the moutaine, in the eyes of the children of Israel.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And Moses entred into the middes of the cloude, and went vp to the mountaine: and Moses was in the mount fourtie dayes and fourty nightes.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then the Lorde spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Speake vnto the children of Israel, that they receiue an offring for me: of euery man, whose heart giueth it freely, ye shall take the offring for me.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And this is the offring which ye shal take of them, golde, and siluer, and brasse,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And blewe silke, and purple, and skarlet, and fine linnen, and goates heare,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And rammes skinnes coloured red, and the skinnes of badgers, and the wood Shittim,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Oyle for the light, spices for anoynting oyle, and for the perfume of sweete sauour,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Onix stones, and stones to be set in the Ephod, and in the brest plate.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also they shall make me a Sanctuarie, that I may dwell among them.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: According to all that I shewe thee, euen so shall ye make the forme of the Tabernacle, and the facion of all the instruments thereof.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: They shall make also an Arke of Shittim wood, two cubites and an halfe long, and a cubite and an halfe broade, and a cubite and an halfe hie.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And thou shalt ouerlay it with pure golde: within and without shalt thou ouerlay it, & shalt make vpon it a crowne of golde rounde about.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And thou shalt cast foure rings of golde for it, and put them in the foure corners thereof: that is, two rings shalbe on the one side of it, and two rings on the other side thereof.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And thou shalt make barres of Shittim wood, and couer them with golde.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then thou shalt put the barres in the rings by the sides of the Arke, to beare the Arke with them.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: The barres shalbe in the rings of the Arke: they shall not be taken away from it.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: So thou shalt put in the Arke the Testimonie which I shall giue thee.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also thou shalt make a Mercie seate of pure golde, two cubites and an halfe long, and a cubite and an halfe broade.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And thou shalt make two Cherubims of golde: of worke beaten out with the hammer shalt thou make the at ye two endes of the Merciseate.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the one Cherub shalt thou make at the one ende, and the other Cherub at the other ende: of the matter of the Mercieseate shall ye make the Cherubims, on the two endes thereof.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the Cherubims shall stretche their winges on hie, couering the Mercie seate with their winges, and their faces one to another: to the Mercie seate warde shal the faces of the Cherubims be.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And thou shalt put the Mercieseate aboue vpon the Arke, and in the Arke thou shalt put the Testimonie, which I will giue thee,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And there I will declare my selfe vnto thee, & from aboue ye Mercieseate betweene ye two Cherubims, which are vpon ye Arke of ye Testimonie, I wil tel thee al things which I wil giue thee in comandement vnto ye children of Israel.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Thou shalt also make a Table of Shittim wood, of two cubites long, and one cubite broade, and a cubite and an halfe hie:

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And thou shalt couer it with pure gold, & make thereto a crowne of golde round about.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Thou shalt also make vnto it a border of foure fingers roud about and thou shalt make a golden crowne round about the border thereof.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: After, thou shalt make for it foure ringes of golde, and shalt put the rings in the foure corners that are in the foure feete thereof:

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Ouer against the border shall the rings be for places for barres, to beare the Table.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And thou shalt make the barres of Shittim wood, and shalt ouerlay them with golde, that the Table may be borne with them.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Thou shalt make also dishes for it, and incense cuppes for it, and couerings for it, & goblets, wherewith it shall be couered, euen of fine golde shalt thou make them.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And thou shalt set vpon the Table shewe bread before me continually.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also thou shalt make a Candlesticke of pure golde: of worke beaten out with the hammer shall the Candlesticke be made, his shaft, & his branches, his boules, his knops: and his floures shalbe of the same.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Six braunches also shall come out of the sides of it: three branches of the Candlesticke out of the one side of it, & three branches of the Candlesticke out of the other side of it.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Three boules like vnto almondes, one knop and one floure in one braunch: and three boules like almondes in the other branch, one knop and one floure: so throughout the sixe branches that come out of the Candlesticke.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And in the shaft of the Candlesticke shalbe foure boules like vnto almondes, his knops & his floures.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And there shalbe a knop vnder two branches made thereof: and a knop vnder two branches made thereof: and a knop vnder two branches made thereof, according to the sixe branches comming out of the Candlesticke.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Their knops and their branches shall bee thereof. all this shalbe one beaten worke of pure golde.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And thou shalt make the seuen lampes thereof: and the lampes thereof shalt thou put theron, to giue light toward that that is before it.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also the snuffers and snuffedishes thereof shalbe of pure golde.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Of a talent of fine gold shalt thou make it with all these instruments.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Looke therefore that thou make them after their facion, that was shewed thee in the mountaine.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Afterwarde thou shalt make the Tabernacle with tenne curtaines of fine twined linen, and blewe silke, and purple, and skarlet: and in them thou shalt make Cherubims of broydered worke.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: The length of one curtaine shalbe eight and twentie cubites, and the bredth of one curtaine, foure cubites: euery one of the curtaines shall haue one measure.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Fiue curtaines shalbe coupled one to an other: and the other fiue curtaines shall be coupled one to another.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And thou shalt make stringes of blew silke vpon the edge of the one curtaine, which is in the seluedge of the coupling: and likewise shalt thou make in the edge of the other curtaine in the seluedge, in the second coupling.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Fiftie strings shalt thou make in one curtaine, and fiftie stringes shalt thou make in the edge of the curtaine, which is in the second coupling: ye stringes shalbe one right against another.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Thou shalt make also fiftie taches of gold, and couple the curtaines one to another with the taches, and it shalbe one tabernacle.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also thou shalt make curtaines of goates heare, to be a couering vpon the Tabernacle: thou shalt make them to the number of eleuen curtaines.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: The length of a curtaine shall be thirtie cubites, and the breadth of a curtaine foure cubites: the eleuen curtaines shalbe of one measure.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And thou shalt couple fiue curtaynes by themselues, and the sixe curtaines by themselues: but thou shalt double the sixt curtaine vpon the forefront of the couering.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And thou shalt make fifty stringes in the edge of one curtayne, in the seluedge of the coupling, and fifty stringes in the edge of the other curtaine in the second coupling.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Likewise thou shalt make fifty taches of brasse, & fasten them on the strings, & shalt couple the couering together, that it may be one.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the remnant that resteth in ye curtaines of the couering, euen the halfe curtaine that resteth, shalbe left at the backeside of the Tabernacle,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: That the cubite on the one side, & the cubite on the other side of that which is left in the legth of the curtaines of ye couering, may remaine on either side of the Tabernacle to couer it.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Moreouer, for that couering thou shalt make a couering of rammes skinnes died red, and a couering of badgers skinnes aboue.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also thou shalt make boards for the Tabernacle of Shittim wood to stand vp.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Ten cubites shalbe the length of a boarde, and a cubite and an halfe cubite the breadth of one boarde.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Two tenons shalbe in one boarde set in order as the feete of a ladder, one against an other: thus shalt thou make for all the boardes of the Tabernacle.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And thou shalt make boardes for the Tabernacle, euen twenty boardes on the South side, euen full South.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And thou shalt make fourty sockets of siluer vnder the twentie boardes, two sockets vnder one boarde for his two tenons, and two sockets vnder an other boarde for his two tenons.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: In like maner on the other side of the Tabernacle towarde the North side shalbe twentie boardes,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And their fourtie sockets of siluer, two sockets vnder one boarde, and two sockets vnder another board.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And on the side of the Tabernacle, toward the West shalt thou make sixe boards.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also two boardes shalt thou make in the corners of the Tabernacle in the two sides.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also they shalbe ioyned beneath, & likewise they shalbe ioyned aboue to a ring: thus shal it be for them two: they shalbe for ye two corners.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: So they shalbe eight boardes hauing sockets of siluer, euen sixteene sockets, that is, two sockets vnder one board, and two sockets vnder an other boarde.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: The thou shalt make fiue barres of Shittim wood for the boardes of one side of the Tabernacle,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And fiue barres for the boardes of the other side of the Tabernacle: also fiue barres for the boardes of the side of the Tabernacle toward the Westside.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the middle barre shall goe through the middes of the boards, from ende to ende.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And thou shalt couer the boards with golde, and make their rings of golde, for places for the barres, & thou shalt couer the barres with golde.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: So thou shalt reare vp the Tabernacle, according to the facion thereof, which was shewed thee in the mount.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Moreouer, thou shalt make a vaile of blewe silke, and purple, and skarlet, and fine twined linen: thou shalt make it of broydred worke with Cherubims.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And thou shalt hang it vpo foure pillers of Shittim wood couered with gold, (whose hookes shalbe of gold) stading vpo foure sockets of siluer.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Afterward thou shalt hang the vaile on the hookes, that thou mayest bring in thither, that is (within the vaile) the arke of the Testimonie: and the vaile shall make you a separation betweene the Holy place and the most holy place.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also thou shalt put ye Mercy seate vpon the Arke of the testimonie in the most Holy place.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And thou shalt set the Table without the vaile, & the Candlesticke ouer against the Table on the Southside of the Tabernacle, and thou shalt set the Table on the Northside.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also thou shalt make an hanging for the dore of ye Tabernacle of blew silke, & purple, & skarlet, & fine twined linen wrought with needle.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And thou shalt make for the hanging fiue pillers of Shittim, and couer them with gold: their heads shalbe of golde, and thou shalt cast fiue sockets of brasse for them.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Moreouer thou shalt make the altar of Shittim wood, fiue cubites long and fiue cubites broade (the altar shall be foure square) and the height thereof three cubites.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And thou shalt make it hornes in the foure corners thereof: the hornes shalbe of it selfe, and thou shalt couer it with brasse.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also thou shalt make his ashpannes for his ashes and his besoms, and his basens, and his flesh-hookes, and his censers: thou shalt make all the instruments thereof of brasse.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And thou shalt make vnto it a grate like networke of brasse: also vpon that grate shalt thou make foure brasen rings vpon the foure corners thereof.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And thou shalt put it vnder the compasse of the altar beneath, that the grate may be in the middes of the altar.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also thou shalt make barres for the altar, barres, I say, of Shittim wood, and shalt couer them with brasse.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the barres thereof shalbe put in the rings, the which barres shalbe vpon the two sides of the altar to beare it.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Thou shalt make the altar holowe betwene the boardes: as God shewed thee in the mount, so shall they make it.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also thou shalt make the court of the Tabernacle in the Southside, euen full South: the court shall haue curtaines of fine twined linnen, of an hundreth cubites long, for one side,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And it shal haue twentie pillars, with their twentie sockets of brasse: the heades of the pillars, and their filets shalbe siluer.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Likewise on the Northside in length there shalbe hangings of an hundreth cubites long, and the twentie pillars thereof with their twentie sockets of brasse: the heades of the pillars and the filets shalbe siluer.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the breadth of the court on the Westside shall haue curtaines of fiftie cubites, with their ten pillars and their ten sockets.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the breadth of the court, Eastwarde full East shall haue fiftie cubites.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also hangings of fifteene cubites shalbe on the one side with their three pillars and their three sockets.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Likewise on the other side shalbe hangings of fifteene cubites, with their three pillars & their three sockets.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And in the gate of the court shalbe a vaile of twentie cubites, of blewe silke, and purple, and skarlet, and fine twined linen wrought with needle, with the foure pillars thereof and their foure sockets.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: All the pillars of the court shal haue filets of siluer round about, with their heads of siluer, and their sockets of brasse.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: The length of the court shalbe an hundreth cubites, and the breadth fiftie at either ende, & the height fiue cubites, and the hangings of fine twined linen, and their sockets of brasse.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Al the vessels of the Tabernacle for al maner seruice thereof, and all the pinnes thereof, and all the pinnes of the court shalbe brasse.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And thou shalt commande the children of Israel, that they bring vnto thee pure oyle oliue beaten, for the light, that the lampes may alway burne.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: In the Tabernacle of the Congregation without the vaile, which is before the Testimony, shall Aaron and his sonnes dresse them from euening to morning before the Lorde, for a statute for euer vnto their generations, to be obserued by the children of Israel.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And cause thou thy brother Aaron to come vnto thee and his sonnes with him, from among the children of Israel, that he may serue me in the Priestes office: I meane Aaron, Nadab, and Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar Aarons sonnes.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also thou shalt make holy garments for Aaron thy brother, glorious and beautifull.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Therefore thou shalt speake vnto al cunning men, whome I haue filled with the spirite of wisedome, that they make Aarons garments to consecrate him, that he may serue me in the Priestes office.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Nowe these shall be the garments, which they shall make, a brest plate, and an Ephod, and a robe, and a broydred coate, a miter, and a girdle. so these holy garments shall they make for Aaron thy brother, and for his sonnes, that he may serue me in the Priests office.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Therefore they shall take golde, and blew silke, and purple, and skarlet, and fine linnen,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And they shal make the Ephod of gold, blewe silke, and purple, skarlet, and fine twined linen of broydred worke.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: The two shoulders thereof shalbe ioyned together by their two edges: so shall it be closed.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the embroydred garde of the same Ephod, which shalbe vpon him, shall be of the selfe same worke and stuffe, euen of golde, blewe silke, and purple, & skarlet, & fine twined linen.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And thou shalt take two onix stones, and graue vpon them the names of the children of Israel:

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Sixe names of them vpon the one stone, and the sixe names that remaine, vpon the seconde stone, according to their generations.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Thou shalt cause to graue the two stones according to the names of the children of Israel by a grauer of signets, that worketh and graueth in stone, and shalt make them to be set and embossed in golde.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And thou shalt put the two stones vpon the shoulders of the Ephod, as stones of remebrance of the children of Israel: for Aaron shall beare their names before the Lorde vpon his two shoulders for a remembrance.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: So thou shalt make bosses of golde,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And two cheynes of fine golde at the ende, of wrethed worke shalt thou make them, and shalt fasten the wrethed cheynes vpon the bosses.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also thou shalt make the brest plate of iudgement with broydred worke: like the worke of the Ephod shalt thou make it: of gold, blewe silke, and purple, and skarlet, and fine twined linen shalt thou make it.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Foure square it shall be and double, an hand bredth long and an hand bredth broade.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then thou shalt set it full of places for stones, euen foure rowes of stones: the order shalbe this, a rubie, a topaze, and a carbuncle in the first rowe.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And in the seconde rowe thou shalt set an emeraude, a saphir, and a diamonde.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And in the third rowe a turkeis, an achate, and an hematite.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And in the fourth rowe a chrysolite, an onix, and a iasper: and they shall be set in golde in their embossements.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the stones shall be according to the names of the children of Israel, twelue, according to their names, grauen as signets, euerye one after his name, and they shall bee for the twelue tribes.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then thou shalt make vpon the breast plate two cheines at the endes of wrethen worke of pure golde.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Thou shalt make also vpon the brest plate two rings of golde, and put the two rings on the two endes of the brest plate.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And thou shalt put the two wrethen chaynes of golde in the two rings in the endes of the brest plate.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the other two endes of the two wrethen cheines, thou shalt fasten in ye two embossements, and shalt put them vpon the shoulders of the Ephod on the foreside of it.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also thou shalt make two rings of gold, which thou shalt put in the two other endes of the brest plate, vpon the border thereof, towarde the inside of the Ephod.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And two other rings of golde thou shalt make, and put them on the two sides of the Ephod, beneath in the forepart of it ouer against the coupling of it vpon the broydred garde of the Ephod.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Thus they shall binde the brest plate by his rings vnto the rings of the Ephod, with a lace of blewe silke, that it may be fast vpon the broydred garde of the Ephod, and that the brest plate be not loosed from the Ephod.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: So Aaron shall beare the names of the children of Israel in the brest plate of iudgement vpon his heart, when he goeth into the holy place, for a remembrance continually before the Lorde.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also thou shalt put in the brest plate of iudgement the Vrim and the Thummim, which shalbe vpon Aarons heart, when he goeth in before the Lord: and Aaron shall beare the iudgement of the children of Israel vpon his heart before the Lord continually.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And thou shalt make the robe of the Ephod altogether of blewe silke.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the hole for his head shalbe in the middes of it, hauing an edge of wouen woorke rounde about the coller of it: so it shalbe as the coller of an habergeon that it rent not.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And beneath vpon the skirtes thereof thou shalt make pomegranates of blew silke, and purple, & skarlet, round about the skirts thereof, and belles of gold betweene them round about:

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: That is, a golden bell and a pomegranate, a golden bell and a pomegranate rounde about vpon the skirtes of the robe.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: So it shalbe vpon Aaron, when he ministreth, and his sound shalbe heard, when he goeth into the holy place before the Lorde, and when he commeth out, and he shall not dye.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also thou shalt make a plate of pure golde, and graue thereon, as signets are grauen, Holines To The Lord,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And thou shalt put it on a blew silke lace, and it shalbe vpon the miter: euen vpon the fore front of the miter shall it be.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: So it shalbe vpon Aarons forehead, that Aaron may beare the iniquitie of the offrings, which the children of Israel shall offer in all their holy offrings: and it shall be alwayes vpon his forehead, to make them acceptable before the Lorde.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Likewise thou shalt embroyder the fine line coat, & thou shalt make a miter of fine line, but thou shalt make a girdell of needle worke.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also thou shalt make for Aarons sonnes coates, & thou shalt make the girdels, & bonets shalt thou make them for glorie & comelinesse.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And thou shalt put them vpon Aaron thy brother, and on his sonnes with him, and shalt anoint them, and fill their handes, and sanctifie them, that they may minister vnto me in the Priestes office.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Thou shalt also make them linen breeches to couer their priuities: from the loynes vnto the thighs shall they reache.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And they shalbe for Aaron & his sonnes when they come into the Tabernacle of the Congregation, or whe they come vnto the altar to minister in the holy place, that they commit not iniquitie, and so die. This shalbe a lawe for euer vnto him and to his seede after him.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: This thing also shalt thou do vnto them whe thou consecratest them to be my Priestes, Take a yong calfe, & two rams wtout blemish,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And vnleauened bread and cakes vnleauened tempered with oyle, and wafers vnleauened anoynted with oyle: (of fine wheate flowre shalt thou make them)

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then thou shalt put them in one basket, and present them in the basket with the calfe and the two rammes,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And shalt bring Aaron and his sonnes vnto the doore of the Tabernacle of the Congregation, and wash them with water.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also thou shalt take the garments, and put vpon Aaron the tunicle, and the robe of the Ephod, and the Ephod, and the brest plate, and shalt close them to him with the broidred garde of the Ephod.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then thou shalt put the miter vpon his head, & shalt put the holy crowne vpon ye miter.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And thou shalt take the anoynting oyle, and shalt powre vpon his head, and anoynt him.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And thou shalt bring his sonnes, and put coates vpon them,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And shalt girde them with girdles, both Aaron and his sonnes: and shalt put the bonets on them, and the Priestes office shalbe theirs for a perpetuall lawe: thou shalt also fill the hands of Aaron, and the hands of his sonnes.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: After, thou shalt present the calfe before the Tabernacle of the Congregation, and Aaron and his sonnes shall put their handes vpon the head of the calfe.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: So thou shalt kill the calfe before the Lord, at the doore of the Tabernacle of the Congregation.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then thou shalt take of the blood of the calfe, and put it vpon the hornes of the altar with thy finger, and shalt powre al the rest of the blood at the foote of the altar.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also thou shalt take all the fat that couereth the inwardes, and the kall, that is on the liuer, and the two kidneis, and the fat that is vpon them, and shalt burne them vpon the altar.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: But the flesh of the calfe, and his skin, and his doung shalt thou burne with fire without the hoste: it is a sinne offring.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Thou shalt also take one ramme, and Aron and his sonnes shall put their hands vpon the head of the ramme.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then thou shalt kil the ramme, & take his blood, & sprinkle it round about vpon the altar,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And thou shalt cut the ramme in pieces, and wash the inwards of him and his legges, and shalt put them vpon the pieces thereof, and vpon his head.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: So thou shalt burne the whole ram vpon the altar: for it is a burnt offering vnto the Lord for a sweete sauour: it is an offering made by fire vnto the Lord.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And thou shalt take the other ramme, & Aaron and his sonnes shall put their handes vpon the head of the ramme.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then thou shalt kill the ramme, & take of his blood and put it vpon the lappe of Aarons eare, and vpon the lappe of the right eare of his sonnes, and vpon the thumbe of their right hand, and vpon the great toe of their right foote, and shalt sprinkle the blood vpon ye altar roud about.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And thou shalt take of the blood that is vpon the altar, and of the anoynting oyle, and shalt sprinkle it vpon Aaron, and vpon his garments, and vpon his sonnes, and vpon the garments of his sonnes with him: so he shall be halowed, and his clothes, and his sonnes, and the garments of his sonnes with him.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also thou shalt take of the rammes ye fatte & the rumpe, euen the fat that couereth the inwards, and the kall of the liuer, and the two kidneis, and the fat that is vpon them, & the ryght shoulder, (for it is the ramme of consecration)

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And one loafe of bread, and one cake of bread tempered with oyle, and one wafer, out of the basket of the vnleauened bread that is before the Lorde.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And thou shalt put al this in the handes of Aaron, and in the handes of his sonnes, and shalt shake them to and fro before the Lorde.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Againe, thou shalt receyue them of their handes, & burne them vpon the altar besides the burnt offring for a sweete sauour before ye Lord: for this is an offering made by fire vnto the Lord.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Likewise thou shalt take the brest of the ram of the consecration, which is for Aaron, and shalt shake it to and fro before the Lord and it shalbe thy part.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And thou shalt sanctifie the brest of the shaken offering, and the shoulder of the heaue offering, which was shaken to and fro, and which was heaued vp of the ramme of the consecration, which was for Aaro, & which was for his sonnes.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And Aaron and his sonnes shall haue it by a statute for euer, of the children of Israel: for it is an heaue offering, and it shal be an heaue offering of the children of Israel, of their peace offerings, euen their heaue offering to the Lord.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the holy garmets, which apperteine to Aaron, shall bee his sonnes after him, to bee anoynted therein, and to bee consecrate therein.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: That sonne that shalbe Priest in his steade, shall put them on seuen dayes, when he commeth into the Tabernacle of the Congregation to minister in the holy place.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: So thou shalt take the ram of the consecration, and seeth his flesh in the holy place.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And Aaron and his sonnes shall eate the flesh of the ram, & the bread that is in the basket, at the doore of ye Tabernacle of ye Congregation.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: So they shall eate these thinges, whereby their attonement was made, to consecrate them, and to sanctifie them: but a stranger shall not eate thereof, because they are holy things.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Now if ought of the flesh of the consecration, or of the bread remaine vnto the morning, then thou shalt burne the rest with fire: it shall not be eaten, because it is an holie thing.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Therefore shalt thou doe thus vnto Aaron & vnto his sonnes, according to all things, which I haue commanded thee: seuen dayes shalt thou consecrate them,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And shalt offer euery day a calfe for a sinne offring, for reconciliation: and thou shalt cleanse the altar, when thou hast offred vpon it for reconciliation, and shalt annoynt it, to sanctifie it.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Seuen dayes shalt thou cleanse the altar, & sanctifie it, so the altar shalbe most holy: and whatsoeuer toucheth the altar, shalbe holy.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Nowe this is that which thou shalt present vpon the altar: euen two lambes of one yere olde, day by day continually.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: The one lambe thou shalt present in the morning, and the other lambe thou shalt present at euen.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And with the one lambe, a tenth part of fine floure mingled with the fourth part of an Hin of beaten oyle, and the fourth part of an Hin of wine, for a drinke offring.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the other lambe thou shalt present at euen: thou shalt doe thereto according to the offring of the morning, and according to the drinke offring thereof, to be a burnt offring for a sweete sauour vnto, the Lorde.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: This shalbe a continuall burnt offring in your generations at the doore of the Tabernacle of the Congregation before the Lord, where I wil make appoyntment with you, to speake there vnto thee.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: There I will appoynt with the children of Israel, and the place shall bee sanctified by my glorie.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And I will sanctifie the Tabernacle of the Congregation and the altar: I will sanctifie also Aaron & his sonnes to be my Priests,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And I will dwell among the children of Israel, and will bee their God.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then shall they knowe that I am ye Lord their God, that brought them out of the lande of Egypt, that I might dwell among them: I am the Lord their God.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Fvrthermore thou shalt make an altar for sweete perfume, of Shittim wood thou shalt make it.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: The length therof a cubite and the breadth thereof a cubite (it shalbe foure square) and the height thereof two cubites: the hornes thereof shalbe of the same,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And thou shalt ouerlay it with fine golde, both the toppe therof and the sides thereof round about, and his hornes: also thou shalt make vnto it a crowne of gold round about.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Besides this thou shalt make vnder this crowne two golden rings on either side: euen on euery side shalt thou make them, that they may be as places for the barres to beare it withall.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: The which barres thou shalt make of Shittim wood, and shalt couer them with golde.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: After thou shalt set it before the vaile, that is neere the Arke of Testimonie, before the Merciseate that is vpon the Testimonie, where I will appoynt with thee.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And Aaron shall burne thereon sweete incense euery morning: when hee dresseth the lampes thereof, shall he burne it.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Likewise at eue, when Aaron setteth vp the lampes thereof, he shall burne incense: this perfume shalbe perpetually before ye Lord, throughout your generations.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Ye shall offer no strange incense thereon, nor burnt sacrifice, nor offring, neither powre any drinke offring thereon.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And Aaron shall make reconciliation vpon the hornes of it once in a yere with the blood of the sinne offring in the day of reconciliation: once in the yeere shall hee make reconciliation vpon it throughout your generations: this is most holy vnto the Lord.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Afterward the Lord spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: When thou takest the summe of the children of Israel after their nomber, then they shall giue euery man a redemption of his life vnto the Lord, when thou tellest them, that there bee no plague among the when thou countest them.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: This shall euery man giue, that goeth into the nomber, halfe a shekel, after the shekel of the Sanctuarie: ( a shekel is twentie gerahs) the halfe shekel shalbe an offring to the Lord.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: All that are nombred from twentie yeere olde and aboue, shall giue an offring to the Lord.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: The rich shall not passe, and the poore shall not diminish from halfe a shekel, when ye shall giue an offring vnto the Lorde, for the redemption of your liues.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: So thou shalt take the money of the redemption of the children of Israel, and shalt put it vnto the vse of the Tabernacle of the Congregation, that it may be a memoriall vnto the children of Israel before the Lorde for the redemption of your liues.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also the Lord spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Thou shalt also make a lauer of brasse, and his foote of brasse to wash, and shalt put it betweene the Tabernacle of the Congregation and the Altar, and shalt put water therein.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: For Aaron and his sonnes shall wash their hands and their feete thereat.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: When they go into the Tabernacle of the Congregation, or when they goe vnto the Altar to minister and to make the perfume of ye burnt offring to the Lorde, they shall wash themselues with water, lest they die.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: So they shall wash their handes and their feete that they die not: and this shall be to them an ordinance for euer, both vnto him and to his seede throughout their generations.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also the Lord spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Take thou also vnto thee, principall spices of the most pure myrrhe fiue hundreth shekels, of sweete cinamon halfe so much, that is, two hundreth and fiftie, and of sweete calamus, two hundreth, and fiftie:

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also of cassia fiue hundreth, after the shekel of the Sanctuarie, & of oyle oliue an Hin.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: So thou shalt make of it the oyle of holie oyntment, euen a most precious oyntment after the arte of the Apothecarie: this shalbe the oyle of holy oyntment.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And thou shalt anoynt the Tabernacle of the Congregation therewith, and the Arke of the Testimonie:

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also the Table, & al the instruments thereof, and the Candlesticke, with all the instruments thereof, and the altar of incense:

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also the Altar of burnt offring with al his instruments, and the lauer and his foote.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: So thou shalt sanctifie them, & they shalbe most holy: all that shal touch them, shalbe holy.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Thou shalt also anoint Aaron & his sonnes, & shalt consecrate them, that they may minister vnto me in the Priests office.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Moreouer thou shalt speake vnto the children of Israel, saying, This shalbe an holy oynting oyle vnto me, throughout your generations.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: None shal anoynt, mans flesh therewith, neither shall ye make any composition like vnto it: for it is holy, and shalbe holy vnto you.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Whosoeuer shal make the like oyntment, or whosoeuer shal put any of it vpon a stranger, euen he shalbe cut off from his people.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the Lord sayd vnto Moses, Take vnto thee these spices, pure myrrhe and cleare gumme and galbanum, these odours with pure frankincense, of eche like weight:

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then thou shalt make of them perfume composed after the arte of the apothecarie, mingled together, pure and holy.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And thou shalt beate it to pouder, & shalt put of it before the Arke of the Testimonie in the Tabernacle of ye Cogregatio, where I wil make appointmet with thee: it shalbe vnto you most holy.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And ye shal not make vnto you any compositio like this perfume, which thou shalt make: it shalbe vnto thee holy for the Lord.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Whosoeuer shal make like vnto that to smell thereto, euen he shalbe cut off from his people.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the Lord spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Behold, I haue called by name, Bezaleel the sonne of Vri, the sonne of Hur of the tribe of Iudah,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Whom I haue filled with the Spirit of God, in wisedome, and in vnderstanding and in knowledge and in all workmanship:

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: To finde out curious workes to worke in golde, and in siluer, and in brasse,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also in the arte to set stones, & to carue in timber, & to worke in all maner of workmaship.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And behold, I haue ioyned with him Aholiab the sonne of Ahisamach of the tribe of Dan, & in the hearts of all that are wise hearted, haue I put wisdome to make all that I haue commanded thee:

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: That is, the Tabernacle of the Congregation, and the Arke of the Testimonie, & the Merciseate that shalbe therupon, with all instruments of the Tabernacle:

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also the Table & the instruments thereof, and the pure Candlesticke with all his instruments, and the Altar of perfume:

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Likewise the Altar of burnt offring with al his instruments, and the Lauer with his foote:

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also the garments of the ministration, & ye holy garments for Aaron ye Priest, & the garmets of his sonnes, to minister in the Priestes office,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the anoynting oyle, and sweete perfume for the Sanctuarie: according to all that I haue commanded thee, shal they do.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Afterwarde the Lord spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Speake thou also vnto the children of Israel, and say, Notwithstanding keepe yee my Sabbaths: for it is a signe betweene me and you in your generations, that ye may know that I the Lord do sanctifie you.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Ye shall therefore keepe the Sabbath: for it is holy vnto you: he that defileth it, shal die the death: therefore whosoeuer worketh therin, the same person shalbe euen cut off from among his people.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Sixe dayes shall men worke, but in the seuenth day is the Sabbath of the holy rest to the Lord: whosoeuer doeth any worke in the Sabbath day, shall dye the death.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Wherfore the children of Israel shal keepe the Sabbath, that they may obserue the rest throughout their generations for an euerlasting couenant.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: It is a signe betweene me and the children of Israel for euer: for in sixe dayes the Lorde made the heauen and the earth, & in the seuenth day he ceased, and rested.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Thus (when the Lord had made an ende of communing with Moses vpon mount Sinai) he gaue him two Tables of the Testimonie, euen tables of stone, written with the finger of God.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Bvt when the people sawe, that Moses taryed long or he came downe from the mountaine, the people gathered themselues together against Aaron, and sayde vnto him, Vp, make vs gods to goe before vs: for of this Moses (the man that brought vs out of the land of Egypt) we knowe not what is become of him.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And Aaron said vnto them, Plucke off the golden earings, which are in the eares of your wiues, of your sonnes, and of your daughters, and bring them vnto me.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then all ye people pluckt fro them selues the golden earings, which were in their eares, and they brought them vnto Aaron.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Who receiued them at their handes, and facioned it with the grauing toole, & made of it a molte calfe: then they said, These be thy gods, O Israel, which brought thee out of ye lad of Egypt

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: When Aaron sawe that, he made an Altar before it: and Aaron proclaimed, saying, To morow shalbe the holy day of the Lord.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: So they rose vp the next day in the morning, and offred burnt offerings, & brought peace offrings: also the people sate them downe to eate and drinke, and rose vp to play.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then the Lord said vnto Moses, Go, get thee downe: for thy people which thou hast brought out of the land of Egypt, hath corrupted their wayes.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: They are soone turned out of the way, which I commanded them: for they haue made them a molten calfe and haue worshipped it, and haue offered thereto, saying, These be thy gods, O Israel, which haue brought thee out of the lande of Egypt.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Againe the Lord said vnto Moses, I haue seene this people, and beholde, it is a stiffe necked people.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Nowe therefore let mee alone, that my wrath may waxe hote against them, for I wil consume the: but I wil make of thee a mighty people.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: But Moses praied vnto the Lord his God, and said, O Lord, why doeth thy wrath waxe hote against thy people, which thou hast brought out of the lande of Egypt, with great power and with a mightie hand?

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Wherefore shall the Egyptians speake, and say, He hath brought them out maliciously for to slay them in the mountaines, and to consume them from the earth? turne from thy fearce wrath, and change thy minde from this euill towarde thy people.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Remember Abraham, Izhak, and Israel thy seruants, to whom thou swarest by thine owne selfe, and saydest vnto them, I wil multiply your seede, as the starres of the heauen, & all this land, that I haue spoken of, wil I giue vnto your seede, and they shal inherit it for euer.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then the Lord changed his minde fro the euil, which he threatned to do vnto his people.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: So Moses returned and went downe from the mountaine with the two Tables of the Testimonie in his hande: the Tables were written on both their sides, euen on the one side and on the other were they written.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And these Tables were the worke of God, and this writing was the writing of God grauen in the Tables.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And when Ioshua heard the noyse of the people, as they shouted, he said vnto Moses, There is a noyse of warre in the hoste.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Who answered, It is not the noyse of them that haue the victorie, nor the noyse of them that are ouercome: but I do heare ye noyse of singing.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Nowe, as soone as he came neere vnto the hoste, he sawe the calfe and the dancing: so Moses wrath waxed hote, and he cast the Tables out of his handes, and brake them in pieces beneath the mountaine.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: After, he tooke the calfe, which they had made, and burned it in the fire, and ground it vnto powder, and strowed it vpon the water, & made the children of Israel drinke of it.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also Moses said vnto Aaron, What did this people vnto thee, that thou hast brought so great a sinne vpon them?

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then Aaron answered, Let not the wrath of my Lord waxe fearce: Thou knowest this people, that they are euen set on mischiefe.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And they sayde vnto me, Make vs gods to go before vs: for we knowe not what is become of this Moses (the man that brought vs out of the land of Egypt.)

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then I sayde to them, Ye that haue golde, plucke it off: and they brought it me, & I did cast it into the fire, and thereof came this calfe.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Moses therefore sawe that the people were naked (for Aaron had made them naked vnto their shame among their enemies)

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And Moses stoode in ye gate of the campe, and sayde, Who pertaineth to the Lorde? let him come to mee; all the sonnes of Leui gathered themselues vnto him.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then he said vnto them, Thus sayth ye Lord God of Israel, Put euery man his sworde by his side: go to and fro, from gate to gate, through the hoste, and slay euery man his brother, and euery man his companion, & euery man his neighbour.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: So the children of Leui did as Moses had commanded: and there fel of the people the same day about three thousand men.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: (For Moses had said, Cosecrate your hands vnto the Lord this day, euen euery man vpon his sonne, and vpon his brother, that there may be giuen you a blessing this day)

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And when the morning came, Moses sayde vnto the people, Yee haue committed a grieuous crime: but now I wil goe vp to the Lord, if I may pacifie him for your sinne.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Moses therefore went againe vnto ye Lord, and said, Oh, this people haue sinned a great sinne, and haue made them gods of golde.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Therefore now if thou pardon their sinne, thy mercy shal appeare: but if thou wilt not, I pray thee, rase me out of thy booke, which thou hast written.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then the Lord sayd to Moses, Whosoeuer hath sinned against me, I will put out of my booke.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Go nowe therefore, bring the people vnto the place which I commanded thee: behold, mine Angel shal goe before thee, but yet in the day of my visitation I wil visite their sinne vpon them.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: So the Lorde plagued the people, because they caused Aaro to make ye calfe which he made.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Afterward the Lord sayd vnto Moses, Depart, goe vp from hence, thou, and the people (which thou hast brought vp out of lande of Egypt) vnto the lande which I sware vnto Abraham, to Izhak and to Iaakob, saying, Vnto thy seede will I giue it.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And I will send an Angel before thee & will cast out the Canaanites, the Amorites, and the Hittites, and the Perizzites, the Hiuites, and the Iebusites:

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: To a lande, I say, that floweth with milke and hony: for I will not goe vp with thee, because thou art a stiffe necked people, least I consume thee in the way.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And when the people heard this euill tydings, they sorowed, and no man put on his best rayment.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: (For the Lord had said to Moses, Say vnto the children of Israel, Ye are a stiffe necked people, I wil come suddenly vpon thee, and consume thee: therefore now put thy costly rayment from thee, that I may know what to do vnto thee)

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: So the children of Israel layed their good raiment from them, after Moses came downe from the mount Horeb.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then Moses tooke his tabernacle, and pitched it without the host farre off from the hoste, & called it Ohel-moed; whe any did seeke to the Lord, he went out vnto the Tabernacle of the Congregation, which was without the hoste.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And when Moses went out vnto the Tabernacle, all the people rose vp, and stood euery man at his tent doore, and looked after Moses, vntil he was gone into the Tabernacle.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And assoone as Moses was entred into the Tabernacle, the cloudie pillar descended & stood at the doore of the Tabernacle, and the Lord talked with Moses.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Nowe when all the people saw the cloudie pillar stand at the Tabernacle doore, all the people rose vp, and worshipped euery man in his tent doore.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the Lord spake vnto Moses, face to face, as a man speaketh vnto his friende. After he turned againe into the hoste, but his seruant Ioshua the sonne of Nun a yong man, departed not out of the Tabernacle.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then Moses sayde vnto the Lorde, See, thou sayest vnto me, Leade this people forth, and thou hast not shewed me whom thou wilt sende with mee: thou hast sayde moreouer, I knowe thee by name, and thou hast also found grace in my sight.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Nowe therefore, I pray thee, if I haue founde fauour in thy sight, shewe mee nowe thy way, that I may knowe thee, and that I may finde grace in thy sight: consider also that this nation is thy people.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And he answered, My presence shal go with thee, and I will giue thee rest.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then he sayd vnto him, If thy presence go not with vs, cary vs not hence.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And wherein nowe shal it be knowen, that I and thy people haue found fauour in thy sight? Shall it not be when thou goest with vs? so I, and thy people shall haue preeminence before all the people that are vpon the earth.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the Lord sayde vnto Moses, I will doe this also that thou hast saide: for thou hast founde grace in my sight, and I knowe thee by name.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Againe he sayde, I beseech thee, shewe me thy glory.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And he answered, I wil make all my good go before thee, and I wil proclaime the Name of the Lord before thee: for I will shewe mercy to whom I will shewe mercy, and will haue compassion on whom I will haue compassion.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Furthermore he sayde, Thou canst not see my face, for there shall no man see me, and liue.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also the Lord sayd, Behold, there is a place by me, and thou shalt stand vpon the rocke:

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And while my glory passeth by, I will put thee in a cleft of the rocke, and will couer thee with mine hand whiles I passe by.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: After I will take away mine hande, & thou shalt see my backe parts: but my face shal not be seene.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the Lord saide vnto Moses, Hewe thee two Tables of stone, like vnto the first, and I will write vpon the Tables the wordes that were in the first Tables, which thou brakest in pieces.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And be ready in ye morning, that thou mayest come vp earely vnto the mount of Sinai, and waite there for me in the top of the mount.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: But let no man come vp with thee, neither let any man be seene throughout all the mount, neyther let the sheepe nor cattell feede before this mount.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then Moses hewed two Tables of stone like vnto the first, and rose vp earely in the morning, and went vp vnto the mount of Sinai, as the Lord had commanded him, & tooke in his hande two Tables of stone.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the Lorde descended in the cloude, and stoode with him there, and proclaimed the name of the Lord.

Book.Name: Exodus
