Text: So the Lord passed before his face, and cried, The Lord, the Lord, strong, mercifull, & gracious, slowe to anger, and abundant in goodnesse and trueth,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Reseruing mercy for thousands, forgiuing iniquitie, and transgression and sinne, and not making the wicked innocent, visiting the iniquitie of the fathers vpon ye children, & vpon childrens children, vnto the third and fourth generation.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then Moses made haste & bowed him selfe to the earth, and worshipped,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And sayde, O Lorde, I pray thee, If I haue founde grace in thy sight, that the Lorde woulde nowe goe with vs ( for it is a stiffe necked people) and pardon our iniquitie and our sinne, and take vs for thine inheritance.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And he answered, Behold, I will make a couenant before all thy people, and will do marueiles, such as haue not bene done in all the worlde, neyther in all nations: and all the people among whom thou art, shal see the worke of the Lord: for it is a terrible thing that I will do with thee.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Keepe diligently that which I commande thee this day: Beholde, I will cast out before thee the Amorites, and the Canaanites, and the Hittites, and the Perizzites, and the Hiuites, and the Iebusites.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Take heede to thy selfe, that thou make no compact with ye inhabitantes of the land whither thou goest, least they be the cause of ruine among you:

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: But yee shall ouerthrowe their altars, and breake their images in pieces, & cut downe their groues,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: (For thou shalt bow downe to none other god, because the Lord, whose Name is Ielous, is a ielous God)

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Lest thou make a compact with the inhabitantes of the lande, and when they goe a whoring after their gods, and doe sacrifice vnto their gods, some man call thee, & thou eate of his sacrifice:

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And least thou take of their daughters vnto thy sonnes, and their daughters goe a whoring after their gods, and make thy sonnes goe a whoring after their gods.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Thou shalt make thee no gods of metall.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: The feast of vnleauened bread shalt thou keepe: seuen dayes shalt thou eate vnleauened bread, as I commanded thee, in ye time of the moneth of Abib: for in the moneth of Abib thou camest out of Egypt.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Euery male, that first openeth the wombe, shalbe mine: also all the first borne of thy flocke shalbe rekoned mine, both of beeues and sheepe.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: But ye first of ye asse thou shalt bie out with a lambe: and if thou redeeme him not, then thou shalt breake his necke: all the first borne of thy sonnes shalt thou redeeme, and none shal appeare before me emptie.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Six dayes shalt thou worke, and in the seuenth day thou shalt rest: both in earing time, and in the haruest thou shalt rest.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Thou shalt also obserue the feast of weekes in the time of ye first fruits of wheate haruest, and the feast of gathering fruites in the ende of the yere.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Thrise in a yere shal all your men children appeare before the Lorde Iehouah God of Israel.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: For I wil cast out the nations before thee, and enlarge thy coasts, so that no man shall desire thy land, whe thou shalt come vp to appeare before the Lord thy God thrise in the yeere.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Thou shalt not offer the blood of my sacrifice with leauen, neither shall ought of the sacrifice of the feast of Passeouer be left vnto the morning.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: The first ripe fruites of thy land thou shalt bring vnto the house of the Lorde thy God: yet shalt thou not seethe a kid in his mothers milke.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the Lord said vnto Moses, Write thou these words: for after the tenour of these words I haue made a couenant with thee & with Israel.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: So hee was there with the Lorde fourtie dayes and fourtie nights, and did neither eat bread nor drinke water: and hee wrote in the Tables the wordes of the couenant, euen the tenne commandements.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: So when Moses came downe fro mount Sinai, the two Tables of the Testimonie were in Moses hande, as hee descended from the mount: (nowe Moses wist not that the skinne of his face shone bright, after that God had talked with him.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And Aaron and all the children of Israel looked vpon Moses, and beholde, the skin of his face shone bright, and they were afraid to come neere him)

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: But Moses called them: and Aaron and all the chiefe of the congregatio returned vnto him: and Moses talked with them.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And afterwarde all the children of Israel came neere, and he charged them with al that the Lord had said vnto him in mount Sinai.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: So Moses made an end of comuning with them, and had put a couering vpon his face.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: But, when Moses came before the Lorde to speake with him, he tooke off the couering vntill he came out: then he came out, and spake vnto the children of Israel that which he was commanded.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the children of Israel sawe the face of Moses, howe the skin of Moses face shone bright: therefore Moses put the couering vpon his face, vntill he went to speake with God.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then Moses assembled all the Congregation of the children of Israel, and sayd vnto them, These are the wordes which the Lord hath commanded, that ye should do them:

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Six dayes thou shalt work, but the seuenth day shall bee vnto you the holy Sabbath of rest vnto the Lord: whosoeuer doth any worke therein, shall die.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Ye shall kindle no fire throughout all your habitations vpon the Sabbath day.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Againe, Moses spake vnto all the Congregation of the children of Israel, saying, This is the thing which the Lord commandeth, saying,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Take from among you an offering vnto the Lorde: whosoeuer is of a willing heart, let him bring this offring to the Lord, namely golde, and siluer, and brasse:

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also blewe silke, and purple, and skarlet, and fine linen, and goates heare,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And rams skins died red, and badgers skins with Shittim wood:

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also oyle for light, and spices for the anointing oyle, and for the sweete incense,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And onix stones, and stones to be set in the Ephod, and in the brest plate.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And all the wise hearted among you, shall come and make all that the Lord hath commanded:

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: That is, the Tabernacle, that pauilion thereof, and his couering, and his taches & his boards, his barres, his pillars and his sockets,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: The Arke, and the barres thereof ye Merci-seate, and the vaile that couereth it,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: The Table, and the barres of it, and all the instruments thereof, and the shewe bread:

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also the Candlesticke of light and his instrumentes, and his lampes with the oyle for the light:

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Likewise the Altar of perfume and his barres, and the anoynting oyle, and the sweete incense, and the vaile of the doore at the entring in of the Tabernacle,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: The Altar of burnt offering with his brasen grate, his barres and all his instrumentes, the Lauer and his foote,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: The hangings of the court, his pillars & his sockets, and the vaile of the gate of the court,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: The pinnes of the Tabernacle, & the pinnes of the court with their cordes,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: The ministring garments to minister in the holy place, and the holy garments for Aaron the Priest, and the garmentes of his sonnes, that they may minister in the Priests office.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then all the Congregation of the children of Israel departed from the presence of Moses.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And euery one, whose heart encouraged him, & euery one, whose spirit made him willing, came and brought an offring to the Lord, for the worke of the Tabernacle of the Congregation, & for all his vses, and for the holy garments.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Both men & women, as many as were free hearted, came and brought taches and earings, and rings, and bracelets, all were iewels of golde: and euery one that offered an offring of gold vnto the Lord:

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Euery man also, which had blewe silke, and purple, and skarlet, & fine linen, and goates heare, and rammes skinnes died red, and badgers skins, brought them.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: All that offered an oblation of siluer and of brasse, brought the offring vnto the Lord: and euery one, that had Shittim wood for any maner worke of the ministration, brought it.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And all the women that were wise hearted, did spin with their hands, and brought ye spun worke, euen the blewe silke, and the purple, the skarlet, and the fine linen.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Likewise al the women, whose hearts were moued with knowledge, spun goates heare.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And ye rulers brought onix stones, & stones to be set in the Ephod, and in the brest plate:

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also spice, and oyle for light, and for the anoynting oyle, and for the sweete perfume.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Euery man and woman of the children of Israel, whose hearts moued the willingly to bring for all the worke which the Lorde had commanded the to make by the hand of Moses, brought a free offring to the Lord.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then Moses sayde vnto the children of Israel, Beholde, the Lord hath called by name Bezaleel the sonne of Vri, the sonne of Hur of the tribe of Iudah,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And hath filled him with an excellent spirit of wisdome, of vnderstanding, and of knowledge, and in all maner worke,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: To finde out curious workes, to worke in golde, and in siluer, and in brasse,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And in grauing stones to set them, and in karuing of wood, euen to make any maner of fine worke.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And he hath put in his heart that hee may teach other: both hee, and Aholiab the sonne of Ahisamach of the tribe of Dan:

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Them hath he filled with wisdome of heart to worke all maner of cunning and broidred, and needle worke: in blewe silke, and in purple, in skarlet, and in fine linnen and weauing, euen to do all maner of worke and subtill inuentions.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then wrought Bezaleel, and Aholiab, and all cunning men, to whome the Lorde gaue wisedome, and vnderstanding, to knowe howe to worke all maner worke for the seruice of the Sanctuarie, according to all that the Lorde had commanded.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: For Moses had called Bezaleel, and Aholiab, and all the wise hearted men, in whose heartes the Lorde had giuen wisedome, euen as many as their hearts encouraged to come vnto that worke to worke it.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And they receiued of Moses all the offering which the children of Israel had brought for the worke of the seruice of the Sanctuary, to make it: also they brought still vnto him free giftes euery morning.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: So all the wise men, that wrought all the holy worke, came euery man from his worke which they wrought,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And spake to Moses, saying, The people bring too much, and more then ynough for the vse of the worke, which the Lord hath commanded to be made.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then Moses gaue a commandement, and they caused it to be proclaymed throughout the hoste, saying, Let neither man nor woman prepare any more worke for the oblation of the Sanctuarie. So the people were stayed from offring.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: For the stuffe they had, was sufficient for all the worke to make it, and too much.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: All the cunning men therefore among the workemen, made for the Tabernacle ten curtaines of fine twined linnen, and of blewe silke, and purple, and skarlet: Cherubims of broydred worke made they vpon them.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: The length of one curtaine was twentie & eight cubits, & the breadth of one curtaine foure cubites: and the curtaines were all of one cise.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And he coupled fiue curtaines together, & other fiue coupled he together.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And he made strings of blewe silke by the edge of one curtaine, in the seluedge of the coupling: likewise he made on the side of the other curtaine in the seluedge in the second coupling.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Fiftie strings made he in the one curtaine, and fiftie strings made he in the edge of the other curtaine, which was in the second coupling: the strings were set one against another.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: After, he made fiftie taches of golde, and coupled the curtaines one to another with the taches: so was it one Tabernacle.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also he made curtaines of goates heare for the couering vpon the Tabernacle: he made them to the nomber of eleuen curtaines.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: The length of one curtaine had thirtie cubites, & the bredth of one curtaine foure cubites: the eleuen curtaines were of one cise.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And hee coupled fiue curtaines by themselues, and sixe curtaines by themselues:

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also he made fiftie strings vpon the edge of one curtaine in the seluedge in the coupling, & fiftie strings made hee vpon the edge of the other curtaine in the second coupling.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: He made also fiftie taches of brasse to couple the couering that it might be one.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And he made a couering vpon the pauilion of rams skinnes dyed red, and a couering of badgers skinnes aboue.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Likewise he made the boards for the Tabernacle, of Shittim wood to stand vp.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: The length of a board was ten cubites, and the bredth of one board was a cubite, & an halfe.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: One board had two tenons, set in order as the feete of a ladder, one against another: thus made he for all the boardes of the Tabernacle.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: So he made twentie boardes for the South side of the Tabernacle, euen full South.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And fourtie sockets of siluer made he vnder the twentie boardes, two sockets vnder one board for his two tenons, and two sockets vnder another board for his two tenons.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also for the other side of the Tabernacle toward the North, he made twentie boards,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And their fourtie sockets of siluer, two sockets vnder one board, and two sockets vnder another boarde.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Likewise toward the Westside of the Tabernacle he made sixe boardes.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And two boardes made he in the corners of the Tabernacle, for either side,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And they were ioyned beneath, and likewise were made sure aboue with a ring: thus he did to both in both corners.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: So there were eight boards & their sixteene sockets of siluer, vnder euery board two sockets.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: After, he made barres of Shittim wood, fiue for the boards in ye one side of ye Tabernacle,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And fiue barres for the boardes in the other side of the Tabernacle, and fiue barres for the boards of the Tabernacle on the side toward the West.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And he made the middest barre to shoote through the boards, from the one end to ye other.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: He ouerlayd also the boards with gold, and made their rings of gold for places for the barres, and couered the barres with golde.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Moreouer he made a vaile of blew silke, and purple, & of skarlet, and of fine twined linen: with Cherubims of broydred worke made he it:

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And made thereunto foure pillars of Shittim, & ouerlayd them with golde: whose hookes were also of golde, and hee cast for them foure sockets of siluer.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And he made an hanging for the Tabernacle doore, of blew silke, & purple, and skarlet, and fine twined linnen, and needle worke,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the fiue pillars of it with their hookes, and ouerlayde their chapiters & their filets with golde, but their fiue sockets were of brasse.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: After this, Bezaleel made the Arke of Shittim wood, two cubites and an halfe long and a cubite and an halfe broade, and a cubite and an halfe hie:

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And ouerlayde it with fine golde within and without, and made a crowne of golde to it rounde about,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And cast for it foure rings of golde for the foure corners of it: that is, two rings for the one side of it, & two rings for the other side thereof.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also he made barres of Shittim wood, and couered them with golde,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And put the barres in the rings by the sides of the Arke, to beare the Arke.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And he made the Merciseate of pure golde: two cubites and an halfe was the length thereof, and one cubite and an halfe the breadth thereof.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And he made two Cherubims of gold, vpo the two endes of the Merciseate: euen of worke beaten with the hammer made he them.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: One Cherub on the one ende, and another Cherub on the other ende: of the Merciseate made he the Cherubims, at ye two endes thereof.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the Cherubims spread out their wings on hie, & couered the Merciseat with their wings, & their faces were one towards another: towarde the Merciseat were the faces of the Cherubims.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also he made ye Table of Shittim wood: two cubites was the length thereof, and a cubite the breadth thereof, and a cubite and an halfe the height of it.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And hee ouerlayde it with fine golde, and made thereto a crowne of golde round about.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also he made thereto a border of an hand breadth round about, and made vpon the border a crowne of golde round about.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And he cast for it foure rings of gold, and put the rings in the foure corners that were in the foure feete thereof.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Against the border were the rings, as places for the barres to beare the Table.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And he made the barres of Shittim wood, & couered them with golde to beare the Table.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also he made the instruments for the Table of pure golde: dishes for it, and incense cuppes for it, and goblets for it, & couerings for it, wherewith it should be couered.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Likewise he made the Candlesticke of pure golde: of worke beaten out with the hammer made he the Candlesticke: and his shaft, and his branche, his bolles, his knops, and his floures were of one piece.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And sixe branches came out of the sides thereof: three branches of the Candlesticke out of the one side of it, and three branches of the Candlesticke out of the other side of it.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: In one branche three bolles made like almondes, a knop & a floure: and in another branch three bolles made like almondes, a knop and a floure: and so throughout the sixe branches that proceeded out of the Candlesticke.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And vpon the Candlesticke were foure bolles after the facion of almondes, the knoppes thereof and the floures thereof:

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: That is, vnder euery two branches a knop made thereof, & a knop vnder the second branch thereof, and a knop vnder the thirde branche thereof, according to the sixe branches comming out of it.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Their knops & their branches were of the same: it was all one beaten worke of pure gold.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And he made for it seuen lampes with the snuffers, and snufdishes thereof of pure golde.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Of a talent of pure golde made he it with all the instruments thereof.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Furthermore he made the perfume altar of Shittim wood: the length of it was a cubite, & the breadth of it a cubite (it was square) and two cubites hie, & the hornes thereof were of ye same.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And he couered it with pure gold, both the top and the sides thereof rounde about, and the hornes of it, and made vnto it a crowne of golde round about.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And he made two rings of gold for it, vnder the crowne thereof in the two corners of the two sides thereof, to put barres in for to beare it therewith.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also he made the barres of Shittim wood, and ouerlayde them with golde.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And he made the holy anointing oyle, & the sweete pure incense after ye apothecaries arte.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also he made the altar of the burnt offering of Shittim wood: fiue cubites was the length therof, and fiue cubites the breadth thereof: it was square and three cubites hie.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And hee made vnto it hornes in the foure corners thereof: the hornes thereof were of the same, and he ouerlayd it with brasse.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also he made al the instruments of the altar: the ashpans, and the besoms, and the basins, the fleshhookes, and the censers: all the instruments thereof made he of brasse.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Moreouer he made a brasen grate wrought like a net to the Altar, vnder the compasse of it beneath in the middes of it,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And cast foure rings of brasse for the foure endes of the grate to put barres in.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And he made the barres of Shittim wood, and couered them with brasse.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: The which barres he put into the rings on the sides of the altar to beare it withall, & made it hollow within the boardes.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also he made the Lauer of brasse, & the foote of it of brasse of the glasses of the women that did assemble & came together at the doore of the Tabernacle of the Congregation.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Finally he made the court on the South side full South: the hangings of the court were of fine twined linnen, hauing an hundreth cubites.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Their pillars were twentie, and their brasen sockets twentie: the hookes of the pillars, and their filets were of siluer.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And on the Northside the hanginges were an hundreth cubites: their pillars twentie, & their sockets of brasse twentie, the hookes of the pillars and their filets of siluer.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: On the Westside also were hangings of fiftie cubites, their ten pillars with their ten sockets: the hookes of the pillars and their filets of siluer.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And toward ye Eastside, full East were hangings of fiftie cubites.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: The hangings of the one side were fifteene cubites, their three pillars, and their three sockets:

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And of the other side of the court gate on both sides were hangings of fifteene cubites, with their three pillars and their three sockets.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: All the hangings of the court round about were of fine twined linen:

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: But the sockets of ye pillars were of brasse: the hookes of the pillars and their filets of siluer, and the couering of their chapiters of siluer: and all the pillars of the court were hooped about with siluer.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: He made also the hanging of the gate of the court of needle worke, blewe silke, and purple, & skarlet, and fine twined linen euen twentie cubites long, and fiue cubites in height & bredth, like the hangings of the court.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And their pillars were foure with their foure sockets of brasse: their hookes of siluer, & the couering of their chapiters, & their filets of siluer.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: But all the pins of the Tabernacle and of the court round about were of brasse.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: These are the parts of the Tabernacle, I meane, of the Tabernacle of the Testimonie, which was appovnted by the commandement of Moses for the office of the Leuites by the hande of Ithamar sonne to Aaron the Priest.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: So Bezaleel the sonne of Vri the sonne of Hur of the tribe of Iudah, made all that the Lord commanded Moses.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And with him Aholiab sonne of Ahisamach of the tribe of Dan, a cunning workeman & an embroiderer & a worker of needle work in blew silke, & in purple, & in skarlet, and in fine linen.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: All ye gold that was occupied in all ye worke wrought for the holy place (which was the gold of the offring) was nine and twentie talents, and seuen hundreth and thirtie shekels, according to the shekel of the Sanctuarie.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: But the siluer of them that were numbred in the Congregation, was an hundreth talents, and a thousand seuen hundreth seuentie and fiue shekels, after the shekel of the Sanctuarie.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: A portion for a man, that is, halfe a shekel after ye shekel of the Sanctuarie, for all them that were numbred from twentie yeere olde & aboue, among sixe hundreth thousande, and three thousand, and fiue hundreth and fiftie men.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Moreouer there were an hundreth talentes of siluer, to cast ye sockets of ye Sanctuary, and the sockets of the vaile: an hundreth sockets of an hundreth talents, a talent for a socket.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: But he made the hookes for the pillars of a thousande seuen hundreth and seuentie and fiue shekels, and ouerlayde their chapiters, and made filets about them.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also the brasse of the offering was seuentie talents, and two thousande, and foure hundreth shekels.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Whereof he made the sockets to the doore of the Tabernacle of the Congregation, and the brasen altar, and the brasen grate which was for it, with all the instruments of the Altar,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the sockets of the court round about, and the sockets for the court gate, & al the pins of the Tabernacle, and all the pins of the court round about.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Moreouer they made garments of ministration to minister in the Sanctuarie of blewe silke, and purple, and skarlet: they made also the holy garments for Aaron, as the Lord had comanded Moses.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: So he made the Ephod of gold, blewe silke, and purple, and skarlet, and fine twined linen.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And they did beate the golde into thinne plates, and cut it into wiers, to worke it in ye blewe silke and in the purple, and in the skarlet, and in the fine linen, with broydred worke.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: For the which they made shoulders to couple together: for it was closed by the two edges thereof.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the broydred garde of his Ephod that was vpon him, was of the same stuffe, and of like worke: euen of golde, of blewe silke, and purple, & skarlet, and fine twined linen, as the Lorde had commanded Moses.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And they wrought two Onix stones closed in ouches of golde, and graued, as signets are grauen, with the names of the children of Israel,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And put them on the shoulders of the Ephod, as stones for a remembrance of the children of Israel, as the Lorde had commaunded Moses.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also he made the brestplate of broydred worke like the worke of the Ephod: to wit, of gold, blewe silke, and purple, and skarlet, and fine twined linen.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: They made the brest plate double, & it was square, an hand breadth long, & an hand breadth broad: it was also double.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And they filled it with foure rowes of stones. The order was thus, a Rubie, a Topaze, & a Carbuncle in the first rowe:

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And in the seconde rowe, an Emeraude, a Saphir, and a Diamond:

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also in the thirde rowe, a Turkeis, an Achate, and an Hematite:

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Likewise in the fourth rowe, a Chrysolite, an Onix, and a Iasper: closed and set in ouches of golde.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: So the stones were according to the names of the children of Israel, euen twelue after their names, grauen like signets euery one after his name according to the twelue tribes.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: After, they made vpon the brest plate cheines at the endes, of wrethen worke and pure golde.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: They made also two bosses of golde, and two golde rings, and put the two rings in the two corners of the brest plate.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And they put ye two wrethe cheines of gold in the two rings, in the corners of the brest plate.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also the two other endes of the two wrethen chaines they fastened in the two bosses, and put the on the shoulders of the Ephod vpon the forefront of it.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Likewise they made two rings of gold, and put them in the two other corners of the brest plate vpon the edge of it, which was on the inside of the Ephod.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: They made also two other golden rings, & put them on the two sides of the Ephod, beneath on the foreside of it, & ouer against his coupling aboue the broydered garde of the Ephod.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then they fastened the brest plate by his rings vnto the rings of the Ephod, with a lace of blewe silke, that it might bee fast vpon the broydered garde of the Ephod, and that the brest plate should not be loosed fro the Ephod, as the Lorde had commanded Moses.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Moreouer, he made the robe of the Ephod of wouen worke, altogether of blewe silke.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the hole of the robe was in the middes of it, as the coller of an habergeon, with an edge about the coller, that it shoulde not rent.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And they made vpon the skirts of the robe pomegranates, of blewe silke, and purple, and skarlet, and fine linen twined.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: They made also belles of pure gold and put the belles betweene the pomegranates vpon the skirtes of the robe rounde about betweene the pomegranates.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: A bel and a pomegranate, a bel & a pomegranate round about the skirts of the robe to minister in, as the Lord had commanded Moses.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: After, they made coates of fine linen, of wouen worke for Aaron and for his sonnes.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the miter of fine linen, and goodly bonnets of fine linen, and linen breeches of fine twined linen,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the girdle of fine twined linen, and of blew silke, and purple, and skarlet, euen of needle worke, as the Lord had commanded Moses.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Finally they made the plate for the holy crowne of fine golde, and wrote vpon it a superscription like to the grauing of a signet, HOLINES TO THE LORD.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And they tied vnto it a lace of blewe silke to fasten it on hie vpon the miter, as the Lorde had commanded Moses.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Thus was all the worke of the Tabernacle, euen of the Tabernacle of the Congregation finished: and the children of Israel did according to al that the Lord had commanded Moses: so dyd they.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Afterwarde they brought the Tabernacle vnto Moses, the Tabernacle and al his instruments, his taches, his boards, his barres, and his pillers, and his sockets,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And the couering of rammes skinnes died red, and the couerings of badgers skinnes, & the couering vaile.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: The Arke of the Testimony, and the barres thereof, and the Merciseate,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: The Table, with all the instruments thereof, and the shewebread,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: The pure Candlesticke, the lampes thereof, euen the lampes set in order, and all the instruments thereof, and the oyle for light:

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also the golden Altar and the anoynting oyle, and the sweete incense, and the hanging of the Tabernacle doore,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: The brasen Altar with his grate of brasse, his barres and all his instrumentes, the Lauer and his foote.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: The curtaines of the court with his pillers, and his sockets, & the hanging to the court gate, and his cordes, and his pinnes, and all the instruments of the seruice of the Tabernacle, called the Tabernacle of the Congregation.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Finally, the ministring garmentes to serue in the Sanctuarie, and the holy garmentes for Aaron the Priest, and his sonnes garmentes to minister in the Priestes office.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: According to euery poynt that the Lorde had commanded Moses, so the children of Israel made all the worke.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And Moses beheld al the worke, & behold, they had done it as the Lord had commanded: so had they done: and Moses blessed them.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then the Lord spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: In the first day of the first moneth in the very first of the same moneth shalt thou set vp the Tabernacle, called ye Tabernacle of the Congregation:

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And thou shalt put therein the Arke of the Testimonie, and couer the Arke with the vaile.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also thou shalt bring in the Table, and set it in order as it doth require: thou shalt also bring in the Candlesticke, and light his lampes,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And thou shalt set ye incense Altar of gold before the Arke of the Testimonie, and put the hanging at the doore of the Tabernacle.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Moreouer, thou shalt set the burnt offering Altar before the doore of the Tabernacle, called the Tabernacle of the Congregation.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And thou shalt set the Lauer betweene the Tabernacle of the Congregation and the Altar, and put water therein.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then thou shalt appoynt the courte round about, and hang vp the hanging at the courte gate.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: After, thou shalt take the anoynting oyle, and anoynt the Tabernacle, and all that is therein, and halowe it with all the instruments thereof, that it may be holy.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And thou shalt anoynt the Altar of the burnt offring, and all his instrumentes, and shalt sanctifie the Altar, that it may bee an altar most holie.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also thou shalt anoynt the Lauer, and his foote, and shalt sanctifie it.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then thou shalt bring Aaron & his sonnes vnto the doore of the Tabernacle of the Congregation, and wash them with water.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And thou shalt put vpon Aaron the holy garmentes, and shalt anoynt him, and sanctifie him, that he may minister vnto me in the Priestes office.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Thou shalt also bring his sonnes, & clothe them with garments,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And shalt anoynt them as thou diddest anoynt their father, that they may minister vnto mee in the Priestes office: for their anoynting shall be a signe, that the Priesthood shall be euerlasting vnto them throughout their generations.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: So Moses did according to all that ye Lorde had commanded him: so did he.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Thus was the Tabernacle reared vp the first day of the first moneth in the seconde yeere.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then Moses reared vp the Tabernacle and fastened his sockets, and set vp the boardes thereof, and put in the barres of it, and reared vp his pillars.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And he spred the couering ouer the Tabernacle, and put the couering of that couering on hie aboue it, as the Lorde had commaunded Moses.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And he tooke and put the Testimonie in the Arke, and put the barres in the ringes of the Arke, and set the Merciseate on hie vpon the Arke.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: He brought also the Arke into the Tabernacle, and hanged vp the couering vaile, and couered the Arke of the Testimonie, as the Lord had commanded Moses.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Furthermore he put the Table in the Tabernacle of the Congregation in the Northside of the Tabernacle, without the vaile,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And set the bread in order before the Lord, as the Lord had commanded Moses.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also he put the Candlesticke in the Tabernacle of the Congregation, ouer against the Table toward ye Southside of the Tabernacle.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And he lighted the lampes before the Lord, as the Lord had commanded Moses.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Moreouer he set the golden Altar in the Tabernacle of the Congregation before the vayle,

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: And burnt sweete incense thereon, as the Lord had commanded Moses.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Also he hanged vp the vayle at the doore of the Tabernacle.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: After, he set the burnt offring Altar without the doore of the Tabernacle, called the Tabernacle of the Congregation, and offered the burnt offering and the sacrifice thereon, as the Lord had commanded Moses.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Likewise he set the Lauer betweene the Tabernacle of the Congregation and the Altar, and powred water therein to wash with.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: So Moses and Aaron, and his sonnes washed their handes and their feete thereat.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: When they went into the Tabernacle of the Congregation, and when they approched to the Altar, they washed, as the Lord had commanded Moses.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Finally, he reared vp the court rounde about the Tabernacle and the Altar, and hanged vp the vaile at the court gate: so Moses finished the worke.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Then the cloud couered the Tabernacle of the Congregation, and the glorie of the Lorde filled the Tabernacle.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: So Moses could not enter into the Tabernacle of the Congregation, because the cloude abode thereon, and the glorie of the Lorde filled the Tabernacle.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: Nowe when the cloude ascended vp from the Tabernacle, the children of Israel went forward in all their iourneyes.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: But if the cloude ascended not, then they iourneyed not till the day that it ascended.

Book.Name: Exodus
Text: For the cloude of the Lorde was vpon the Tabernacle by day, & fire was in it by night in the sight of all the house of Israel, throughout all their iourneyes.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Nowe the Lorde called Moses, and spake vnto him out of the Tabernacle of the Congregation, saying,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Speake vnto the children of Israel, and thou shalt say vnto them, If any of you offer a sacrifice vnto the Lord, ye shall offer your sacrifice of cattell, as of beeues and of the sheepe.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: If his sacrifice be a burnt offering of the heard, he shall offer a male without blemish, presenting him of his owne voluntarie will at the doore of the Tabernacle of the Congregation before the Lorde.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And he shall put his hande vpon the head of the burnt offering, and it shalbe accepted to the Lorde, to be his atonement.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And he shall kill the bullocke before the Lord, and the Priestes Aarons sonnes shall offer the blood, and shal sprinckle it round about vpon the altar, that is by the doore of the Tabernacle of the Congregation.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then shall he fley the burnt offering, and cut it in pieces.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: So the sonnes of Aaron the Priest shall put fire vpon the altar, and lay the wood in order vpon the fire.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then the Priestes Aarons sonnes shall lay the parts in order, the head & the kall vpon the wood that is in the fire which is vpon the altar.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But the inwardes thereof and the legges thereof he shall wash in water, and the Priest shal burne all on the altar: for it is a burnt offering, an oblation made by fire, for a sweete sauour vnto the Lorde.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And if his sacrifice for the burnt offering be of the flocks (as of the sheepe, or of the goats) he shall offer a male without blemish,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And he shall kill it on the Northside of the altar before the Lorde, and the Priestes Aarons sonnes shall sprinckle the blood thereof rounde about vpon the altar.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And he shall cut it in pieces, separating his head and his kall, and the Priest shall lay them in order vpon the wood that lyeth in the fire which is on the altar:

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But he shall wash the inwardes, and the legges with water, and the Priest shall offer the whole & burne it vpon the altar: for it is a burnt offering, an oblation made by fire for a sweete sauour vnto the Lorde.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And if his sacrifice be a burnt offring to the Lord of ye foules, then he shall offer his sacrifice of the turtle doues, or of the yong pigeons.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And the Priest shall bring it vnto the altar, and wring the necke of it asunder, & burne it on the altar: and the blood thereof shall bee shed vpon the side of the altar.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And he shall plucke out his maw with his fethers, and cast them beside the altar on the East part in the place of the ashes.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And he shall cleaue it with his wings, but not deuide it asunder: and the Priest shall burne it vpon the altar vpon the wood that is in the fire: for it is a burnt offering, an oblation made by fire for a sweete sauour vnto the Lorde.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And when any will offer a meate offering vnto the Lorde, his offering shall be of fine floure, and he shall powre oyle vpon it, and put incense thereon,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And shall bring it vnto Aarons sonnes the Priestes, and he shall take thence his handfull of the flowre, and of the oyle with al the incense, and the Priest shall burne it for a memoriall vpon the altar: for it is an offering made by fire for a sweete sauour vnto the Lorde.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But the remnant of the meate offering shalbe Aarons and his sonnes: for it is most holy of the Lordes offrings made by fire.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: If thou bring also a meate offring baken in the ouen, it shalbe an vnleauened cake of fine floure mingled with oyle, or an vnleauened wafer anointed with oyle.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But if thy meate offring be an oblation of the frying pan, it shall be of fine flowre vnleauened, mingled with oyle.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And thou shalt part it in pieces, and powre oyle thereon: for it is a meate offring.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And if thy meate offring be an oblation made in the caldron, it shalbe made of fine floure with oyle.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: After, thou shalt bring the meate offering (that is made of these things) vnto the Lord, and shalt present it vnto the Priest, and he shall bring it to the altar,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And the Priest shall take from the meate offring a memoriall of it, and shall burne it vpon the altar: for it is an oblation made by fire for a sweete sauour vnto the Lord.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But that which is left of the meate offring, shalbe Aarons and his sonnes: for it is most holy of the offrings of the Lorde made by fire.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: All the meate offrings which ye shall offer vnto the Lorde, shalbe made without leauen: for ye shall neither burne leauen nor honie in any offring of the Lorde made by fire.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: In the oblation of the first fruits ye shal offer them vnto the Lorde, but they shall not be burnt vpon the altar for a sweete sauour.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: (All the meate offrings also shalt thou season with salt, neither shalt thou suffer the salt of the couenant of thy God to be lacking from thy meate offring, but vpon all thine oblations thou shalt offer salt)

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: If then thou offer a meate offring of thy first fruites vnto the Lorde, thou shalt offer for thy meate offering of thy first fruites eares of corne dryed by the fire, and wheate beaten out of the greene eares.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: After, thou shalt put oyle vpon it, and lay incense thereon: for it is a meate offring.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And the Priest shall burne the memoriall of it, euen of that that is beaten, and of the oyle of it, with all the incense thereof: for it is an offring vnto the Lorde made by fire.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Also if his oblation be a peace offering, if he will offer of the droue (whether it be male or female) he shall offer such as is without blemish, before the Lorde,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And shall put his hande vpon the head of his offering, and kill it at the doore of the Tabernacle of the Congregation: and Aarons sonnes the Priestes shall sprinkle the blood vpon the altar rounde about.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: So he shall offer part of the peace offerings as a sacrifice made by fire vnto the Lorde, euen the fat that couereth the inwardes, and all the fat that is vpon the inwardes.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: He shall also take away the two kidneis, & the fat that is on them, and vpon the flankes, and the kall on the liuer with the kidneis.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And Aarons sonnes shall burne it on the altar, with the burnt offering, which is vpon the wood, that is on the fire: this is a sacrifice made by fire for a sweete sauour vnto the Lorde.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Also if his oblation be a peace offring vnto the Lorde out of ye flocke, whether it be male or female, he shall offer it without blemish.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: If he offer a lambe for his oblation, then he shall bring it before the Lorde,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And lay his hand vpon the head of his offring, & shall kill it before the Tabernacle of the Congregation, and Aarons sonnes shall sprinckle the blood thereof round about vpon the altar.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: After, of the peace offrings he shal offer an offring made by fire vnto the Lord: he shall take away the fat therof, & the rump altogether, hard by the backe bone, and the fat that couereth the inwardes, & all the fat that is vpon the inwards.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Also hee shall take away the two kidneis, with the fat that is vpon them, & vpon the flankes, and the kall vpon the liuer with the kidneis.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then the Priest shall burne it vpon the altar, as the meat of an offring made by fire vnto the Lord.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Also if his offring be a goate, then shal he offer it before the Lord,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And shall put his hande vpon the head of it, and kil it before the Tabernacle of the Congregation, & the sonnes of Aaron shall sprinkle the blood thereof vpon the altar round about.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then he shall offer thereof his offring, euen an offring made by fire vnto the Lorde, the fat that couereth the inwardes, and all the fatte that is vpon the inwardes.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Also hee shall take away the two kidneis, and the fat that is vpon them, and vpon ye flankes, and the kall vpon the liuer with the kidneis.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: So the Priest shall burne them vpon the altar, as the meate of an offering made by fire for a sweete sauour: all the fatte is the Lordes.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: This shalbe a perpetual ordinance for your generations, throughout al your dwellings, so that ye shall eate neither fatte nor blood.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Moreouer the Lord spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Speake vnto the children of Israel, saying, If any shall sinne through ignorance, in any of the commandementes of the Lord, (which ought not to be done) but shall doe contrary to any of them,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: If the Priest that is anointed doe sinne (according to the sinne of the people) then shall he offer, for his sinne which hee hath sinned, a yong bullocke without blemish vnto the Lorde for a sinne offring,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And hee shall bring the bullocke vnto the dore of the Tabernacle of the Congregation before the Lorde, and shall put his hande vpon the bullocks head, and kill the bullocke before the Lorde.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And the Priest that is anointed shall take of the bullocks blood, and bring it into the Tabernacle of the Congregation.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then the Priest shall dippe his finger in the blood, & sprinkle of the blood seuen times before the Lord, before the vaile of the Sanctuarie.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: The Priest also shall put some of the blood before the Lord, vpon the hornes of the altar of sweete incense, which is in the Tabernacle of the Congregatoin, then shall hee powre all the rest of the blood of the bullocke at the foote of the altar of burnt offring, which is at the doore of the Tabernacle of the Congregation.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And hee shall take away all the fat of the bullocke for the sinne offring: to wit, the fat that couereth the inwardes, and all the fatte that is about the inwardes.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: He shall take away also the two kidneis, and the fat that is vpon them, and vpon the flankes, and the kall vpon the liuer with the kidneis,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: As it was taken away from the bullock of the peace offrings, & the Priest shall burne them vpon the altar of burnt offring.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But the skinne of the bullocke, and all his flesh, with his heade, and his legs, and his inwardes, and his dung shal he beare out.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: So he shall cary the whole bullocke out of the host vnto a cleane place, where the ashes are powred, & shall burne him on ye wood in the fire: where ye ashes are cast out, shal he be burnt.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And if the whole Congregation of Israel shall sinne through ignorance, and the thing be hid from the eyes of the multitude, and haue done against any of the commaundementes of the Lorde which should not be done, and haue offended:

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: When the sinne which they haue committed shalbe knowen, then the Congregation shall offer a yong bullocke for the sinne, & bring him before the Tabernacle of the Congregation,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And the Elders of the Congregation shal put their handes vpon the head of the bullocke before the Lorde, and he shall kill the bullocke before the Lorde.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then the Priest that is anointed, shall bring of the bullockes blood into the Tabernacle of the Congregation,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And the Priest shall dip his finger in the blood, and sprinkle it seuen times before the Lord, euen before the vaile.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Also he shall put some of ye blood vpon the hornes of the altar, which is before the Lord, that is in the Tabernacle of the Congregation: then shall he powre all the rest, of the blood at ye foote of the altar of burnt offring, which is at the doore of the Tabernacle of the Congregation,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And he shall take all his fat from him, and burne it vpon the altar.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And the Priest shal doe with this bullocke, as he did with the bullocke for his sinne: so shall he do with this: so the Priest shal make an atonement for them, and it shalbe forgiuen them.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: For he shal carie the bullocke without the hoste, and burne him as he burned the first bullock: for it is an offring for the sinne of the Congregation.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: When a ruler shal sinne, and do through ignorance against any of the commaundementes of the Lorde his God, which should not be done, and shall offend,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: If one shewe vnto him his sinne, which he hath committed, the shall he bring for his offring an hee goat without blemish,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And shall lay his hand vpon the heade of the he goate, and kill it in the place where he should kill the burnt offring before the Lord: for it is a sinne offring.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then the Priest shall take of the blood of the sinne offring with his finger, and put it vpon the hornes of the burnt offring altar, and shall powre the rest of his blood at the foote of the burnt offring altar,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And shall burne all his fat vpon the altar, as the fat of the peace offring: so the Priest shall make an atonement for him, concerning his sinne, and it shalbe forgiuen him.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Likewise if any of the people of ye lande shall sinne through ignoraunce in doing against any of the commandements of the Lord, which should not be done, and shall offend,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: If one shewe him his sinne which he hath committed, then he shall bring for his offring, a shee goate without blemish for his sinne which he hath committed,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And he shall lay his hand vpon the head of the sinne offring, and slay the sinne offring in the place of burnt offring.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then the Priest shall take of the blood thereof with his finger, and put it vpon the hornes of the burnt offring altar, & powre all the rest of the blood thereof at the foote of the altar,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And shall take away all his fat, as the fat of the peace offringes is taken away, and the Priest shall burne it vpon the altar for a sweete sauour vnto the Lorde, and the Priest shall make an atonement for him, and it shalbe forgiuen him.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And if he bring a lambe for his sinne offring, he shall bring a female without blemish,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And shall lay his hand vpon the head of the sinne offring, and hee shall slay it for a sinne offring in the place where hee shoulde kill the burnt offring.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then the Priest shall take of the blood of the sinne offring with his finger, and put it vpon the hornes of the burnt offring altar, and shall powre al the rest of the blood thereof at the foote of the altar.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And he shall take away all the fat thereof, as the fatte of the lambe of the peace offrings is taken away: then the Priest shall burne it vpon the altar with the oblations of the Lord made by fire, and the Priest shall make an atonement for him concerning his sinne that he hath committed, and it shalbe forgiuen him.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Also if any haue sinned, that is, If he haue heard the voyce of an othe, and hee can be a witnes, whether he hath seene or knowen of it, if hee doe not vtter it, he shall beare his iniquitie:

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Either if one touche any vncleane thing, whether it be a carion of an vncleane beast, or a carion of vncleane cattel, or a carion of vncleane creeping things, and is not ware of it, yet he is vncleane, and hath offended:

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Eyther if hee touche any vncleannesse of man (whatsoeuer vncleannes it be, that hee is defiled with) and is not ware of it, and after commeth to the knowledge of it, he hath sinned:

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Either if any sweare and pronounce with his lippes to do euill, or to doe good (whatsoeuer it bee that a man shall pronounce with an othe) and it be hid from him, and after knoweth that he hath offended in one of these poyntes,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Whe he hath sinned in any of these things, then he shal confesse that he hath sinned therein.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Therefore shall he bring his trespasse offring vnto the Lord for his sinne which he hath committed, euen a female from ye flocke, be it a lambe or a she goat for a sinne offring, and the Priest shall make an atonement for him, concerning his sinne.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But if he be not able to bring a sheepe, he shall bring for his trespas which he hath committed, two turtle doues, or two yong pigeons vnto the Lord, one for a sinne offring, and the other for a burnt offring.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: So he shall bring them vnto the Priest, who shall offer the sinne offring first, and wring the necke of it a sunder, but not plucke it cleane off.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: After he shall sprinkle of the blood of the sinne offring vpon the side of the altar, and the rest of the blood shall be shed at the foote of the altar: for it is a sinne offering.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Also he shall offer the seconde for a burnt offring as the maner is: so shall the Priest make an atonement for him (for his sinne which hee hath committed) and it shalbe forgiuen him.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But if he be not able to bring two turtle doues, or two yong pigeons, then he that hath sinned, shall bring for his offring, the tenth parte of an Ephah of fine floure for a sinne offring, he shall put none oyle thereto, neither put any incense thereon: for it is a sinne offering.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then shall hee bring it to the Priest, and the Priest shall take his handfull of it for the remembrance thereof, and burne it vpon the altar with the offrings of the Lorde made by fire: for it is a sinne offring.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: So the Priest shal make an atonement for him, as touching his sinne that he hath committed in one of these poyntes, and it shall bee forgiuen him: and the remnant shalbe the Priests, as the meate offring.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And the Lord spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: If any person transgresse & sinne through ignorance by taking away things consecrated vnto the Lorde, hee shall then bring for his trespasse offring vnto the Lorde a ramme without blemish out of the flocke, worth two shekels of siluer by thy estimation after the shekel of the Sanctuarie, for a trespasse offring.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: So hee shall restore that wherein hee hath offended, in taking away of the holy thing, and shall put the fift part more thereto, and giue it vnto the Priest: so the Priest shal make an atonement for him with the ram of ye trespasse offring, and it shalbe forgiuen him.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Also if any sinne and doe against any of the commaundementes of the Lorde, which ought not to be done, and knowe not and sinne and beare his iniquitie,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then shall he bring a ramme without blemishe out of the flocke, in thy estimation worth two shekels for a trespasse offring vnto ye Priest: and the Priest shall make an atonement for him concerning his ignorance wherein he erred, and was not ware: so it shalbe forgiuen him.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: This is the trespasse offring for the trespasse committed against the Lord.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And the Lord spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: If any sinne and commit a trespasse against the Lorde, and denie vnto his neighbour that, which was take him to keepe, or that which was put to him of trust, or doth by robberie, or by violence oppresse his neighbour,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Or hath found that which was lost, and denieth it, and sweareth falsely, for any of these things that a man doeth, wherein he sinneth:

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: When, I say, he thus sinneth & trespasseth, he shall then restore the robbery that he robbed, or the thing taken by violence which hee tooke by force, or the thing which was deliuered him to keepe, or the lost thing which he founde,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Or for whatsoeuer he hath sworne falsely, he shall both restore it in the whole summe, and shall adde the fift parte more thereto, and giue it vnto him to whome perteyneth, the same day that he offreth for trespasse.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Also he shall bring for his trespasse vnto the Lorde, a ramme without blemish out of the flocke in thy estimation worth two shekels for a trespasse offring vnto the Priest.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And the Priest shall make an atonement for him before the Lorde, and it shall be forgiuen him, whatsoeuer thing he hath done, and trespassed therein.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then the Lord spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Commaund Aaron and his sonnes, saying, This is the lawe of the burnt offring, (it is the burnt offring because it burneth vpon the altar al the night vnto the morning, and the fire burneth on the altar)

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And the Priest shall put on his linen garment, and shall put on his linen breeches vpon his flesh, and take away the ashes when the fire hath consumed the burnt offring vpon the altar, and he shall put them beside the altar.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: After, he shal put off his garments, and put on other raiment, and cary the ashes foorth without the hoste vnto a cleane place.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But the fire vpon the altar shall burne thereon and neuer be put out: wherefore the Priest shall burne wood on it euery morning, and lay the burnt offering in order vpon it, and he shall burne thereon the fat of the peace offrings.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: The fire shall euer burne vpon the altar, and neuer go out.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Also this is the lawe of the meate offring, which Aarons sonnes shall offer in the presence of the Lorde, before the altar.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: He shall euen take thence his handfull of fine flowre of the meate offring and of the oyle, & all the incense which is vpon the meat offring, and shall burne it vpon the altar for a sweete sauour, as a memoriall therefore vnto the Lorde:

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But the rest thereof shall Aaron and his sonnes eate: it shalbe eaten without leauen in the holy place: in the court of the Tabernacle of the Congregation they shall eate it.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: It shall not be baken with leauen: I haue giuen it for their portion of mine offrings made by fire: for it is as the sinne offering and as the trespasse offring.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: All the males among the children of Aaron shall eate of it: It shalbe a statute for euer in your generations concerning the offrings of the Lord, made by fire: whatsoeuer toucheth them shall be holy.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Agayne the Lorde spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: This is the offering of Aaron & his sonnes, which they shall offer vnto the Lorde in the day when he is anointed: the tenth part of an Ephah of fine floure, for a meate offering perpetuall: halfe of it in ye morning, & halfe thereof at night.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: In the frying panne it shalbe made with oyle: thou shalt bring it fryed, and shalt offer the baken pieces of the meate offering for a sweete sauour vnto the Lorde.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And the Priest that is anointed in his steade, among his sonnes shall offer it: It is the Lordes ordinance for euer, it shall be burnt altogether.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: For euery meate offring of the Priest shall be burnt altogether, it shall not be eaten.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Furthermore, the Lord spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Speake vnto Aaron, and vnto his sonnes, and say, This is the Lawe of the sinne offering, In the place where the burnt offring is killed, shall the sinne offring be killed before the Lord, for it is most holy.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: The Priest that offreth this sinne offring, shall eate it: in the holy place shall it be eaten, in the court of ye Tabernacle of the Congregation.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Whatsoeuer shall touch the flesh thereof shalbe holy: & when there droppeth of the blood thereof vpon a garment, thou shalt wash that whereon it droppeth in the holy place.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Also the earthen pot that it is sodden in, shalbe broken, but if it be sodden in a brasen pot, it shall both be scoured and washed with water.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: All the males among the Priestes shal eate thereof, for it is most holy.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But no sinne offering, whose blood is brought into the Tabernacle of the Congregation to make reconciliation in the holy place, shalbe eaten, but shalbe burnt in the fire.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Likewise this is the lawe of the trespasse offering, it is most holy.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: In the place where they kill the burnt offering, shall they kill the trespasse offering, and the blood thereof shall he sprinkle rounde about vpon the altar.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: All the fat thereof also shall he offer, the rumpe, and the fat that couereth the inwardes.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: After he shall take away the two kidneis, with the fat that is on them & vpon the flankes, and the kall on the liuer with the kidneis.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then the Priest shall burne them vpon the altar, for an offring made by fire vnto the Lorde: this is a trespasse offring.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: All the males among the Priestes shall eate thereof, it shalbe eaten in the holy place, for it is most holy.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: As the sinne offring is, so is the trespasse offring, one lawe serueth for both: that wherewith the Priest shall make atonement, shalbe his.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Also the Priest that offereth any mans burnt offring, shall haue the skinne of the burnt offring which he hath offered.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And all the meate offring that is baken in the ouen, and that is dressed in the pan, and in the frying pan, shall be the Priestes that offereth it.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And euery meate offering mingled with oyle, and that is dry, shall pertaine vnto all the sonnes of Aaron, to all alike.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Furthermore, this is the lawe of the peace offrings, which he shall offer vnto the Lorde.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: If he offer it to giue thankes, then he shal offer for his thankes offering, vnleauened cakes mingled with oyle, and vnleauened wafers anointed with oyle, and fine floure fryed with the cakes mingled with oyle.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: He shall offer also his offring with cakes of leauened bread, for his peace offrings, to giue thankes.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And of all the sacrifice he shall offer one cake for an heaue offering vnto the Lorde, and it shalbe the Priestes that sprinckleth the blood of the peace offrings.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Also the flesh of his peace offerings, for thankesgiuing, shalbe eaten the same day that it is offered: he shall leaue nothing thereof vntill the morning.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But if the sacrifice of his offring be a vow, or a free offering, it shalbe eaten the same day that he offreth his sacrifice: and so in the morning the residue thereof shalbe eaten.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But as much of the offered flesh as remaineth vnto the third day, shalbe burnt with fire.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: For if any of the flesh of his peace offrings be eaten in the third day, he shall not be accepted that offereth it, neither shall it be reckoned vnto him, but shalbe an abomination: therefore ye person that eateth of it shall beare his iniquitie.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: The flesh also that toucheth any vncleane thing, shall not be eaten, but burnt with fire: but of this flesh all that be cleane shal eate thereof.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But if any eate of the flesh of the peace offerings that pertaineth to the Lorde, hauing his vncleannesse vpon him, euen the same person shalbe cut off from his people.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Moreouer, whe any toucheth any vncleane thing, as the vncleannesse of man, or of an vncleane beast, or of any filthie abomination, and eate of the flesh of the peace offrings, which pertaineth vnto the Lorde, euen that person shalbe cut off from his people.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Againe ye Lord spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Speake vnto the children of Israel, & say, Ye shall eate no fat of beeues, nor of sheepe, nor of goates:

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Yet the fat of the dead beast, and the fat of that, which is torne with beastes, shalbe occupied to any vse, but ye shall not eate of it.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: For whosoeuer eateth the fat of the beast, of the which he shall offer an offering made by fire to the Lorde, euen the person that eateth, shalbe cut off from his people.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Neither shall ye eate any blood, either of foule, or of beast in all your dwellings.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Euery person that eateth any blood, euen the same person shall be cut off from his people.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And the Lord talked with Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Speake vnto the children of Israel, & say, Hee that offereth his peace offerings vnto the Lorde, shall bring his gifte vnto the Lorde of his peace offerings:

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: His handes shall bring the offerings of the Lorde made by fire: euen the fatte with the breast shall he bring, that the breast may be shaken to and fro before the Lorde.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then the Priest shall burne the fatte vpon the Altar, and the breast shall be Aarons and his sonnes.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And the right shoulder shall ye giue vnto the Priest for an heaue offering, of your peace offrings.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: The same that offreth the blood of ye peace offrings, and the fatte, among the sonnes of Aaron, shall haue the right shoulder for his parte.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: For the breast shaken to and fro, and the shoulder lifted vp, haue I taken of the children of Israel, euen of their peace offrings, and haue giuen them vnto Aaron the Priest and vnto his sonnes by a statute for euer from among the children of Israel.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: This is the anointing of Aaron, & the anointing of his sonnes, concerning the offerings of the Lord made by fire, in the day when he presented them to serue in the Priestes office vnto the Lorde.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: The which portions the Lorde commanded to giue them in the day that he anointed them from among the children of Israel, by a statute for euer in their generations.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: This is also the lawe of the burnt offring of the meate offring, and of the sinne offring, and of the trespasse offring, and of the consecrations, and of the peace offrings,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Which the Lorde commaunded Moses in the mount Sinai, when he commanded the children of Israel to offer their giftes vnto the Lorde in the wildernesse of Sinai.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Afterwarde the Lorde spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Take Aaron and his sonnes with him, and the garments and the anointing oyle, and a bullocke for the sinne offring, & two rammes, and a basket of vnleauened bread,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And assemble all the company at the doore of the Tabernacle of the Congregation.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: So Moses did as the Lord had commanded him, & the companie was assembled at the doore of the Tabernacle of the Congregation.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then Moses said vnto the company, This is the thing which the Lorde hath commaunded to doe.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And Moses brought Aaron and his sonnes, and washed them with water,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And put vpon him the coate, and girded him with a girdle, & clothed him with the robe, and put the Ephod on him, which he girded with the broydred garde of the Ephod, and bounde it vnto him therewith.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: After he put the brest plate thereon, and put in the breast plate the Vrim and the Thummim.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Also he put the miter vpon his head, and put vpon the miter on the fore front the golden plate, and the holy crowne, as the Lorde had commanded Moses.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: (Nowe Moses had taken the anointing oyle, and anoynted the Tabernacle, and al that was therein, and sanctified them,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And sprinkled thereof vpon the altar seuen times, and anointed the altar and all his instruments, and the lauer, and his foote, to sanctifie them)

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And he powred of the anointing oyle vpon Aarons head, and anointed him, to sanctifie him.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: After, Moses brought Aarons sonnes, and put coates vpon them, and girded them with girdles, and put bonets vpon their heades, as the Lorde had commanded Moses.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then he brought the bullocke for the sinne offring, and Aaron and his sonnes put their handes vpon the head of the bullocke for the sinne offring.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And Moses slew him, and tooke the blood, which he put vpon the hornes of the Altar roud about with his finger, and purified the altar, & powred the rest of the blood at the foote of ye altar: so he sanctified it, to make reconciliation vpon it.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then he tooke all the fatte that was vpon the inwardes, and the kall of the liuer and the two kidneis, with their fat, which Moses burned vpon the Altar.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But the bullocke and his hide, and his flesh, and his doung, hee burnt with fire without the host as the Lord had commanded Moses.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Also hee brought the ram for the burnt offring, and Aaron and his sonnes put their hands vpon the head of the ramme.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: So Moses killed it, and sprinkled the blood vpon the Altar round about,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And Moses cut the ram in pieces, & burnt the head with the pieces, and the fat,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And washed the inwardes and the legges in water: so Moses burnt the ram euery whit vpon ye Altar: for it was a burnt offring for a sweete sauour, which was made by fire vnto the Lord, as the Lord had commanded Moses.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: After, he brought the other ram, the ram of consecrations, and Aaron and his sonnes layed their handes vpon the head of the ram,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Which Moses slewe, and tooke of the blood of it, and put it vpon the lappe of Aarons right eare, & vpon the thumbe of his right hand, and vpon the great toe of his right foote.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then Moses brought Aarons sonnes, and put of the blood on the lap of their right eares, and vpon the thumbes of their right handes, and vpon the great toes of their right feete, and Moses sprinckled the rest of the blood vpon the Altar round about.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And he tooke the fat & the rumpe and all the fat that was vpon the inwards, and the kall of the liuer, and the two kidneis with their fat, & the right shoulder.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Also he tooke of ye basket of ye vnleauened bread that was before the Lorde, one vnleauened cake and a cake of oiled bread, & one wafer, and put them on the fat, & vpon the right shoulder.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: So hee put all in Aarons handes, and in his sonnes handes, and shooke it to and fro before the Lord.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: After, Moses tooke the out of their hands, & burnt them vpon the altar for a burnt offring: for these were consecrations for a sweete sauour which were made by fire vnto the Lord.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Likewise Moses tooke the breast of the ram of consecrations, & shooke it to and fro before the Lord: for it was Moses portion, as the Lord had commanded Moses.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Also Moses tooke of the anointing oyle, and of the blood which was vpon the Altar, and sprinkled it vpon Aaron, vpon his garments, and vpon his sonnes, and on his sonnes garments with him: so hee sanctified Aaron, his garments, & his sonnes, and his sonnes garments with him.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Afterward Moses saide vnto Aaron and his sonnes, Seethe the flesh at the doore of the Tabernacle of the Congregation, & there eate it with the bread that is in the basket of consecrations, as I commanded, saying, Aaron and his sonnes shall eate it,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But that which remaineth of the flesh and of the bread, shall ye burne with fire.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And ye shall not depart from the doore of the Tabernacle of the Congregation seuen dayes, vntill the dayes of your consecrations bee at an ende: for seuen dayes, saide the Lorde, shall hee consecrate you,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: As hee hath done this day: so the Lorde hath commanded to doe, to make an atonement for you.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Therefore shall yee abide at the doore of the Tabernacle of the Congregation day and night, seuen dayes, and shall keepe the watch of the Lord, that ye dye not: for so I am commanded.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: So Aaron and his sonnes did all thinges which the Lorde had commanded by the hand of Moses.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And in the eight day Moses called Aaron and his sonnes, and the Elders of Israel:

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then hee sayde vnto Aaron, Take thee a yong calfe for a sinne offring, and a ram for a burnt offring, both without blemish, and bring them before the Lord.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And vnto the children of Israel thou shalt speake, saying, Take yee an hee goate for a sinne offring, and a calfe, and a lambe, both of a yeere olde, without blemish for a burnt offring:

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Also a bullock, and a ramme for peace offringes, to offer before the Lorde, and a meate offring mingled with oyle: for to day the Lorde will appeare vnto you.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then they brought that which Moses commanded before the Tabernacle of the Congregation, and all the assembly drewe neere and stood before the Lord.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: (For Moses had sayde, This is the thing, which the Lord commaunded that ye should do, and the glory of the Lord shal appeare vnto you)

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then Moses sayd vnto Aaron, Draw neere to the Altar, and offer thy sinne offering, and thy burnt offring, and make an attonement for thee and for the people: offer also the offring of the people, and make an atonement for them, as the Lord hath commaunded.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Aaron therefore went vnto the Altar, and killed the calfe of the sinne offring, which was for himselfe.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And the sonnes of Aaron brought ye blood vnto him, and he dipt his finger in the blood, and put it vpon the hornes of the Altar, and powred the rest of the blood at the foote of the Altar.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But the fat and the kidneis and the kall of the liuer of the sinne offring, he burnt vpon the Altar, as the Lord had commaunded Moses.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: The flesh also and the hide hee burnt with fire without the hoste.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: After, he slewe the burnt offering, and Aarons sonnes brought vnto him the blood, which he sprinckled round about vpon the Altar.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Also they brought the burnt offring vnto him with the pieces thereof, and the head, and he burnt them vpon the Altar.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Likewise he did wash the inwardes and the legs, and burnt them vpon the burnt offring on the Altar.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then he offred the peoples offring, and tooke a goate, which was the sinne offring for the people, and slewe it: and offred it for sinne, as the first:

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: So he offred the burnt offring, and prepared it, according to the maner.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: He presented also the meate offring, & filled his hand thereof, and beside the burnt sacrifice of the morning he burnt this vpon the Altar.

Book.Name: Leviticus
