Text: He slewe also the bullock, and the ram for the peace offrings, that was for the people, and Arons sonnes brought vnto him the blood, which he sprinkled vpon the Altar round about,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: With the fat of the bullocke, and of the ram, the rumpe, and that which couereth the inwards and the kidneis, and the kall of the liuer.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: So they layed the fat vpon the breasts, and he burnt the fat vpon the Altar.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But the breastes and the ryght shoulder Aaron shooke to and fro before the Lord, as the Lord had commaunded Moses.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: So Aaron lift vp his hand toward the people, and blessed them, and came downe from offring of the sinne offring, and the burnt offring, and the peace offrings.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: After, Moses and Aaron went into the Tabernacle of the Congregation, and came out, and blessed the people, and the glorie of the Lord appeared to all the people.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And there came a fire out from the Lord and consumed vpon the Altar the burnt offring and the fatte: which when all the people sawe, they gaue thankes, and fell on their faces.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Bvt Nadab and Abihu, the sonnes of Aaron, tooke either of them his censor, and put fire therein, and put incense thereupon, and offred strange fire before the Lorde, which hee had not commaunded them.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Therefore a fire went out from the Lord, & deuoured them: so they dyed before the Lord.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then Moses sayde vnto Aaron, This is it that the Lord spake, saying, I will bee sanctified in the that come neere me, & before all the people I will be glorified: but Aaron held his peace.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And Moses called Mishael and Elzaphan the sonnes of Vzziel, the vncle of Aaron, & saide vnto them, Come neere, cary your brethre from before the Sanctuarie out of the hoste.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then they went, and caried them in their coates out of the host, as Moses had comaunded.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: After, Moses saide vnto Aaron and vnto Eleazar & Ithamar his sonnes, Vncouer not your heads, neither rent your clothes, least ye dye, and least wrath come vpon all ye people: but let your brethren, all the house of Israel bewayle the burning which the Lorde hath kindled.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And go not yee out from the doore of the Tabernacle of the Congregation, least ye dye: for the anointing oyle of the Lorde is vpon you: and they did according to Moses commaundement.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And the Lorde spake vnto Aaron, saying,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Thou shalt not drinke wine nor strong drinke, thou, nor thy sonnes with thee, when yee come into the Tabernacle of the Congregation, lest ye die: this is an ordinance for euer throughout your generations,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: That ye may put difference betweene the holy and the vnholy, and betweene the cleane and the vncleane,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And that ye may teach the children of Israel all the statutes which the Lorde hath commaunded them by the hand of Moses.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then Moses saide vnto Aaron and vnto Eleazar and to Ithamar his sonnes that were left, Take the meate offring that remaineth of the offrings of the Lorde, made by fire, and eate it without leauen beside ye altar: for it is most holy:

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And ye shall eate it in the holy place, because it is thy duetie and thy sonnes duety of the offringes of the Lorde made by fire: for so I am commannded.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Also the shaken breast and the heaue shoulder shall yee eate in a cleane place: thou, and thy sonnes, and thy daughters with thee: for they are giuen as thy duetie & thy sonnes duety, of the peace offringes of the children of Israel.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: The heaue shoulder, and the shaken breast shall they bring with the offringes made by fire of the fat, to shake it to and fro before the Lord, and it shalbe thine and thy sonnes with thee by a lawe for euer, as the Lord hath commaunded.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And Moses sought the goate that was offred for sinne, and lo, it was burnt: therefore he was angrie with Eleazar and Ithamar the sonnes of Aaron, which were left aliue, saying,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Wherfore haue ye not eaten the sinne offring in the holy place, seeing it is most Holie? & God hath giuen it you, to beare the iniquitie of the Congregation, to make an atonement for them before the Lorde.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Beholde, the blood of it was not brought within the holy place: ye should haue eaten it in the holy place, as I commaunded.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And Aaron said vnto Moses, Behold, this day haue they offred their sinne offring, and their burnt offring before the Lorde, and such things as thou knowest are come vnto mee: If I had eaten the sinne offring to day, should it haue bene accepted in the sight of the Lord?

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: So when Moses heard it, he was content.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: After, the Lord spake vnto Moses and to Aaron, saying vnto them,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Speake vnto the children of Israel, and say, These are the beastes which yee shall eate, among all the beasts that are on the earth.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Whatsoeuer parteth the hoofe, and is clouen footed, and cheweth the cudde, among the beastes, that shall ye eate.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But of them that chewe the cud, or deuide the hoofe onely, of them yee shall not eate: as the camel, because he cheweth the cud, & deuideth not ye hoofe, he shall be vncleane vnto you.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Likewise the conie, because he cheweth the cud and deuideth not the hoofe, he shall bee vncleane to you.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Also the hare, because he cheweth the cud, and deuideth not the hoofe, he shalbe vncleane to you.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And the swine, because he parteth ye hoofe and is clouen footed, but cheweth not the cud, he shalbe vncleane to you.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Of their flesh shall yee not eate, and their carkeise shall yee not touch: for they shall bee vncleane to you.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: These shall ye eate, of all that are in the waters: whatsoeuer hath finnes & skales in ye waters, in the seas, or in the riuers, them shal ye eate.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But all that haue not finnes nor skales in the seas, or in the riuers, of all that moueth in the waters, and of al liuing things that are in the waters, they shalbe an abomination vnto you.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: They, I say, shalbe an abomination to you: ye shall not eate of their flesh, but shall abhorre their carkeis.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Whatsoeuer hath not fins nor skales in the waters, that shalbe abomination vnto you.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: These shal ye haue also in abomination among the foules, they shal not be eaten: for they are an abomination, the egle, and the goshauke, and the osprey:

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Also the vultur, & the kite after his kinde,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And all rauens after their kinde:

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: The ostrich also, and the night crowe, and the seameaw, and the hauke after his kinde:

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: The litle owle also, and the connorant, and the great owle.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Also the redshanke and the pelicane, and the swanne:

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: The storke also, the heron after his kinde, and the lapwing, and the backe:

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Also euery foule that creepeth & goeth vpon all foure, such shalbe an abomination vnto you.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Yet these shal ye eate: of euery foule that creepeth, and goeth vpon all foure which haue their feete and legs all of one to leape withal vpon the earth,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Of them ye shal eate these, the grashopper after his kinde, & the solean after his kinde, the hargol after his kinde, & the hagab after his kind.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But al other foules that creepe & haue foure feete, they shalbe abomination vnto you.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: For by such ye shalbe polluted: whosoeuer toucheth their carkeis, shalbe vncleane vnto the euening.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Whosoeuer also beareth of their carkeis, shal wash his clothes, and be vncleane vntil euen.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Euery beast that hath clawes deuided, and is not clouen footed, nor cheweth the cud, such shalbe vncleane vnto you: euery one that toucheth them, shalbe vncleane.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And whatsoeuer goeth vpon his pawes among all maner beastes that goeth on all foure, such shalbe vncleane vnto you: who so doth touch their carkeis shalbe vncleane vntil the euen.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And he that beareth their carkeis, shal wash his clothes, and be vncleane vntill the euen: for such shalbe vncleane vnto you.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Also these shalbe vncleane to you amog the things that creepe and moue vpon the earth, the weasell, and the mouse, and the frog, after his kinde:

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Also the rat, and the lizard, and the chameleon, and the stellio, and the molle.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: These shall be vncleane to you among all that creepe: whosoeuer doeth touch them when they be dead, shalbe vncleane vntil the euen.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Also whatsoeuer any of the dead carkeises of them doth fall vpon, shalbe vncleane, whether it be vessel of wood, or rayment, or skinne, or sacke: whatsoeuer vessel it be that is occupied, it shalbe put in the water as vncleane vntil the euen, and so be purified.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But euery earthen vessel, whereinto any of them falleth, whatsoeuer is within it shalbe vncleane, and ye shal breake it.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Al meate also that shalbe eaten, if any such water come vpon it, shalbe vncleane: & all drinke that shalbe drunke in al such vessels shalbe vncleane.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And euery thing that their carkeis fall vpon, shalbe vncleane: the fornais or the pot shalbe broken: for they are vncleane, & shalbe vncleane vnto you.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Yet the fountaines and welles where there is plentie of water shalbe cleane: but that which toucheth their carkeises shalbe vncleane.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And if there fal of their dead carkeis vpo any seede, which vseth to be sowe, it shalbe cleane.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But if any water be powred vpon ye seede, and there fal of their dead carkeis thereon, it shal be vncleane vnto you.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: If also any beast, whereof ye may eate, die, he that toucheth the carkeis thereof shal be vncleane vntil the euen.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And he that eateth of the carkeis of it, shal wash his clothes and be vncleane vntil the euen: he also that beareth the carkeis of it, shal wash his clothes, and be vncleane vntil the euen.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Euery creeping thing therefore that creepeth vpon the earth shalbe an abomination, and not be eaten.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Whatsoeuer goeth vpon the breast, and whatsoeuer goeth vpon al foure, or that hath many feete among all creeping thinges that creepe vpon the earth, ye shal not eate of them, for they shalbe abomination.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Ye shall not pollute your selues with any thing that creepeth, neither make your selues vncleane with them, neither defile your selues thereby: ye shal not, I say, be defiled by them,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: For I am the Lord your God: be sanctified therefore, and be holy, for I am holy, and defile not your selues with any creeping thing, that creepeth vpon the earth.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: For I am the Lorde that brought you out of the lande of Egypt, to be your God, and that you should be holy, for I am holy.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: This is the law of beasts, and of foules, and of euery liuing thing that moueth in the waters, and of euery thing that creepeth vpon the earth:

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: That there may be a difference betweene the vncleane and cleane, and betweene the beast that may be eaten, and the beast that ought not to be eaten.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And the Lord spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Speake vnto the children of Israel, and say, When a woman hath brought forth seede, & borne a manchilde, shee shalbe vncleane seuen dayes, like as she is vncleane when she is put apart for her disease.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: (And in the eight day, the foreskin of the childes flesh shalbe circumcised)

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And she shal continue in the blood of her purifying three and thirtie dayes: she shal touch no halowed thing, nor come into the Sanctuarie, vntil the time of her purifying be out.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But if she beare a mayde childe, then shee shalbe vncleane two weekes, as when shee hath her disease: and she shal continue in the blood of her purifying three score and sixe dayes.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Nowe when the dayes of her purifying are out, (whether it be for a sonne or for a daughter) shee shal bring to the Priest a lambe of one yeere olde for a burnt offering, and a yong pigeon or a turtle doue for a sinne offring, vnto the doore of the Tabernacle of the Congregation,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Who shal offer it before the Lord, & make an atonement for her: so she shalbe purged of the issue of her blood this is the law for her that hath borne a male or female.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But if she bee not able to bring a lambe, she shall bring two turtles, or two yong pigeons: the one for a burnt offring, and the other for a sinne offring: and the Priest shall make an atonement for her: so she shal be cleane.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Moreouer the Lorde spake vnto Moses, and to Aaron, saying,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: The man that shall haue in the skin of his flesh a swelling or a skab, or a white spot, so that in the skinne of his flesh it be like the plague of leprosie, then he shalbe brought vnto Aaron the Priest, or vnto one of his sonnes the Priestes,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And the Priest shall looke on the sore in the skinne of his flesh: if the heare in the sore be turned into white, and the sore seeme to be lower then the skinne of his flesh, it is a plague of leprosie. Therefore the Priest shall looke on him, and pronounce him vncleane:

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But if the white spot be in the skinne of his flesh, and seeme not to bee lower then the skin, nor the heare thereof be turned vnto white, then the Priest shall shut vp him that hath the plague, seuen dayes.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: After, the Priest shall looke vpon him the seuenth day: and if the plague seeme to him to abide still, and the plague growe not in the skin, the Priest shal shut him vp yet seuen dayes more.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then the Priest shall looke on him againe the seuenth day, and if the plague be darke, and the sore grow not in the skinne, then the Priest shal pronounce him cleane, for it is a skab: therefore he shall washe his clothes and be cleane.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But if the skab growe more in the skinne, after that he is seene of ye Priest for to be purged, he shall be seene of the Priest yet againe.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then the Priest shall consider, and if the skab growe in the skin, then the Priest shal pronounce him vncleane: for it is leprosie.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: When the plague of leprosie is in a man, he shalbe brought vnto the Priest,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And the Priest shall see him: and if the swelling be white in ye skin, & haue made ye heare white, and there be rawe flesh in the swelling,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: It is an old leprosie in the skin of his flesh: and the Priest shall pronounce him vncleane, and shall not shut him vp, for he is vncleane.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Also if the leprosie breake out in the skin, and the leprosie couer all the skin of the plague, from his head euen to his feete, wheresoeuer the Priest looketh,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then the Priest shall consider: and if the leprosie couer all his flesh, he shal pronounce the plague to bee cleane, because it is all turned into whitenesse: so he shalbe cleane.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But if there be raw flesh on him when he is seene, he shalbe vncleane.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: For the Priest shall see the rawe flesh, and declare him to be vncleane: for the rawe flesh is vncleane, therefore it is the leprosie.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Or if the rawe flesh change and be turned into white, then he shall come to the Priest,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And the Priest shal beholde him and if the sore be changed into white, then the Priest shall pronounce the plague cleane, for it is cleane.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: The flesh also in whose skin there is a bile and is healed,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And in ye place of the bile there be a white swelling, or a white spot somewhat reddish, it shal be seene of the Priest.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And when the Priest seeth it, if it appeare lower then the skinne, and the heare thereof bee changed into white, ye Priest then shal pronounce him vncleane: for it is a plague of leprosie, broken out in the bile.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But if the Priest looke on it, & there be no white heares therein, and if it bee not lower then the skin, but be darker, then the Priest shall shut him vp seuen dayes.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And if it spred abroad in the flesh, ye Priest shall pronounce him vncleane, for it is a sore.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But if the spot continue in his place, and growe not, it is a burning bile: therefore the Priest shall declare him to be cleane.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: If there be any flesh, in whose skin there is an hote burning, & the quick flesh of ye burning haue a white spot, somewhat reddish or pale,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then the Priest shall looke vpon it: and if the heare in that spot be changed into white, and it appeare lower then the skin, it is a leprosie broken out in the burning therefore the Priest shall pronounce him vncleane: for it is the plague of leprosie.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But if the Priest looke on it, and there be no white heare in the spot, and be no lower then the other skinne, but be darker, then the Priest shall shut him vp seuen dayes.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: After, the Priest shall looke on him the seuenth day: if it be growen abroad in the skinne, then the Priest shall pronounce him vncleane: for it is the plague of leprosie.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And if the spot abide in his place, not growing in the skin, but is darke, it is a rising of the burning: the Priest shall therefore declare him cleane, for it is the drying vp of the burning.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: If also a man or woman hath a sore on the head or in the beard,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then the Priest shall see his sore: and if it appeare lower then the skin, and there be in it a smal yelow heare, then the Priest shal pronouce him vncleane: for it is a blacke spot, and leprosie of the head or of the beard.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And if the Priest looke on the sore of the blacke spotte, and if it seeme not lower then the skinne, nor haue any blacke heare in it, then the Priest shall shut vp him, that hath the sore of the blacke spot, seuen dayes.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: After, in the seuenth day the Priest shall looke on the sore: and if the blacke spot growe not, and there be in it no yelowe heare, and the blacke spot seeme not lower then the skinne,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then he shalbe shauen, but the place of the blacke spot shall he not shaue: but the Priest shall shut vp him, that hath the blacke spot, seuen dayes more.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And the seuenth day the Priest shall looke on the blacke spot: and if the blacke spot growe not in the skinne, nor seeme lower then the other skinne, then the Priest shall clense him, and hee shall wash his clothes, and be cleane.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But if the blacke spot growe abroad in the flesh after his clensing,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then the Priest shall looke on it: & if the blacke spot grow in the skin, the Priest shall not seeke for the yelowe heare: for he is vncleane.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But if ye blacke spot seeme to him to abide, and that blacke heare growe therein, the blacke spot is healed, he is cleane, and the Priest shall declare him to be cleane.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Furthermore if there bee many white spots in the skin of the flesh of man or woman,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then the Priest shall consider: and if the spots in the skin of their flesh be somewhat darke and white withall, it is but a white spot broken out in the skin: therefore he is cleane.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And the man whose heare is fallen off his head, and is balde, is cleane.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And if his head lose the heare on the forepart, and be balde before, he is cleane.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But if there be in the balde head, or in the balde forehead a white reddish sore, it is a leprosie springing in his balde head, or in his balde forehead.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Therefore the Priest shall looke vpon it, & if the rising of the sore bee white reddish in his balde head, or in his bald forehead, appearing like leprosie in the skin of the flesh,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: He is a leper and vncleane: therefore the Priest shall pronounce him altogether vncleane: for the sore is in his head.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: The leper also in whom the plague is, shall haue his clothes rent, and his head bare, & shall put a couering vpon his lips, and shal cry, I am vncleane, I am vncleane.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: As long as the disease shall be vpon him, he shalbe polluted, for he is vncleane: he shall dwell alone, without the campe shall his habitation be.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Also the garment that the plague of leprosie is in, whether it be a wollen garment or a linen garment,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Whether it bee in the warpe or in ye woofe of linen or of wollen, either in a skin, or in any thing made of skin,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And if the sore be greene or somewhat reddish in the garment or in ye skin, or in the warpe, or in the woofe, or in any thing that is made of skin, it is a plague of leprosie and shalbe shewed vnto the Priest.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then the Priest shall see the plague, and shut vp it that hath the plague, seuen dayes,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And shall looke on the plague the seuenth day: if the plague growe in the garment or in the warpe, or in the woofe, or in the skinne, or in any thing that is made of skin, that plague is a fretting leprosie and vncleane.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And hee shall burne the garment, or the warpe, or the woofe, whether it bee wollen or linen, or any thing that is made of skin, wherein the plague is: for it is a freating leprosie, therefore it shalbe burnt in the fire.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: If the Priest yet see that the plague grow not in the garment, or in the woofe, or in whatsoeuer thing of skin it be,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then the Priest shall commaunde them to wash the thing wherein the plague is, and he shall shut it vp seuen dayes more.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Againe ye Priest shall looke on the plague, after it is washed: and if the plague haue not changed his colour, though the plague haue spred no further, it is vncleane: thou shalt burne it in the fire, for it is a fret inwarde, whether the spot bee in the bare place of the whole, or in part thereof.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And if the Priest see that the plague bee darker, after that it is washed, he shall cut it out of the garment, or out of the skin, or out of the warpe, or out of the woofe.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And if it appeare stil in ye garment or in the warpe, or in the woofe, or in any thing made of skin, it is a spreading leprie: thou shalt burne the thing wherein the plague is, in the fire.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: If thou hast washed ye garment or ye warpe, or ye woofe, or whatsouer thing of skin it be, if the plague be departed therefrom, then shal it be washed the second time, and be cleane.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: This is the lawe of the plague of leprosie in a garment of wollen or linnen, or in the warpe, or in the woofe, or in any thing of skin, to make it cleane or vncleane.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And the Lord spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: This is the law of the leper in the day of his clensing: that is, he shall be brought vnto the Priest,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And the Priest shall go out of the campe, & the Priest shall consider him: and if the plague of leprosie be healed in the leper,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then shall the Priest commaunde to take for him that is clensed, two sparrowes aliue and cleane, and cedar wood and a skarlet lace, and hyssope.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And the Priest shall commaunde to kill one of the birdes ouer pure water in an earthen vessell.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: After, he shall take the liue sparowe with the cedar wood, and the skarlet lace, and the hyssope, and shall dip them and the liuing sparowe in the blood of the sparowe slaine, ouer the pure water,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And hee shall sprinkle vpon him, that must be clensed of his leprosie, seuen times, and clense him, and shall let goe the liue sparowe into the broad fielde.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then he that shall be clensed, shall wash his clothes, and shaue off all his heare, and wash himselfe in water, so he shalbe cleane: after that shall he come into the host, but shall tary without his tent seuen dayes.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: So in the seuenth day hee shall shaue off all his heare, both his head, and his beard, and his eye browes: euen all his heare shall he shaue, and shall wash his clothes and shall wash his flesh in water: so he shalbe cleane.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then in the eight day he shal take two hee lambes without blemish, and an ewe lambe of a yere olde without blemish, and three tenth deales of fine flower for a meate offering, mingled with oyle, and a pint of oyle.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And the Priest that maketh him cleane shal bring the man which is to bee made cleane, and those things, before the Lord, at the doore of the Tabernacle of the Congregation.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then the Priest shall take one lambe, and offer him for a trespasse offering, and the pint of oyle, and shake the to and fro before the Lord.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And hee shall kill the lambe in the place where the sinne offring and the burnt offring are slaine, euen in the holy place: for as the sinne offring is the Priests, so is the trespasse offring: for it is most holy.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: So the Priest shal take of the blood of the trespasse offring, and put it vpon the lappe of the right eare of him that shalbe clensed, and vpon the thumbe of his right hand, and vpon the great toe of his right foote.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: The Priest shall also take of ye pint of oyle, and powre it into the palme of his left hand,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And the Priest shal dip his right finger in the oyle that is in his left hand, & sprinkle of the oyle with his finger seuen times before the Lord.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And of the rest of the oyle that is in his hand, shal the Priest put vpon the lap of the right eare of him that is to bee clensed, and vpon the thumbe of his right hand, and vpon the great toe of his right foote, where the blood of the trespasse offring was put.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But the remnant of the oyle that is in the Priests hand, he shal powre vpon the head of him that is to be clensed: so the Priest shall make an atonement for him before the Lord.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And the Priest shal offer the sinne offring and make an atonement for him that is to bee clensed of his vncleannesse: then after shall he kill the burnt offring.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: So the Priest shal offer ye burnt offring and the meat offring vpon ye altar and the Priest shall make an atonement for him: so he shalbe cleane.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But if he be poore, and not able, then he shall bring one lambe for a trespasse offring to be shaken, for his reconciliation, and a tenth deale of fine flower mingled with oyle, for a meate offring, with a pinte of oyle.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Also two turtle doues, or two yong pigeons, as he is able, whereof the one shalbe a sinne offering, and the other a burnt offring,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And he shall bring them the eight day for his clensing vnto the Priest at the doore of the Tabernacle of the Congregation before ye Lord.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: The the Priest shall take the lambe of the trespasse offring, & the pint of oyle, & the Priest shall shake them to and fro before the Lord.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And he shall kil the lambe of the trespasse offering, and the Priest shall take of the blood of the trespasse offring, and put it vpon the lap of his right eare that is to be clensed, & vpon ye thumbe of his right hande, and vpon the great toe of his right foote.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Also the Priest shal powre of the oyle into the palme of his owne left hand.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: So ye Priest shal with his right finger sprinkle of the oyle that is in his left hand, seuen times before the Lord.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then the Priest shall put of the oyle that is in his hande, vpon the lap of the right eare of him that is to bee clensed, and vpon the thumbe of his right hande, and vpon the great toe of his right foote: vpon the place of the blood of the trespasse offring.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But ye rest of the oyle that is in the Priests hand, he shall put vpon the head of him that is to be clensed, to make an atonement for him before the Lord.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Also hee shall present one of the turtle doues, or of the yong pigeons, as he is able:

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Such, I say, as he is able, the one for a sinne offring, and the other for a burnt offring with the meate offring: so the Priest shall make an atonement for him that is to bee clensed before the Lord.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: This is the lawe of him which hath the plague of leprosie, who is not able in his clensing to offer the whole.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: The Lord also spake vnto Moses and to Aaron, saying,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: When ye be come vnto the land of Canaan which I giue you in possession, if I sende the plague of leprosie in an house of the land of your possession,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then he that oweth the house, shall come and tell the Priest, saying, Me thinke there is like a plague of leprosie in the house.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then the Priest shall commande them to emptie the house before the Priest goe into it to see the plague, that all that is in the house be not made vncleane, and then shall the Priest goe in to see the house,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And hee shall marke the plague: and if the plague be in the walles of the house, & that there be deepe spots, greenish or reddish, which seeme to be lower then the wall,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then the Priest shall goe out of the house to the doore of the house, and shall cause to shut vp the house seuen dayes.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: So the Priest shall come againe ye seuenth day: and if he see that the plague bee increased in the walles of the house,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then the Priest shall commande them to take away the stones wherein the plague is, and they shall cast them into a foule place without the citie.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Also hee shall cause to scrape the house within rounde about, and powre the dust, that they haue pared off, without the citie in an vncleane place.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And they shall take other stones, and put them in the places of those stones, and shall take other mortar, to plaister the house with.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But if the plague come againe and breake out in the house, after that he hath taken away ye stones, and after that hee hath scraped and playstered the house,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then the Priest shall come and see: and if the plague growe in the house, it is a freating leprosie in the house: it is therefore vncleane.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And hee shall breake downe the house, with the stones of it, and the timber thereof, and all the mortar of the house, and hee shall carie them out of the citie vnto an vncleane place.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Moreouer he that goeth into the house all the while that it is shut vp, hee shall bee vncleane vntill the euen.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Hee also that sleepeth in the house shall wash his clothes: he likewise that eateth in the house, shall wash his clothes.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But if the Priest shall come and see, that the plague hath spread no further in the house, after the house be plaistered, the Priest shall pronounce that house cleane, for the plague is healed.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then shal he take to purifie the house, two sparrowes, and cedar wood, and skarlet lace, and hyssope.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And hee shall kill one sparowe ouer pure water in an earthen vessell,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And shall take the cedar wood, and the hyssope, and the skarlet lace with the liue sparow, and dip them in the blood of the slayne sparow, and in the pure water, and sprinkle the house seuen times:

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: So shall hee clense the house with ye blood of the sparowe, & with the pure water, and with the liue sparowe, and with the cedar wood, and with the hyssope, and with the skarlet lace.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Afterwarde he shal let go the liue sparowe out of the towne into the broad fieldes: so shal he make atonement for the house, and it shal be cleane.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: This is the law for euery plague of leprosie and blacke spot,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And of the leprosie of the garment, and of the house,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And of the swelling, and of the skab, and of the white spot.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: This is the lawe of the leprosie to teache when a thing is vncleane, & when it is cleane.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Moreouer the Lord spake vnto Moses, and to Aaron, saying,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Speake vnto the children of Israel, and say vnto them, Whosoeuer hath an issue from his flesh, is vncleane, because of his issue.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And this shalbe his vncleannes in his issue: when his flesh auoydeth his issue, or if his flesh be stopped from his issue, this is his vncleannes.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Euery bed whereon he lyeth that hath the issue, shall be vncleane, and euery thing whereon he sitteth, shalbe vncleane.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Whosoeuer also toucheth his bed, shal wash his clothes, and wash himselfe in water, and shall be vncleane vntill the euen.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And he that sitteth on any thing, whereon he sate that hath the issue, shall wash his clothes, and wash himselfe in water, and shalbe vncleane vntill the euen.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Also he that toucheth the flesh of him that hath the issue, shal wash his clothes, & wash himselfe in water, & shalbe vncleane vntil the euen.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: If he also, that hath the issue, spit vpon him that is cleane, he shal wash his clothes, and wash himselfe in water, and shalbe vncleane vntill the euen.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And what saddle soeuer he rideth vpon, that hath the issue, shalbe vncleane,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And whosoeuer toucheth any thing that was vnder him, shall be vncleane vnto the euen: and he that beareth those things, shall wash his clothes, and wash himselfe in water, and shall be vncleane vntill the euen.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Likewise whomesoeuer hee toucheth that hath the issue (and hath not washed his handes in water) shal wash his clothes and wash himselfe in water, and shalbe vncleane vntill the euen.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And the vessel of earth that he toucheth, which hath the issue, shalbe broken: and euery vessel of wood shalbe rinsed in water.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But if he that hath an issue, be cleansed of his issue, then shall he count him seuen dayes for his cleansing, and wash his clothes, and wash his flesh in pure water: so shal he be cleane.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then the eight day he shall take vnto him two Turtle doues or two yong pigeons, and come before the Lorde at the doore of the Tabernacle of the Congregation, and shall giue them vnto the Priest.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And the Priest shall make of the one of them a sinne offring, & of the other a burnt offering: so the Priest shall make an atonement for him before the Lord, for his issue.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Also if any mans issue of seede depart from him, he shal wash all his flesh in water, and be vncleane vntill the euen.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And euery garment, & euery skinne whereupon shalbe issue of seede, shall be euen washed with water, and be vncleane vnto the euen.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: If he that hath an issue of seede, do lie with a woman, they shall both wash themselues with water, and be vncleane vntill the euen.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Also when a woman shal haue an issue, and her issue in her flesh shalbe blood, she shalbe put apart seuen dayes: and whosoeuer toucheth her, shalbe vncleane vnto the euen.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And whatsoeuer she lieth vpon in her separation, shalbe vncleane, and euery thing that she sitteth vpon, shalbe vncleane.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Whosoeuer also toucheth her bedde, shall wash his clothes, and wash himselfe with water, & shalbe vncleane vnto the euen.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And whosoeuer toucheth any thing that she sate vpon, shal wash his clothes, and wash him selfe in water, & shalbe vncleane vnto the euen:

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: So that whether he touche her bed, or any thing whereon shee hath sit, he shalbe vncleane vnto the euen.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And if a man lye with her, and the flowers of her separation touch him, he shalbe vncleane seuen dayes, and all the whole bed whereon he lieth, shalbe vncleane.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Also when a womans issue of blood runneth long time besides the time of her floures, or when she hath an issue, longer then her floures, all the dayes of the issue of her vncleannesse shee shalbe vncleane, as in the time of her floures.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Euery bed whereon shee lyeth (as long as her issue lasteth) shalbe to her as her bed of her separation: & whatsoeuer she sitteth vpon, shalbe vncleane, as her vncleannes whe she is put apart.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And whosoeuer toucheth these things, shal be vncleane, & shal wash his clothes, & wash him selfe in water, & shalbe vncleane vnto the euen.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But if she be clensed of her issue, then shee shall count her seuen dayes, and after, shee shall be cleane.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And in the eight day shee shall take vnto her two Turtles or two yong pigeons, and bring them vnto the Priest at the doore of the Tabernacle of the Congregation.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And the Priest shall make of ye one a sinne offring, and of the other a burnt offring, and the Priest shal make an atonement for her before the Lord, for the issue of her vncleannes.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Thus shal yee separate the children of Israel from their vncleannes, that they dye not in their vncleannesse, if they defile my Tabernacle that is among them.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: This is the lawe of him that hath an issue, and of him from whome goeth an issue of seede whereby he is defiled:

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Also of her that is sicke of her floures, and of him that hath a running issue, whether it bee man or woman, and of him that lyeth with her which is vncleane.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Fvrthermore the Lord spake vnto Moses, after the death of the two sonnes of Aaron, whe they came to offer before the Lord, and dyed:

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And the Lord sayd vnto Moses, Speake vnto Aaron thy brother, that he come not at all times into the Holy place within the vayle, before the Merciseate, which is vpon the Arke, that he dye not: for I wil appeare in the cloude vpon the Merciseate.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: After this sort shall Aaron come into the Holy place: euen with a yong bullocke for a sinne offring, and a ramme for a burnt offring.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: He shal put on the holy linnen coate, and shal haue linnen breeches vpon his flesh, & shal be girded with a linnen girdle, and shal couer his head with a linnen miter: these are the holy garments: therefore shal hee wash his flesh in water, when he doeth put them on.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And hee shal take of the Congregation of the children of Israel, two hee goates for a sinne offring, and a ramme for a burnt offring.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then Aaron shal offer the bullocke for his sinne offring, and make an atonement for himselfe, and for his house.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And he shal take the two hee goates, and present them before the Lord at the doore of the Tabernacle of the Congregation.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then Aaron shal cast lots ouer the two hee goates: one lot for the Lord, and the other for the Scape goate.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And Aaron shal offer the goat, vpon which the Lords lot shal fal, & make him a sinne offring.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But the goate, on which the lot shal fall to be the Scape goate, shalbe presented aliue before the Lord, to make reconciliation by him, & to let him go (as a Scape goate) into the wildernes.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Thus Aaron shal offer the bullocke for his sinne offring, and make a reconciliation for himselfe, and for his house, and shal kill the bullocke for his sinne offring.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And he shal take a censer full of burning coles from off the altar before the Lorde, and his handfull of sweete incense beaten small, & bring it within the vayle,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And shal put the incense vpon the fire before the Lorde, that the cloude of the incense may couer the Merciseat that is vpon the Testimonie: so he shal not dye.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And hee shall take of the blood of the bullocke, and sprinkle it with his finger vpon the Merciseat Eastward: and before the Merciseate shal he sprinkle of the blood with his finger seuen times.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then shall he kill the goate that is the peoples sinne offring, and bring his blood within the vaile, and doe with that blood, as he did with the blood of the bullocke, and sprinckle it vpon the Merciseate, and before the Merciseate.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: So he shal purge the Holy place from the vncleannes of the children of Israel, & from their trespasses of all their sinnes: so shal he do also for the Tabernacle of the Cogregation placed with them, in the middes of their vncleannesse.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And there shalbe no man in the Tabernacle of the Congregation, when he goeth in to make an atonement in the Holy place, vntill hee come out, and haue made an atonement for himselfe, and for his housholde, and for all the Congregation of Israel.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: After, he shal goe out vnto the altar that is before the Lord & make a reconciliation vpon it, and shal take of the blood of the bullocke, and of the blood of the goate, and put it vpon the hornes of the Altar round about:

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: So shal hee sprinkle of the blood vpon it with his finger seuen times, & clense it, & halowe it from the vncleannes of the children of Israel.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: When he hath made an ende of purging the Holy place, and the Tabernacle of the Congregation, and the altar, then he shall bring the liue goate:

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And Aaron shal put both his handes vpon the head of the liue goate, & confesse ouer him al the iniquities of the children of Israel, & all their trespasses, in all their sinnes, putting them vpon the head of the goate, & shal sende him away (by the hand of a man appointed) into the wildernes.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: So the goate shal beare vpon him all their iniquities into the land that is not inhabited, & he shal let the goate go into the wildernesse.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: After, Aaron shal come into the Tabernacle of the Congregation, and put off the linnen clothes, which he put on when he went into the Holy place, and leaue them there.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Hee shal wash also his flesh with water in the Holy place, and put on his owne rayment, and come out, and make his burnt offring, & the burnt offring of the people, and make an atonement for himselfe, and for the people.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Also the fatte of the sinne offring shal he burne vpon the altar.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And he that caried forth the goat, called the Scape goat, shal wash his clothes, & wash his flesh in water, and after that shal come into the hoste.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Also the bullocke for the sinne offring, & the goate for the sinne offring (whose blood was brought to make a reconciliation in the Holy place) shal one carie out without the hoste to be burnt in the fire, with their skinnes, and with their flesh, and with their doung.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And hee that burneth them shal wash his clothes, and wash his flesh in water, and afterward come into the hoste.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: So this shalbe an ordinance for euer vnto you: the tenth day of the seuenth moneth, yee shal humble your soules, & do no worke at all, whether it be one of the same countrey or a strager that soiourneth among you.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: For that day shal ye Priest make an atonement for you to clense you: ye shalbe cleane from all your sinnes before the Lord.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: This shall be a Sabbath of rest vnto you, and ye shal humble your soules, by an ordinance for euer.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And the Priest whom he shal anoynt, & whom he shal cosecrate (to minister in his fathers steade) shal make the atonement, & shal put on the linnen clothes and Holy vestments,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And shal purge the Holy Sanctuarie & the Tabernacle of the Congregation, and shal clense the altar, and make an atonement for the Priests and for all the people of the Congregation.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And this shalbe an euerlasting ordinance vnto you, to make an atonement for the children of Israel for all their sinnes once a yeere: and as the Lord commanded Moses, he did.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And the Lord spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Speake vnto Aaron, and to his sonnes, and to all the children of Israel, & say vnto them, This is the thing which the Lorde hath commanded, saying,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Whosoeuer he be of the house of Israel that killeth a bullocke, or lambe, or goate in the hoste, or that killeth it out of the hoste,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And bringeth it not vnto the doore of the Tabernacle of the Congregation to offer an offring vnto the Lord before the Tabernacle of the Lord, blood shalbe imputed vnto that man: he hath shed blood, wherefore that man shall be cut off from among his people.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Therefore the children of Israel shall bring their offrings, which they would offer abroad in the fielde, & present the vnto ye Lord at the doore of the Tabernacle of ye Congregation by ye Priest, and offer them for peace offrings vnto the Lord.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then the Priest shall sprinkle the blood vpon the Altar of the Lord before the doore of the Tabernacle of the Congregation, and burne the fat for a sweete sauour vnto the Lord.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And they shall no more offer their offerings vnto deuils, after whom they haue gone a whoring: this shalbe an ordinance for euer vnto them in their generations.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Also thou shalt say vnto them, whosoeuer he be of the house of Israel, or of the strangers which soiourne among them, that offreth a burnt offring or sacrifice,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And bringeth it not vnto ye doore of the Tabernacle of the Congregation to offer it vnto the Lord, euen that man shall be cut off from his people.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Likewise whosoeuer he be of the house of Israel, or of the strangers that soiourne among them, that eateth any blood, I will euen set my face against that person that eateth blood, & will cut him off from among his people.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: For the life of the flesh is in the blood, and I haue giuen it vnto you to offer vpon the altar, to make an atonemet for your soules: for this blood shall make an atonement for the soule.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Therefore I saide vnto ye children of Israel, None of you shall eate blood: neither the stranger that soiourneth among you, shall eate blood.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Moreouer whosoeuer he be of the children of Israel, or of the strangers that soiourne among the, which by hunting taketh any beast or foule that may be eaten, he shal powre out the blood thereof, and couer it with dust:

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: For ye life of all flesh is his blood, it is ioyned with his life: therefore I sayd vnto the children of Israel, Ye shall eate the blood of no flesh: for the life of al flesh is the blood thereof: whosoeuer eateth it, shalbe cut off.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And euery person that eateth it which dyeth alone, or that which is torne with beastes, whether it be one of the same countrey or a stranger, he shall both wash his clothes, and wash himselfe in water, and be vncleane vnto the euen: after he shalbe cleane.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But if he wash them not, nor wash his flesh, then he shall beare his iniquitie.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And the Lord spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Speake vnto the children of Israel, and say vnto them, I am the Lord your God.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: After ye doings of the land of Egypt, wherin ye dwelt, shall ye not doe: and after the maner of the land of Canaan, whither I will bring you, shal ye not do, neither walke in their ordinances,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But do after my iudgementes, and keepe mine ordinances, to walke therein: I am the Lord your God.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Ye shall keepe therefore my statutes, & my iudgementes, which if a man doe, he shall then liue in them: I am the Lord.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: None shall come neere to any of ye kinred of his flesh to vncouer her shame: I am the Lord.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Thou shalt not vncouer the shame of thy father, nor the shame of thy mother: for she is thy mother, thou shalt not discouer her shame.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: The shame of thy fathers wife shalt thou not discouer: for it is thy fathers shame.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Thou shalt not discouer the shame of thy sister the daughter of thy father, or the daughter of thy mother, whether shee bee borne at home, or borne without: thou shalt not discouer their shame.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: The shame of thy sonnes daughter, or of thy daughters daughter, thou shalt not, I say, vncouer their shame: for it is thy shame.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: The shame of thy fathers wiues daughter, begotten of thy father (for she is thy sister) thou shalt not, I say, discouer her shame.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Thou shalt not vncouer the shame of thy fathers sister: for she is thy fathers kinswoman.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Thou shalt not discouer the shame of thy mothers sister: for she is thy mothers kinsewoman.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Thou shalt not vncouer the shame of thy fathers brother: that is, thou shalt not goe in to his wife, for she is thine aunte.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Thou shalt not discouer the shame of thy daughter in lawe: for she is thy sonnes wife: therefore shalt thou not vncouer her shame.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Thou shalt not discouer the shame of thy brothers wife. for it is thy brothers shame.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Thou shalt not discouer the shame of the wife and of her daughter, neither shalt thou take her sonnes daughter, nor her daughters daughter, to vncouer her shame: for they are thy kinsfolkes, and it were wickednesse.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Also thou shalt not take a wife with her sister, during her life, to vexe her, in vncouering her shame vpon her.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Thou shalt not also go vnto a woman to vncouer her shame, as long as she is put apart for her disease.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Moreouer, thou shalt not giue thy selfe to thy neighbours wife by carnall copulation, to be defiled with her.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Also thou shalt not giue thy children to offer them vnto Molech, neither shalt thou defile the name of thy God: for I am the Lord.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Thou shalt not lie with ye male as one lieth with a woman: for it is abomination.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Thou shalt not also lie with any beast to bee defiled therewith, neither shall any woman stand before a beast, to lie downe thereto: for it is abomination.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Yee shall not defile your selues in any of these things: for in al these the nations are defiled, which I will cast out before you:

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And the land is defiled: therefore I wil visit the wickednesse thereof vpon it, and the lande shall vomit out her inhabitants.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Ye shall keepe therefore mine ordinances, and my iudgementes, and commit none of these abominations, aswell hee that is of the same countrey, as the straunger that soiourneth among you.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: (For all these abominations haue the men of the land done, which were before you, and the land is defiled:

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And shall not the lande spue you out if ye defile it, as it spued out the people that were before you?)

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: For whosoeuer shall commit any of these abominations, the persons that doe so, shall bee cut off from among their people.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Therefore shall yee keepe mine ordinances that ye do not any of the abominable customes, which haue bene done before you, and that yee defile not your selues therein: for I am the Lorde your God.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And the Lorde spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Speake vnto all the Congregation of the children of Israel, and say vnto them, Ye shalbe holy, for I the Lord your God am holy.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Yee shall feare euery man his mother and his father, and shall keepe my Sabbaths: for I am the Lord your God.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Ye shall not turne vnto idoles, nor make you molten gods: I am the Lord your God.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And when yee shall offer a peace offering vnto the Lord, ye shall offer it freely.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: It shall be eaten the day yee offer it, or on the morowe: and that which remaineth vntill the third day, shalbe burnt in the fire.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: For if it be eaten the third day, it shall be vncleane, it shall not be accepted.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Therefore he that eateth it, shal beare his iniquitie, because he hath defiled the halowed thing of the Lorde, and that person shalbe cut off from his people.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: When yee reape the haruest of your land, ye shal not reape euery corner of your field, neither shalt thou gather the glainings of thy haruest.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Thou shalt not gather the grapes of thy vineyarde cleane, neyther gather euery grape of thy vineyarde, but thou shalt leaue them for the poore and for the straunger: I am the Lorde your God.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Ye shall not steale, neither deale falsely, neither lie one to another.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Also yee shall not sweare by my name falsely, neither shalt thou defile the name of thy God: I am the Lord.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Thou shalt not do thy neighbour wrong, neither rob him. The workemans hire shal not abide with thee vntil the morning.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Thou shalt not curse the deafe, neither put a stumbling blocke before the blinde, but shalt feare thy God: I am the Lord.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Ye shall not doe vniustly in iudgement. Thou shalt not fauour the person of the poore, nor honour the person of the mightie, but thou shalt iudge thy neighbour iustly.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Thou shalt not walke about with tales among thy people. Thou shalt not stand against the blood of thy neighbour: I am the Lord.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Thou shalt not hate thy brother in thine heart, but thou shalt plainely rebuke thy neighbour, and suffer him not to sinne.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Thou shalt not auenge, nor be mindful of wrong against ye childre of thy people, but shalt loue thy neighbour as thy selfe: I am the Lord.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Yee shall keepe mine ordinances. Thou shalt not let thy cattel gender with others of diuers kindes. Thou shalt not sowe thy fielde with mingled seede, neyther shall a garment of diuers thinges, as of linen and wollen come vpon thee.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Whosoeuer also lyeth and medleth with a woman that is a bonde mayde, affianced to a husbande, and not redeemed, nor freedome giuen her, she shalbe scourged, but they shall not die, because she is not made free.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And he shall bring for his trespasse offring vnto the Lorde, at the doore of the Tabernacle of the Congregation, a ramme for a trespasse offering.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then the Priest shall make an atonement for him with the ramme of the trespasse offering before the Lorde, concerning his sinne which he hath done, and pardon shalbe giuen him for his sinne which he hath committed.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Also when ye shall come into the land, & haue planted euery tree for meate, ye shal count the fruite thereof as vncircumcised: three yeere shall it be vncircumcised vnto you, it shall not be eaten:

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But in the fourth yere all the fruite thereof shalbe holy to the praise of the Lorde.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And in the fifth yeere shall ye eate of the fruite of it that it may yeelde to you the encrease thereof: I am the Lorde your God.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Ye shal not eat the flesh with the blood, ye shall not vse witchcraft, nor obserue times.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Ye shall not cut rounde the corners of your heades, neither shalt thou marre the tuftes of thy beard.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Ye shal not cut your flesh for the dead, nor make any print of a marke vpon you: I am the Lorde,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Thou shalt not make thy daughter common, to cause her to be a whore, least the lande also fall to whoredome, and the lande bee full of wickednesse.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Ye shall keepe my Sabbaths and reuerence my Sanctuarie: I am the Lorde.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Ye shall not regarde them that worke with spirites, neither soothsayers: ye shall not seeke to them to be defiled by them: I am the Lorde your God.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Thou shalt rise vp before the horehead, and honour the person of the old man, and dread thy God: I am the Lorde.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And if a stranger soiourne with thee in your lande, ye shall not vexe him.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But the stranger that dwelleth with you, shalbe as one of your selues, and thou shalt loue him as thy selfe: for ye were strangers in the lad of Egypt: I am the Lorde your God.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Ye shall not doe vniustly in iudgement, in line, in weight, or in measure.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: You shall haue iust ballances, true weightes, a true Ephah, and a true Hin. I am the Lorde your God, which haue brought you out of the lande of Egypt.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Therefore shall ye obserue all mine ordinances, and all my iudgements, and doe them: I am the Lorde.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And the Lorde spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Thou shalt say also to the children of Israel, Whosoeuer he be of the children of Israel, or of the strangers that dwell in Israel, that giueth his children vnto Molech, he shal die the death, ye people of ye land shall stone him to death.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And I will set my face against that man and cut him off from among his people, because he hath giuen his children vnto Molech, for to defile my Sanctuarie, and to pollute mine holye Name.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And if the people of the lande hide their eyes, and winke at that man when he giueth his children vnto Molech, and kill him not,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then will I set my face against that man, and against his familie, and will cut him off, and all that go a whoring after him to comit whoredome with Molech, from among their people.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: If any turne after such as worke with spirits, and after soothsayers, to go a whoring after them, then will I set my face against that person, and will cut him off from among his people.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Sanctifie your selues therefore, and be holie, for I am the Lorde your God.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Keepe ye therefore mine ordinances, and doe them. I am the Lorde which doeth sanctifie you.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: If there be any that curseth his father or his mother, he shall die the death: seeing hee hath cursed his father and his mother, his blood shalbe vpon him.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And the man that committeth adulterie with another mans wife, because he hath comitted adulterie with his neighbours wife, the adulterer and the adulteresse shall die the death.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And the man that lyeth with his fathers wife, because hee hath vncouered his fathers shame, they shall both dye: their blood shalbe vpon them.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Also the man that lyeth with his daughter in lawe, they both shall dye the death, they haue wrought abomination, their blood shalbe vpon them.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: The ma also that lyeth with the male, as one lyeth with a woman, they haue both committed abomination: they shall dye the death, their blood shalbe vpon them.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Likewise he that taketh a wife and her mother, committeth wickednesse: they shal burne him and them with fire, that there be no wickednes among you.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Also the man that lyeth with a beast, shall dye the death, and ye shall slay the beast.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And if a woman come to any beast, and lye therewith, then thou shalt kill the woman and the beast: they shall die the death, their blood shalbe vpon them.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Also the man that taketh his sister, his fathers daughter, or his mothers daughter, & seeth her shame and she seeth his shame, it is villenie: therefore they shall be cut off in the sight of their people, because he hath vncouered his sisters shame, he shall beare his iniquitie.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: The man also that lyeth with a woman hauing her disease, and vncouereth her shame, and openeth her fountaine, and she open the foutaine of her blood, they shall bee euen both cut off from among their people.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Moreouer thou shalt not vncouer the shame of thy mothers sister, nor of thy fathers sister: because he hath vncouered his kin, they shall beare their iniquitie.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Likewise the man that lyeth with his fathers brothers wife, and vncouereth his vncles shame: they shall beare their iniquitie, and shall die childlesse.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: So the man that taketh his brothers wife, committeth filthines, because he hath vncouered his brothers shame: they shalbe childles.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Ye shall keepe therefore all mine ordinances and all my iudgements, and doe them, that the land, whither I bring you to dwel therein, spue you not out.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Wherefore ye shall not walke in the maners of this nation which I cast out before you: for they haue committed all these things, therefore I abhorred them.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But I haue saide vnto you, ye shall inherite their land, & I will giue it vnto you to possesse it, euen a land that floweth with milke and honie: I am the Lorde your God, which haue separated you from other people.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Therefore shall ye put difference betweene cleane beastes and vncleane, & betweene vncleane foules and cleane: neither shall ye defile your selues with beastes and foules, nor with any creeping thing, that ye ground bringeth forth, which I haue separated from you as vncleane.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Therefore shall ye be holie vnto me: for I the Lorde am holy, and I haue separated you from other people, that ye shoulde be mine.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And if a man or woman haue a spirite of diuination, or soothsaying in them, they shall die the death: they shall stone them to death, their blood shalbe vpon them.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And the Lorde said vnto Moses, Speake vnto the Priestes the sonnes of Aaron, and say vnto them, Let none be defiled by the dead among his people,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But by his kinseman that is neere vnto him: to wit, by his mother, or by his father, or by his sonne, or by his daughter, or by his brother,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Or by his sister a maid, that is neere vnto him, which hath not had a husband: for her he may lament.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: He shall not lament for the Prince among his people, to pollute him selfe.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: They shall not make balde partes vpon their head, nor shaue off the locks of their beard, nor make any cuttings in their flesh.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: They shalbe holy vnto their God, and not pollute the name of their God: for the sacrifices of the Lorde made by fire, and the bread of their God they doe offer: therefore they shalbe holie.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: They shall not take to wife an whore, or one polluted, neither shall they marrie a woman diuorced from her husband: for such one is holy vnto his God.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Thou shalt sanctifie him therefore, for he offereth the bread of thy God: he shall be holy vnto thee: for I the Lorde, which sanctifie you, am holy.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: If a Priestes daughter fall to play the whore, she polluteth her father: therefore shal she be burnt with fire.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Also ye hie Priest among his brethren, (vpon whose head the anointing oyle was powred, and hath consecrated his hand to put on the garments) shall not vncouer his head, nor rent his clothes,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Neither shall he goe to any dead bodie, nor make him selfe vncleane by his father or by his mother,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Neither shall he goe out of the Sanctuarie, nor pollute the holy place of his God: for the crowne of the anoynting oyle of his God is vpon him: I am the Lorde.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Also he shall take a maide vnto his wife:

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But a widowe, or a diuorced woman, or a polluted, or an harlot, these shall he not marrie, but shall take a maide of his owne people to wife:

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Neyther shall he defile his seede among his people: for I am the Lorde which sanctifie him.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And the Lord spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Speake vnto Aaron, and say, Whosoeuer of thy seede in their generations hath any blemishes, shall not prease to offer the bread of his God:

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: For whosoeuer hath any blemish, shall not come neere: as a man blinde or lame, or that hath a flat nose, or that hath any misshapen member,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Or a man that hath a broken foote, or a broken hande,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Or is crooke backt, or bleare eyed, or hath a blemish in his eye, or be skiruie, or skabbed, or haue his stones broken.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: None of the seede of Aaron the Priest that hath a blemish, shall come neere to offer the sacrifices of the Lorde made by fire, hauing a blemish: he shall not prease to offer the bread of his God.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: The bread of his God, euen of the most holie, and of the holy shall he eate:

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But he shall not goe in vnto the vaile, nor come neere the altar, because hee hath a blemish, least he pollute my Sanctuaries: for I am the Lord that sanctifie them.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Thus spake Moses vnto Aaron, and to his sonnes, and to all the children of Israel.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And the Lord spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Speake vnto Aaron, and to his sonnes, that they be separated from the holy thinges of the children of Israel, and that they pollute not mine holy name in those things, which they hallowe vnto me: I am the Lorde.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Say vnto them, Whosoeuer he be of all your seede among your generations after you, that toucheth the holy things which the children of Israel hallowe vnto the Lord, hauing his vncleannesse vpon him, euen that person shall be cut off from my sight: I am the Lorde.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Whosoeuer also of the seede of Aaron is a leper, or hath a running issue, he shall not eate of the holy things vntill he be cleane: and who so toucheth any that is vncleane, by reason of the dead, or a man whose issue of seede runneth from him,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Or the man that toucheth any creeping thing, whereby he may be made vncleane, or a man, by whom he may take vncleannesse, whatsoeuer vncleannesse he hath,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: The person that hath touched such, shall therefore be vncleane vntill the euen, and shall not eat of ye holy things, except he haue washed his flesh with water.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But when the Sunne is downe, hee shalbe cleane, & shall afterward eate of the holy things: for it is his foode.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Of a beast that dyeth, or is rent with beasts, whereby he may be defiled, hee shall not eate: I am the Lorde.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Let them keepe therefore mine ordinance, least they beare their sinne for it, and die for it, if they defile it: I the Lord sanctifie them.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: There shall no stranger also eate of the holie thing, neither the ghest of the Priest, neither shall an hired seruant eat of the holie thing:

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But if the Priest bye any with money, he shall eate of it, also he that is borne in his house: they shall eate of his meate.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: If the Priests daughter also be maried vnto a stranger, she may not eate of the holy offrings.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Notwithstanding if the Priests daughter be a widowe or diuorced, and haue no childe, but is returned vnto her fathers house shee shall eate of her fathers bread, as she did in her youth but there shall no stranger eate thereof.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: If a man eate of the holie thing vnwittingly, he shall put the fift part thereunto, and giue it vnto the Priest with the halowed thing.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: So they shall not defile the holy things of the children of Israel, which they offer vnto the Lord,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Neither cause the people to beare the iniquitie of their trespas, while they eate their holy thing: for I the Lorde do halowe them.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And the Lord spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Speake vnto Aaron, and to his sonnes, and to all the children of Israel, and say vnto them, Whosoeuer he be of the house of Israel, or of the strangers in Israel, that will offer his sacrifice for all their vowes, and for all their free offrings, which they vse to offer vnto the Lorde for a burnt offring,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Yee shall offer of your free minde a male without blemish of the beeues, of the sheepe, or of the goates.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Ye shall not offer any thing that hath a blemish: for that shal not be acceptable for you.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And whosoeuer bringeth a peace offring vnto ye Lord to accomplish his vowe, or for a free offring, of the beeues, or of the sheepe, his free offring shall bee perfect, no blemish shalbe in it.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Blinde, or broken, or maimed, or hauing a wenne, or skiruie, or skabbed: these shall yee not offer vnto the Lord nor make an offring by fire of these vpon the altar of the Lorde.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Yet a bullocke, or a sheepe that hath any member superfluous, or lacking, such mayest thou present for a free offring, but for a vowe it shall not be accepted.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Ye shall not offer vnto ye Lord that which is bruised or crusshed, or broken, or cut away, neither shal ye make an offring thereof in your land,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Neither of ye hand of a strager shal ye offer ye bread of your God of any of these, because their corruption is in them, there is a blemish in them: therefore shall they not be accepted for you.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And the Lord spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: When a bullocke, or a sheepe, or a goate shal be brought foorth, it shalbe euen seuen daies vnder his damme: and from the eight day forth, it shalbe accepted for a sacrifice made by fire vnto the Lord.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: As for the cowe or the ewe, yee shall not kill her, and her yong both in one day.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: So when ye will offer a thanke offring vnto the Lord, ye shall offer willingly.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: The same day it shalbe eaten, yee shall leaue none of it vntill the morowe: I am the Lord.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Therefore shall ye keepe my commandements and do them: for I am the Lord.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Neither shal ye pollute mine holy Name, but I will be halowed among the children of Israel. I the Lord sanctifie you,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Which haue brought you out of the land of Egypt, to be your God: I am the Lord.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And the Lorde spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Speake vnto the children of Israel, & say vnto them, The feastes of ye Lord which yee shall call ye holie assemblies, euen these are my feasts.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Six daies shall worke be done, but in the seuenth day shalbe the Sabbath of rest, an holie conuocation: ye shall do no worke therein, it is the Sabbath of the Lorde, in all your dwellings.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: These are the feastes of the Lord, and holie conuocations, which yee shall proclaime in their seasons.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: In the first moneth, and in the fourteenth day of the moneth at euening shalbe ye Passeouer of the Lord.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And on the fifteenth day of this moneth shalbe the feast of vnleauened bread vnto the Lord: seuen dayes ye shall eate vnleauened bread.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: In the first day yee shall haue an holy conuocation: ye shal do no seruile worke therein.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Also ye shall offer sacrifice made by fire vnto the Lord seuen daies, and in the seuenth day shalbe an holie conuocation: ye shall do no seruile worke therein.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And the Lord spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Speake vnto the children of Israel, and say vnto them, When ye be come into ye land which I giue vnto you, and reape the haruest thereof, then ye shal bring a sheafe of the first fruites of your haruest vnto the Priest,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And hee shall shake the sheafe before the Lord, that it may be acceptable for you: the morowe after the Sabbath, the Priest shall shake it.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And that day when yee shake the sheafe, shall yee prepare a lambe without blemish of a yeere olde, for a burnt offring vnto the Lord:

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And the meate offring thereof shalbe two tenth deales of fine floure mingled with oyle, for a sacrifice made by fire vnto ye Lord of sweete sauour; the drinke offring thereof the fourth part of an Hin of wine.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And ye shal eat neither bread nor parched corne, nor greene eares vntill the selfe same day that ye haue brought an offring vnto your God: this shalbe a lawe for euer in your generations and in all your dwellings.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Ye shall count also to you from the morowe after the Sabbath, euen from the day that yee shall bring the sheafe of the shake offring, seuen Sabbaths, they shalbe complete.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Vnto ye morow after the seuenth Sabbath shall ye nomber fiftie dayes: then yee shall bring a newe meate offring vnto the Lord.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Ye shal bring out of your habitatios bread for the shake offring: they shalbe two loaues of two tenth deales of fine floure, which shalbe baken with leauen for first fruites vnto the Lord.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Also yee shall offer with the bread seuen lambes without blemish of one yeere olde, and a yong bullocke and two rams: they shalbe for a burnt offring vnto the Lorde, with their meate offrings and their drinke offrings, for a sacrifice made by fire of a sweete sauour vnto the Lord.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then ye shall prepare an hee goate for a sinne offring, and two lambes of one yeere olde for peace offrings.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And the Priest shall shake them to and fro with the bread of the first fruits before the Lord, and with the two lambes: they shalbe holy to the Lord, for the Priest.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: So ye shall proclayme the same day, that it may be an holie conuocation vnto you: ye shall doe no seruile worke therein: it shalbe an ordinance for euer in al your dwellinges, throughout your generations.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And when you reape the haruest of your land, thou shalt not rid cleane the corners of thy field when thou reapest, neither shalt thou make any aftergathering of thy haruest, but shalt leaue them vnto the poore and to the stranger: I am the Lord your God.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And the Lord spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Speake vnto the children of Israel, & say, In the seuenth moneth, and in the first day of the moneth shall ye haue a Sabbath, for the remembrance of blowing the trumpets, an holy conuocation.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Ye shall do no seruile worke therein, but offer sacrifice made by fire vnto the Lord.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And the Lord spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: The tenth also of this seuenth moneth shalbe a day of reconciliation: it shalbe an holie conuocation vnto you, and yee shall humble your soules, and offer sacrifice made by fire vnto the Lord.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And ye shall doe no worke that same day: for it is a day of reconciliation, to make an atonement for you before the Lord your God.

Book.Name: Leviticus
