Text: For euery person that humbleth not himselfe that same day, shall euen be cut off from his people.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And euery person that shall doe any work that same day, the same person also will I destroy from among his people.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Ye shall do no maner worke therefore: this shalbe a law for euer in your generations, throughout all your dwellings.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: This shalbe vnto you a Sabbath of rest, & ye shall humble your soules: in the ninth day of the moneth at euen, from euen to euen shall ye celebrate your Sabbath.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And the Lord spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Speake vnto the children of Israel, and say, In the fifteenth day of this seueth moneth shalbe for seuen dayes the feast of Tabernacles vnto the Lorde.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: In the first day shalbe an holie conuocation: ye shall do no seruile worke therein.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Seuen daies ye shall offer sacrifice made by fire vnto the Lord, and in the eight day shalbe an holy conuocation vnto you, and ye shall offer sacrifices made by fire vnto the Lorde: it is the solemne assemblie, yee shall doe no seruile worke therein.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: These are the feastes of the Lord (which ye shall call holie conuocations) to offer sacrifice made by fire vnto the Lord, as burnt offring, and meate offring, sacrifice, and drinke offrings, euery one vpon his day,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Beside the Sabbaths of the Lorde, and beside your giftes, and beside al your vowes, and beside all your free offrings, which ye shal giue vnto the Lorde.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But in the fifteenth day of the seueth moneth, when ye haue gathered in the fruite of the land, ye shall keepe an holie feast vnto the Lord seuen daies: in the first day shalbe a Sabbath: likewise in the eight day shalbe a Sabbath.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And yee shall take you in the first day the fruite of goodly trees, branches of palme trees, & the boughes of thicke trees, and willowes of the brooke, and shall reioyce before the Lorde your God seuen daies.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: So ye shall keepe this feast vnto the Lorde seuen daies in the yere, by a perpetuall ordinance through your generations: in the seuenth moneth shall you keepe it.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Ye shall dwell in boothes seuen daies: all that are Israelites borne, shall dwel in boothes,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: That your posterity may know that I haue made the children of Israel to dwell in boothes, when I brought them out of the lande of Egypt: I am the Lord your God.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: So Moses declared vnto the children of Israel the feastes of the Lord.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And the Lord spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Commande the children of Israel that they bring vnto thee pure oyle oliue beaten, for the light, to cause ye lampes to burne continually.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Without the vaile of the Testimonie, in the Tabernacle of the Congregation, shal Aaron dresse them, both euen and morning before the Lord alwayes: this shalbe a lawe for euer through your generations.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: He shall dresse the lampes vpon the pure Candlesticke before the Lorde perpetually.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Also thou shalt take fine floure, and bake twelue cakes thereof: two tenth deales shalbe in one cake.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And thou shalt set them in two rowes, six in a rowe vpon the pure table before the Lorde.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Thou shalt also put pure incense vpon the rowes, that in steade of the bread it may bee for a remembrance, and an offering made by fire to the Lord.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Euery Sabbath hee shall put them in rowes before the Lord euermore, receiuing them of the children of Israel for an euerlasting couenant.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And the bread shalbe Aaros & his sonnes, and they shall eate it in the holie place: for it is most holie vnto him of the offrings of the Lord made by fire by a perpetuall ordinance.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And there went out among the children of Israel the sonne of an Israelitish woman, whose father was an Egyptian: and this sonne of the Israelitish woman, and a man of Israel stroue together in the hoste.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: So the Israelitish womans sonne blasphemed the name of the Lord, and cursed, and they brought him vnto Moses (his mothers name also was Shelomith, the daughter of Dibri, of the tribe of Dan)

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And they put him in warde, till he tolde them the minde of the Lorde.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then the Lorde spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Bring the blasphemer without the hoste, and let all that heard him, put their handes vpon his head, and let all the Congregation stone him.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And thou shalt speake vnto the children of Israel, saying, Whosoeuer curseth his God, shall beare his sinne.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And he that blasphemeth the name of the Lord, shalbe put to death: all the Congregation shall stone him to death: aswell the stranger, as he that is borne in the lande: when he blasphemeth the name of the Lorde, let him beslaine.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: He also that killeth any man, he shal be put to death.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And he that killeth a beast, he shal restore it, beast for beast.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Also if a man cause any blemish in his neighbour: as he hath done, so shall it be done to him.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Breache for breach, eye for eye, tooth for tooth: such a blemish as he hath made in any, such shalbe repayed to him.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And he that killeth a beast shall restore it: but he that killeth a man shall be slaine.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Ye shall haue one lawe: it shalbe aswel for the stranger as for one borne in the countrey: for I am the Lorde your God.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then Moses tolde the children of Israel, and they brought the blasphemer out of the hoste, and stoned him with stones: so the children of Israel did as the Lorde had commanded Moses.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And the Lorde spake vnto Moses in mount Sinai, saying,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Speake vnto the children of Israel, and say vnto them, When ye shall come into the lande which I giue you, the lande shall keepe Sabbath vnto the Lorde.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Sixe yeeres thou shalt sowe thy field, and sixe yeeres thou shalt cut thy vineyarde, and gather the fruite thereof.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But the seuenth yeere shalbe a Sabbath of rest vnto the lande: it shall be the Lordes Sabbath: thou shalt neither sowe thy fielde, nor cut thy vineyarde.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: That which groweth of it owne accorde of thy haruest, thou shalt not reape, neither gather the grapes that thou hast left vnlaboured: for it shalbe a yeere of rest vnto the land.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And the rest of the lande shall be meate for you, euen for thee, and for thy seruant, and for thy mayde, and for thy hired seruant, and for the stranger that soiourneth with thee:

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And for thy cattell, and for the beastes that are in thy lande shall all the encrease thereof be meate.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Also thou shalt number seuen Sabbaths of yeeres vnto thee, euen seuen times seuen yeere: and the space of the seuen Sabbaths of yeeres will be vnto thee nine and fourtie yeere.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then thou shalt cause to blow the trumpet of the Iubile in the tenth day of the seuenth moneth: euen in the day of the reconciliation shall ye make the trumpet blowe, throughout all your lande.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And ye shall halowe that yeere, euen the fiftieth yeere, and proclaime libertie in the lande to all the inhabitants thereof: it shalbe the Iubile vnto you, and ye shall returne euery man vnto his possession, and euery man shall returne vnto his familie.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: This fiftieth yeere shalbe a yeere of Iubile vnto you: ye shall not sowe, neither reape that which groweth of it selfe, neither gather the grapes thereof, that are left vnlaboured.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: For it is the Iubile, it shall be holy vnto you: ye shall eate of the encrease thereof out of the fielde.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: In the yeere of this Iubile, ye shall returne euery man vnto his possession.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And when thou sellest ought to thy neighbour, or byest at thy neighbours hande, ye shall not oppresse one another:

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But according to the nomber of yeeres after the Iubile thou shalt bye of thy neighbour: also according to the nomber of the yeeres of the reuenues, he shall sell vnto thee.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: According to the multitude of yeeres, thou shalt increase the price thereof, and according to the fewnesse of yeeres, thou shalt abate the price of it: for the nomber of fruites doeth he sell vnto thee.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Oppresse not ye therefore any man his neighbour, but thou shalt feare thy God: for I am the Lorde your God.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Wherefore ye shall obey mine ordinances, and keepe my lawes, and do them, and ye shall dwell in the land in safetie.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And the lande shall giue her fruite, and ye shall eate your fill, and dwell therein in safetie.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And if ye shall say, What shall we eate the seuenth yeere, for we shall not sowe, nor gather in our increase?

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: I will sende my blessing vpon you in the sixt yeere, and it shall bring foorth fruite for three yeeres.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And ye shall sowe the eight yeere, & eate of the olde fruite vntill the ninth yeere: vntill the fruite thereof come, ye shall eate the olde.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Also the lande shall not be solde to be cut off from the familie: for the land is mine, and ye be but strangers and soiourners with me.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Therefore in all the land of your possession ye shall graunt a redemption for the lande.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: If thy brother be impouerished, and sell his possession, then his redeemer shall come, euen his neere kinsman, and bye out that which his brother solde.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And if he haue no redeemer, but hath gotten and founde to bye it out,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then shal he count the yeeres of his sale, & restore the ouerplus to the man, to whome he solde it: so shall he returne to his possession.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But if he can not get sufficient to restore to him, then that which is solde, shall remaine in the hande of him that hath bought it, vntill the yere of the Iubile: and in the Iubile it shal come out, and he shall returne vnto his possession.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Likewise if a man sell a dwelling house in a walled citie, he may bye it out againe within a whole yeere after it is solde: within a yeere may he bye it out.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But if it be not bought out within ye space of a ful yeere, then the house that is in the walled citie, shalbe stablished, as cut off from the familie, to him that bought it, throughout his generations: it shall not goe out in the Iubile.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But the houses of villages, which haue no walles round about them, shalbe esteemed as the fielde of the countrey: they may be bought out againe, and shall goe out in the Iubile.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Notwithstanding, the cities of the Leuites, and the houses of the cities of their possession, may the Leuites redeeme at all seasons.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And if a man purchase of the Leuites, the house that was solde, and the citie of their possession shall goe out in the Iubile: for the houses of the cities of the Leuites are their possession among the children of Israel.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But the fielde of the suburbes of their cities, shall not be solde: for it is their perpetuall possession.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Moreouer, if thy brother be impouerished, and fallen in decay with thee, thou shalt relieue him, and as a stranger and soiourner, so shall he liue with thee.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Thou shalt take no vsurie of him, nor vantage, but thou shalt feare thy God, that thy brother may liue with thee.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Thou shalt not giue him thy money to vsurie, nor lende him thy vitailes for increase.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: I am the Lorde your God, which haue brought you out of the lande of Egypt, to giue you the lande of Canaan, and to be your God.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: If thy brother also that dwelleth by thee, be impouerished, and be sold vnto thee, thou shalt not compel him to serue as a bond seruant,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But as an hired seruant, and as a soiourner he shalbe with thee: he shall serue thee vnto the yeere of the Iubile.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then shall he depart from thee, both hee, and his children with him, and shall returne vnto his familie, and vnto the possession of his fathers shall he returne:

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: For they are my seruants, whom I brought out of the lande of Egypt: they shall not be solde as bondmen are solde.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Thou shalt not rule ouer him cruelly, but shalt feare thy God.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Thy bond seruant also, & thy bond maid, which thou shalt haue, shalbe of the heathen that are rounde about you: of them shall ye bye seruants and maydes.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And moreouer of the children of the stragers, that are soiourners among you, of them shall ye bye, and of their families that are with you, which they begate in your lande: these shall be your possession.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: So ye shall take them as inheritance for your children after you, to possesse them by inheritance, ye shall vse their labours for euer: but ouer your brethren the children of Israel ye shall not rule one ouer another with crueltie.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: If a soiourner or a stranger dwelling by thee get riches, & thy brother by him be impouerished, and sell him selfe vnto the stranger or soiourner dwelling by thee, or to the stocke of the strangers familie,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: After that he is solde, he may be bought out: one of his brethren may bye him out,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Or his vncle, or his vncles sonne may bye him out, or any of the kindred of his flesh among his familie, may redeeme him: either if he can get so much, he may bye him selfe out.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then he shall recken with his byer from the yeere that he was solde to him, vnto the yere of Iubile: and the money of his sale shalbe according to the number of yeeres: according to the time of an hyred seruant shall he be with him.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: If there be many yeeres behind, according to them he shall giue againe for his deliuerance, of the money that he was bought for.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: If there remaine but fewe yeeres vnto the yeere of Iubile, then he shall count with him, and according to his yeeres giue againe for his redemption.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: He shalbe with him yeere by yeere as an hired seruant: he shall not rule cruelly ouer him in thy sight.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And if he be not redeemed thus, he shal go out in the yeere of Iubile, he, and his children with him.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: For vnto me the children of Israel are seruants: they are my seruants, who I haue brought out of the land of Egypt: I am ye Lord your God.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Ye shall make you none idoles nor grauen image, neither reare you vp any pillar, neither shal ye set any image of stone in your land to bow downe to it: for I am the Lord your God.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Ye shall keepe my Sabbaths, and reuerence my Sanctuarie: I am the Lorde.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: If ye walke in mine ordinances, and keepe my commandements, and doe them,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: I will then sende you raine in due season, and the land shal yelde her increase, and the trees of the fielde shall giue her fruite.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And your threshing shall reache vnto the vintage, and the vintage shall reache vnto sowing time, and you shall eate your bread in plenteousnesse, and dwell in your land safely.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And I will sende peace in the land, and ye shall sleepe and none shal make you afraid: also I will rid euill beastes out of the lande, and the sworde shall not go through your lande.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Also ye shall chase your enemies, and they shall fall before you vpon the sworde.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And fiue of you shall chase an hundreth, and an hundreth of you shall put ten thousande to flight, and your enemies shall fall before you vpon the sworde.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: For I will haue respect vnto you, and make you encrease, and multiplie you, and establish my couenant with you.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Ye shall eate also olde store, and cary out olde because of the newe.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And I will set my Tabernacle among you, and my soule shall not lothe you.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Also I will walke among you, and I wil be your God, and ye shalbe my people.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: I am the Lorde your God which haue brought you out of the lande of Egypt, that yee should not be their bondmen, & I haue broken ye bonds of your yoke, & made you goe vpright.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But if ye will not obey me, nor do all these commandements,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And if ye shall despise mine ordinances, either if your soule abhorre my lawes, so that yee will not do all my commandements, but breake my couenant,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then wil I also do this vnto you, I wil appoint ouer you fearefulnes, a consumption, and the burning ague to consume the eyes, and make the heart heauie, and you shall sowe your seede in vaine: for your enemies shall eate it:

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And I will set my face against you, and ye shal fal before your enemies, & they that hate you, shall raigne ouer you, and yee shall flee when none pursueth you.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And if ye wil not for these things obey me, then wil I punish you seuen times more, according to your sinnes,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And I wil breake the pride of your power, and I will make your heauen as yron, and your earth as brasse:

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And your strength shalbe spent in vaine: neither shall your lande giue her increase, neither shall the trees of the land giue their fruite.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And if ye walke stubburnly against me, and will not obey mee, I will then bring seuen times mo plagues vpon you, according to your sinnes.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: I will also sende wilde beastes vpon you, which shall spoyle you, and destroy your cattell, & make you fewe in number: so your hye waies shalbe desolate.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Yet if by these ye will not be reformed by me, but walke stubburnly against me,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then wil I also walke stubburnly against you, and I will smite you yet seuen times for your sinnes:

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And I wil send a sword vpon you, that shal auenge the quarel of my couenant: and when ye are gathered in your cities, I wil send the pestilence among you, and ye shall be deliuered into the hand of the enemie.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: When I shall breake the staffe of your bread, then ten women shal bake your breade in one ouen, & they shal deliuer your bread againe by weight, and ye shall eate, but not be satisfied.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Yet if ye will not for this obey mee, but walke against me stubburnly,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then will I walke stubburnly in mine anger against you, and I will also chastice you seuen times more according to your sinnes.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And ye shall eate ye flesh of your sonnes, & the flesh of your daughters shall ye deuoure.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: I will also destroy your hye places, & cut away your images, and cast your carkeises vpon the bodies of your idoles, and my soule shall abhorre you.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And I will make your cities desolate, and bring your Sanctuarie vnto nought, and will not smell the sauour of your sweete odours.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: I will also bring the land vnto a wildernes, and your enemies, which dwell therein, shalbe astonished thereat.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Also I wil scatter you among the heathen, and will drawe out a sworde after you, & your land shalbe waste, & your cities shalbe desolate.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then shall the land inioy her Sabbaths, as long as it lieth voide, and yee shalbe in your enemies land: then shall the land rest, and enioy her Sabbaths.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: All the dayes that it lieth voide, it shal rest, because it did not rest in your Sabbaths, when ye dwelt vpon it.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And vpon them that are left of you, I will send euen a faintnes into their hearts in ye land of their enemies, & the sounde of a leafeshaken shal chase them, and they shall flee as fleeing from a sword, and they shall fall, no man pursuing them.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: They shall fall also one vpon another, as before a sword, though none pursue them, and ye shall not be able to stand before your enemies:

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And ye shall perish among the heathen, & the land of your enemies shall eate you vp.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And they that are left of you, shall pine away for their iniquitie, in your enemies landes, and for the iniquities of their fathers shall they pine away with them also.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then they shall confesse their iniquitie, & the wickednes of their fathers for their trespasse, which they haue trespassed against mee, and also because they haue walked stubburnly against me.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Therefore I wil walke stubburnly against them, and bring them into the land of their enemies: so then their vncircumcised hearts shalbe humbled, and then they shalt willingly beare the punishment of their iniquitie.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then I will remember my couenant with Iaakob, and my couenant also with Izhak, and also my couenant with Abraham will I remember, and will remember the land.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: The land also in the meane season shalbe left of them, & shall enioye her Sabbaths while she lieth waste without them, but they shall willingly suffer the punishment of their iniquitie, because they despised my lawes, and because their soule abhorred mine ordinances.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Yet notwithstanding this, when they shalbe in the lande of their enemies, I wil not cast them away, neither will I abhorre them, to destroy them vtterly, nor to breake my couenant with them: for I am the Lord their God:

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But I will remember for them the couenant of olde when I brought them out of ye land of Egypt in the sight of the heathen that I might be their God: I am the Lorde.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: These are the ordinances, and the iudgements, and the lawes, which the Lorde made betweene him, and the children of Israel in mount Sinai, by the hand of Moses.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Moreouer the Lord spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Speake vnto the children of Israel, and say vnto them, If any man shall make a vowe of a person vnto the Lord, by thy estimation,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then thy estimation shall bee thus: a male from twentie yeere olde vnto sixty yeere olde shalbe by thy estimation euen fifty shekels of siluer, after the shekel of the Sanctuarie.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But if it be a female, then thy valuation shal be thirtie shekels.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And from fiue yere old to twentie yere olde thy valuation shall be for the male twentie shekels, and for the female ten shekels.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But fro a moneth old vnto fiue yere old, thy price of the male shall bee fiue shekels of siluer, and thy price of the female, three shekels of siluer.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And from sixty yeere olde and aboue, if he be a male, then thy price shalbe fifteene shekels, and for the female ten shekels.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But if he be poorer then thou hast esteemed him, then shall hee present himselfe before the Priest, & the Priest shal value him, according to the abilitie of him that vowed, so shall the Priest value him.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And if it be a beast, whereof men bring an offering vnto the Lorde, all that one giueth of such vnto the Lorde, shalbe holy.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: He shall not alter it nor change it, a good for a badde, nor a badde for a good: and if hee change beast for beast, then both this and that, which was changed for it, shall be holy.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And if it be any vncleane beast, of which men do not offer a sacrifice vnto the Lorde, hee shall then present the beast before the Priest.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And the Priest shall value it, whether it be good or bad: and as thou valuest it, which art the Priest, so shall it bee.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But if he will bye it againe, then hee shall giue the fift part of it more, aboue thy valuation.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Also whe a man shall dedicate his house to be holy vnto the Lorde, then the Priest shall value it, whether it be good or bad, and as ye Priest shall prise it, so shall the value be.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But if he that sanctified it, will redeeme his house, then hee shall giue thereto the fift part of money more then thy estimation, & it shalbe his.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: If also a man dedicate to the Lorde any grounde of his inheritance, then shalt thou esteeme it according to the seede therof: an Homer of barlie seede shalbe at fiftie shekels of siluer.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: If he dedicate his field immediately from the yeere of Iubile, it shall bee worth as thou doest esteeme it.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But if hee dedicate his fielde after the Iubile, then the Priest shall recken him the money according to ye yeeres that remaine vnto the yere of Iubile, and it shalbe abated by thy estimation.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And if he that dedicateth it, will redeeme the fielde, then he shall put the fift parte of the price, that thou esteemedst it at, thereunto, and it shall remaine his.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And if he will not redeeme the fielde, but the Priest sell the fielde to another man, it shalbe redeemed no more.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But the field shalbe holy to the Lord, whe it goeth out in the Iubile, as a fielde separate from common vses: the possession thereof shall be the Priests.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: If a man also dedicate vnto ye Lord a fielde which he hath bought, which is not of the groud of his inheritance,

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Then the Priest shall set the price to him, as thou esteemest it, vnto the yeere of Iubile, & he shall giue thy price the same day, as a thing holy vnto the Lord.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But in the yeere of Iubile, the fielde shall returne vnto him, of whome it was bought: to him, I say, whose inheritance the land was.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And all thy valuation shall bee according to the shekel of the Sanctuarie: a shekel conteyneth twenty gerahs.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Notwithstanding the first borne of the beastes, because it is the Lordes first borne, none shall dedicate such, be it bullocke, or sheepe; for it is the Lords.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But if it be an vncleane beast, then he shall redeeme it by thy valuation, and giue the fift part more thereto: & if it be not redeemed, then it shalbe solde, according to thy estimation.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Notwithstanding, nothing separate from the common vse that a man doeth separate vnto the Lord of all that he hath (whether it bee man or beast, or lande of his inheritance) may be solde nor redeemed: for euery thing separate from the common vse is most holy vnto the Lorde.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Nothing separate from the common vse, which shall be separate from man, shalbe redeemed, but dye the death.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: Also all the tithe of the lande both of the seede of the ground, and of the fruite of the trees is the Lords: it is holy to the Lorde.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: But if a man will redeeme any of his tithe, he shal adde the fift part thereto.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: And euery tithe of bullock, and of sheepe, and of all that goeth vnder the rod, the tenth shalbe holy vnto the Lord.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: He shal not looke if it be good or bad, neither shall he change it: els if he change it, both it, and that it was changed withall, shalbe holy, and it shall not be redeemed.

Book.Name: Leviticus
Text: These are the commaundements which the Lord commaunded by Moses vnto the children of Israel in mount Sinai.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The Lorde spake againe vnto Moses in the wildernesse of Sinai, in the Tabernacle of the Congregation, in the first day of the second moneth, in the second yere after they were come out of the land of Egypt, saying,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Take ye the summe of all the Congregation of the children of Israel, after their families, and housholdes of their fathers with the nomber of their names: to wit, all the males, man by man:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: From twentie yere olde and aboue, all that go forth to the warre in Israel, thou and Aaron shall number them, throughout their armies.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And with you shalbe men of euery tribe, such as are the heads of the house of their fathers.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And these are the names of the men that shall stand with you, of the tribe of Reuben, Elizur, the sonne of Shedeur:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Of Simeon, Shelumiel the sonne of Zurishaddai:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Of Iudah, Nahshon the sonne of Amminadab:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Of Issachar, Nethaneel, the sonne of Zuar:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Of Zebulun, Eliab, the sonne of Helon:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Of the children of Ioseph: of Ephraim, Elishama the sonne of Ammihud: of Manasseh, Gamliel, the sonne of Pedahzur:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Of Beiamin, Abida the sonne of Gideoni:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Of Dan, Ahiezer, the sonne of Ammishaddai:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Of Asher, Pagiel, the sonne of Ocran:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Of Gad, Eliasaph, the sonne of Deuel:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Of Naphtali, Ahira the sonne of Enan.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: These were famous in the Congregation, princes of the tribes of their fathers, and heads ouer thousands in Israel.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The Moses and Aaron tooke these men which are expressed by their names.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And they called all the Congregation together, in the first day of the second moneth, who declared their kindreds by their families, and by the houses of their fathers, according to the nomber of their names, from twentie yere olde and aboue, man by man.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: As the Lord had commanded Moses, so he nombred them in the wildernesse of Sinai.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: So were the sonnes of Reuben Israels eldest sonne by their generations, by their families, and by the houses of their fathers, according to the nomber of their names, man by man euery male from twentie yere olde and aboue, as many as went forth to warre:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The nomber of them, I say, of the tribe of Reuben, was sixe and fourtie thousande, and fiue hundreth.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Of the sonnes of Simeon by their generatios, by their families, and by the houses of their fathers, the summe therof by the nomber of their names, man by man, euery male fro twentie yeere olde and aboue, all that went forth to warre:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The summe of them, I say, of the tribe of Simeon was nine and fiftie thousande, and three hundreth.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Of the sonnes of Gad by their generations, by their families, and by the houses of their fathers, according to the nomber of their names, from twentie yere olde and aboue, all that went forth to warre:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The number of them, I say, of the tribe of Gad was fiue and fourtie thousand, and six hundreth and fiftie.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Of the sonnes of Iudah by their generations, by their families, and by the houses of their fathers, according to the nomber of their names, from twentie yere olde and aboue, all that went forth to warre:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The nomber of them, I say, of the tribe of Iudah was three score and fourteene thousande, and sixe hundreth.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Of the sonnes of Issachar by their generations, by their families, and by the houses of their fathers, according to the nomber of their names, from twentie yeere olde and aboue, all that went forth to warre:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The nomber of them also of the tribe of Issachar was foure and fiftie thousande and foure hundreth.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Of the sonnes of Zebulun by their generations, by their families, and by the houses of their fathers, according to the number of their names, from twentie yeere olde and aboue, all that went foorth to warre:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The nomber of them also of the tribe of Zebulun was seuen and fiftie thousand and foure hundreth.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Of the sonnes of Ioseph, namely of the sonnes of Ephraim by their generations, by their families, and by the houses of their fathers, according to the nomber of their names, from twentie yeere olde and aboue, all that went foorth to warre:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The nomber of them also of the tribe of Ephraim was fourtie thousande & fiue hundreth.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Of the sonnes of Manasseh by their generations, by their families, and by the houses of their fathers, according to the nomber of their names, from twentie yeere olde and aboue, all that went foorth to warre:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The nober of the also of ye tribe of Manasseh was two & thirtie thousand & two hundreth.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Of the sonnes of Beniamin by their generations, by their families, and by the houses of their fathers, according to the nomber of their names, from twentie yeere olde and aboue, all that went foorth to warre:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The nomber of them also of the tribe of Beniamin was fiue and thirtie thousande and foure hundreth.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Of the sonnes of Dan by their generations, by their families, and by the houses of their fathers, according to the nomber of their names, from twentie yeere olde and aboue, all that went foorth to warre:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The nomber of the also of ye tribe of Dan was three score & two thousand & seue hudreth.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Of the sonnes of Asher by their generations, by their families, and by the houses of their fathers, according to the number of their names, from twentie yeere olde and aboue, all that went foorth to warre:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The nomber of them also of ye tribe of Asher was one & fourtie thousand & fiue hudreth.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Of the children of Naphtali, by their generations, by their families, and by the houses of their fathers, according to the nomber of their names, from twentie yeere olde and aboue, all that went to the warre:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The nomber of them also of the tribe of Naphtali, was three and fiftie thousand, & foure hundreth.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: These are the summes which Moses, and Aaron nombred, and the Princes of Israel, the twelue men, which were euery one for the house of their fathers.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: So this was all the summe of the sonnes of Israel, by the houses of their fathers, from twenty yeere olde and aboue, all that went to the warre in Israel,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And all they were in nomber sixe hudreth and three thousande, fiue hundreth and fiftie.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: But the Leuites, after the tribes of their fathers were not nombred among them.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: For the Lord had spoken vnto Moses, and said,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Onely thou shalt not number the tribe of Leui, neither take the summe of them among the children of Israel:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: But thou shalt appoynt the Leuites ouer the Tabernacle of the Testimonie, & ouer all the instruments thereof, and ouer all things that belong to it: they shall beare the Tabernacle, and all the instruments thereof, & shall minister in it, and shall dwell round about the Tabernacle.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And when the Tabernacle goeth forth, the Leuites shall take it downe: and when the Tabernacle is to be pitched, ye Leuites shall set it vp: for the stranger that commeth nere, shalbe slaine.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Also the children of Israel shal pitch their tentes, euery man in his campe, and euery man vnder his standerd throughout their armies.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: But the Leuites shall pitch rounde about the Tabernacle of the Testimonie, least vengeance come vpon the Congregation of the children of Israel, and the Leuites shall take the charge of the Tabernacle of the Testimonie.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: So the children of Israel did according to all that ye Lord had comanded Moses: so did they.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Lorde spake vnto Moses, and to Aaron, saying,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Euery man of the children of Israel shall campe by his standerd, and vnder the ensigne of their fathers house: farre off about the Tabernacle of the Congregation shall they pitch.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: On the East side towarde the rising of the sunne, shall they of the standerd of the hoste of Iudah pitch according to their armies: and Nahshon the sonne of Amminadab shalbe captaine of the sonnes of Iudah.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And his hoste and the nomber of the were seuentie and foure thousande and sixe hundreth.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Next vnto him shall they of the tribe of Issachar pitch, and Nethaneel the sonne of Zuar shalbe the captaine of the sonnes of Issachar:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And his hoste, & the nomber thereof were foure and fiftie thousand, and foure hundreth.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then the tribe of Zebulun, and Eliab the sonne of Helon, captaine ouer the sonnes of Zebulun:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And his hoste, and the nomber thereof seuen and fiftie thousand and foure hundreth:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The whole nomber of the hoste of Iudah are an hundreth fourescore and sixe thousande, and foure hundreth according to their armies: they shall first set foorth.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: On the South side shalbe ye standerd of the host of Reuben according to their armies, & the captaine ouer the sonnes of Reuben shalbe Elizur the sonne of Shedeur.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And his host, and the nomber thereof sixe and fourty thousand and fiue hundreth.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And by him shal the tribe of Simeon pitch, and the captaiue ouer the sonnes of Simeon shall be Shelumiel the sonne of Zurishaddai:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And his hoste, and the nomber of them, nine and fiftie thousand and three hundreth.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the tribe of Gad, and the captaine ouer the sonnes of Gad shall be Eliasaph the sonne of Deuel:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And his host and the nomber of the were fiue and fourtye thousande, sixe hundreth and fiftie.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: All the nomber of the campe of Reuben were an hundreth and one and fiftie thousande, and foure hundreth and fiftie according to their armies, and they shall set foorth in the seconde place.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then the Tabernacle of the Congregation shall goe with the host of the Leuites, in the mids of the campe as they haue pitched, so shall they goe forwarde, euery man in his order according to their standerds.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The standerd of the campe of Ephraim shalbe toward the west according to their armies: and ye captaine ouer the sonnes of Ephraim shall be Elishama the sonne of Ammihud:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And his host and the nomber of the were fortie thousand and fiue hundreth.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And by him shalbe the tribe of Manasseh, and the captaine ouer the sonnes of Manasseh shalbe Gamliel the sonne of Pedahzur:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And his hoste and the nomber of them were two and thirtie thousand and two hundreth.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the tribe of Beniamin, and ye captaine ouer the sonnes of Beniamin shalbe Abidan the sonne of Gideoni:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And his host, and the nomber of the were fiue and thirtie thousand and foure hundreth.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: All the nomber of the campe of Ephraim were an hundreth and eight thousande and one hundreth according to their armies, and they shal go in the third place.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The standerd of the host of Dan shalbe toward the North according to their armies: and the captaine ouer the children of Dan shall be Ahiezer the sonne of Ammishaddai:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And his host & the number of them were two and threescore thousand and seue hundreth.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And by him shal the tribe of Asher pitch, and the captaine ouer the sonnes of Asher shalbe Pagiel the sonne of Ocran.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And his host and the nomber of them were one and fourtie thousand and fiue hundreth.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then the tribe of Naphtali, and the captaine ouer the children of Naphtali shall be Ahira the sonne of Enan:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And his host and the nomber of them were three and fiftie thousand and foure hundreth.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: All the nomber of the host of Dan was an hundreth and seuen and fiftie thousand and sixe hundreth: they shall goe hinmost with their standerdes.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: These are the summes of the childre of Israel by ye houses of their fathers, all the nomber of ye host, according to their armies, six hundreth and three thousand, fiue hundreth and fiftie.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: But the Leuites were not nombred among the children of Israel, as the Lord had commanded Moses.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the children of Israel did according to all that the Lord had commanded Moses: so they pitched according to their standards, and so they iourneyed euery one with his families, according to the houses of their fathers.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: These also were the generations of Aaron & Moses, in the day that the Lorde spake with Moses in mount Sinai.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: So these are the names of the sonnes of Aaron, Nadab the first borne, and Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: These are the names of the sonnes of Aaron the anoynted Priests, whom Moses did consecrate to minister in the Priests office.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And Nadab and Abihu died before the Lord, when they offred strange fire before the Lord in the wildernesse of Sinai, and had no children: but Eleazar and Ithamar serued in ye Priestes office in the sight of Aaron their father.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then the Lord spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Bring the tribe of Leui, and set the before Aaron the Priest that they may serue him,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And take the charge with him, euen the charge of the whole Congregation before the Tabernacle of the Congregation to doe the seruice of the Tabernacle.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: They shall also keepe all the instrumentes of the Tabernacle of the Congregation, and haue the charge of the children of Israel to doe the seruice of the Tabernacle.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And thou shalt giue the Leuites vnto Aaron and to his sonnes: for they are giuen him freely from among the children of Israel.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And thou shalt appoint Aaron & his sonnes to execute their Priestes office: and the stranger that commeth neere, shalbe slayne.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Also the Lord spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Beholde, I haue euen taken the Leuites fro among the childre of Israel: for al the first borne that openeth the matrice among the children of Israel, and the Leuites shalbe mine,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Because all the first borne are mine: for the same day, that I smote all the first borne in the land of Egypt, I sanctified vnto me all the first borne in Israel, both man and beast: mine they shalbe: I am the Lord.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Moreouer, the Lord spake vnto Moses in the wildernesse of Sinai, saying,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Nomber the children of Leui after the houses of their fathers, in their families: euery male from a moneth olde and aboue shalt thou nomber.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then Moses nombred them according to the word of the Lord, as he was commanded.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And these are the sonnes of Leui by their names, Gershon, and Kohath, and Merari.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Also these are the names of the sonnes of Gershon by their families: Libni and Shimei.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The sonnes also of Kohath by their families: Amram, and Izehar, Hebron, and Vzziel.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the sonnes of Merari by their families: Mahli and Mushi. These are the families of Leui, according to the houses of their fathers.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Of Gershon came the familie of the Libnites, and the familie of the Shimeites: these are the families of the Gershonites.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The summe whereof ( after the nomber of all the males from a moneth olde and aboue) was counted seuen thousand and fiue hundreth.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The families of the Gershonites shall pitch behind the Tabernacle westward.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The captaine and auncient of the house of the Gershonites shalbe Eliasaph the sonne of Lael.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the charge of the sonnes of Gershon in the Tabernacle of the Congregation shall be the Tabernacle, and the pauilion, the couering thereof, and the vaile of the dore of the Tabernacle of the Congregation,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the hanging of the court, & the vaile of the doore of the court, which is neere the Tabernacle, and neere ye Altar round about, and the cordes of it for all the seruice thereof.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And of Kohath came the familie of the Amramites, and the familie of the Izeharites, and the familie of the Hebronites, and the familie of the Vzzielites: these are the families of the Kohathites.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The nomber of all the males from a moneth olde and aboue was eight thousand and sixe hundreth, hauing the charge of the Sanctuarie.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The families of the sonnes of Kohath shall pitch on the Southside of the Tabernacle.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The captaine and auncient of the house, & families of the Kohathites shall be Elizaphan the sonne of Vzziel:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And their charge shalbe the Arke, and the Table, & the Candlesticke, & the altars, and the instruments of the Sanctuarie that they minister with, and the vaile, and all that serueth thereto.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And Eleazar the sonne of Aaron the Priest shalbe chiefe captaine of the Leuites, hauing the ouersight of them that haue the charge of the Sanctuarie.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Of Merari came the familie of the Mahlites, and the familie of the Mushites: these are the families of Merari.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the summe of them, according to the nomber of all the males, from a moneth olde and aboue was sixe thousand and two hundreth.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The captaine and the ancient of the house of the families of Merari shalbe Zuriel the sonne of Abihail: they shall pitche on the Northside of the Tabernacle.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And in ye charge and custodie of the sonnes of Merari shall be the boardes of the Tabernacle, and the barres thereof, and his pillars, and his sockets, and al the instruments therof, and al that serueth thereto,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: With the pillars of the court round about, with their sockets, and their pins & their coardes.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Also on the forefront of the Tabernacle toward the East, before the Tabernacle, I say, of the Congregation Eastwarde shal Moses and Aaron and his sonnes pitch, hauing the charge of the Sanctuarie, and the charge of the children of Israel: but the stranger that commeth neere, shall be slayne.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The wholesumme of ye Leuites, which Moses and Aaron nombred at the commaundement of the Lord throughout their families, euen al the males from a moneth olde & aboue, was two and twentie thousand.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Lord said vnto Moses, Nomber all the first borne that are Males among the children of Israel, from a moneth old and aboue, and take the nomber of their names.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And thou shalt take ye Leuites to me for all the first borne of the children of Israel (I am the Lorde) and the cattell of the Leuites for all the first borne of the cattell of the children of Israel.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And Moses nombred, as the Lord commanded him, all the first borne of the children of Israel.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And all the first borne males rehearsed by name (from a moneth olde and aboue) according to their nomber were two & twentie thousand, two hundreth seuentie and three.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Lord spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Take the Leuites for all the first borne of the children of Israel, and the cattell of the Leuites for their cattel, and the Leuites shalbe mine, (I am the Lord)

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And for the redeeming of the two hundreth seuentie and three, (which are moe then the Leuites) of the first borne of the children of of Israel,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Thou shalt also take fiue shekels for euery person: after the weight of the Sanctuarie shalt thou take it: ye shekel conteineth twenty gerahs.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And thou shalt giue the money, wherwith the odde nomber of them is redeemed, vnto Aaron and to his sonnes.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Thus Moses tooke the redemption of the that were redeemed, being mo then the Leuites:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Of the first borne of the children of Israel tooke he the mony: eue a thousand three hundreth three score and fiue shekels after the shekel of the Sanctuarie.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And Moses gaue the money of them that were redeemed, vnto Aaron and to his sonnes according to the word of the Lord, as the Lord had commanded Moses.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Lorde spake vnto Moses, and to Aaron, saying,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Take the summe of the sonnes of Kohath fro among the sonnes of Leui, after their families, and houses of their fathers,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: From thirtie yeere olde and aboue, euen vntill fiftie yeere olde, all that enter into the assemblie to do the worke in the Tabernacle of the Congregation.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: This shall be the office of the sonnes of Kohath in the Tabernacle of the Congregaton about the Holiest of all.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: When the hoste remoueth, then Aaron and his sonnes shall come and take downe the couering vaile, and shall couer the Arke of the Testimonie therewith.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And they shall put thereon a couering of badgers skinnes, and shall spread vpon it a cloth altogether of blewe silke, and put to the barres thereof:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And vpon ye table of shew bread they shall spread a cloth of blewe silke, and put thereon the dishes, and the incense cups, and goblets, and couerings to couer it with, and the bread shall be thereon continually:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And they shal spread vpon them a couering of skarlet, and couer the same with a couering of badgers skinnes, and put to the barres thereof.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then they shall take a cloth of blewe silke, and couer the candlesticke of light with his lampes and his snuffers, and his snuffedishes, and al the oyle vessels thereof, which they occupie about it.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: So they shal put it, and all the instruments thereof in a couering of badgers skinnes, and put it vpon the barres.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Also vpon the golden altar they shall spread a cloth of blewe silke, and couer it with a couering of badgers skinnes, & put to the barres thereof.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And they shall take all the instruments of the ministerie wherewith they minister in the Sanctuarie, and put them in a cloth of blew silke, & couer the with a couering of badgers skinnes, and put them on the barres.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Also they shall take away the ashes from the altar, and spread a purple cloth vpon it,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And shall put vpon it all the instruments thereof, which they occupie about it: the censers, the fleshhookes and the besomes, & the basens, euen al the instruments of the altar and they shal spread vpon it a couering of badgers skinnes, and put to the barres of it.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And when Aaron and his sonnes haue made an ende of couering the Sanctuarie, and al the instruments of the Sanctuarie, at the remouing of the host, afterward the sonnes of Kohath shall come to beare it, but they shall not touch any holy thing, lest they dye. This is the charge of the sonnes of Kohath in the Tabernacle of the Congregation.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And to the office of Eleazar the sonne of Aaron the Priest pertaineth the oyle for the light, and the sweete incense and the dayly meat offring, and the anointing oyle, with the ouersight of all the Tabernacle, and of all that therein is, both in the Sanctuarie and in all the instruments thereof.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Lord spake vnto Moses and to Aaron, saying,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Ye shal not cut off the tribe of the families of the Kohathites from among the Leuites:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: But thus do vnto them, that they may liue and not die, when they come neere to the most holy things: let Aaron and his sonnes come and appoynt them, euery one to his office, and to his charge.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: But let them not goe in, to see when the Sanctuarie is folden vp, lest they die.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Lord spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Take also ye summe of the sonnes of Gershon, euery one by the houses of their fathers throughout their families:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: From thirtie yere old and aboue, vntil fiftie yere old shalt thou nomber them, al that enter into the assemblie for to do seruice in the Tabernacle of the Congregation.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: This shall be the seruice of the families of the Gershonites, to serue and to beare.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: They shall beare the curtaines of the Tabernacle, and the Tabernacle of the Congregation, his couering, and the couering of badgers skinnes, that is on hie vpon it, and the vayle of the doore of the Tabernacle of the Congregation:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The curtaines also of the court, & the vaile of the entring in of the gate of the court, which is neere the Tabernacle & neere the altar round about, with their cordes, and all the instrumentes for their seruice, and all that is made for them: so shall they serue.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: At the commaundement of Aaron and his sonnes shall all the seruice of the sonnes of ye Gershonites bee done, in all their charges and in all their seruice, and ye shall appoynt them to keepe all their charges.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: This is the seruice of the families of the sonnes of the Gershonites in the Tabernacle of the Congregation, and their watch shall be vnder the hande of Ithamar the sonne of Aaron the Priest.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Thou shalt nomber the sonnes of Merari by their families, and by the houses of their fathers:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: From thirty yere olde and aboue, euen vnto fiftie yere olde shalt thou nomber the, all that enter into the assemblie, to doe the seruice of the Tabernacle of the Congregation.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And this is their office and charge according to all their seruice in the Tabernacle of the Congregation: the boardes of the Tabernacle witth the barres thereof, and his pillars, and his sockets,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the pillars rounde about the court, with their sockets and their pinnes, & their cords, with all their instruments, euen for all their seruice: and by name ye shall recken the instruments of their office and charge.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: This is the seruice of the families of the sonnes of Merari, according to all their seruice in the Tabernacle of the Congregation vnder the hand of Ithamar the sonne of Aaron the Priest.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then Moses and Aaron and the princes of the Congregation nombred the sonnes of the Kohathites, by their families and by the houses of their fathers,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: From thirtie yeere olde and aboue, euen vnto fiftie yere olde, all that enter into the assemblie for the seruice of the Tabernacle of ye Congregation.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: So the nombers of the throughout their families were two thousande, seuen hundreth and fiftie.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: These are the nombers of the families of the Kohathites, al that serue in the Tabernacle of the Congregation, which Moses and Aaron did nomber according to the commandement of the Lord by the hand of Moses.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Also the nombers of the sonnes of Gershon throughout their families & houses of their fathers,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: From thirtie yere olde and vpwarde, euen vnto fiftie yere olde: all that enter into the assemblie for the seruice of the Tabernacle of the Cogregation.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: So the nombers of them by their families, and by the houses of their fathers were two thousand sixe hundreth and thirtie.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: These are the nombers of the families of the sonnes of Gershon: of all that did seruice in the Tabernacle of the Congregation, whom Moses and Aaron did nomber according to the commandement of the Lord.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The nombers also of the families of the sonnes of Merari by their families, and by the houses of their fathers,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: From thirtie yeere olde and vpwarde, euen vnto fiftie yeere olde: all that enter into the assemblie for the seruice of the Tabernacle of the Congregation.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: So the nombers of them by their families were three thousand, and two hundreth.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: These are the summes of ye families of the sonnes of Merari, whom Moses and Aaron nombred according to the commaundement of the Lord, by the hand of Moses.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: So all the nombers of the Leuites, which Moses, and Aaron, and the princes of Israel nombred by their families and by the houses of their fathers,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: From thirtie yere olde and vpward, euen to fiftie yeere olde, euery one that came to doe his duetie, office, seruice and charge in the Tabernacle of the Congregation.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: So the nombers of them were eight thousand, fiue hundreth and foure score.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: According to the commaundement of the Lord by the hand of Moses did Aaron nomber them, euery one according to his seruice, and according to his charge. Thus were they of that tribe nombred, as the Lorde commaunded Moses.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Lorde spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Commaund the children of Israel that they put out of the hoste euery leper, and euery one that hath an issue, and whosoeuer is defiled by the dead.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Both male and female shal ye put out: out of the hoste shall yee put them, that they defile not their tentes among whome I dwell.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the children of Israel did so, and put them out of the host, euen as the Lord had commanded Moses, so did the children of Israel.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Lorde spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Speake vnto the children of Israel, When a man or woman shall commit any sinne that men commit, and transgresse against the Lorde, when that person shall trespasse,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then they shall confesse their sinne which they haue done, and shall restore the domage thereof with his principall, and put the fift part of it more thereto, and shall giue it vnto him, against whom he hath trespassed.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: But if the man haue no kinseman, to whom he shoulde restore the domage, the domage shal be restored to the Lord for the Priests vse besides the ramme of the atonement, whereby hee shall make atonement for him.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And euery offring of all the holy thinges of the children of Israel, which they bring vnto the Priest, shalbe his.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And euery mans halowed things shall bee his: that is, whatsoeuer any man giueth the Priest, it shalbe his.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Lord spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Speake vnto the children of Israel, and say vnto them, If any mans wife turne to euill, and commit a trespasse against him,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: So that an other man lie with her fleshly, and it bee hid from the eyes of her husbande, and kept close, and yet she be defiled, and there be no witnesse against her, neither she taken with the maner,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: If he be moued with a ielous minde, so that he is ielous ouer his wife, which is defiled, or if he haue a ielous minde, so that he is ielous ouer his wife, which is not defiled,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then shall the man bring his wife to the Priest, and bring her offering with her, the tenth part of an Ephah of barly meale, but he shal not powre oyle vpon it, nor put incense thereon: for it is an offring of ielousie, an offring for a remembrance, calling the sinne to minde:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Priest shall bring her, and set her before the Lord.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then the Priest shal take the holy water in an earthen vessel, and of the dust that is in the floore of the Tabernacle, euen the Priest shal take it and put it into the water.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: After, the Priest shal set the woman before the Lord, and vncouer the womans head, and put the offring of the memorial in her hands: it is the ielousie offering, and the Priest shall haue bitter and cursed water in his hand,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Priest shall charge her by an oth, and say vnto the woman, If no man haue lien with thee, neither thou hast turned to vncleannesse from thine husbande, be free from this bitter and cursed water.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: But if thou hast turned fro thine husband, and so art defiled, and some man hath lyen with thee beside thine husband,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: (Then the Priest shall charge the woman with an oth of cursing, and the Priest shal say vnto the woman) The Lorde make thee to be accursed, and detestable for the othe among thy people, and the Lord cause thy thigh to rot, and thy belly to swell:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And that this cursed water may goe into thy bowels, to cause thy belly to swell, and thy thigh to rot. Then the woman shall answere, Amen, Amen.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: After, the Priest shal write these curses in a booke, and shall blot them out with the bitter water,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And shal cause the woman to drinke ye bitter and cursed water, and the cursed water, turned into bitternesse, shal enter into her.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then the Priest shall take the ielousie offring out of the womans hand, and shal shake the offring before the Lord, and offer it vpon ye altar.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Priest shal take an handfull of the offring for a memorial thereof, and burne it vpon the altar, and afterwarde make the woman drinke the water.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: When yee haue made her drinke the water, (if she bee defiled and haue trespassed against her husband) then shall the cursed water, turned into bitternesse, enter into her, and her belly shall swell, and her thigh shall rot, and the woman shal be accursed among her people.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: But if the woman bee not defiled, but bee cleane, she shalbe free & shall conceiue & beare.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: This is the law of ielousie, when a wife turneth from her husband and is defiled,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Or when a man is moued with a ielous minde being ielous ouer his wife then shall he bring the woman before the Lord, and the Priest shal do to her according to al this lawe,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the man shalbe free from sinne, but this woman shall beare her iniquitie.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Lord spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Speake vnto the children of Israel, & say vnto them, When a man or a woman doeth separate themselues to vowe a vowe of a Nazarite to separate himselfe vnto the Lord,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: He shall absteine fro wine & strong drinke, and shal drinke no sowre wine nor sowre drinke, nor shall drinke any licour of grapes, neither shal eate fresh grapes nor dryed.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: As long as his abstinence endureth, shall hee eat nothing that is made of the wine of the vine, neither the kernels, nor the huske.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: While hee is separate by his vowe, the rasor shall not come vpon his head, vntill the dayes be out, in the which he separateth him selfe vnto the Lord, he shalbe holy, and shall let the lockes of the heare of his head growe.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: During the time that he separateth himselfe vnto the Lord, he shall come at no dead body:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Hee shall not make himselfe vncleane at the death of his father, or mother, brother, or sister: for the consecration of his God is vpon his head.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: All the dayes of his separation he shalbe holy to the Lord.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And if any dye suddenly by him, or hee beware, then the head of his consecration shall be defiled, and he shall shaue his head in the day of his clensing: in the seuenth day he shall shaue it.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And in the eight day hee shall bring two turtles, or two yong pigeons to the Priest, at the doore of the Tabernacle of the Congregation.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then the Priest shall prepare the one for a sinne offering, and the other for a burnt offering, and shall make an atonement for him, because he sinned by the dead: so shall he halowe his head the same day,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And he shall consecrate vnto the Lorde the dayes of his separation, and shal bring a lambe of a yeere olde for a trespasse offering, and the first dayes shalbe voide: for his consecration was defiled.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: This then is the lawe of the Nazarite: When the time of his consecration is out, he shall come to the doore of the Tabernacle of the Congregation,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And hee shall bring his offering vnto the Lorde, an hee lambe of a yeere olde without blemish for a burnt offering, and a shee lambe of a yere olde without blemish for a sinne offring, and a ramme without blemish for peace offrings,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And a basket of vnleauened bread, of cakes of fine floure, mingled with oyle, and wafers of vnleauened bread anointed with oile, with their meate offring, and their drinke offrings:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The which the Priest shal bring before the Lorde, and make his sinne offering and his burnt offering.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: He shal prepare also the ram for a peace offring vnto the Lorde, with the basket of vnleauened bread, and the Priest shal make his meate offring, and his drinke offring.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Nazarite shall shaue the head of his consecration at the doore of the Tabernacle of the Congregation, & shall take the heare of the head of his consecration, and put it in the fire, which is vnder the peace offring.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then the Priest shall take ye sodden shoulder of the ramme, and an vnleauened cake out of the basket, and a wafer vnleauened, and put them vpon the hands of the Nazarite, after he hath shauen his consecration.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Priest shal shake them to & fro before the Lorde: this is an holy thing for the Priest besides the shaken breast, and besides the heaue shoulder: so afterwarde the Nazarite may drinke wine.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: This is the Lawe of the Nazarite, which he hath vowed, and of his offering vnto the Lord for his consecration, besides that that hee is able to bring: according to the vowe which he vowed, so shall he do after the lawe of his consecration.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Lord spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Speake vnto Aaron and to his sonnes, saying, Thus shal ye blesse the childre of Israel, and say vnto them,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The Lord blesse thee, and keepe thee,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The Lorde make his face shine vpon thee, and be merciful vnto thee,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The Lord lift vp his coutenance vpon thee, and giue thee peace.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: So they shal put my Name vpo the children of Israel, and I wil blesse them.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Nowe when Moses had finished the setting vp of the Tabernacle, and anointed it & sanctified it, and all the instrumentes thereof, and the altar with al the instruments thereof, and had anoynted them and sanctified them,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then the princes of Israel, heads ouer the houses of their fathers (they were the princes of the tribes, who were ouer them that were nombred) offred,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And brought their offring before the Lord, sixe couered charets, and twelue oxen: one charet for two princes, and for euery one an oxe, and they offred them before the Tabernacle.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Lord spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Take these of them, that they may be to doe the seruice of the Tabernacle of the Congregation, and thou shalt giue them vnto the Leuites, to euery man according vnto his office.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: So Moses tooke the charets and the oxen, and gaue them vnto the Leuites:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Two charets and foure oxen hee gaue to the sonnes of Gershon, according vnto their office.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And foure charets and eight oxen hee gaue to the sonnes of Merari according vnto their office, vnder the hand of Ithamar the sonne of Aaron the Priest.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: But to the sonnes of Kohath he gaue none, because the charge of the Sanctuarie belonged to them, which they did beare vpon their shoulders.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The princes also offered in the dedication for the altar in the day that it was anoynted: then the princes offered their offering before the altar.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Lord sayd vnto Moses, One prince one day, and an other prince an other day shal offer their offring, for the dedication of the altar.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: So then on the first day did Nahshon the sonne of Amminadab of ye tribe of Iudah offer his offring.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And his offring was a siluer charger of an hundreth and thirtie shekels weight, a siluer boule of seuenty shekels, after the shekel of the Sanctuarie, both ful of fine floure, mingled with oyle, for a meate offring,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: An incense cup of gold of tenne shekels, ful of incense,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: A yong bullocke, a ram, a lambe of a yeere olde for a burnt offring,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: An hee goate for a sinne offring,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And for peace offrings, two bullockes, fiue rams, fiue hee goates, and fiue lambes of a yeere olde: this was the offring of Nahshon the sonne of Amminadab.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The second day Nethaneel, the sonne of Zuar, prince of the tribe of Issachar did offer:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Who offred for his offring a siluer charger of an hundreth and thirtie shekels weight, a siluer boule of seuentie shekels, after the shekel of the Sanctuarie, both ful of fine floure, mingled with oyle, for a meat offring,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: An incense cup of gold of ten shekels, ful of incense,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: A yong bullocke, a ram, a lambe of a yeere olde for a burnt offring,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: An hee goate for a sinne offring,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And for peace offrings, two bullockes, fiue rammes, fiue hee goates, fiue lambes of a yeere olde: this was the offring of Nethaneel the sonne of Zuar.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The third day Eliab the sonne of Helon prince of the children of Zebulun offred.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: His offring was a siluer charger of an hundreth and thirty shekels weight, a siluer boule of seuentie shekels, after the shekel of the Sanctuarie, both ful of fine floure, mingled with oyle, for a meate offring,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: A golden incense cup of ten shekels, ful of incense,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: A yong bullocke, a ram, a lambe of a yeere olde for a burnt offring,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: An hee goate for a sinne offring,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And for peace offrings, two bullockes, fiue rammes, fiue hee goates, fiue lambes of a yeere olde: this was the offering of Eliab the sonne of Helon.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The fourth day Elizur ye sonne of Shedeur prince of the children of Reuben offred.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: His offring was a siluer charger of an hundreth and thirtie shekels weight, a siluer boule of seuentie shekels, after the shekel of the Sanctuary, both ful of fine floure, mingled with oyle, for a meate offring,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: A golden incense cup of ten shekels, full of incense,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: A yong bullocke, a ram, a lambe of a yere olde for a burnt offring,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: An hee goate for a sinne offring,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And for a peace offring, two bullockes, fiue rammes, fiue hee goates, and fiue lambes of a yere olde: this was the offering of Elizur the sonne of Shedeur.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The fifth day Shelumiel the sonne of Zurishaddai, prince of the children of Simeon offered.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: His offring was a siluer charger of an hundreth and thirtie shekels weight, a siluer boule of seuentie shekels, after the shekel of the Sanctuary, both ful of fine floure, mingled with oyle, for a meate offring,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: A golden incense cup of ten shekels, full of incense,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: A yong bullocke, a ram, a lambe of a yeere olde for a burnt offring,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: An hee goate for a sinne offring,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And for a peace offring, two bullocks, fiue rammes, fiue hee goates, fiue lambes of a yere old: this was the offering of Shelumiel the sonne of Zurishaddai.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The sixt day Eliasaph the sonne of Deuel prince of the children of Gad offred.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: His offring was a siluer charger of an hundreth and thirtie shekels weight, a siluer boule of seuentie shekels, after the shekel of the Sanctuarie, both ful of fine floure, mingled with oyle, for a meate offring,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: A golden incense cup of ten shekels, full of incense,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: A yong bullocke, a ram, a lambe of a yere olde, for a burnt offring,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: An hee goate for a sinne offring,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And for a peace offering, two bullockes, fiue rammes, fiue hee goates, fiue lambes of a yere olde: this was the offring of Eliasaph the sonne of Deuel.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The seuenth day Elishama the sonne of Ammiud prince of the children of Ephraim offered.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: His offring was a siluer charger of an hundreth and thirtie shekels weight, a siluer boule of seuentie shekels, after the shekel of the Sanctuary, both full of fine floure, mingled with oyle, for a meate offering,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: A golden incense cup of ten shekels, full of incense,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: A yong bullocke, a ram, a lambe of a yeere olde for a burnt offring,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: An hee goate for a sinne offring,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And for a peace offring, two bullockes, fiue rammes, fiue hee goates, fiue lambes of a yeere olde: this was the offring of Elishama the sonne of Ammiud.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The eight day offred Gamliel the sonne of Pedazur, prince of the children of Manasseh.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: His offring was a siluer charger of an hundreth and thirtie shekels weight, a siluer boule of seuentie shekels, after the shekel of the Sanctuarie, both full of fine floure, mingled with oyle, for a meate offring,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: A golden incense cup of ten shekels, full of incense,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: A yong bullocke, a ram, a lambe of a yeere olde for a burnt offring,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: An hee goate for a sinne offring,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And for a peace offring, two bullockes, fiue rammes, fiue hee goates, fiue lambes of a yeere olde: this was the offring of Gamliel the sonne of Pedazur.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The ninth day Abidan the sonne of Gideoni prince of the children of Beniamin offered.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: His offring was a siluer charger of an hundreth and thirtie shekels weight, a siluer boule of seuentie shekels, after the shekel of the Sanctuarie, both full of fine floure, mingled with oyle, for a meate offring,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: A golden incense cup of ten shekels, full of incense,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: A yong bullocke, a ram, a lambe of a yeere olde for a burnt offring,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: An hee goate for a sinne offring,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And for a peace offring, two bullockes, fiue rammes, fiue hee goates, fiue lambes of a yeere olde: this was the offring of Abidan the sonne of Gideoni.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The tenth day Ahiezer the sonne of Ammishaddai, prince of the children of Dan offred.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: His offring was a siluer charger of an hundreth and thirtie shekels weight, a siluer boule of seuentie shekels, after the shekel of the Sanctuarie, both full of fine floure, mingled with oyle, for a meate offring,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: A golden incense cup of ten shekels full of incense,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: A yong bullocke, a ram, a lambe of a yeere olde for a burnt offring,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: An hee goate for a sinne offring,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And for a peace offring, two bullocks, fiue rammes, fiue hee goates, fiue lambes of a yeere olde: this was the offring of Ahiezer the sonne of Ammishaddai.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The eleuenth day Pagiel the sonne of Ocran, prince of the children of Asher offred.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: His offring was a siluer charger of an hundreth and thirtie shekels weight, a siluer boule of seuentie shekels, after the shekel of the Sanctuarie, both full of fine floure, mingled with oyle, for a meate offring,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: A golden incense cup of ten shekels, ful of incense,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: A yong bullocke, a ram, a lambe of a yere olde for a burnt offring,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: An hee goate for a sinne offring,

Book.Name: Numbers
