Text: And for a peace offring, two bullockes, fiue rams, fiue he goates, fiue lambes of a yeere olde: this was the offring of Pagiel the sonne of Ocran.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The twelfth day Ahira the sonne of Enan, prince of the children of Naphtali offred,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: His offring was a siluer charger of an hundreth and thirtie shekels weight, a siluer boule of seuentie shekels, after the shekel of the Sanctuarie, both full of fine floure, mingled with oyle, for a meate offring,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: A golden incense cup of ten shekels, ful of incense,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: A yong bullocke, a ram, a lambe of a yere olde for a burnt offring,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: An hee goate for a sinne offring,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And for peace offerings, two bullockes, fiue rammes, fiue hee goates, fiue lambes of a yeere olde: this was the offering of Ahira the sonne of Enan.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: This was the dedication of the Altar by the princes of Israel, whe it was anointed: twelue chargers of siluer, twelue siluer boules, twelue incense cuppes of golde,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Euery charger, conteining an hundreth and thirtie shekels of siluer, and euery boule seuentie: all the siluer vessell conteined two thousande and foure hundreth shekels, after the shekell of the Sanctuarie.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Twelue incense cups of gold ful of incense, conteining ten shekels euery cup, after the shekell of the Sanctuarie: all the gold of the incense cups was an hundreth and twentie shekels.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: All the bullockes for the burnt offering were twelue bullocks, the rams twelue, the lambs of a yeere olde twelue, with their meate offrings, and twelue hee goates for a sinne offring.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And all the bullocks for the peace offrings were foure and twentie bullockes, the rammes sixtie, the hee goates sixtie, the lambes of a yeere olde sixtie: this was the dedication of the Altar, after that it was anointed.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And when Moses went into the Tabernacle of the Congregation, to speake with God, he heard the voyce of one speaking vnto him from the Merciseat, that was vpon the Arke of the Testimonie betweene the two Cherubims, and he spake to him.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Lorde spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Speake vnto Aaron, and say vnto him, When thou lightest the lampes, the seuen lampes shall giue light towarde the forefront of the Candlesticke.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And Aaron did so, lighting the lampes thereof towarde ye forefront of the Candlesticke, as the Lorde had commanded Moses.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And this was the worke of the Candlesticke, euen of golde beaten out with the hammer, both the shafte, and the flowres thereof was beaten out with the hammer: according to the paterne, which the Lord had shewed Moses, so made he the Candlesticke.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Lord spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Take the Leuites from among the children of Israel, and purifie them.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And thus shalt thou doe vnto them, when thou purifiest them, Sprinckle water of purification vpon them, & let them shaue all their flesh, and wash their clothes: so they shalbe cleane.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then they shal take a yong bullocke with his meate offring of fine floure, mingled with oyle, and another yong bullocke shalt thou take for a sinne offring.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then thou shalt bring the Leuites before the Tabernacle of the Congregation, & asseble all the Congregation of the children of Israel.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Thou shalt bring the Leuites also before the Lorde, and the children of Israel shall put their handes vpon the Leuites.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And Aaron shall offer the Leuites before the Lord, as a shake offring of ye childre of Israel, that they may execute the seruice of the Lorde.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Leuites shall put their handes vpon the heades of the bullockes, and make thou the one a sinne offring, and the other a burnt offring vnto the Lorde, that thou mayest make an atonement for the Leuites.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And thou shalt set the Leuites before Aaron and before his sonnes, & offer the as a shake offring to the Lorde.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Thus thou shalt separate the Leuites from among the children of Israel, and the Leuites shal be mine.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And afterwarde shall the Leuites goe in, to serue in the Tabernacle of the Congregation, and thou shalt purifie them and offer them, as a shake offering.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: For they are freely giuen vnto me from among the children of Israel, for such as open any wombe: for all the first borne of the children of Israel haue I taken them vnto me.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: For all the first borne of the children of Israel are mine, both of man and of beast: since the day that I smote euery first borne in the land of Egypt, I sanctified them for my selfe.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And I haue taken the Leuites for all the first borne of the children of Israel,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And haue giuen the Leuites as a gift vnto Aaron, and to his sonnes from among the children of Israel, to do the seruice of the children of Israel in the Tabernacle of the Congregation, and to make an atonement for the children of Israel, that there be no plague among the children of Israel, when the children of Israel come neere vnto the Sanctuarie.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then Moses and Aaron and all the Cogregation of the children of Israel did with the Leuites, according vnto all that the Lorde had commanded Moses concerning the Leuites: so did the children of Israel vnto them.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: So the Leuites were purified, and washed their clothes, and Aaron offred them as a shake offring before the Lord, and Aaron made an atonement for them, to purifie them.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And after that, went the Leuites in to doe their seruice in the Tabernacle of the Congregation, before Aaron and before his sonnes: as the Lorde had commaunded Moses concerning the Leuites, so they did vnto them.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Lord spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: This also belongeth to the Leuites: from fiue and twentie yeere olde and vpwarde, they shall goe in, to execute their office in the seruice of the Tabernacle of the Congregation.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And after the age of fiftie yeere, they shall cease from executing the office, and shall serue no more:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: But they shal minister with their brethre in the Tabernacle of the Congregation, to keepe things committed to their charge, but they shall doe no seruice: thus shalt thou doe vnto the Leuites touching their charges.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Lorde spake vnto Moses in the wildernes of Sinai, in the first moneth of the second yeere, after they were come out of the land of Egypt, saying,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The children of Israel shall also celebrate the Passeouer at ye time appointed thereunto.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: In the fourtenth day of this moneth at euen, ye shall keepe it in his due season: according to all the ordinances of it, and according to all the ceremonies thereof shall ye keepe it.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then Moses spake vnto the children of Israel, to celebrate the Passeouer.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And they kept the Passeouer in the fouretenth day of the first moneth at euen in the wildernesse of Sinai: according to all that the Lord had comanded Moses, so did ye children of Israel.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And certaine men were defiled by a dead man, that they might not keepe the Passeouer the same day: and they came before Moses & before Aaron the same day.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And those men said vnto him, We are defiled by a dead man: wherefore are wee kept backe that we may not offer an offering vnto the Lorde in the time thereunto appointed among the children of Israel?

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then Moses saide vnto them, Stande still, and I will heare what the Lorde will commande concerning you.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Lord spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Speake vnto the children of Israel, and say, If any amog you, or of your posteritie shalbe vncleane by ye reason of a corps, or be in a log iourney, he shall keepe the Passeouer vnto ye Lord.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: In the fourtenth day of the second moneth at euen they shall keepe it: with vnleauened bread and sowre herbes shall they eate it.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: They shall leaue none of it vnto the morning, nor breake any bone of it: according to all the ordinance of the Passeouer shall they keepe it.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: But the man that is cleane and is not in a iourney, and is negligent to keepe the Passeouer, the same person shalbe cut off from his people: because he brought not the offring of the Lorde in his due season, that man shall beare his sinne.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And if a stranger dwell among you, and wil keepe the Passeouer vnto the Lord, as the ordinance of the Passeouer, & as the maner thereof is, so shall he do: ye shall haue one lawe both for the stranger, and for him that was borne in the same lande.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And when the Tabernacle was reared vp, a cloude couered the Tabernacle, namely the Tabernacle of the Testimonie: and at euen there was vpon the Tabernacle, as the appearance of fire vntill the morning.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: So it was always: the cloude couered it by day, and the appearance of fire by night.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And when the cloude was taken vp from the Tabernacle, then afterwarde the children of Israel iourneyed: and in the place where the cloude abode, there the children of Israel pitched their tents.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: At the commaundement of the Lorde the children of Israel iourneyed, and at the comandement of the Lorde they pitched: as long as the cloude abode vpon the Tabernacle, they lay still.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And when the cloude taryed stil vpon the Tabernacle a long time, the childre of Israel kept the watch of the Lorde, and iourneyed not.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: So when the cloud abode a few dayes vpon the Tabernacle, they abode in their tents according to the comandement of ye Lord: for they iourneyed at the commandement of the Lorde.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And though the cloud abode vpo the Tabernacle from euen vnto the morning, yet if the cloude was taken vp in the morning, then they iourneyed: whether by daye or by night the cloude was taken vp, then they iourneyed.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Or if the cloude taryed two dayes or a moneth, or a yeere vpon the Tabernacle, abiding thereon, the children of Israel abode still, and iourneyed not: but when it was taken vp, they iourneyed.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: At the commandement of the Lord they pitched, and at the commandement of the Lorde they iourneyed, keeping the watch of the Lorde at the commaundement of the Lorde by the hand of Moses.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Lorde spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Make thee two trumpets of siluer: of an whole piece shalt thou make the, that thou mayest vse them for the assembling of the Congregation, and for the departure of the campe.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And when they shall blowe with them, all the Congregation shall assemble to thee before the doore of the Tabernacle of the Cogregation.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: But if they blowe with one, then the princes, or heades ouer the thousandes of Israel shall come vnto thee.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: But if ye blow an alarme, then the campe of the that pitch on the East part, shal go forward.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: If ye blowe an alarme the second time, then the hoste of them that lie on the Southside shal march: for they shal blowe an alarme when they remoue.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: But in assembling the Congregation, ye shall blowe without an alarme.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the sonnes of Aaron the Priest shall blowe the trumpets, and ye shall haue them as a lawe for euer in your generations.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And when ye goe to warre in your lande against the enemie that vexeth you, ye shall blowe an alarme with the trumpets, and ye shall bee remembred before the Lorde your God, and shalbe saued from your enemies.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Also in the day of your gladnesse, and in your feast dayes, & in the beginning of your moneths, ye shal also blow the trumpets ouer your burnt sacrifices, and ouer your peace offrings, that they may be a remembrance for you before your God: I am the Lorde your God.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And in the seconde yeere, in the seconde moneth, and in the twentieth day of the moneth the cloude was taken vp from the Tabernacle of the Testimonie.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And ye children of Israel departed on their iourneys out of the desart of Sinai, & the cloud rested in the wildernesse of Paran.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: So they first tooke their iourney at the comandement of the Lord, by ye hand of Moses.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: In the first place went the standerd of the hoste of the children of Iudah, according to their armies: and Nahshon the sonne of Amminabad was ouer his band.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And ouer the band of the tribe of the children of Issachar was Nethaneel ye sonne of Zuar.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And ouer the band of the tribe of the children of Zebulun was Eliab the sonne of Helon.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: When the Tabernacle was taken downe, then the sonnes of Gershon, and the sonnes of Merari went forward bearing the Tabernacle.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: After, departed the standerd of the hoste of Reuben, according to their armies, and ouer his band was Elizur the sonne of Shedeur.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And ouer the band of the tribe of ye children of Simeon was Shelumiel the sonne of Shurishaddai.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And ouer the bande of the tribe of ye children of Gad was Eliasaph the sonne of Deuel.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The Kohathites also went forward and bare the Sanctuarie, and the former did set vp the Tabernacle against they came.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then the standerd of the hoste of the children of Ephraim went forward according to their armies, and ouer his bande was Elishama the sonne of Ammiud.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And ouer the band of the tribe of ye sonnes of Manasseh was Gamliel the sonne of Pedazur.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And ouer the band of ye tribe of the sonnes of Beniamin was Abidan the sonne of Gideoni.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Last, the standerd of the hoste of the children of Dan marched, gathering all ye hostes according to their armies: and ouer his bande was Ahiezer the sonne of Ammishaddai.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And ouer the bande of the tribe of the children of Asher was Pagiel the sonne of Ocran.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And ouer the bande of the tribe of the children of Naphtali was Ahira ye sonne of Enan.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: These were the remouings of the children of Israel according to their armies, whe they marched.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: After, Moses said vnto Hobab ye sonne of Reuel the Midianite, ye father in law of Moses, We go into the place, of which ye Lord said, I will giue it you: Come thou with vs, & we wil doe thee good: for ye Lord hath promised good vnto Israel.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And he answered him, I will not goe: but I will depart to mine owne countrey, and to my kindred.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then he sayd, I pray thee, leaue vs not: for thou knowest our camping places in the wildernesse: therefore thou mayest be our guide.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And if thou go with vs, what goodnes the Lord shall shew vnto vs, the same will we shewe vnto thee.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: So they departed from the mount of the Lorde, three dayes iourney: and the Arke of the couenant of the Lorde went before them in the three dayes iourney, to searche out a resting place for them.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the cloude of the Lord was vpon the by day, when they went out of the campe.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And when the Arke went forwarde, Moses saide, Rise vp, Lord, & let thine enemies bee scattered, & let them that hate thee, flee before thee.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And when it rested, hee sayde, Returne, O Lord, to the many thousands of Israel.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Vvhen the people became murmurers, it displeased the Lorde: and the Lorde heard it, therefore his wrath was kindled, and the fire of the Lorde burnt among them, and consumed the vtmost parte of the hoste.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then the people cryed vnto Moses: and when Moses praied vnto the Lorde, the fire was quenched.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And he called the name of that place Taberah, because the fire of the Lorde burnt among them.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And a nomber of people that was amog them, fell a lusting, and turned away, and the children of Israel also wept, and saide, Who shall giue vs flesh to eate?

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: We remember the fish which we did eat in Egypt for nought, the cucumbers, & the pepons, and the leekes, and the onions, and the garleke.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: But now our soule is dryed away, we can see nothing but this Man.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: (The Man also was as coriander seede, and his colour like the colour of bdelium.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The people went about and gathered it, and ground it in milles, or beat it in morters, and baked it in a cauldron, and made cakes of it, and the taste of it was like vnto the taste of fresh oyle.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And when the dewe fell downe vpon the hoste in the night, the Man fell with it)

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then Moses heard the people weepe throughout their families, euery man in the doore of his tent, and the wrath of the Lord was grieuously kindled: also Moses was grieued.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And Moses saide vnto the Lorde, Wherefore hast thou vexed thy seruant? And why haue I not found fauour in thy sight, seeing thou hast put the charge of al this people vpon mee?

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Haue I conceiued al this people? Or haue I begotte them, that thou shouldest say vnto me, Cary them in thy bosome (as a nurse beareth the sucking childe) vnto the lande, for the which thou swarest vnto their fathers?

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Where should I haue flesh to giue vnto al this people? For they weepe vnto me, saying, Giue vs flesh that we may eate.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: I am not able to beare al this people alone, for it is too heauie for me.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Therefore if thou deale thus with mee, I pray thee, if I haue founde fauour in thy sight, kill me, that I behold not my miserie.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then the Lord said vnto Moses, Gather vnto me seuetie men of ye Elders of Israel, whome thou knowest, that they are the Elders of the people, and gouernonrs ouer them, & bring them vnto the Tabernacle of the Congregation, and let them stand there with thee,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And I will come downe, and talke with thee there, and take of the Spirite, which is vpon thee, and put vpon them, and they shall beare the burthen of the people with thee: so thou shalt not beare it alone.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Furthermore thou shalt saye vnto the people, Bee sanctified against to morowe, and yee shall eate flesh: for you haue wept in the eares of the Lord, saying, Who shall giue vs flesh to eate? For we were better in Egypt: therefore the Lorde will giue you flesh, and ye shall eate.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Ye shal not eat one day nor two daies, nor fiue daies, neither ten daies, nor twentie dayes,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: But a whole moneth, vntill it come out at your nostrels, and bee lothesome vnto you, because ye haue contemned the Lorde, which is among you, and haue wept before him, saying, Why came we hither out of Egypt?

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And Moses saide, Six hundreth thousande footemen are there of the people, among whom I am: and thou saiest, I will giue them flesh, that they may eate a moneth long.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Shall the sheepe and the beeues be slaine for them, to finde them? Either shall all the fish of the sea be gathered together for them to suffice them?

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Lorde saide vnto Moses, Is the Lordes hand shortened? Thou shalt see now whether my word shal come to passe vnto thee, or no.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: So Moses went out, and told the people the wordes of the Lorde, and gathered seuentie men of the Elders of the people, and set them round about the Tabernacle.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then the Lord came downe in a cloude, and spake vnto him, and tooke of the Spirit that was vpon him, and put it vpon the seuentie Ancient men: & when the Spirit rested vpon them, then they prophecied, and did not cease.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: But there remained two of the men in the hoste: the name of the one was Eldad, and the name of the other Medad, and the Spirit rested vpon them, (for they were of them that were written, and went not out vnto the Tabernacle) and they prophecied in the hoste.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then there ranne a yong man, and tolde Moses, and saide, Eldad and Medad doe prophesie in the hoste.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And Ioshua the sonne of Nun the seruant of Moses one of his yong men answered & said, My lord Moses, forbid them.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: But Moses saide vnto him, Enuiest thou for my sake? yea, would God that all the Lordes people were Prophets, and that the Lord woulde put his Spirit vpon them.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And Moses returned into the hoste, he and the Elders of Israel.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then there went foorth a winde from the Lorde, and brought quailes from the Sea, and let them fall vpon the campe, a dayes iourney on this side, and a dayes iourney on the other side, round about the hoste, and they were about two cubites aboue the earth.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then the people arose, al that day, and all the night, and all the next day, and gathered the quailes: he that gathered the least, gathered ten Homers full, and they spred them abroade for their vse round about the hoste.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: While the flesh was yet betweene their teeth, before it was chewed, euen the wrath of the Lorde was kindled against the people, and the Lorde smote the people with an exceeding great plague.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: So the name of the place was called, Kibroth-hattaauah: for there they buried the people that fell a lusting.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: From Kibroth-hattaauah ye people tooke their iourney to Hazeroth, & abode at Hazeroth.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Afterward Miriam and Aaron spake against Moses, because of the woman of Ethiopia whome hee had maried (for hee had married a woman of Ethiopia)

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And they saide, What? hath the Lorde spoken but onely by Moses? hath he not spoken also by vs? and the Lord heard this.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: (But Moses was a verie meeke man, aboue all the men that were vpon the earth)

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And by and by the Lorde sayd vnto Moses, and vnto Aaron, and vnto Miriam, come out yee three vnto the Tabernacle of the Congregation: and they three came forth.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then the Lorde came downe in the pillar of the cloude, and stoode in the doore of the Tabernacle, and called Aaron and Miriam, & they both came forth.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And hee saide, Heare nowe my wordes, If there be a Prophet of the Lord among you, I will be knowen to him by a vision, and will speake vnto him by dreame.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: My seruant Moses is not so, who is faithfull in all mine house.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Vnto him will I speake mouth to mouth, and by vision, and not in darke wordes, but hee shall see the similitude of the Lorde. Wherefore then were ye not afraid to speake against my seruant, euen against Moses?

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Thus the Lorde was very angrie with them, and departed.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Also the cloude departed from the Tabernacle: and beholde, Miriam was leprous like snowe: and Aaron looked vpon Miriam, and beholde, she was leprous.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then Aaron saide vnto Moses, Alas, my Lord, I beseech thee, lay not the sinne vpon vs, which we haue foolishly committed and wherein we haue sinned.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Let her not, I pray thee, be as one dead, of whome the flesh is halfe consumed, when he commeth out of his mothers wombe.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then Moses cryed vnto the Lord, saying, O God, I beseech thee, heale her nowe.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Lord said vnto Moses, If her father had spit in her face, shoulde she not haue bene ashamed seuen dayes? let her be shut out of the hoste seuen dayes, and after she shall bee receiued.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: So Miriam was shut out of the hoste seuen dayes, and the people remooued not, till Miriam was brought in againe.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: (13:1) Then afterwarde the people remooued from Hazeroth, and pitched in the wildernesse of Paran.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: (13:2) And the Lord spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: (13:3) Sende thou men out to search the lande of Canaan which I giue vnto the children of Israel: of euery tribe of their fathers shall ye sende a man, such as are all rulers among them.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: (13:4) Then Moses sent them out of the wildernesse of Paran at the commandement of the Lorde: all those men were heades of the children of Israel.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: (13:5) Also their names are these: of the tribe of Reuben, Shammua the sonne of Zaccur:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: (13:6) Of the tribe of Simeon, Shaphat the sonne of Hori:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: (13:7) Of the tribe of Iudah, Caleb the sonne of Iephunneh:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: (13:8) Of the tribe of Issachar, Igal the sonne of Ioseph:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: (13:9) Of the tribe of Ephraim, Oshea the sone of Nun:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: (13:10) Of the tribe of Beniamin, Palti the sonne of Raphu:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: (13:11) Of the tribe of Zebulun, Gaddiel the sone of Sodi:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: (13:12) Of the tribe of Ioseph, to wit, of the tribe of Manasseh, Gaddi the sonne of Susi:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: (13:13) Of the tribe of Dan, Ammiel the sonne of Gemalli:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: (13:14) Of the tribe of Asher, Sethur the sonne of Michael:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: (13:15) Of the tribe of Naphtali, Nahbi the sonne of Vophsi:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: (13:16) Of the tribe of Gad, Geuel the sonne of Machi.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: (13:17) These are the names of the men, which Moses sent to spie out the lande: and Moses called ye name of Oshea the sonne of Nun, Iehoshua.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: (13:18) So Moses sent them to spie out the lande of Canaan, & said vnto them, Go vp this way toward the South, and go vp into the moutaines,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: (13:19) And consider the land what it is, and the people that dwel therein, whether they be strong or weake, either fewe or many,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: (13:20) Also what the lande is that they dwell in, whether it be good or bad: and what cities they be, that they dwell in, whether they dwell in tents, or in walled townes:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: (13:21) And what the land is: whether it be fat or leane, whether there be trees therein, or not. And be of good courage, and bring of the fruite of the lande (for then was the time of the first ripe grapes)

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: (13:22) So they went vp, and searched out the lande, from the wildernesse of Zin vnto Rehob, to go to Hamath,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: (13:23) And they ascended toward the South, and came vnto Hebron, where were Ahiman, Sheshai and Talmai, the sonnes of Anak; Hebron was built seuen yeere before Zoan in Egypt.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: (13:24) Then they came to the riuer of Eshcol, and cut downe thence a branch with one cluster of grapes, and they bare it vpon a barre betwene two, and brought of the pomegranates and of the figges.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: (13:25) That place was called the riuer Eshcol, because of the cluster of grapes, which the children of Israel cut downe thence.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: (13:26) Then after fourtie dayes, they turned againe from searching of the land.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: (13:27) And they went and came to Moses and to Aaron and vnto al the Congregation of the children of Israel, in the wildernesse of Paran, to Kadesh, and brought to the, and to all the Congregation tydings, and shewed them the fruite of the lande.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: (13:28) And they tolde him, and saide, We came vnto the land whither thou hast sent vs, and surely it floweth with milke and honie: and here is of the fruite of it.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: (13:29) Neuerthelesse the people be strong that dwell in the land, and the cities are walled and exceeding great: and moreouer, we sawe the sonnes of Anak there.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: (13:30) The Amalekites dwell in the South countrey, and the Hittites, and the Iebusites, & the Amorites dwell in the mountaines, & the Canaanites dwell by the sea, & by the coast of Iorden.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: (13:31) Then Caleb stilled the people before Moses, & saide, Let vs go vp at once, and possesse it: for vndoubtedly we shall ouercome it.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: (13:32) But the men, that went vp with him, saide, we be not able to goe vp against the people: for they are stronger then we.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: (13:33) So they brought vp an euill report of the land which they had searched for the children of Israel, saying, The lande which we haue gone through to search it out, is a land that eateth vp the inhabitants thereof: for all the people that we sawe in it, are men of great stature.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: (13:34) For there we sawe gyants, the sonnes of Anak, which come of the gyants, so that we seemed in our sight like grashoppers: and so wee were in their sight.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then all ye Congregation lifted vp their voice, & cryed: and the people wept that night,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And all the children of Israel murmured against Moses and Aaron: and the whole assemblie said vnto them, Would God we had died in the land of Egypt, or in this wildernesse: would God we were dead.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Wherefore nowe hath the Lorde brought vs into this lande to fall vpon the sworde? Our wiues, and our children shall be a pray: were it not better for vs to returne into Egypt?

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And they said one to another, Let vs make a Captaine and returne into Egypt.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then Moses and Aaron fell on their faces before all the assemblie of the Congregation of the children of Israel.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And Ioshua the sonne of Nun, and Caleb the sonne of Iephunneh two of them that searched the lande, rent their clothes,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And spake vnto all the assemblie of the childre of Israel, saying, The land which we walked through to search it, is a very good lande.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: If the Lorde loue vs, he will bring vs into this land, and giue it vs, which is a land that floweth with milke and honie.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: But rebell not ye against the Lord, neither feare ye the people of the land: for they are but bread for vs: their shielde is departed from the, and the Lorde is with vs, feare them not.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And all the multitude saide, Stone them with stones: but the glory of the Lord appeared in the Tabernacle of the Congregation, before all the children of Israel.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Lord said vnto Moses, How long will this people prouoke me, and howe long will it be, yer they beleeue me, for al the signes which I haue shewed among them?

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: I will smite them with the pestilence and destroy them, and will make thee a greater nation and mightier then they.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: But Moses saide vnto the Lorde, When the Egyptians shall heare it, (for thou broughtest this people by thy power from among them)

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then they shall say to the inhabitants of this land, (for they haue heard that thou, Lorde, art among this people, and that thou, Lorde, art seene face to face, and that thy cloude standeth ouer them, and that thou goest before them by day time in a pillar of a cloude, and in a pillar of fire by night)

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: That thou wilt kill this people as one man: so the heathen which haue heard the fame of thee, shall thus say,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Because the Lord was not able to bring this people into the lande, which he sware vnto them, therefore hath he slaine them in the wildernesse.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And now, I beseech thee, let the power of my Lorde be great, according as thou hast spoken, saying,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The Lord is slowe to anger, and of great mercie, and forgiuing iniquitie, and sinne, but not making the wicked innocent, and visiting the wickednes of the fathers vpon the children, in the thirde and fourth generation:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Be mercifull, I beseech thee, vnto the iniquitie of this people, according to thy great mercie, and as thou hast forgiuen this people from Egypt, euen vntill nowe.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Lord said, I haue forgiuen it, according to thy request.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Notwithstanding, as I liue, all the earth shall be filled with the glory of the Lord.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: For all those men which haue seene my glory, and my miracles which I did in Egypt, and in the wildernes, and haue tempted me this ten times, and haue not obeyed my voyce,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Certainely they shall not see the lande, whereof I sware vnto their fathers: neither shall any that prouoke me, see it.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: But my seruant Caleb, because he had another spirite, and hath followed me stil, euen him will I bring into the lande, whither he went, and his seede shall inherite it.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Nowe the Amalekites and the Canaanites remaine in the valley: wherefore turne backe to morowe, and get you into the wildernesse, by the way of the red Sea.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: After, the Lorde spake vnto Moses and to Aaron, saying,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: How long shall I suffer this wicked multitude to murmure against me? I haue heard the murmurings of the children of Israel, which they murmure against me.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Tell them, As I liue (saith the Lorde) I wil surely do vnto you, euen as ye haue spoken in mine eares.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Your carkeises shall fall in this wildernes, and all you that were counted through all your nombers, from twentie yeere olde and aboue, which haue murmured against me,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Ye shall not doubtles come into the land, for the which I lifted vp mine hande, to make you dwell therein, saue Caleb the sonne of Iephunneh, and Ioshua the sonne of Nun.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: But your children, (which ye said shoulde be a pray) them will I bring in, and they shall knowe the lande which ye haue refused:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: But euen your carkeises shall fall in this wildernes,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And your children shall wander in the wildernesse, fourtie yeeres, and shall beare your whoredomes, vntill your carkeises be wasted in the wildernesse.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: After the nuber of the dayes, in the which ye searched out the lande, euen fourtie dayes, euery day for a yeere, shall ye beare your iniquity, for fourtie yeeres, & ye shall feele my breach of promise.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: I the Lord haue said, Certainely I will doe so to all this wicked company, that are gathered together against me: for in this wildernesse they shall be consumed, and there they shall die.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the men which Moses had sent to search the land (which, when they came againe, made all the people to murmure against him, and brought vp a slander vpon the lande)

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Euen those men that did bring vp that vile slander vpon the land, shall die by a plague before the Lorde.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: But Ioshua the sonne of Nun, and Caleb the sonne of Iephunneh, of those men that went to search the land, shall liue.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then Moses tolde these sayings vnto all the children of Israel, and the people sorowed greatly.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And they rose vp earely in the morning, and gate them vp into the toppe of the mountaine, saying, Loe, we be readie, to goe vp to the place which the Lorde hath promised: for wee haue sinned.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: But Moses said, Wherefore transgresse yee thus the commandement of the Lorde? it will not so come well to passe.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Goe not vp (for the Lorde is not among you) lest ye be ouerthrowe before your enemies.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: For the Amalekites & the Canaanites are there before you, and ye shall fall by the sworde: for in as much as ye are turned away from the Lord, the Lord also will not be with you.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Yet they presumed obstinately to goe vp to the top of the mountaine: but the Arke of the couenant of the Lorde, and Moses departed not out of the campe.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then the Amalekites and the Canaanites, which dwelt in that mountaine, came downe & smote them, & consumed them vnto Hormah.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Lorde spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Speake vnto the children of Israel, and say vnto them, Whe ye be come into the land of your habitations, which I giue vnto you,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And will make an offring by fire vnto the Lorde, a burnt offring or a sacrifice to fulfil a vowe, or a free offring, or in your feastes, to make a sweete sauour vnto the Lord of the hearde, or of the flocke.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then let him that offreth his offring vnto the Lorde, bring a meate offring of a tenth deale of fine flowre, mingled with the fourth part of an Hin of oyle.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Also thou shalt prepare ye fourth part of an Hin of wine to be powred on a lambe, appointed for the burnt offring or any offring.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And for a ram, thou shalt for a meat offring, prepare two tenth deales of fine floure, mingled with the third part of an Hin of oyle.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And for a drinke ofring, thou shalt offer the third part of an Hin of wine, for a sweete sauour vnto the Lord.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And when thou preparest a bullocke for a burnt offring, or for a sacrifice to fulfill a vowe or a peace offring to the Lord,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then let him offer with ye bullocke a meate offring of three tenth deales of fine floure, mingled with halfe an Hin of oyle.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And thou shalt bring for a drinke offring halfe an Hin of wine, for an offring made by fire of a sweete sauour vnto the Lord.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Thus shall it be done for a bullocke, or for a ram, or for a lambe, or for a kid.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: According to the nomber that yee prepare to offer, so shall yee doe to euery one according to their nomber.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: All that are borne of the countrey, shall do these things thus, to offer an offring made by fire of sweete sauour vnto the Lord.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And if a stranger soiourne with you, or whosoeuer bee among you in your generations, and will make an offring by fire of a sweete sauour vnto the Lord, as ye do, so hee shall doe.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: One ordinace shalbe both for you of the Congregation, & also for the stranger that dwelleth with you, euen an ordinance for euer in your generations: as you are, so shall the stranger bee before the Lord.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: One Lawe and one maner shall serue both for you and for the stranger that soiourneth with you.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Lord spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Speake vnto the children of Israel, and say vnto them, When ye be come into the lande, to the which I bring you,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And when ye shal eate of the bread of the land, ye shall offer an heaue offring vnto ye Lord.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Ye shall offer vp a cake of the first of your dowe for an heaue offring: as the heaue offring of the barne, so ye shall lift it vp.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Of the first of your dowe ye shal giue vnto the Lord an heaue offring in your generations.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And if ye haue erred, and not obserued all these commandements, which the Lord hath spoken vnto Moses,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Euen all that the Lorde hath commanded you by the hand of Moses, from the first day that the Lord commanded Moses, and hence forward among your generations:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And if so be that ought be committed ignorantly of the Congregation, then all ye Congregatio shal giue a bullocke for a burnt offring, for a sweete sauour vnto the Lord, with the meat offring and drinke offring thereto, according to the maner, and an hee goate for a sinne offring.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Priest shall make an atonement for al the Congregation of the children of Israel, and it shalbe forgiuen them: for it is ignorance: and they shall bring their offring for an offring made by fire vnto the Lord, and their sinne offering before the Lord for their ignorance.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then it shalbe forgiuen all the Congregation of the children of Israel, & the stranger that dwelleth among them: for all the people were in ignorance.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: But if any one person sinne through ignorance, then he shall bring a shee goate of a yeere olde for a sinne offring.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Priest shall make an atonement for the ignorant person, when hee sinneth by ignorance before the Lord, to make reconciliation for him: and it shalbe forgiuen him.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: He that is borne among the children of Israel, and the stranger that dwelleth among them, shall haue both one lawe, who so doth sinne by ignorance.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: But the person that doeth ought presumptuously, whether he be borne in the land, or a stranger, the same blasphemeth the Lord: therefore that person shalbe cut off from among his people,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Because he hath despised the worde of the Lord, and hath broken his commandement: that person shalbe vtterly cut off: his iniquitie shalbe vpon him.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And while the children of Israel were in the wildernesse, they found a man that gathered stickes vpon the Sabbath day.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And they that found him gathering sticks, brought him vnto Moses and to Aaron, and vnto all the Congregation,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And they put him warde: for it was not declared what should be done vnto him.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then the Lord said vnto Moses, This man shall dye the death: & let al the multitude stone him with stones without the hoste.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And all the Congregation brought him without the hoste, and stoned him with stones, and he died, as the Lord had commanded Moses.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Lord spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Speake vnto the children of Israel, and bid them that they make them fringes vpon the borders of their garments throughout their generations, and put vpon the fringes of the borders a ryband of blewe silke.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And ye shall haue the fringes, that when ye looke vpon them, ye may remember all the commandemets of the Lord, & do them: & that ye seeke not after your own heart, nor after your owne eyes, after the which ye go a whoring;

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: That yee may remember and doe all my commandements, and bee holy vnto your God.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: I am the Lord your God, which brought you out of the lande of Egypt, to bee your God: I am the Lord your God.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Nowe Korah the sonne of Izhar, the sonne of Kohath, the sonne of Leui went apart with Dathan, and Abiram the sonnes of Eliab, & On the sonne of Peleth, the sonnes of Reuben:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And they rose vp against Moses, with certaine of the children of Israel, two hundreth and fiftie captaines of the assemblie, famous in the Congregation, and men of renoume,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Who gathered themselues together against Moses, and against Aaron, and sayde vnto them, Ye take too much vpon you, seeing all the Congregation is holie, euery one of them, and the Lord is among them: wherfore then lift ye your selues aboue the Congregation of the Lorde?

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: But when Moses heard it, hee fell vpon his face,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And spake to Korah and vnto all his companie, saying, To morow the Lord will shew who is his, and who is holy, and who ought to approche neere vnto him: and whom he hath chosen, hee will cause to come neere to him.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: This doe therefore, Take you censers, both Korah, and all his companie,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And put fire therein, and put incense in the before the Lord to morowe: and the man whome the Lord doeth chuse, the same shalbe holie: ye take too much vpon you, ye sonnes of Leui.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Againe Moses saide vnto Korah, Heare, I pray you, ye sonnes of Leui.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Seemeth it a smal thing vnto you that the God of Israel hath separated you from the multitude of Israel, to take you neere to himselfe, to doe the seruice of the Tabernacle of the Lord, & to stand before the Congregation and to minister vnto them?

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: He hath also taken thee to him, and all thy brethren the sonnes of Leui with thee, and seeke ye the office of the Priest also?

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: For which cause, thou, and all thy companie are gathered together against the Lord: and what is Aaron, that ye murmure against him?

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And Moses sent to call Dathan, & Abiram the sonnes of Eliab: who answered, We will not come vp.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Is it a small thing that thou hast brought vs out of a lande that floweth with milke and honie, to kill vs in the wildernesse, except thou make thy selfe lord and ruler ouer vs also?

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Also thou hast not brought vs vnto a land that floweth with milke and honie, neither giuen vs inheritance of fieldes and vineyardes: wilt thou put out the eyes of these men? we will not come vp.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then Moses waxed verie angry, and saide vnto the Lord, Looke not vnto their offring: I haue not taken so much as an asse from them, neither haue I hurt any of them.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And Moses said vnto Korah, Bee thou and al thy companie before the Lord: both thou, they, and Aaron to morowe:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And take euery man his censor, and put incense in them, and bring ye euery man his censor before the Lord, two hundreth and fiftie censors: thou also and Aaron, euery one his censor.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: So they tooke euery man his censor, and put fire in them, and laide incense thereon, and stoode in the doore of the Tabernacle of the Congregation with Moses and Aaron.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And Korah gathered all the multitude against them vnto the doore of the Tabernacle of the Congregation: then the glorie of the Lorde appeared vnto all the Congregation.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Lorde spake vnto Moses and to Aaron, saying,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Separate your selues from among this Cogregation, that I may consume them at once.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And they fell vpon their faces and saide, O God the God of the spirits, of all fleshe, hath not one man onely sinned, and wilt thou bee wroth with all the Congregation?

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Lorde spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Speake vnto the Congregation & say, Get you away from about the Tabernacle of Korah, Dathan and Abiram.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then Moses rose vp, and went vnto Dathan and Abiram, and the Elders of Israel followed him.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And he spake vnto the Congregation, saying, Depart, I pray you, from the tentes of these wicked men, and touche nothing of theirs, lest ye perish in all their sinnes.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: So they gate them away from the Tabernacle of Korah, Dathan and Abiram on euerie side: and Dathan, and Abiram came out & stood in the doore of their tentes with their wiues, and their sonnes, and their little children.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And Moses saide, Hereby yee shall knowe that the Lord hath sent me to do all these works: for I haue not done them of mine owne minde.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: If these men die the common death of all men, or if they be visited after the visitation of all men, the Lord hath not sent me.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: But if the Lord make a newe thing, and the earth open her mouth, and swallowe them vp with all that they haue, and they goe downe quicke into ye pit, then ye shal vnderstand that these men haue prouoked the Lord.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And assoone as he had made an ende of speaking all these wordes, euen the ground claue asunder that was vnder them,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the earth opened her mouth, and swallowed them vp, with their families, and all the men that were with Korah, and all their goods.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: So they and all that they had, went down aliue into the pit, and the earth couered them: so they perished from among the Congregation.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And all Israel that were about them, fled at the crie of them: for they said, Let vs flee, least the earth swalow vs vp.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: But there came out a fire from the Lorde, and consumed the two hundreth and fiftie men that offred the incense.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Lord spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Speake vnto Eleazar, the sonne of Aaron the Priest, that he take vp the censers out of the burning, and scatter the fire beyond the altar: for they are halowed,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The censers, I say, of these sinners, that destroyed themselues: and let them make of them broade plates for a couering of the Altar: for they offered them before the Lorde, therefore they shalbe holy, and they shall be a signe vnto the children of Israel.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then Eleazar the Priest tooke the brasen censers, which they, that were burnt, had offred, and made broade plates of them for a couering of the Altar.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: It is a remembrance vnto the children of Israel, that no stranger which is not of the seede of Aaron, come neere to offer incense before the Lord, that he be not like Korah & his copanie, as the Lord said to him by the hand of Moses.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: But on the morowe all the multitude of the children of Israel murmured against Moses & against Aaron, saying, Ye haue killed the people of the Lord.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And when the Congregation was gathered against Moses and against Aaron, then they turned their faces toward the Tabernacle of the Congregation: and beholde, the cloude couered it, and the glory of the Lord appeared.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then Moses and Aaron were come before the Tabernacle of the Congregation.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Lord spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Get you vp from among this Congregation: for I wil consume them quickly: then they fell vpon their faces.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And Moses said vnto Aaron, Take the censer and put fire therein of the Altar, and put therein incense, and goe quickly vnto the Congregation, and make an atonement for them: for there is wrath gone out fro the Lord: the plague is begunne.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then Aaron tooke as Moses commanded him, and ranne into the middes of the Congregation, and beholde, the plague was begun among the people, and hee put in incense, and made an atonement for the people.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And when hee stoode betweene the dead, and them that were aliue, the plague was stayed.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: So they died of this plague fourtene thousande and seuen hundreth, beside them that dyed in the conspiracie of Korah.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And Aaro went againe vnto Moses before the doore of the Tabernacle of the Congregation, and the plague was stayed.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Lord spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Speake vnto the children of Israel, and take of euery one of them a rod, after the house of their fathers, of all their princes according to the familie of their fathers, euen twelue rods: and thou shalt write euery mans name vpon his rod.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And write Aarons name vpon the rod of Leui: for euery rodde shalbe for the head of the house of their fathers.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And thou shalt put them in the Tabernacle of the Congregation, before the Arke of the Testimonie, where I wil declare my selfe to you.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the mans rod, whome I chuse, shall blossome: and I will make cease from mee the grudgings of the children of Israel, which grudge against you.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then Moses spake vnto the children of Israel, and al their princes gaue him a rod, one rod for euery Prince, according to the houses of their fathers, euen twelue rods, and the rod of Aaron was among their roddes.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And Moses layde the rods before the Lord in the Tabernacle of the Testimonie.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And when Moses on the morow went into the Tabernacle of the Testimonie, beholde, the rod of Aaron for the house of Leui was budded, and brought forth buddes, & brought forth blossoms, and bare ripe almondes.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then Moses brought out all the rods from before the Lorde vnto all the children of Israel: and they looked vpon them, & tooke euery man his rodde.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: After, the Lord said vnto Moses, Bring Aarons rod againe before the Testimonie to bee kept for a token to the rebellious children, and thou shalt cause their murmurings to cease from me, that they dye not.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: So Moses did as the Lord had commanded him: so did he.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the children of Israel spake vnto Moses, saying, Behold, we are dead, we perish, we are all lost:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Whosoeuer commeth neere, or approcheth to the Tabernacle of the Lorde, shal dye: shal we be consumed and dye?

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Lord sayd vnto Aaron, Thou, and thy sonnes and thy fathers house with thee, shall beare the iniquitie of the Sanctuarie: both thou and thy sonnes with thee shal beare the iniquitie of your Priestes office.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And bring also with thee thy brethren of the tribe of Leui of ye familie of thy father, which shalbe ioyned with thee, and minister vnto thee: but thou, and thy sonnes with thee shall minister before the Tabernacle of the Testimonie:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And they shal keepe thy charge, euen the charge of all the Tabernacle: but they shall not come neere the instruments of the Sanctuary, nor to the altar, lest they die, both they and you:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And they shalbe ioyned with thee, & keepe the charge of the Tabernacle of the Congregation for all the seruice of the Tabernacle: and no stranger shal come neere vnto you:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Therefore shall ye keepe the charge of the Sanctuarie, and the charge of the altar: so there shall fall no more wrath vpon the children of Israel.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: For lo, I haue taken your brethren the Leuites from among the children of Israel, which as a gift of yours, are giuen vnto the Lord, to do the seruice of the Tabernacle of the Congregation.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: But thou, and thy sonnes with thee shall keepe your Priestes office for all things of the altar, and within the vaile: therefore shal ye serue: for I haue made your Priestes office an office of seruice: therefore the stranger that cometh neere, shalbe slayne.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Againe the Lord spake vnto Aaron, Behold, I haue giuen thee the keeping of mine offrings, of all the hallowed things of the children of Israel: vnto thee I haue giuen them for the anoyntings sake, and to thy sonnes, for a perpetuall ordinance.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: This shalbe thine of the most holy things, reserued from the fire: all their offering of all their meate offring, and of all their sinne offring, and of all their trespasse offring, which they bring vnto me, that shalbe most holy vnto thee, and to thy sonnes.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: In the most holy place shalt thou eate it: euery male shal eate of it: it is holy vnto thee.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: This also shalbe thine: the heaue offering of their gift, with all the shake offerings of the children of Israel: I haue giuen them vnto thee and to thy sonnes and to thy daughters with thee, to be a duetie for euer al the cleane in thine house shal eate of it.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: All the fat of the oyle, and all the fat of the wine, and of the wheate, which they shal offer vnto the Lord for their first fruites, I haue giuen them vnto thee.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the first ripe of al that is in their land, which they shal bring vnto Lord, shalbe thine: all the cleane in thine house shal eate of it.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Euery thing separate from the common vse in Israel, shalbe thine.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: All that first openeth the matrice of any flesh, which they shal offer vnto the Lord, of man or beast, shalbe thine: but the first borne of man shalt thou redeeme, and the first borne of the vncleane beast shalt thou redeeme.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And those that are to bee redeemed, shalt thou redeeme from the age of a moneth, according to thy estimation, for the money of fiue shekels, after the shekel of the Sanctuarie, which is twentie gerahs.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: But the first borne of a kowe, or the first borne of a sheepe, or the first borne of a goate shalt thou not redeeme: for they are holy: thou shalt sprinkle their blood at the altar, and thou shalt burne their fat: it is a sacrifice made by fire for a sweete sauour vnto the Lord.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the flesh of them shalbe thine, as the shake breast, and as the right shoulder shalbe thine.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: All the heaue offrings of the holy things which the children of Israel shal offer vnto the Lorde, haue I giuen thee, and thy sonnes, and thy daughters with thee, to be a duetie for euer: it is a perpetual couenant of salt before the Lord, to thee, and to thy seede with thee.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Lorde sayde vnto Aaron, Thou shalt haue none inheritance in their lande, neyther shalt thou haue any parte among them: I am thy part & thine inheritance among the children of Israel.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: For beholde, I haue giuen the children of Leui all the tenth in Israel for an inheritance, for their seruice which they serue in the Tabernacle of the Congregation.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Neyther shal the children of Israel any more come neere the Tabernacle of the Congregation, lest they susteine sinne, and die.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: But the Leuites shal do the seruice in the Tabernacle of the Congregation, and they shal beare their sinne: it is a law for euer in your generations, that among the children of Israel they possesse none inheritance.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: For the tythes of the children of Israel, which they shal offer as an offring vnto the Lord, I haue giuen the Leuites for an inheritance: therfore I haue said vnto them, Among the children of Israel ye shal possesse none inheritance.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Lord spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Speake also vnto the Leuites and say vnto them, When ye shal take of the children of Israel the tithes, which I haue giuen you of them for your inheritance, then shal ye take an heaue offring of that same for the Lorde, euen the tenth part of the tithe.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And your heaue offering shalbe reckened vnto you, as the corne of the barne, or as the abundance of the wine presse.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: So ye shal also offer an heaue offring vnto the Lorde of all your tithes, which ye shal receiue of the children of Israel, and ye shal giue thereof the Lords heaue offring to Aaron the Priest.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Ye shal offer of all your gifts al the Lords heaue offrings: of all the fat of the same shall ye offer the holy things thereof.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Therefore thou shalt say vnto them, When ye haue offred the fat thereof, then it shalbe couted vnto the Leuites, as the encrease of the corne floore, or as the encrease of the wine presse.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And ye shal eate it in al places, ye, & your housholdes: for it is your wages for your seruice in the Tabernacle of the Congregation.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And ye shal beare no sinne by the reason of it, when ye haue offred the fatte of it: neither shal ye pollute the holy things of the children of Israel, lest ye die.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Lorde spake to Moses, and to Aaron, saying,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: This is the ordinance of the lawe, which the Lorde hath commanded, saying, Speake vnto the children of Israel that they bring thee a red kowe without blemish, wherein is no spot, vpon the which neuer came yoke.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And ye shal giue her vnto Eleazar ye Priest, that hee may bring her without the hoste, and cause her to be slaine before his face.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then shall Eleazar the Priest take of her blood with his finger, and sprinkle it before the Tabernacle of the Congregation seuen times,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And cause the kow to be burnt in his sight: with her skinne, and her flesh, and her blood, & her doung shal he burne her.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then shal the Priest take cedar wood, and hyssope & skarlet lace, and cast them in the mids of the fire where the kow burneth.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then shal the Priest wash his clothes, and he shal wash his flesh in water, and then come into the hoste, and the Priest shalbe vncleane vnto the euen.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Also he that burneth her, shall wash his clothes in water, and wash his flesh in water, and be vncleane vntill euen.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And a man, that is cleane, shal take vp the ashes of the kow, & put them without the hoste in a cleane place: and it shalbe kept for the Congregation of the children of Israel for a sprinkling water: it is a sinne offring.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Therefore he that gathereth the ashes of the kowe, shal wash his clothes, and remaine vncleane vntil euen: and it shalbe vnto the children of Israel, and vnto the stranger that dwelleth among them, a statute for euer.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Hee that toucheth the dead body of any man, shalbe vncleane euen seuen dayes.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Hee shall purifie himselfe therewith the third day, and the seuenth day he shall be cleane: but if he purifie not himselfe the thirde day, then the seuenth day he shall not be cleane.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Whosoeuer toucheth ye corps of any man that is dead, and purgeth not himselfe, defileth the Tabernacle of the Lord, and that person shall be cut off from Israel, because the sprinkling water was not sprinkled vpon him: he shall be vncleane, and his vncleannesse shall remaine still vpon him.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: This is the law, Whe a man dieth in a tent, all that come into the tent, and all that is in the tent, shalbe vncleane seuen dayes,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And all the vessels that bee open, which haue no couering fastened vpon them, shall be vncleane.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Also whosoeuer toucheth one that is slaine with a sworde in the fielde, or a dead person, or a bone of a dead man, or a graue, shall be vncleane seuen dayes.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Therfore for an vncleane person they shall take of the burnt ashes of the sinne offring, and pure water shalbe put thereto in a vessel.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And a cleane person shal take hyssope & dip it in the water, and sprinkle it vpon the tent, and vpon all the vessels, and on the persons that were therein, and vpon him that touched ye bone, or the slayne, or the dead, or the graue.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the cleane person shall sprinkle vpon the vncleane the third day, and the seuenth day, and hee shall purifie him selfe the seuenth day, and wash his clothes, and wash himself in water, and shalbe cleane at euen.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: But the man that is vncleane and purifieth not himselfe, that person shalbe cut off fro among the Congregation, because hee hath defiled the Sanctuarie of the Lorde: and the sprinkling water hath not bene sprinkled vpon him: therefore shall he be vncleane.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And it shalbe a perpetual lawe vnto them, that he that sprinkleth the sprinkling water, shall wash his clothes: also hee that toucheth the sprinkling water, shalbe vncleane vntill euen.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And whatsoeuer the vncleane person toucheth, shall be vncleane: and the person that toucheth him, shalbe vncleane vntill the euen.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then the children of Israel came with ye whole Congregation to the desert of Zin in the first moneth, and the people abode at Cadesh: where Miriam died, and was buried there.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: But there was no water for the Congregation, and they assembled them selues against Moses and against Aaron.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the people chode with Moses, & spake, saying, Would God we had perished, when our brethren died before the Lord.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Why haue ye thus brought the Congregation of the Lorde vnto his wildernesse, that both we, and our cattell should die there?

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Wherefore nowe haue yee made vs to come vp from Egypt, to bring vs into this miserable place, which is no place of seede, nor figges, nor vines, nor pomegranates? Neither is there any water to drinke.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then Moses and Aaron went from the assemblie vnto the doore of the Tabernacle of the Congregation, and fell vpon their faces: and the glory of the Lord appeared vnto them.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Lord spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Take the rod, and gather thou & thy brother Aaron the Congregation together, & speake yee vnto the rocke before their eyes, and it shall giue foorth his water, and thou shalt bring them water out of the rocke: so thou shalt giue the Congregation, and their beastes drinke.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then Moses tooke the rod from before the Lord, as he had commanded him.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And Moses and Aaron gathered the Congregation together before the rocke, and Moses sayd vnto them, Heare nowe, ye rebels: shall we bring you water out of this rocke?

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then Moses lift vp his hande, and with his rod he smote the rocke twise, and the water came out aboundantly: so the Congregation, and their beastes dranke.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Againe the Lorde spake vnto Moses, and to Aaron, Because ye beleeued me not, to sanctifie mee in the presence of the children of Israel, therefore ye shall not bring this Congregation into the land which I haue giuen them.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: This is the water of Meribah, because the children of Israel stroue with the Lorde, and hee was sanctified in them.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then Moses sent messengers from Kadesh vnto the king of Edom, saying, Thus sayth thy brother Israel, Thou knowest all the trauaile that we haue had,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: How our fathers went downe into Egypt, and we dwelt in Egypt a long time, where the Egyptians handled vs euill and our fathers.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: But when we cried vnto the Lord, he heard our voyce, and sent an Angel, and hath brought vs out of Egypt, and beholde, wee are in the citie Kadesh, in thine vtmost border.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: I pray thee that we may passe through thy countrey: we will not goe through the fieldes nor the vineyardes, neither will we drinke of the water of the welles: we will goe by the kings way, and neither turne vnto the right hand nor to the left, vntill we be past thy borders.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And Edom answered him, Thou shalt not passe by mee, least I come out against thee with the sword.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then the children of Israel said vnto him, We will goe vp by the hie way: and if I and my cattell drinke of thy water, I will then pay for it: I will onely (without any harme) goe through on my feete.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Hee answered againe, Thou shalt not goe through. The Edom came out against him with much people, and with a mightie power.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Thus Edom denyed to giue Israel passage through his countrey: wherefore Israel turned away from him.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And when the children of Israel with al the Congregation departed from Kadesh, they came vnto the mount Hor.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Lorde spake vnto Moses and to Aaron in the mount Hor neere the coast of the land of Edom, saying,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Aaron shall be gathered vnto his people: for hee shall not enter into the lande, which I haue giuen vnto the children of Israel, because ye disobeyed my commaundement at the water of Meribah.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Take Aaron and Eleazar his sonne, and bring them vp into the mount Hor,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And cause Aaron to put off his garmentes and put them vpon Eleazar his sonne: for Aaron shall be gathered to his fathers, and shall die there.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And Moses did as the Lord had commanded: and they went vp into the mount Hor, in the sight of all the Congregation.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And Moses put off Aarons clothes, & put them vpon Eleazar his sonne: so Aaron dyed there in the top of the mount: and Moses and Eleazar came downe from off the mount.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: When al the Congregation sawe that Aaron was dead, al the house of Israel wept for Aaron thirtie dayes.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: When King Arad the Canaanite, which dwelt toward the South, heard tel that Israel came by the way of the spies, then fought hee against Israel, and tooke of them prysoners.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: So Israel vowed a vowe vnto the Lord, and said, If thou wilt deliuer and giue this people into mine hand, then I wil vtterly destroy their cities.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Lord heard the voyce of Israel, and deliuered them the Canaanites: and they vtterly destroied them and their cities, and called ye name of the place Hormah.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: After, they departed from the mount Hor by the way of the red Sea, to compasse the land of Edom: and the people were sore grieued because of the way.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the people spake against God and against Moses, saying, Wherefore haue ye brought vs out of Egypt, to die in the wildernesse? for here is neither bread nor water, & our soule lotheth this light bread.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Wherefore the Lorde sent fierie serpents among ye people, which stung the people: so that many of the people of Israel died.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Therefore the people came to Moses & said, We haue sinned: for wee haue spoken against the Lord, and against thee: pray to the Lorde, that he take away the serpents from vs: and Moses prayed for the people.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Lord said vnto Moses, Make thee a fiery serpent, and set it vp for a signe, that as many as are bitten, may looke vpon it, and liue.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: So Moses made a serpent of brasse, and set it vp for a signe: and when a serpent had bitten a man, then he looked to the serpent of brasse, and liued.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And ye children of Israel departed thence, and pitched in Oboth.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And they departed from Oboth, & pitched in lie-abarim, in the wildernesse, which is before Moab on the Eastside.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: They remoued thence, and pitched vpon the riuer of Zared.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Thence they departed, & pitched on the other side of Arnon, which is in the wildernesse, and commeth out of the coasts of the Amorites: (for Arnon is the border of Moab, betweene the Moabites and the Amorites)

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Wherefore it shall be spoken in the booke of the battels of the Lorde, what thing he did in the red sea, and in the riuers of Arnon,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And at the streame of the riuers that goeth downe to the dwelling of Ar, and lieth vpon the border of Moab.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And from thence they turned to Beer: the same is the well where the Lord said vnto Moses, Assemble the people, and I wil giue them water.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then Israel sang this song, Rise vp wel, sing ye vnto it.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The princes digged this well, the captaines of the people digged it, euen the lawe giuer, with their staues; from the wildernesse they came to Mattanah,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And from Mattanah to Nahaliel, and from Nahaliel to Bamoth,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And from Bamoth in the valley, that is in the plaine of Moab, to the top of Pisgah that looketh toward Ieshimon.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then Israel sent messengers vnto Sihon, King of the Amorites, saying,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Let me goe through thy land: we wil not turne aside into the fieldes, nor into the vineyardes, neither drinke of the waters of ye welles: we will goe by the kings way, vntill we be past thy countrey.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: But Sihon gaue Israel no licence to passe through his countrey, but Sihon assembled all his people, and went out against Israel into the wildernesse: and he came to Iahoz, and fought against Israel.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: But Israel smote him with the edge of the sword, and conquered his land, from Arnon vnto Iabok, euen vnto ye children of Ammon: for the border of the children of Ammon was strong.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And Israel tooke al these cities, & dwelt in all the cities of the Amorites in Heshbon and in all the villages thereof.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: For Heshbon was the citie of Sihon the king of the Amorites, which had fought beforetime against the king of the Moabites, & had taken al his land out of his hand, euen vnto Arnon.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Wherefore they that speake in prouerbes, say, Come to Heshbon, let the citie of Sihon bee built and repaired:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: For a fire is gone out of Heshbon, and a flame from the citie of Sihon, and hath consumed Ar of the Moabites, and the lords of Bamoth in Arnon.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Wo be to thee, Moab: O people of Chemosh, thou art vndone: he hath suffered his sonnes to be pursued, and his daughters to be in captiuitie to Sihon the king of the Amorites.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Their empire also is lost from Heshbon vnto Dibon, and wee haue destroyed them vnto Nophah, which reacheth vnto Medeba.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Thus Israel dwelt in the lande of the Amorites.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And Moses sent to searche out Iaazer, and they tooke the townes belonging thereto, and rooted out the Amorites that were there.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And they turned and went vp toward Bashan: and Og the King of Bashan came out against them, hee, and all his people, to fight at Edrei.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then the Lord said vnto Moses, Feare him not: for I haue deliuered him into thine hand and all his people, and his land: and thou shalt do to him as thou diddest vnto Sihon the king of the Amorites, which dwelt at Heshbon.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: They smote him therefore, and his sonnes, and all his people, vntill there was none left him: so they conquered his land.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: After, the children of Israel departed & pitched in the plaine of Moab on the other side of Iorden from Iericho.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Now Balak the sonne of Zippor sawe all that Israel had done to the Amorites.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Moabites were sore afraide of the people, because they were many, and Moab fretted against the children of Israel.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Therfore Moab said vnto the Elders of Midian, Nowe shall this multitude licke vp all that are round about vs, as an oxe licketh vp ye grasse of the fielde: and Balak the sonne of Zippor was King of the Moabites at that time.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Hee sent messengers therefore vnto Balaam the sonne of Beor to Pethor (which is by the riuer of the lande of the children of his folke) to call him, saying, Beholde, there is a people come out of Egypt, which couer the face of the earth, and lye ouer against me.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Come now therefore, I pray thee, and curse me this people (for they are stronger then I) so it may be that I shall be able to smite them, and to driue them out of the land: for I knowe that hee, whome thou blessest, is blessed, and he whom thou cursest, shall be cursed.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Elders of Moab, and the Elders of Midian departed, hauing the reward of the soothsaying in their hande, and they came vnto Balaam, and tolde him the wordes of Balak.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Who answered them, Tary here this night, and I will giue you an answere, as the Lorde shall say vnto mee. So the princes of Moab abode with Balaam.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then God came vnto Balaam, and sayde, What men are these with thee?

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And Baalam said vnto God, Balak ye sonne of Zippor, king of Moab hath set vnto me, saying,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Beholde, there is a people come out of Egypt and couereth the face of the earth: come nowe, curse them for my sake: so it may be that I shalbe able to ouercome them in battell, and to driue them out.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And God said vnto Balaam, Go not thou with them, neither curse the people, for they are blessed.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And Balaam rose vp in the morning, and sayde vnto ye princes of Balak, Returne vnto your land: for the Lord hath refused to giue me leaue to go with you.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: So the princes of Moab rose vp, and went vnto Balak, & sayd, Balaam hath refused to come with vs.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Balak yet sent againe moe princes, and more honourable then they.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Who came to Balaam, and sayde to him, Thus saith Balak the sonne of Zippor, Bee not thou staied, I pray thee, from coming vnto me.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: For I wil promote thee vnto great honour, and wil do whatsoeuer thou sayest vnto me: come therefore, I pray thee, curse me this people.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And Balaam answered, and sayde vnto the seruants of Balak, If Balak woulde giue me his house full of siluer and golde, I can not goe beyonde the worde of the Lorde my God, to doe lesse or more.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: But nowe, I pray you, tary here this night, that I may wit, what the Lorde will say vnto mee more.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And God came vnto Balaam by night, and sayd vnto him, If the men come to call thee, rise vp, and goe with them: but onely what thing I say vnto thee, that shalt thou doe.
