Book.Name: Numbers
Text: So Balaam rose vp early, and sadled his asse, and went with the princes of Moab.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And ye wrath of God was kindled, because he went: and the Angel of the Lord stood in the way to be against him, as he rode vpon his asse, & his two seruants were with him.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And when the asse saw the Angel of the Lord stand in the way, and his sworde drawen in his hand, the asse turned out of the way and went into the field, but Balaam smote the asse, to turne her into the way.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Againe the Angel of the Lord stood in a path of the vineyardes, hauing a wall on the one side, and a wall on the other.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And when the asse sawe the Angel of the Lord, she thrust her selfe vnto the wall, and dasht Balaams foote against the wall: wherefore hee smote her againe.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then the Angel of the Lord went further, & stoode in a narowe place, where was no way to turne, either to the right hand, or to the left.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And when the asse sawe the Angell of the Lorde, she lay downe vnder Balaam: therefore Balaam was very wroth, and smote the asse with a staffe.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then the Lorde opened the mouth of the asse, and she saide vnto Balaam, What haue I done vnto thee, that thou hast smitten me nowe three times?

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And Balaam saide vnto the asse, Because thou hast mocked me: I woulde there were a sworde in mine hand, for nowe would I kill thee.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the asse saide vnto Balaam, Am not I thine asse, which thou hast ridden vpon since thy first time vnto this day? haue I vsed at any time to doe thus vnto thee? Who said, Nay.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Lord opened the eyes of Balaam, and he sawe the Angel of the Lord standing in the way with his sword drawen in his hande: then he bowed him selfe, and fell flat on his face.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Angel of the Lord said vnto him, Wherefore hast thou nowe smitten thine asse three times? beholde, I came out to withstande thee, because thy way is not straight before me.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: But the asse sawe me, and turned fro me now three times: for els, if she had not turned fro me, surely I had euen nowe slaine thee, and saued her aliue.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then Balaam saide vnto the Angel of the Lorde, I haue sinned: for I wist not that thou stoodest in the way against me: now therefore if it displease thee, I will turne home againe.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: But the Angel said vnto Balaam, Go with the men: but what I say vnto thee, that shalt thou speake. So Balaam went with ye princes of Balak.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And when Balak heard that Balaam came, he went out to meete him vnto a citie of Moab, which is in the border of Arnon, euen in the vtmost coast.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then Balak saide vnto Balaam, Did I not sende for thee to call thee? Wherefore camest thou not vnto me? am I not able in deede to promote thee vnto honour?

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And Balaam made answere vnto Balak, Lo, I am come vnto thee, and can I nowe say any thing at all? the worde that God putteth in my mouth, that shal I speake.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: So Balaam went with Balak, & they came vnto the citie of Huzoth.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then Balak offred bullockes, and sheepe, and sent thereof to Balaam, & to the princes that were with him.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And on the morowe Balak tooke Balaam, and brought him vp into the hie places of Baal, that thence hee might see the vtmost part of the people.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And Balaam sayd vnto Balak, Builde me here seuen altars, and prepare me here seuen bullockes, and seuen rammes.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And Balak did as Balaam sayd, and Balak and Balaam offred on euery altar a bullocke and a ramme.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then Balaam sayde vnto Balak, Stande by the burnt offring, and I will goe, if so be that the Lorde will come and meete me: and whatsoeuer he sheweth me, I will tell thee: so he went forth alone.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And God met Balaam, and Balaam sayd vnto him, I haue prepared seuen altars, and haue offred vpon euery altar a bullocke and a ramme.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Lord put an answere in Balaams mouth, and sayde, Go againe to Balak, and say on this wise.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: So when he returned vnto him, loe, hee stoode by his burnt offering, he, and all the princes of Moab.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then he vttered his parable, and sayde, Balak the king of Moab hath brought mee from Aram out of the mountaines of the East, saying, Come, curse Iaakob for my sake: come, and detest Israel.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: How shal I curse, where God hath not cursed? or howe shall I detest, where the Lorde hath not detested?

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: For from the top of the rocks I did see him, and from the hils I did beholde him: lo, the people shal dwell by themselues, and shal not be reckened among the nations.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Who can tell the dust of Iaakob, and the nomber of the fourth part of Israel? Let me die the death of the righteous, and let my last ende be like his.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then Balak saide vnto Balaam, What hast thou done vnto mee? I tooke thee to curse mine enemies, and beholde, thou hast blessed them altogether.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And he answered, and said, Must I not take heede to speake that, which the Lord hath put in my mouth?

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And Balak sayde vnto him, Come, I pray thee, with mee vnto another place, whence thou mayest see them, & thou shalt see but the vtmost part of them, and shalt not see them all: therefore curse them out of that place for my sake.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And he brought him into Sede-sophim to the top of Pisgah, and built seuen altars, and offred a bullocke, and a ramme on euery altar.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: After, he sayde vnto Balak, Stande here by thy burnt offring, & I wil meete the Lord yonder.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Lord mette Balaam, and put an answere in his mouth, and sayd, Goe againe vnto Balak, and say thus.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And when he came to him, beholde, hee stoode by his burnt offering, and the princes of Moab with him: so Balak sayde vnto him, What hath the Lord sayd?

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And he vttered his parable, and sayde, Rise vp, Balak, and heare: hearken vnto me, thou sonne of Zippor.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: God is not as man, that he should lie, neither as the sonne of man that he shoulde repent: hath he sayde and shal he not do it? and hath he spoken, and shal he not accomplish it?

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Behold, I haue receiued commandement to blesse: for he hath blessed, and I cannot alter it.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Hee seeth none iniquitie in Iaakob, nor seeth no transgression in Israel: the Lord his God is with him, and the ioyfull shoute of a king is among them.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: God brought them out of Egypt: their strength is as an vnicorne.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: For there is no sorcerie in Iaakob, nor soothsaying in Israel: according to this time it shalbe sayde of Iaakob and of Israel, What hath God wrought?

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Behold, the people shal rise vp as a lyon, & lift vp himselfe as a yong lyon: hee shall not lye downe, till he eate of the pray, and till he drinke the blood of the slayne.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then Balak sayde vnto Balaam, Neither curse, nor blesse them at all.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: But Balaam answered, & saide vnto Balak, Tolde not I thee, saying, All that the Lorde speaketh, that must I do?

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Againe Balak sayd vnto Balaam, Come, I pray thee, I wil bring thee vnto another place, if so be it wil please God, that thou mayest thence curse them for my sake.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: So Balak brought Balaam vnto the top of Peor, that looketh toward Ieshmon.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then Balaam sayde vnto Balak, Make me here seuen altars, and prepare me here seuen bullocks, and seuen rammes.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And Balak did as Balaam had sayd, and offred a bullocke and a ram on euery altar.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: When Balaam saw that it pleased the Lord to blesse Israel, then he went not, as certaine times before, to set diuinations, but set his face toward the wildernesse.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And Balaam lift vp his eyes, & looked vpon Israel, which dwelt according to their tribes, and the Spirit of God came vpon him.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And he vttered his parable, and sayd, Balaam the sonne of Beor hath sayde, and the man, whose eyes were shut vp, hath sayd,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: He hath sayde, which heard the wordes of God, and sawe the vision of the Almightie, and falling in a traunce had his eyes opened:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: How goodly are thy tentes, O Iaakob, & thine habitations, O Israel!

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: As the valleis, are they stretched forth, as gardes by the riuers side, as the aloe trees, which the Lorde hath planted, as the cedars beside the waters.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The water droppeth out of his bucket, & his seede shalbe in many waters, and his king shall be hier then Agag, and his kingdome shall bee exalted.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: God brought him out of Egypt: his strength shalbe as an vnicorne: he shal eate the nations his enemies, and bruise their bones, & shoote them through with his arrowes.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: He coucheth and lieth downe as a yong lion, and as a lion: who shall stirre him vp? blessed is he that blesseth thee, and cursed is he that curseth thee.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then Balak was very angry with Balaam, and smote his handes together: so Balak sayde vnto Balaam, I sent for thee to curse mine enemies, and beholde, thou hast blessed them nowe three times.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Therefore nowe flee vnto thy place: I thought surely to promote thee vnto honour, but loe, the Lorde hath kept thee backe from honour.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then Balaam answered Balak, Tolde I not also thy messengers, which thou sentest vnto me, saying,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: If Balak would giue me his house ful of siluer and gold, I can not passe the commandement of the Lorde, to doe either good or bad of mine owne minde? what the Lord shall commaunde, the same will I speake.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And nowe behold, I goe vnto my people: come, I will aduertise thee what this people shall doe to thy folke in the later dayes.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And he vttered his parable, and sayd, Balaam the sonne of Beor hath sayde, and the man whose eyes were shut vp, hath sayd,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: He hath said that heard the words of God, and hath the knowledge of the most High, and sawe the vision of the Almightie, and falling in a traunce had his eyes opened:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: I shal see him, but not nowe: I shal behold him, but not neere: there shall come a starre of Iaakob, and a scepter shal rise of Israel, and shall smite the coastes of Moab, and destroy all the sonnes of Sheth.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And Edom shalbe possessed, and Seir shall be a possession to their enemies: but Israel shal do valiantly.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: He also that shall haue dominion shall bee of Iaakob, and shall destroy the remnant of the citie.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And when he looked on Amalek, he vttered his parable, and sayd, Amalek was the first of the nations: but his latter ende shal come to destruction.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And he looked on the Kenites, and vttered his parable, and sayde, Strong is thy dwelling place, and put thy nest in the rocke.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Neuerthelesse, the Kenite shalbe spoyled vntill Asshur cary thee away captiue.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Againe he vttered his parable, and sayd, Alas, who shall liue when God doeth this?

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The ships also shal come from the coastes of Chittim, and subdue Asshur, and shall subdue Eber, and he also shall come to destruction.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then Balaam rose vp, and went and returned to his place: and Balak also went his way.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Nowe whiles Israel abode in Shittim, the people began to commit whoredome with the daughters of Moab:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Which called the people vnto the sacrifice of their gods, and the people ate, & bowed downe to their gods.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And Israel coupled himselfe vnto Baal Peor: wherefore the wrath of the Lord was kindled against Israel:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Lord sayde vnto Moses, Take all the heades of the people, and hang them vp before the Lord against ye sunne, that the indignation of the Lords wrath may be turned fro Israel.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then Moses sayd vnto the Iudges of Israel, Euery one slay his men that were ioyned vnto Baal Peor.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And behold, one of the children of Israel came and brought vnto his brethren a Midianitish woman in the sight of Moses, and in the sight of all the Congregation of the children of Israel, who wept before the doore of the Tabernacle of the Congregation.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And when Phinehas the sonne of Eleazar the sonne of Aaron the Priest sawe it, hee rose vp from the middes of the Congregation, & tooke a speare in his hand,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And followed ye man of Israel into the tent, and thrust them both through: to wit, the man of Israel, and the woman, through her belly: so the plague ceased from the children of Israel.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And there died in that plague, foure and twentie thousand.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then the Lord spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Phinehas the sonne of Eleazar, the sonne of Aaron the Priest, hath turned mine anger away from the children of Israel, while hee was zealous for my sake among them: therefore I haue not consumed the children of Israel in my ielousie.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Wherefore say to him, Beholde, I giue vnto him my couenant of peace,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And he shal haue it, and his seede after him, euen the couenant of the priestes office for euer, because he was zealous for his God, & hath made an atonement for the children of Israel.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the name of the Israelite thus slayne, which was killed with the Midianitish woman, was Zimri the sonne of Salu, prince of the familie of the Simeonites.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the name of the Midianitish woman, that was slayne, was Cozbi the daughter of Zur, who was head ouer the people of his fathers house in Midian.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Againe ye Lord spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Vexe the Midianites, and smite them:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: For they trouble you with their wiles, wherewith they haue beguiled you as concerning Peor, & as concerning their sister Cozbi ye daughter of a prince of Midian, which was slayne in the day of the plague because of Peor.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And so after the plague, the Lord spake vnto Moses, and to Eleazar the sonne of Aaron the Priest, saying,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Take the nomber of all the Congregation of the children of Israel from twentie yeere olde and aboue throughout their fathers houses, all that go forth to warre in Israel.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: So Moses and Eleazar the Priest spake vnto them in the plaine of Moab, by Iorden towarde Iericho, saying,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: From twentie yeere olde and aboue ye shall nomber the people, as the Lord had commanded Moses, and the childre of Israel, when they came out of the land of Egypt.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Reuben the first borne of Israel: the children of Reube were: Hanoch, of whom came the familie of the Hanochites, and of Pallu the familie of the Palluites:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Of Hesron, the familie of the Hesronites: of Carmi, the familie of the Carmites.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: These are the families of the Reubenites: & they were in nomber three and fourtie thousand, seuen hundreth and thirtie.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the sonnes of Pallu, Eliab:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the sonnes of Eliab, Nemuel, and Dathan, and Abiram: this Dathan and Abiram were famous in the Congregation, and stroue against Moses and against Aaron in the assemblie of Korah, when they stroue against the Lord.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the earth opened her mouth, and swalowed them vp with Korah, when the Congregation died, what time the fire consumed, two hundreth and fiftie men, who were for a signe.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Notwithstanding, all the sonnes of Korah dyed not.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the children of Simeon after their families were: Nemuel, of whom came the familie of the Nemuelites: of Iamin, the familie of the Iaminites: of Iachin, the familie of the Iachinites:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Of Zerah, the familie of the Zarhites: of Shaul, the familie of the Shaulites.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: These are the families of the Simeonites: two and twentie thousand and two hundreth.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The sonnes of Gad after their families were: Zephon, of whome came ye familie of the Zephonites: of Haggi, the familie of the Haggites: of Shuni, the familie of the Shunites:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Of Ozni, the familie of the Oznites: of Eri, the familie of the Erites:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Of Arod, the familie of the Arodites: of Areli, the familie of the Arelites.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: These are the families of the sonnes of Gad, according to their nombers, fourtie thousand and fiue hundreth.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The sonnes of Iudah, Er and Onan: but Er and Onan died in the land of Canaan.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: So were the sonnes of Iudah after their families: of Shelah came the familie of ye Shelanites: of Pharez, the familie of the Pharzites, of Zerah, the familie of the Zarhites.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the sonnes of Pharez were: of Hesron, the familie of the Hesronites: of Hamul, the familie of the Hamulites.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: These are the families of Iudah, after their nombers, seuentie and sixe thousande and fiue hundreth.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The sonnes of Issachar, after their families were: Tola, of whom came the familie of the Tolaites: of Pua, the familie of the Punites:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Of Iashub the familie of the Iashubites: of Shimron, the familie of the Shimronites.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: These are the families of Issachar, after their nombers, threescore and foure thousand & three hundreth.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The sonnes of Zebulun, after their families were: of Sered, the familie of the Sardites: of Elon, the familie of the Elonites: of Iahleel, the familie of the Iahleelites.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: These are the families of the Zebulunites, after their nombers, three score thousande & fiue hundreth.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The sonnes of Ioseph, after their families were Manasseh and Ephraim.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The sonnes of Manasseh were: of Machir, the familie of the Machirites: and Machir begate Gilead: of Gilead came the familie of the Gileadites.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: These are the sonnes of Gilead: of Iezer, the familie of the Iezerites: of Helek, the familie of the Helekites.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Of Asriel, the familie of the Asrielites: of Shechem, the familie of Shichmites.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Of Shemida, the familie of the Shemidaites: of Hepher, the familie of the Hepherites.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And Zelophehad the sonne of Hepher had no sonnes, but daughters: and the names of the daughters of Zelophehad were Mahlah, and Noah, Hoglah, Milcah and Tirzah.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: These are the families of Manasseh, & the nomber of them, two and fiftie thousand and seuen hundreth.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: These are the sonnes of Ephraim after their families: of Shuthelah came the familie of the Shuthalhites: of Becher, the familie of the Bachrites: of Tahan, the familie of the Tahanites.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And these are the sonnes of Shuthelah: of Eran the familie of the Eranites.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: These are the families of the sonnes of Ephraim after their nombers, two and thirtie thousand and fiue hundreth. These are the sonnes of Ioseph after their families.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: These are the sonnes of Beniamin after their families: of Bela came the familie of the Belaites: of Ashbel, the familie of the Ashbelites: of Ahiram, the familie of the Ahiramites:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Of Shupham, the familie of the Suphamites: of Hupham, the familie of the Huphamites.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the sonnes of Bela were Ard and Naaman: of Ard came the familie of the Ardites, of Naaman, the familie of the Naamites.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: These are the sonnes of Beniamin after their families, and their nombers, fiue and fourtie thousand and sixe hundreth.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: These are the sonnes of Dan after their families: of Shuham came the familie of the Shuhamites: these are the families of Dan after their housholdes.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: All the families of the Shuhamites were after their nombers, threescore and foure thousand, and foure hundreth.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The sonnes of Asher after their families were: of Iimnah, the familie of the Iimnites: of Isui, the familie of the Isuites: of Beriah, the familie of the Berijtes.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The sonnes of Beriah were, of Heber the familie of the Heberites: of Malchiel, the familie of the Malchielites.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the name of the daughter of Asher was Sarah.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: These are the families of the sonnes of Asher after their nombers, three and fifty thousand and foure hundreth.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The sonnes of Naphtali, after their families were: of Iahzeel, the families of the Iahzeelites: of Guni, the familie of the Gunites.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Of Iezer, the familie of the Izrites: of Shillem, the familie of the Shillemites.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: These are the families of Naphtali according to their housholdes, and their nomber, fiue and fourtie thousande and foure hundreth.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: These are the nombers of the children of Israel: sixe hundreth and one thousand, seuen hundreth and thirtie.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Lord spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Vnto these the land shalbe deuided for an inheritance, according to the nomber of names.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: To many thou shalt giue the more inheritance, and to fewe thou shalt giue lesse inheritance: to euery one according to his nomber shalbe giuen his inheritance.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Notwithstanding, the land shalbe deuided by lot: according to the names of the tribes of their fathers they shall inherite:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: According to the lot shall the possession thereof be deuided betweene many and fewe.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: These also are the nobers of ye Leuites, after their families: of Gershon came ye familie of the Gershonites: of Kohath, ye familie of the Kohathites: of Merari, the familie of the Merarites.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: These are the families of Leui, the familie of the Libnites: the familie of the Hebronites: the familie of the Mahlites: the familie of the Mushites: the familie of the Korhites: and Kohath begate Amram.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And Amrams wife was called Iochebed the daughter of Leui, which was borne vnto Leui in Egypt: and she bare vnto Amram Aaron, and Moses, and Miriam their sister.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And vnto Aaron were borne Nadab, and Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And Nadab and Abihu dyed, because they offred strange fire before the Lorde.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And their nombers were three and twentie thousand, all males from a moneth old and aboue: for they were not nombred among the children of Israel, because there was none inheritance giuen them among the children of Israel.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: These are the nombers of Moses and Eleazar the Priest which nombred the children of Israel in the plaine of Moab, neere Iorden, towarde Iericho.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And among these there was not a man of them, whome Moses and Aaron the Priest nobred, when they tolde the children of Israel in the wildernes of Sinai.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: For the Lorde said of them, They shall die in the wildernes: so there was not left a man of them, saue Caleb the sonne of Iephunneh, and Ioshua the sonne of Nun.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then came the daughters of Zelophehad, the sonne of Hepher, the sonne of Gilead, the sonne of Machir, the sonne of Manasseh, of the familie of Manasseh, the sonne of Ioseph (and the names of his daughters were these, Mahlah, Noah and Hoglah, and Milcah, and Tirzah)

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And stoode before Moses, and before Eleazar the Priest, and before the Princes, and all the assemblie, at the doore of the Tabernacle of the Congregation, saying,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Our father dyed in the wildernes, and he was not among the assemblie of them that were assembled against the Lorde in the companie of Korah, but died in his sinne, and had no sonnes.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Wherefore should the name of our father be taken away from among his familie, because he hath no sonne? giue vs a possession among the brethren of our father.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then Moses brought their cause before the Lorde.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Lorde spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The daughters of Zelophehad speake right: thou shalt giue them a possession to inherite among their fathers brethren, and shalt turne the inheritance of their father vnto them.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Also thou shalt speake vnto the children of Israel, saying, If a man die and haue no sonne, then ye shall turne his inheritaunce vnto his daughter.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And if he haue no daughter, ye shall giue his inheritance vnto his brethren.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And if he haue no brethren, ye shall giue his inheritance vnto his fathers brethren.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And if his father haue no brethren, ye shal giue his inheritance vnto his next kinsman of his familie, and he shall possesse it: and this shall be vnto the children of Israel a law of iudgement, as the Lord hath commanded Moses.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Againe the Lord said vnto Moses, Go vp into this mount of Abarim, & behold ye lande which I haue giuen vnto the children of Israel.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And when thou hast seene it, thou shalt be gathered vnto thy people also, as Aaron thy brother was gathered.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: For ye were disobedient vnto my worde in the desert of Zin, in the strife of the assemblie, to sanctifie me in the waters before their eyes. That is the water of Meribah in Kadesh in the wildernesse of Zin.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then Moses spake vnto the Lord, saying,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Let the Lorde God of the spirits of all flesh appoint a man ouer the Congregation,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Who may goe out and in before them, and leade them out and in, that the Congregation of the Lorde be not as sheepe, which haue not a shepheard.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Lorde said vnto Moses, Take thee Ioshua the sonne of Nun, in whom is the Spirite, and put thine handes vpon him,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And set him before Eleazar the Priest, and before all the Congregation, and giue him a charge in their sight.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And giue him of thy glory, that all the Congregation of ye children of Israel may obey.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And he shall stande before Eleazar the Priest, who shall aske counsell for him by the iudgement of Vrim before the Lorde: at his worde they shall goe out, and at his worde they shall come in, both he, and all the children of Israel with him and all the Congregation.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: So Moses did as the Lord had commanded him, and he tooke Ioshua, and set him before Eleazar the Priest, & before all the Congregation.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then he put his handes vpon him, & gaue him a charge, as the Lorde had spoken by the hand of Moses.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Lorde spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Command the children of Israel, and say vnto them, Ye shall obserue to offer vnto me in their due season mine offering, and my bread, for my sacrifices made by fire for a sweete sauour vnto me.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Also thou shalt say vnto them, This is the offring made by fire which ye shall offer vnto the Lorde, two lambes of a yeere olde without spot, daily, for a continuall burnt offring.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: One lambe shalt thou prepare in the morning, and the other lambe shalt thou prepare at euen.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the tenth part of an Ephah of fine floure for a meate offering mingled with the fourth part of an Hin of beaten oyle.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: This shalbe a daily burnt offering, as was made in the mount Sinai for a sweete sauour: it is a sacrifice made by fire vnto the Lord.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the drinke offring thereof the fourth part of an Hin for one lambe: in the holy place cause to powre the drinke offring vnto the Lord.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the other lambe thou shalt prepare at euen: as the meate offring of the morning, and as the drinke offering thereof shalt thou prepare this for an offring made by fire of sweete sauour vnto the Lorde.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: But on the Sabbath day ye shall offer two lambes of a yere old, without spot, & two tenth deales of fine floure for a meate offring mingled with oyle, and the drinke offring thereof.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: This is ye burnt offring of euery Sabbath, beside the continuall burnt offring, and drinke offring thereof.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And in the beginning of your moneths, ye shall offer a burnt offring vnto the Lorde, two yong bullockes, and a ramme, and seuen lambes of a yeere olde, without spot,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And three tenth deales of fine floure for a meat offring mingled with oyle for one bullocke, and two tenth deales of fine floure for a meate offring, mingled with oyle for one ramme,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And a tenth deale of fine floure mingled with oyle for a meate offring vnto one lambe: for a burnt offring of sweete sauour: it is an offring made by fire vnto the Lorde.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And their drinke offrings shalbe halfe an Hin of wine vnto one bullocke, and the thirde part of an Hin vnto a ram, and ye fourth part of an Hin vnto a labe: this is the burnt offring of euery moneth, throughout the moneths of the yeere.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And one hee goat for a sinne offring vnto the Lord shalbe prepared, besides the continuall burnt offring, and his drinke offring.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Also the fourtenth day of the first moneth is the Passeouer of the Lord.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And in ye fiftenth day of the same moneth is the feast: seuen dayes shall vnleauened bread be eaten.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: In the first day shalbe an holy conuocation, ye shall do no seruile worke therein.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: But ye shall offer a sacrifice made by fire for a burnt offring vnto the Lord, two yong bullocks, one ram, and seuen lambes of a yeere olde: see that they be without blemish.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And their meate offering shalbe of fine floure mingled with oyle: three tenth deales shall ye prepare for a bullocke, and two tenth deales for a ramme:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: One tenth deale shalt thou prepare for euery lambe, euen for the seuen lambes.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And an hee goate for a sinne offering, to make an atonement for you.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Ye shall prepare these, beside the burnt offering in the morning, which is a continuall burnt sacrifice.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: After this maner ye shall prepare throughout all the seuen dayes, for the mainteining of the offring made by fire for a sweete sauour vnto the Lorde: it shall be done beside the continuall burnt offring and drinke offring thereof.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And in ye seuenth day ye shal haue an holy conuocation, wherein ye shal do no seruile work.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Also in the day of your first fruits, when ye bring a newe meate offring vnto the Lorde, according to your weekes ye shal haue an holy conuocation, & ye shal do no seruile worke in it:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: But ye shall offer a burnt offering for a sweete sauour vnto the Lord, two yong bullocks, a ramme, and seuen lambes of a yeere olde,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And their meat offring of fine floure mingled with oyle, three tenth deales vnto a bullocke, two tenth deales to a ram,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And one tenth deale vnto euery lambe throughout the seuen lambes,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And an hee goate to make an atonement for you:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: (Ye shall doe this besides the continuall burnt offring, and his meate offring:) see they be without blemish, with their drinke offrings.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Moreouer, in the first day of the seuenth moneth ye shall haue an holy conuocation: ye shall doe no seruile worke therein: it shall be a day of blowing the trumpets vnto you.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And ye shall make a burnt offering for a sweete sauour vnto the Lorde: one yong bullocke, one ram, and seuen lambes of a yeere olde, without blemish.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And their meat offring shalbe of fine floure mingled with oyle, three tenth deales vnto the bullocke, and two tenth deales vnto the ramme,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And one tenth deale vnto one lambe, for the seuen lambes,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And an hee goate for a sinne offering to make an atonement for you,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Beside the burnt offring of the moneth, & his meat offring, & the cotinual burnt offring, and his meate offring and the drinke offrings of the same, according to their maner, for a sweete sauour: it is a sacrifice made by fire vnto ye Lord.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And ye shal haue in ye tenth day of the seuenth moneth, an holy conuocation: and ye shall humble your soules, and shall not doe any worke therein:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: But ye shall offer a burnt offring vnto the Lorde for a sweete sauour: one yong bullocke, a ramme, and seuen lambes of a yeere olde: see they be without blemish.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And their meate offering shall be of fine floure mingled with oyle, three tenth deales to a bullocke, and two tenth deales to a ramme,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: One tenth deale vnto euery lambe, thoroughout the seuen lambes,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: An hee goate for a sinne offring, (beside ye sinne offring to make the atonement & the continual burnt offring & the meat offring thereof) and their drinke offrings.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And in the fifteenth day of the seuenth moneth ye shall haue an holie conuocation: ye shall do no seruile worke therein, but yee shall keepe a feast vnto the Lord seuen daies.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And ye shall offer a burnt offring for a sacrifice made by fire of sweete sauour vnto the Lord, thirtene yong bullockes, two rammes, and fourtene lambes of a yeere olde: they shall bee without blemish.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And their meate offering shall bee of fine floure mingled with oyle, three tenth deales vnto euery bullocke of the thirteene bullockes, two tenth deales to either of the two rammes,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And one tenth deale vnto eche of ye fourteene lambes,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And one hee goate for a sinne offring, beside the continuall burnt offring, his meate offring, and his drinke offring.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the second day ye shall offer twelue yong bullockes, two rams, fourteene lambes of a yeere olde without blemish,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: With their meate offring and their drinke offrings for the bullockes, for the rammes, and for the lambes according to their nomber, after the maner,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And an hee goate for a sinne offring, (beside the continuall burnt offering and his meate offring) and their drinke offrings.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Also the third day ye shall offer eleuen bullocks, two rams, and fourteene lambes of a yeere olde without blemish,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: With their meate offring and their drinke offrings, for the bullockes, for the rams, and for the lambes, after their nomber according to the maner,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And an hee goat for a sinne offring, beside the continuall burnt offring, and his meate offring and his drinke offring.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the fourth day ye shall offer tenne bullocks, two rammes, and fourteene lambes of a yeere olde without blemish.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Their meate offring and their drinke offrings, for the bullockes, for the rammes, and for the lambes according to their nomber, after the maner,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And an hee goate for a sinne offering beside the continuall burnt offring, his meate offering and his drinke offering.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: In the fifth day also ye shall offer nine bullockes, two rammes, and fourteene lambes of a yeere olde without blemish,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And their meat offering and their drinke offrings for the bullockes, for the rammes, and for the lambes according to their nomber, after the maner,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And an hee goat for a sinne offring, beside the continuall burnt offring, and his meat offring and his drinke offering.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And in the sixt day ye shall offer eight bullockes, two rams, and fourteene lambes of a yeere olde without blemish,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And their meate offring, and their drinke offrings for the bullockes, for the rammes, and for the lambes according to their nomber, after the maner,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And an hee goat for a sinne offring, beside the continuall burnt offring, his meate offring and his drinke offrings.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: In the seuenth day also ye shall offer seuen bullocks, two rammes and fourteene lambes of a yeere olde without blemish,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And their meate offering and their drinke offrings for the bullockes, for the rammes, and for the lambes according to their nomber, after their maner,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And an hee goate for a sinne offring, beside the continuall burnt offring, his meate offering and his drinke offring.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: In the eight day, yee shall haue a solemne assemblie: yee shall doe no seruile worke therein,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: But yee shall offer a burnt offering, a sacrifice made by fire for a sweete sauour vnto the Lord, one bullocke, one ram, and seuen lambes of a yeere old without blemish,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Their meate offring and their drinke offrings for the bullocke, for the ramme, and for the lambes according to their nomber, after the maner,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And an hee goat for a sinne offring, beside the continuall burnt offring, & his meate offring, and his drinke offring.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: These things ye shall do vnto the Lorde in your feastes, beside your vowes, and your free offrings, for your burnt offrings, and for your meate offrings, and for your drinke offrings and for your peace offrings.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: (30:1) Then Moses spake vnto the children of Israel according to all that the Lorde had commanded him,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: (30:2) Moses also spake vnto the heads of ye tribes concerning the children of Israel, saying, This is the thing which the Lord hath commanded,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: (30:3) Whosoeuer voweth a vow vnto the Lord, or sweareth an othe to binde him selfe by a bonde, he shall not breake his promise, but shall do according to al that proceedeth out of his mouth.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: (30:4) If a woman also vow a vow vnto the Lord, and binde her selfe by a bonde, being in her fathers house, in the time of her youth,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: (30:5) And her father heare her vowe and bonde, wherewith she hath bound her selfe, and her father hold his peace concerning her, then all her vowes shall stande, and euery bonde, wherewith she hath bound her selfe, shall stand.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: (30:6) But if her father disalow her the same day that he heareth all her vowes and bondes, wherewith she hath bound her selfe, they shall not bee of value, and the Lorde will forgiue her, because her father disalowed her.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: (30:7) And if she haue an husband when she voweth or pronounceth ought with her lips, wherewith she bindeth her selfe,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: (30:8) If her husband heard it, & holdeth his peace concerning her, the same day he heareth it, then her vowe shall stande, and her bondes wherewith she bindeth her selfe shall stand in effect.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: (30:9) But if her husbande disalow her the same day that hee heareth it, then shall hee make her vowe which shee hath made, and that that shee hath pronounced with her lips, wherewith shee bound her selfe, of none effect: and the Lorde will forgiue her.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: (30:10) But euery vowe of a widowe, and of her that is diuorced (wherewith she hath bound her selfe) shall stand in effect with her.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: (30:11) And if she vowed in her husbands house, or bound her selfe streightly with an othe,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: (30:12) And her husband hath heard it, and helde his peace cocerning her, not disalowing her, then all her vowes shall stand, and euery bond, wherewith she bound her selfe, shall stand in effect.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: (30:13) But if her husband disanulled them, the same day that he heard them, nothing that proceeded out of her lippes concerning her vowes or concerning her bondes, shall stand in effect: for her husband hath disanulled them: and the Lord will forgiue her.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: (30:14) So euery vowe, and euery othe or bonde, made to humble the soule, her husband may stablish it, or her husband may breake it.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: (30:15) But if her husband holde his peace concerning her from day to day, then he stablisheth al her vowes and all her bondes which shee hath made: hee hath confirmed them because he held his peace concerning her the same day that hee hearde them.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: (30:16) But if he breake them after that he hath heard them, then shall he beare her iniquitie.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: (30:17) These are the ordinances which the Lorde commanded Moses, betweene a man & his wife, and betweene the father and his daughter, being young in her fathers house.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Lorde spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Reuenge the children of Israel of the Midianites, and afterwarde shalt thou be gathered vnto thy people.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And Moses spake to the people, saying, Harnesse some of you vnto warre, and let them goe against Midian, to execute the vengeance of the Lord against Midian.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: A thousande of euery tribe throughout all the tribes of Israel, shall ye sende to the warre.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: So there were taken out of the thousands of Israel, twelue thousande prepared vnto warre, of euery tribe a thousand.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And Moses sent them to the warre, euen a thousand of euery tribe, and sent them with Phinehas the sonne of Eleazar the Priest to the warre: and the holy instruments, that is, the trumpets to blow were in his hand.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And they warred against Midian, as the Lorde had commaunded Moses, and slue all the males.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: They slue also the Kings of Midian among them that were slaine: Eui and Rekem, and Zur, and Hur and Reba fiue kings of Midian, and they slue Balaam the sonne of Beor with the sworde:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: But the children of Israel tooke the women of Midian prisoners, and their children, and spoyled all their cattell, and all their flockes, and all their goods.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And they burnt all their cities, wherein they dwelt, and all their villages with fire.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And they tooke all the spoyle and all the pray both of men and beastes.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And they brought the captiues and that which they had taken, and the spoyle vnto Moses and to Eleazar the Priest, and vnto the Congregation of the children of Israel, into ye campe in the playne of Moab, which was by Iorden toward Iericho.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then Moses and Eleazar the Priest, and all the princes of the Congregation went out of the campe to meete them.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And Moses was angry with the captaines of the hoste, with the captaines ouer thousands, and captaines ouer hundreds, which came from the warre and battel.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And Moses sayde vnto them, What? haue ye saued all the women?

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Behold, these caused the children of Israel through the counsell of Balaam to commit a trespasse against the Lorde, as concerning Peor, and there came a plague among the Congregation of the Lorde.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Now therefore, slay all the males among the children, and kill all the women that haue knowen man by carnall copulation.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: But all the women children that haue not knowen carnall copulation, keepe aliue for your selues.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And ye shal remaine without the host seuen dayes, all that haue killed any person, and all that haue touched any dead, and purifie both your selues and your prisoners the third day and the seuenth.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Also ye shall purifie euery garment and all that is made of skins & al worke of goates heare, and all things made of wood.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And Eleazar ye Priest sayd vnto the men of warre, which went to the battel, This is the ordinance of the law which the Lorde commanded Moses,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: As for gold, and siluer, brasse, yron, tynne, and lead:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Euen all that may abide the fire, yee shall make it goe through the fire, and it shalbe cleane: yet, it shalbe purified with the water of purification: and all that suffereth not the fire, yee shall cause to passe by the water.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Ye shal wash also your clothes the seuenth day, and ye shalbe cleane: and afterward ye shal come into the Hoste.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Lord spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Take the summe of the praie that was taken, both of persons and of cattell, thou and Eleazar the Priest, and the chiefe fathers of the Congregation.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And deuide the praye betweene the souldiers that went to the warre, and all the Congregation.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And thou shalt take a tribute vnto ye Lord of the men of warre, which went out to battel: one person of fiue hundreth, both of the persons, and of the beeues, & of the asses, & of the sheepe.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Yee shall take it of their halfe and giue it vnto Eleazar the Priest, as an heaue offring of the Lorde.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: But of the halfe of the children of Israel thou shalt take one, taken out of fiftie, both of the persons, of the beeues, of the asses, and of the sheepe, euen of all the cattel: and thou shalt giue them vnto the Leuites, which haue the charge of the Tabernacle of the Lord.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And Moses and Eleazar the priest did as the Lord had commanded Moses.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the bootie, to wit, the rest of the praie which the men of warre had spoyled, was sixe hundreth seuentie and fiue thousand sheepe,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And seuentie and two thousand beeues,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And three score and one thousand asses,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And two and thirtie thousande persons in all, of women that had lyen by no man.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the halfe, to wit, the part of them that went out to warre touching the nomber of sheepe, was three hundreth seuen and thirtie thousand, and fiue hundreth.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Lordes tribute of the sheepe was sixe hundreth and seuentie and fiue:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the beeues were six & thirty thousad, whereof the Lordes tribute was seuentie & two.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the asses were thirtie thousande and fiue hundreth, whereof the Lordes tribute was three score and one:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And of persons sixtene thousand, whereof the Lordes tribute was two and thirtie persons.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And Moses gaue the tribute of the Lordes offring vnto Eleazar the Priest, as the Lorde had commanded Moses.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And of the halfe of the children of Israel, which Moses deuided from the men of warre,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: (For the halfe that perteined vnto the Congregation, was three hundreth thirtie and seuen thousand sheepe and fiue hundreth,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And sixe and thirtie thousand beeues,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And thirtie thousand asses, & fiue hudreth,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And sixteene thousande persons)

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Moses, I say, tooke of the halfe that perteined vnto the children of Israel, one taken out of fiftie, both of the persons, and of the cattell, and gaue them vnto the Leuites, which haue the charge of the Tabernacle of the Lorde, as the Lorde had commanded Moses.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then the captaines which were ouer thousandes of the hoste, the captaines ouer the thousandes, and the captaines ouer the hundreds came vnto Moses:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And saide to Moses, Thy seruants haue taken the summe of the men of warre which are vnder our authoritie, and there lacketh not one man of vs.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: We haue therefore brought a present vnto the Lorde, what euery man found of iewels of golde, bracelets, and cheines, rings, eare ringes, and ornaments of the legges, to make an atonement for our soules before the Lorde.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And Moses and Eleazar the Priest tooke the golde of them, and all wrought iewels,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And all the golde of the offring that they offered vp to the Lorde (of the captaines ouer thousands and hundreds) was sixteene thousande seuen hundreth and fiftie shekels,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: (For the men of warre had spoyled, euery man for him selfe)

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And Moses and Eleazar the Priest tooke the golde of the captaines ouer the thousandes, and ouer the hundreds, and brought it into the Tabernacle of the Congregation, for a memoriall of the children of Israel before the Lorde.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Nowe the children of Reuben, and the children of Gad had an exceeding great multitude of cattell: and they sawe the lande of Iazer, and the lande of Gilead, that it was an apt place for cattel.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then the children of Gad, and the childre of Reuben came, and spake vnto Moses and to Eleazar the Priest, and vnto the princes of the Congregation, saying,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The land of Ataroth, and Dibon, and Iazer, and Nimrah, and Heshbon, and Elealeh, and Shebam, and Nebo, and Beon,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Which countrey the Lorde smote before the Congregation of Israel, is a lande meete for cattell, and thy seruants haue cattell:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Wherefore, said they, if we haue foud grace in thy sight, let this lande be giuen vnto thy seruants for a possession, & bring vs not ouer Iorde.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And Moses said vnto the children of Gad, and to the children of Reuben, Shall your brethren goe to warre, and ye tary heere?

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Wherefore now discourage ye the heart of the children of Israel, to goe ouer into the lande, which the Lorde hath giuen them?

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Thus did your fathers when I sent them from Kadesh-barnea to see the lande.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: For when they went vp euen vnto the riuer of Eshcol, and sawe the land: they discouraged the heart of the childre of Israel, that they woulde not goe into the lande, which the Lorde had giuen them.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Lordes wrath was kindled the same day, and he did sweare, saying,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: None of the men that came out of Egypt from twentie yeere olde and aboue, shall see the land for the which I sware vnto Abraha, to Izhak, and to Iaakob, because they haue not wholly followed me:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Except Caleb the sonne of Iephunneh the Kenesite, and Ioshua the sonne of Nun: for they haue constantly followed the Lorde.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Lord was very angry with Israel, and made them wander in the wildernesse fourty yeeres, vntill all the generation that had done euill in the sight of the Lorde were consumed.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And behold, ye are risen vp in your fathers steade as an encrease of sinfull men, still to augment the fierce wrath of the Lord, toward Israel.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: For if ye turne away from following him, he will yet againe leaue the people in the wildernesse, and ye shall destroy all this folke.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And they went neere to him, and said, We will builde sheepe foldes here for our sheepe, and for our cattell, and cities for our children.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: But we our selues will be readie armed to go before the children of Israel, vntill we haue brought them vnto their place: but our childre shall dwell in the defenced cities, because of the inhabitants of the lande.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: We will not returne vnto our houses, vntil the children of Israel haue inherited, euery man his inheritance.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Neither wil we inherite with them beyond Iorden and on that side, because our inheritance is fallen to vs on this side Iorden Eastwarde.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And Moses saide vnto them, If ye will doe this thing, and goe armed before the Lord to warre:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And will goe euery one of you in harnesse ouer Iorden before the Lorde, vntill he hath cast out his enemies from his sight:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And vntill the land be subdued before the Lorde, then ye shall returne and be innocent toward the Lorde, and toward Israel: and this land shalbe your possession before the Lorde.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: But if ye will not doe so, beholde, ye haue sinned against the Lorde, and be sure, that your sinne will finde you out.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Builde you then cities for your children & folds for your sheepe, and do that ye haue spoke.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then the children of Gad & the children of Reuben spake vnto Moses, saying, Thy seruats will doe as my lorde commandeth:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Our childre, our wiues, our sheepe, & al our cattell shall remaine there in the cities of Gilead,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: But thy seruants will goe euery one armed to warre before the Lorde for to fight, as my lorde saith.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: So concerning them, Moses commanded Eleazar the Priest, and Ioshua the sonne of Nun, and the chiefe fathers of the tribes of the children of Israel:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And Moses said vnto them, If the children of Gad, and the children of Reuben, will go with you ouer Iorden, all armed to fight before the Lord, then when the land is subdued before you, ye shall giue the the lad of Gilead for a possessio:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: But if they will not goe ouer with you armed, then they shall haue their possessions amog you in the land of Canaan.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the children of Gad, and the children of Reuben answered, saying, As the Lorde hath said vnto thy seruants, so will we doe.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: We will goe armed before the Lorde into the lande of Canaan: that the possession of our inheritance may be to vs on this side Iorden.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: So Moses gaue vnto them, euen to the children of Gad, and to the children of Reuben, and to halfe the tribe of Manasseh the sonne of Ioseph, the kingdome of Sihon King of the Amorites, and the kingdome of Og King of Bashan, the lande with the cities thereof & coastes, euen the cities of the countrey round about.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then the children of Gad built Dibon, and Ataroth, and Aroer,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And Atroth, Shophan, and Iazer, and Iogbehah,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And Beth-nimrah, and Beth-haran, defenced cities: also sheepe foldes.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the children of Reuben built Heshbon, and Elealeh, and Kiriathaim,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And Nebo, and Baal-meon, and turned their names, and Shibmah: and gaue other names vnto the cities which they built.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the children of Machir the sonne of Manasseh went to Gilead, and tooke it, and put out the Amorites that dwelt therein.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then Moses gaue Gilead vnto Machir the sonne of Manasseh, and he dwelt therein.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And Iair the sonne of Manasseh went and tooke the small townes thereof, and called them Hauoth Iair.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Also Nobah went and tooke Kenath, with the villages thereof and called it Nobah, after his owne name.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: These are the iourneyes of the children of Israel, which went out of the land of Egypt according to their bands vnder the hand of Moses and Aaron.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And Moses wrote their going out by their iourneies according to ye commandement of the Lord: so these are ye iourneies of their going out.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Nowe they departed from Rameses the first moneth, euen the fifteenth day of the first moneth, on the morowe after the Passeouer: and the children of Israel went out with an hie hand in the sight of all the Egyptians.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: (For the Egyptians buried all their first borne, which the Lord had smitten among them: vpon their gods also the Lord did execution.)

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the children of Israel remoued from Rameses, and pitched in Succoth.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And they departed from Succoth, and pitched in Etham, which is in the edge of the wildernesse.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And they remoued from Etham, and turned againe vnto Pi-hahiroth, which is before Baal-zephon, and pitched before Migdol.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And they departed from before Hahiroth, and went through the middes of the Sea into the wildernesse, and went three dayes iourney in the wildernesse of Etham, and pitched in Marah.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And they remoued from Marah, and came vnto Elim, and in Elim were twelue fountaines of water, and seuentie palme trees, and they pitched there.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And they remoued from Elim, and camped by the red Sea.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And they remoued from the red Sea, and lay in the wildernesse of Sin.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And they tooke their iourney out of the wildernesse of Sin, and set vp their tentes in Dophkah.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And they departed from Dophkah, and lay in Alush.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And they remoued from Alush, and lay in Rephidim, where was no water for the people to drinke.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And they departed from Rephidim, and pitched in the wildernesse of Sinai.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And they remoued from the desert of Sinai, and pitched in Kibroth Hattaauah.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And they departed from Kibroth Hattaauah, and lay at Hazeroth.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And they departed from Hazeroth, and pitched in Rithmah.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And they departed from Rithmah, and pitched at Rimmon Parez.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And they departed from Rimmon Parez, and pitched in Libnah.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And they remoued from Libnah, and pitched in Rissah.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And they iourneyed from Rissah, and pitched in Kehelathah.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And they went from Kehelathah, and pitched in mount Shapher.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And they remoued from mount Shapher, and lay in Haradah.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And they remoued from Haradah, and pitched in Makheloth.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And they remoued from Makheloth, and lay in Tahath.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And they departed from Tahath, and pitched in Tarah.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And they remoued from Tarah, and pitched in Mithkah.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And they went from Mithkah, and pitched in Hashmonah.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And they departed from Hashmonah, and lay in Moseroth.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And they departed from Moseroth, and pitched in Bene-iaakan.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And they remoued from Bene-iaakan, and lay in Hor-hagidgad.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And they went from Hor-hagidgad, and pitched in Iotbathah.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And they remoued from Iotbathah, and lay in Ebronah.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And they departed from Ebronah, & lay in Ezion-gaber.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And they remoued from Ezion-gaber, and pitched in the wildernesse of Zin, which is Kadesh.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And they remooued from Kadesh, and pitched in mount Hor, in the edge of the land of Edom.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: (And Aaron the Priest went vp into mount Hor, at the commandement of the Lord, and died there, in the fourtieth yeere after the children of Israel were come out of the lande of Egypt, in the first day of the fifth moneth.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And Aaron was an hundreth, and three and twentie yeere olde, when hee dyed in mount Hor.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And King Arad the Canaanite, which dwelt in the South of the land of Canaan, heard of the comming of the children of Israel)

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And they departed from mount Hor, & pitched in Zalmonah.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And they departed from Zalmonah, and pitched in Punon.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And they departed from Punon, and pitched in Oboth.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And they departed from Oboth, and pitched in Iie-abarim, in the borders of Moab.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And they departed from Iim, and pitched in Dibon-gad.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And they remooued from Dibon-gad, and lay in Almon-diblathaim.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And they remooued from Almon-diblathaim, and pitched in the mountaines of Abarim before Nebo.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And they departed from the mountaines of Abarim, and pitched in the plaine of Moab, by Iorden toward Iericho.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And they pitched by Iorden, from Bethieshimoth vnto Abel-shittim in the playne of Moab.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Lorde spake vnto Moses in the playne of Moab, by Iorden towarde Iericho, saying,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Speake vnto the children of Israel, and say vnto them, When ye are come ouer Iorden to enter into the land of Canaan,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Ye shall then driue out all the inhabitants of the land before you, and destroy all their pictures, and breake asunder all their images of metall, and plucke downe all their hie places.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And ye shall possesse the lande and dwell therein: for I haue giue you ye land to possesse it.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And ye shall inherite the land by lot according to your families: to the more yee shall giue more inheritance, and to the fewer the lesse inheritance. Where the lot shall fall to any man, that shall be his: according to the tribes of your fathers shall ye inherite.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: But if ye will not driue out the inhabitants of the land before you, then those which yee let ramaine of them, shalbe prickes in your eyes, and thornes in your sides, and shall vexe you in the land wherein ye dwell.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Moreouer, it shal come to passe, that I shal doe vnto you, as I thought to do vnto them.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Lord spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Commande the children of Israel, and say vnto them, When yee come into the land of Canaan, this is the land that shall fall vnto your inheritance: that is, the land of Canaan with the coastes thereof.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And your Southquarter shalbe from the wildernesse of Zin to the borders of Edom: so that your Southquarter shall be from the salt Sea coast Eastwarde:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the border shall compasse you from the South to Maaleh-akrabbim, and reach to Zin, and goe out from the South to Kadesh-barnea: thence it shal stretch to Hazar-addar, & go along to Azmon.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the border shall compasse from Azmon vnto the riuer of Egypt, and shall goe out to the Sea.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And your Westquarter shall bee the great Sea: euen that border shalbe your Westcoast.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And this shall bee your Northquarter: yee shall marke out your border from the great Sea vnto mount Hor.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: From mount Hor ye shall point out till it come vnto Hamath, and the end of the coast shal be at Zedad.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the coast shall reach out to Ziphron, & goe out at Hazar-enan. this shalbe your Northquarter.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And ye shall marke out your Eastquarter from Hazar-enan to Shepham.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the coast shall goe downe from Shepham to Riblah, and from the Eastside of Ain: and the same border shall descend and goe out at the side of the sea of Chinnereth Eastward.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Also that border shall goe downe to Iorden, & leaue at the salt Sea. this shalbe your land with the coastes thereof round about.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then Moses commaunded the children of Israel, saying, This is the lande which yee shall inherite by lot, which the Lord commaunded to giue vnto nine tribes and halfe the tribe.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: For the tribe of the children of Reuben, according to the housholdes of their fathers, and the tribe of the children of Gad, according to their fathers housholdes, and halfe the tribe of Manasseh, haue receiued their inheritance.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Two tribes and an halfe tribe haue receiued their inheritance on this side of Iorden toward Iericho full East.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Againe the Lord spake to Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: These are the names of the men which shall deuide ye land vnto you: Eleazar the Priest, and Ioshua the sonne of Nun.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And ye shall take also a prince of euerie tribe to deuide the land.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The names also of the men are these: Of the tribe of Iudah, Caleb ye sonne of Iephunneh.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And of the tribe of the sonnes of Simeon, Shemuel the sonne of Ammihud.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Of the tribe of Beniamin, Elidad the sonne of Chislon.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Also of the tribe of the sonnes of Dan, the prince Bukki, the sonne of Iogli.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Of the sonnes of Ioseph: of the tribe of the sonnes of Manasseh, the prince Hanniel the sonne of Ephod.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And of the tribe of the sonnes of Ephraim, the prince Kemuel, the sonne of Shiphtan.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Of the tribe also of the sonnes of Zebulun, the prince Elizaphan, the sonne of Parnach.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: So of the tribe of the sonnes of Issachar, the prince Paltiel the sonne of Azzan.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Of the tribe also of the sonnes of Asher, the prince Ahihud, the sonne of Shelomi.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And of the tribe of the sonnes of Naphtali, the prince Pedahel, the sonne of Ammihud.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: These are they, whome the Lord commanded to deuide the inheritance vnto the children of Israel, in the land of Canaan.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Lord spake vnto Moses in the plaine of Moab by Iorden, toward Iericho, saying,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Commande ye children of Israel, that they giue vnto the Leuites of the inheritace of their possession, cities to dwell in: yee shall giue also vnto the Leuites the suburbes of the cities round about them.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: So they shall haue the cities to dwell in, & their suburbes shall be for their cattell, and for their substance, and for all their beasts.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the suburbes of the cities, which ye shal giue vnto the Leuites, from the wall of the citie outward, shalbe a thousand cubites round about.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And yee shall measure without the citie of the Eastside, two thousand cubites: and of the Southside, two thousand cubites: & of the Westside, two thousand cubites: & of ye Northside, two thousand cubites: & the citie shalbe in ye middes. this shalbe the measure of the suburbes of their cities.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And of the cities which yee shall giue vnto the Leuites, there shalbe sixe cities for refuge, which ye shal appoint, that he which killeth, may flee thither: and to them yee shall adde two and fourtie cities mo.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: All the cities which yee shall giue to the Leuites, shalbe eight and fourtie cities: them shal ye giue with their suburbes.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And concerning the cities which yee shall giue, of the possession of the children of Israel: of many ye shall take mo, and of few ye shall take lesse: euery one shall giue of his cities vnto the Leuites, according to his inheritance, which hee inheriteth.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Lorde spake vnto Moses, saying,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Speake vnto the children of Israel, and say vnto them, When ye be come ouer Iorden into the land of Canaan,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Ye shall appoint you cities, to bee cities of refuge for you, that the slayer, which slayeth any person vnwares, may flee thither.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And these cities shalbe for you a refuge fro the auenger, that he which killeth, die not, vntill he stand before the Congregation in iudgement.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And of the cities which ye shall giue, sixe cities shall ye haue for refuge.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Ye shall appoint three on this side Iorden, and ye shall appoint three cities in the lande of Canaan which shalbe cities of refuge.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: These six cities shalbe a refuge for the children of Israel, and for the stranger, and for him that dwelleth among you, that euery one which killeth any person vnwares, may flee thither.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And if one smite another with an instrument of yron that hee die, hee is a murtherer, and the murtherer shall die the death.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Also if hee smite him by casting a stone, wherewith hee may be slaine, and he die, hee is a murtherer, and the murtherer shall die the death.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Or if he smite him with an hand weapon of wood, wherewith he may be slaine, if he die, he is a murtherer, and the murtherer shall die the death.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: The reuenger of the blood himselfe shall slay the murtherer: when he meeteth him, he shall slay him.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: But if hee thrust him of hate, or hurle at him by laying of wait, that he die,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Or smite him through enimitie with his hand, that he die, he that smote him shal die ye death: for hee is a murtherer: the reuenger of the blood shall slay the murtherer when he meeteth him.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: But if he pusshed him vnaduisedly, and not of hatred, or cast vpon him any thing, without laying of waite,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Or any stone (whereby he might be slaine) and sawe him not, or caused it to fall vpon him, and he die, and was not his enemie, neither sought him any harme,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then the Congregation shall iudge betweene the slayer and the auenger of blood according to these lawes.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the Congregation shall deliuer the slayer out of the hande of the auenger of blood, and the Congregation shall restore him vnto the citie of his refuge, whither hee was fled: and hee shal abide there vnto the death of the hie Priest, which is anointed with the holy oyle.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: But if the slayer come without the borders of the citie of his refuge, whither he was fled,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And the reuenger of blood finde him without the borders of the citie of his refuge, & the reueger of blood slay ye murtherer, he shalbe giltles,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Because he should haue remained in the citie of his refuge, vntill the death of the hie Priest: and after the death of the hie Priest, the slayer shal returne vnto the land of his possession.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: So these thinges shall be a lawe of iudgement vnto you, throughout your generations in all your dwellings.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Whosoeuer killeth any person, the Iudge shall slay the murtherer, through witnesses: but one witnesse shall not testifie against a person to cause him to die.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Moreouer ye shall take no recompense for the life of the murtherer, which is worthy to die: but he shalbe put to death.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Also ye shall take no recompense for him that is fled to the citie of his refuge, that he should come againe, and dwell in the lande, before the death of the hie Priest.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: So ye shall not pollute the land wherein ye shall dwell: for blood defileth the land: and the land cannot be clensed of the blood that is shed therein, but by the blood of him that shed it.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Defile not therefore the lande which yee shall inhabite, For I dwell in the middes thereof: for I the Lord dwel among the children of Israel.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then the chiefe fathers of the familie of the sonnes of Gilead, the sonne of Machir, the sonne of Manasseh, of the families of the sones of Ioseph, came, & spake before Moses, & before the princes, the chiefe fathers of the children of Israel,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And saide, The Lorde commaunded my lord to giue the land to inherit by lot to the children of Israel: and my lord was commaunded by the Lorde, to giue the inheritance of Zelophehad our brother vnto his daughters.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: If they bee married to any of the sonnes of the other tribes of the children of Israel, then shall their inheritance be taken away from the inheritance of our fathers, and shalbe put vnto the inheritance of the tribe whereof they shalbe: so shall it be taken away from the lot of our inheritance.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Also when the Iubile of the children of Israel commeth, then shall their inheritance be put vnto the inheritance of the tribe whereof they shall be: so shall their inheritance be taken away from the inheritance of the tribe of our fathers.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Then Moses commaunded the children of Israel, according to the word of the Lord, saying, The tribe of the sonnes of Ioseph haue said well.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: This is the thing that the Lorde hath commaunded, concerning the daughters of Zelophehad, saying, They shall be wiues, to whome they thinke best, onely to the familie of the tribe of their father shall they marry:

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: So shall not the inheritance of the children of Israel remoue from tribe to tribe, for euery one of the children of Israel shal ioyne himselfe to the inheritance of the tribe of his fathers.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: And euery daughter that possesseth any inheritance of the tribes of the children of Israel, shalbe wife vnto one of the familie of the tribe of her father: that the children of Israel may enioye euery man the inheritance of their fathers.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: Neither shal the inheritance go about from tribe to tribe: but euery one of the tribes of the childre of Israel shal sticke to his own inheritace.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: As the Lord commanded Moses, so did the daughters of Zelophehad.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: For Mahlah, Tirzah, & Hoglah, and Milcah, and Noah the daughters of Zelophehad were married vnto their fathers brothers sonnes,

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: They were wiues to certaine of the families of the sonnes of Manasseh the sonne of Ioseph: so their inheritance remained in the tribe of the familie of their father.

Book.Name: Numbers
Text: These are the commandements and lawes which the Lord commanded by the hand of Moses, vnto the children of Israel in the plaine of Moab, by Iorden toward Iericho.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: These bee the wordes which Moses spake vnto all Israel, on this side Iorden in the wildernesse, in the plaine, ouer against the red Sea, betweene Paran and Tophel, and Laban, and Hazeroth, & Di-zahab.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: There are eleuen dayes iourney from Horeb vnto Kadesh-barnea, by the way of mout Seir.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: And it came to passe in the first day of the eleuenth moneth, in the fourtieth yeere that Moses spake vnto the children of Israel according vnto all that the Lord had giuen him in commandement vnto them,

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: After that he had slaine Sihon the king of the Amorites which dwelt in Heshbon, & Og king of Bashan, which dwelt at Ashtaroth in Edrei.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: On this side Iorden in the lande of Moab began Moses to declare this lawe, saying,

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: The Lord our God spake vnto vs in Horeb, saying, Ye haue dwelt long ynough in this mount,

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: Turne you and depart, and goe vnto the mountaine of the Amorites, and vnto all places neere thereunto in the plaine, in the mountaine, or in the valley: both Southwarde, and to the Sea side, to the land of the Canaanites, and vnto Lebanon: euen vnto the great riuer, the riuer Perath.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: Beholde, I haue set the land before you: go in and possesse that land which the Lorde sware vnto your fathers, Abraham, Izhak, and Iaakob, to giue vnto them and to their seede after them.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: And I spake vnto you the same time, saying, I am not able to beare you my selfe alone:

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: The Lord your God hath multiplied you: and beholde, ye are this day as the starres of heauen in nomber:

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: (The Lord God of your fathers make you a thousand times so many moe as ye are, and blesse you, as he hath promised you)

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: Howe can I alone beare your combrance and your charge, and your strife?

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: Bring you men of wisedome and of vnderstanding, and knowen among your tribes, and I will make them rulers ouer you:

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: Then ye answered me and said, The thing is good that thou hast commanded vs to doe.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: So I tooke the chiefe of your tribes wise and knowen men, & made them rulers ouer you, captaines ouer thousands, and captaines ouer hundreds, and captaines ouer fiftie, and captaines ouer tenne, and officers among your tribes.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: And I charged your iudges that same time, saying, Heare the controuersies betweene your brethren, and iudge righteously betwene euery man and his brother, and the stranger that is with him.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: Ye shal haue no respect of person in iudgement, but shall heare the small aswell as the great: yee shall not feare the face of man: for the iudgemet is Gods: and the cause that is too hard for you, bring vnto me, and I will heare it.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
