Text: Also I commaunded you the same time all the things which ye should doe.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: Then we departed from Horeb, and went through all that great and terrible wildernesse (as yee haue seene) by the way of the mountaine of the Amorites, as the Lord our God commaunded vs: and we came to Kadesh-barnea.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: And I saide vnto you, Yee are come vnto the mountaine of the Amorites, which the Lorde our God doeth giue vnto vs.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: Beholde, the Lord thy God hath layde the land before thee: go vp and possesse it, as the Lord the God of thy fathers hath saide vnto thee: feare not, neither be discouraged.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: Then ye came vnto me euery one, and said, We wil send men before vs, to search vs out the land & to bring vs word againe, what way we must go vp by, & vnto what cities we shall come.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: So the saying pleased me well, and I tooke twelue men of you, of euery tribe one.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: Who departed, and went vp into the mountaine, and came vnto the riuer Eshcol, and searched out the land.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: And tooke of the fruite of the land in their hands, and brought it vnto vs, and brought vs worde againe, and sayd, It is a good land, which the Lord our God doeth giue vs.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: Notwithstanding, ye would not go vp, but were disobedient vnto the commaundement of the Lord your God,

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: And murmured in your tentes, & sayd, Because the Lorde hated vs, therefore hath hee brought vs out of the land of Egypt, to deliuer vs into the hand of the Amorites, and to destroy vs.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: Whither shal we go vp? our brethren haue discouraged our hearts, saying, The people is greater, and taller then we: the cities are great and walled vp to heauen: and moreouer we haue seene the sonnes of the Anakims there.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: But I sayd vnto you, Dread not, nor be afrayd of them.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: The Lord your God, who goeth before you, he shall fight for you, according to all that he did vnto you in Egypt before your eyes,

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: And in the wildernesse, where thou hast seene how the Lord thy God bare thee, as a man doeth beare his sonne, in all the way which ye haue gone, vntill ye came vnto this place.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: Yet for all this ye did not beleeue the Lord your God,

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: Who went in the way before you, to search you out a place to pitch your tentes in, in fire by night, that ye might see what way to goe, and in a cloude by day.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: Then the Lorde heard the voyce of your wordes, and was wroth, and sware, saying,

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: Surely there shall not one of these men of this froward generation, see that good land, which I sware to giue vnto your fathers,

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: Saue Caleb the sonne of Iephunneh: he shall see it, and to him will I giue the land that he hath troden vpon, and to his children, because he hath constantly followed the Lord.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: Also the Lorde was angry with me for your sakes, saying, Thou also shalt not goe in thither,

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: But Ioshua the sonne of Nun which standeth before thee, he shall go in thither: incourage him: for he shal cause Israel to inherite it.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: Moreouer, your children, which ye sayd should be a praye, and your sonnes, which in that day had no knowledge betweene good and euill, they shall go in thither, and vnto them wil I giue it, and they shall possesse it.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: But as for you, turne backe, and take your iourney into the wildernesse by the way of the red Sea.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: Then ye answered and sayd vnto me, We haue sinned against the Lord, we wil go vp, and fight, according to all that the Lorde our God hath commaunded vs: and ye armed you euery man to the warre, and were ready to goe vp into the mountaine.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: But the Lord said vnto me, Say vnto them, Goe not vp, neither fight, (for I am not among you) least ye fall before your enemies.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: And when I told you, ye would not heare, but rebelled against the commaundement of the Lord, and were presumptuous, and went vp into the mountaine.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: Then the Amorites which dwelt in that mountaine came out against you, and chased you (as bees vse to doe) and destroied you in Seir, euen vnto Hormah.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: And when ye came againe, ye wept before the Lord, but the Lorde would not heare your voyce, nor incline his eares vnto you.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: So ye abode in Kadesh a long time, according to the time that ye had remained before.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: Then we turned, and tooke our iourney into the wildernes, by the way of the red Sea, as the Lorde spake vnto me: and we compassed mount Seir a long time.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: And the Lord spake vnto me, saying,

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: Ye haue compassed this mountaine long ynough: turne you Northward.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: And warne thou the people, saying, Ye shall go through the coast of your brethren the children of Esau, which dwell in Seir, and they shall be afraide of you: take ye good heede therefore.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: Ye shall not prouoke them: for I wil not giue you of their land so much as a foot breadth, because I haue giuen mount Seir vnto Esau for a possession.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: Ye shall buy meate of them for money to eate, and ye shall also procure water of them for money to drinke.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: For the Lord thy God hath blessed thee in all the workes of thine hand: he knoweth thy walking through this great wildernes, and the Lorde thy God hath bene with thee this fourtie yeere, and thou hast lacked nothing.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: And when we were departed from our brethren the children of Esau which dwelt in Seir, through the way of the plaine, from Elath, and from Ezion-gaber, we turned and went by the way of the wildernes of Moab.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: Then the Lord sayd vnto me, Thou shalt not vexe Moab, neither prouoke them to battel: for I wil not giue thee of their land for a possession, because I haue giuen Ar vnto the children of Lot for a possession.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: The Emims dwelt therein in times past, a people great and many, & tall, as the Anakims.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: They also were taken for gyants as the Anakims: whom the Moabites call Emims.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: The Horims also dwelt in Seir before time, whome the children of Esau chased out and destroyed them before them, and dwelt in their steade: as Israel shall doe vnto the land of his possession, which the Lord hath giuen them.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: Now rise vp, sayd I, and get you ouer the riuer Zered: and we went ouer the riuer Zered.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: The space also wherein we came from Kadesh-barnea, vntill we were come ouer the riuer Zered, was eight and thirtie yeeres, vntill all the generation of the men of warre were wasted out from among the hoste, as the Lord sware vnto them.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: For in deede the hand of the Lorde was against them, to destroy them from among the hoste, till they were consumed.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: So when all the men of warre were consumed and dead from among the people:

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: Then the Lord spake vnto me, saying,

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: Thou shalt goe through Ar the coast of Moab this day:

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: And thou shalt come neere ouer against the children of Ammon: but shalt not lay siege vnto them, nor moue warre against them: for I will not giue thee of the land of the children of Ammon any possession: for I haue giuen it vnto the children of Lot for a possession.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: That also was taken for a land of gyants: for gyants dwelt therein afore time, whome the Ammonites called Zamzummims:

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: A people that was great, and many, and tall, as the Anakims: but the Lord destroyed them before them, and they succeeded them in their inheritance, and dwelt in their stead:

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: As he did to the children of Esau which dwell in Seir, when he destroyed the Horims before them, and they possessed them, and dwelt in their stead vnto this day.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: And the Auims which dwelt in Hazarim euen vnto Azzah, the Caphtorims which came out of Caphtor destroyed them, and dwelt in their steade.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: Rise vp therefore, sayd the Lord: take your iourney, and passe ouer the riuer Arnon: beholde, I haue giuen into thy hand Sihon, the Amorite, King of Heshbon, and his land: begin to possesse it and prouoke him to battell.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: This day wil I begin to send thy feare and thy dread, vpon all people vnder the whole heauen, which shall heare thy fame, and shal tremble and quake before thee.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: Then I sent messengers out of the wildernes of Kedemoth vnto Sihon King of Heshbon, with wordes of peace, saying,

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: Let me passe through thy land: I will go by the hie way: I will neither turne vnto the right hand nor to the left.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: Thou shalt sell me meate for money, for to eate, and shalt giue me water for money for to drinke: onely I will go through on my foote,

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: (As the children of Esau which dwell in Seir, and the Moabites which dwell in Ar, did vnto me) vntill I be come ouer Iorden, into the land which the Lord our God giueth vs.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: But Sihon the King of Heshbon would not let vs passe by him: for the Lorde thy God had hardened his spirit, and made his heart obstinate, because hee would deliuer him into thine hand, as appeareth this day.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: And the Lorde sayd vnto me, Beholde, I haue begun to giue Sihon and his land before thee: begin to possesse and inherite his land.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: Then came out Sihon to meete vs, him selfe with all his people to fight at Iahaz.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: But the Lord our God deliuered him into our power, and we smote him, and his sonnes, and all his people.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: And we tooke all his cities the same time, and destroyed euery citie, men, and women, and children: we let nothing remaine.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: Onely the cattell we tooke to our selues, and the spoyle of the cities which we tooke,

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: From Aroer, which is by the banke of the riuer of Arnon, and from the citie that is vpon the riuer, euen vnto Gilead: there was not one citie that escaped vs: for the Lorde our God deliuered vp all before vs.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: Onely vnto the land of the children of Ammon thou camest not, nor vnto any place of the riuer Iabbok, nor vnto the cities in the mountaines, nor vnto whatsoeuer the Lorde our God forbade vs.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: Then we turned, and went vp by the way of Bashan: and Og King of Bashan came out against vs, he, and all his people to fight at Edrei.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: And the Lorde sayde vnto me, Feare him not, for I will deliuer him, and all his people, and his land into thine hand, and thou shalt doe vnto him as thou diddest vnto Sihon King of the Amorites, which dwelt at Heshbon.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: So the Lorde our God deliuered also vnto our hand, Og the King of Bashan, and all his people: and we smote him, vntill none was left him aliue,

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: And we tooke all his cities the same time, neither was there a citie which we tooke not from them, euen three score cities, and all ye countrey of Argob, the kingdome of Og in Bashan.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: All these cities were fenced with hie walles, gates and barres, beside vnwalled townes a great many.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: And we ouerthrewe them, as we did vnto Sihon King of Heshbon, destroying euery citie, with men, women, and children.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: But all the cattell and the spoyle of the cities we tooke for our selues.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: Thus we tooke at that time out of the hand of two Kings of the Amorites, the land that was on this side Iorden from the riuer of Arnon vnto mount Hermon:

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: (Which Hermon the Sidonians call Shirion, but the Amorites call it Shenir)

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: All the cities of the plaine, and all Gilead, and all Bashan vnto Salchah, and Edrei, cities of the kingdome of Og in Bashan.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: For onely Og King of Bashan remained of the remnant of the gyants, whose bed was a bed of yron: is it not at Rabbath among the children of Ammon? The length thereof is nine cubites, and foure cubites the breadth of it, after the cubite of a man.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: And this land which we possessed at that time, from Aroer, which is by the riuer of Arnon, and halfe mount Gilead, and the cities thereof, gaue I vnto the Reubenites and Gadites.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: And the rest of Gilead, and all Bashan, the kingdome of Og, gaue I vnto the halfe tribe of Manasseh: euen all the countrey of Argob with all Bashan, which is called, The land of gyants.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: Iair the sonne of Manasseh tooke all the countrey of Argob, vnto the coastes of Geshuri, and of Maachathi: and called them after his owne name, Bashan, Hauoth Iair vnto this day.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: And I gaue part of Gilead vnto Machir.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: And vnto the Reubenites and Gadites I gaue the rest of Gilead, and vnto the riuer of Arnon, halfe the riuer and the borders, euen vnto the riuer Iabbok, which is the border of the children of Ammon:

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: The plaine also and Iorden, and the borders from Chinnereth euen vnto the Sea of the plaine, to wit, the salt Sea vnder the springs of Pisgah Eastwarde.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: And I commanded you the same time, saying, The Lorde your God hath giuen you this lande to possesse it: ye shall goe ouer armed before your brethren the children of Israel, all men of warre.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: Your wiues onely, and your children, and your cattel (for I know that ye haue much cattel) shall abide in your cities, which I haue giuen you,

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: Vntill the Lorde haue giuen rest vnto your brethren as vnto you, and that they also possesse the lande, which the Lorde your God hath giuen them beyond Iorden: then shall ye returne euery man vnto his possession, which I haue giuen you.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: And I charged Ioshua the same time, saying, Thine eyes haue seene all that the Lorde your God hath done vnto these two Kings: so shall the Lorde doe vnto all the kingdomes whither thou goest.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: Ye shall not feare them: for the Lord your God, he shall fight for you.

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: And I besought the Lorde the same time, saying,

Book.Name: Deuteronomy
Text: O Lord God, thou hast begunne to shewe thy seruant thy greatnesse and thy mightie hande: for where is there a God in heauen or in earth, that can do like thy workes, and like thy power?
